episodes.title: Pilot
episodes.description: The premiere episode introduces the boss and staff of the Dunder-Mifflin Paper Company in Scranton, Pennsylvania in a documentary about the workplace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right Jim. Your quarterlies look very good. How are things at the library?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I told you. I couldn’t close it. So…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you’ve come to the master for guidance? Is this what you’re saying, grasshopper?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Actually, you called me in here, but yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Well, let me show you how it’s done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Yes, I’d like to speak to your office manager, please. Yes, hello. This is Michael Scott. I am the Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products. Just wanted to talk to you manager-a-manger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Done deal. Thank you very much, sir. You’re a gentleman and a scholar. Oh, I’m sorry. OK. I’m sorry. My mistake. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was a woman I was talking to, so… She had a very low voice. Probably a smoker, so… [Clears throat] So that’s the way it’s done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ve, uh, I’ve been at Dunder Mifflin for 12 years, the last four as Regional Manager. If you want to come through here… See we have the entire floor. So this is my kingdom, as far as the eye can see. This is our receptionist, Pam. Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam Beesly. Pam has been with us for…  forever. Right, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well. I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you think she’s cute now, you should have seen her a couple of years ago. [growls]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Any messages?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, yeah. Just a fax.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Pam, this is from Corporate. How many times have I told you? There’s a special filing cabinet for things from corporate.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You haven’t told me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s called the wastepaper basket! Look at that! Look at that face.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People say I am the best boss. They go, “God we’ve never worked in a place like this before. You’re hilarious.” “And you get the best out of us.” [shows the camera his WORLD’S BEST BOSS mug] I think that pretty much sums it up. I found it at Spencer Gifts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] Shall I play for you? Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming] I have no gifts for you. Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My job is to speak to clients on the phone about… uh, quantities and type of copier paper. You know, whether we can supply it to them. Whether they can pay for it. And… I’m boring myself just talking about this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whassup!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whassup! I still love that after seven years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whassup!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whassup!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whass…up!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whassup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Strains, grunts] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. All right. See you later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. Take care.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Back to work.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on her cell phone] Just before lunch. That would be great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Corporate really doesn’t really interfere with me at all. Jan Levinson Gould. [walking out of his office] Jan, hello.  I call her Hillary Rodham Clinton. Right? Not to her face, because… well, not because I’m scared of her. Because I’m not. But, um… Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Alright, was there anything you wanted to add to the agenda?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um… Me no get an agenda.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What? I’m sorry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t get any agenda.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I faxed one over to you this morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? I didn’t… [looks at Pam] Did we get a fax this morning?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, yeah, the one…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why isn’t it in my hand? A company runs on efficiency of communication, right? So what’s the problem, Pam? Why didn’t I get it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You put in the garbage can that was a special filing cabinet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, that was a joke. That was a joke that was actually my brother’s, and… It was supposed to be with bills and it doesn’t work great with faxes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do you want to look at mine?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah. Lovely. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK. Since the last meeting, Ellen and the board have decided we can’t justify a Scranton branch and a Stamford branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, don’t panic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, this is good. This is good. This is fine. Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, no, no, Michael, listen OK. Don’t panic. We haven’t made… We haven’t decided.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All the alarm bells are kind of going… ringie-dingie-ding!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’ve spoken to Josh in Stamford. I’ve told him the same as you and it’s up to either him or you to convince me that your branch can incorporate the other.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. No problem.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This does, however, mean that there is going to be downsizing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Me no wanna hear that, Jan. Because downsizing is a bitch. It is a real bitch. And I wouldn’t wish that on Josh’s men. I certainly wouldn’t wish it on my men. Or women, present company excluded. Sorry. Uh, is Josh concerned about downsizing himself? Not downsizing himself but is he concerned about downsizing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Question. How long do we have to… [Telephone rings] Oh uh, Todd Packer, terrific rep. Do you mind if I take it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Packman.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Hey, you big queen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that’s not appropriate.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Hey, is old Godzillary coming in today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I don’t know what you mean.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I’ve been meaning to ask her one question. Does the carpet match the drapes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God! Oh! That’s… horrifying. Horrible. Horrible person.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So do you think we could keep a lid on this for now? I don’t want to worry people unnecessarily.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, absolutely. Under this regime, it will not leave this office. [zips his lips] Like that.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: So what does downsizing actually mean?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You guys better update your resumes just like I’m doing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I bet it’s gonna be me. Probably gonna be me.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, it’ll be you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have an important question for you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you going to Angela’s cat party on Sunday?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, stop. That is ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Am I going to tell them? No, I am not going to tell them. I don’t see the point of that. As a doctor, you would not tell a patient if they had cancer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guilty! Guilty as charged!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ryan Howard from the temp agency. Daniqua sent me down to start today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Howard, like Moe Howard. Three Stooges.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Watch this. This is Moe. Nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck. Mee! [hold hand up for a high five] Ah, right here. Three Stooges. Oh, Pam. It’s a guy thing, Pam. I’m sort of a student of comedy. Watch this. Here we go. [Yelling in cod German] I’m Hitler. Adolf Hitler. [Continues with cod German]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t think it would be the worst thing if they let me go because then I might… I don’t think it’s many little girls’ dream to be a receptionist. I like to do illustrations. Um… Mostly watercolor. A few oil pencil. Um, Jim thinks they’re good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure. Mr. Davis, let me call you right back. Yeah, something just came up. Two minutes. Thank you very much. Dwight, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just clearing my desk. I can’t concentrate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s not on your desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s overlapping. It’s all spilling over the edge. One word, two syllables. Demarcation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why not?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Safety violation. I could fall and pierce an organ.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [crosses fingers] We’ll see. [Dwight begins smashing pencils with his phone] This is why the whole downsizing thing just doesn’t bother me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Downsizing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Downsizing? I have no problem with that. I have been recommending downsizing since I first got here. I even brought it up in my interview. I say, bring it on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You just still have these messages from yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Relax. Everything’s under control. Uh, yeah. Yeah. That’s important. Right. Oh this is so important, I should run to answer it. [Imitating Six-Million Dollar Man sound effect]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on. Six-Million Dollar Man! Steve Austin! Actually, that would be a good salary for me, don’t you think? Six million dollars? Memo to Jan. I deserve a raise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don’t we all?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m sorry?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you’re unhappy with your compensation, maybe you should take it up with HR. OK. Not today, OK? Pam, just be professional. [Sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think I’m a role model here. I think I garner people’s respect. [Imitating a PA] Attention all Dunder Mifflin employees, please. We have a meeting in the conference room, ASAP.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People I respect, heroes of mine, would be Bob Hope… Abraham Lincoln, definitely. Bono. And probably God would be the fourth one. And I just think all those people really helped the world in so many ways that it’s really beyond words. It’s really incalculable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now I know there’s some rumors out there and I just kind of want to set the record straight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m Assistant Regional Manager. I should know first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Assistant to the Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, um, can you just tell me please? Just tell me quietly. Can you whisper it in my ear?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m about to tell everybody. I’m just about to tell everybody.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can’t you just tell us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, OK? Do you want me to tell ’em?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don’t know what it is. [Laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK. You tell ’em. With my permission. Permission granted.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t need your permission.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Corporate has deemed it appropriate to enforce an ultimatum upon me. And Jan is thinking about downsizing either the Stamford branch or this branch.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I heard they might be closing this branch down. That’s just the rumor going around. This is my first day. I don’t really know.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah but Michael, what if they downsize here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It could be out of your hands Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It won’t be out of my hands Stanley, OK. I promise you that.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Can you promise that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On his mother’s grave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah, it is a promise. And frankly, I’m a little insulted that you have to keep asking about it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It’s just that we need to know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. Hold on a second. I think Pam wanted to say something. Pam, you had a look that you wanted to ask a question just then.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was in the meeting with Jan and she did say that it could be this branch that gets the axe.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Are you sure about that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Pam maybe you should stick to the ongoing confidentiality agreement of meetings.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, information is power.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You can’t say for sure whether it’ll be us or them, can you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Stanley. No, you did not see me in there with her. I said if Corporate wants to come in here and interfere, then they’re gonna have to go through me. Right? You can go mess with Josh’s people, but I’m the head of this family, and you ain’t gonna be messing with my chillin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If I left, what would I do with all this useless information in my head? You know? Tonnage price of manila folders? Um, Pam’s favorite flavor of yogurt, which is mixed berry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim said mixed berries? Well, yeah, he’s on to me. Um… [Laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Watch out for this guy. Dwight Schrute in the building. This is Ryan, the new temp.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What’s up? Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Introduce yourself. Be polite.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Assistant to the Regional Manager. So, uh, Dwight tell him about the kung fu and the car and everything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh… yeah I got a ’78 280Z. Bought it for $1,200. Fixed it up. It’s now worth three grand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s his profit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: New engine, new suspension, I got a respray. I’ve got some photos.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it! Jim!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Hold on, hold on. The judge is in session. What is the problem here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He put my stuff in Jell-O again.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Laughing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s real professional thanks. That’s the third time and it wasn’t funny the first two times either Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s OK here, but people sometimes take advantage because it’s so relaxed. I’m a volunteer Sheriff’s Deputy on the weekends. And you cannot screw around there. That’s sort of one of the rules.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is my stapler.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. Do not take it out. You have to eat it out of there, because there are starving people in the world [turns to camera] which I hate, and it is a waste of that kind of food.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK you know what, you can be a witness. [points to Ryan] Can you reprimand him?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How do you know it was me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s always you. Are you going to discipline him or not?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Discipline. Kinky! [Laughs] All right, here’s the deal you guys. The thing about a practical joke is you have to know when to start and as well as when to stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And yeah, Jim this is the time to stop putting Dwight’s personal effects into Jell-O.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. Dwight, I’m sorry, because I have always been your biggest flan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Laughing] Nice. That’s the way it is around here. It just kind of goes round and round.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You should’ve put him in custardy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Yes! New guy! He scores.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, that’s great. I guess what I’m most concerned with is damage to company property. That’s all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pudding. Pudding… I’m trying to think of another dessert to do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you like going out at the end of the week for a drink?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s why we’re all going out. So we can have an end-of-the-week-drink.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So when are we going out?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Tonight, hopefully.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, baby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy’s my fiance. We’ve been engaged about three years. We were supposed to get married in September but I think we’re gonna get married in the spring.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you mind if I go out for a drink with these guys?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, no. Come on. Let’s get out of here and go home.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. I’m gonna be a few minutes. So it’s only twenty past five. I still have to do my faxes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? You should come with us. Because you know we’re all going out and it could be a good chance for you to see what people are like outside the office. I think it could be fun.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: It sounds good. Seriously, we’ve gotta get going.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um… What’s in the bag?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Just tell her I’ll talk to her later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, definitely. All right, dude. Awesome. Will do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do I think I’ll be invited to the wedding? [scratches head]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So have you felt the vibe yet? We work hard, we play hard. Sometimes we play hard when we should be working hard. Right? I guess the atmosphere that I’ve created here is that I’m a friend first, and a boss second… and probably an entertainer third. [Knock at door] Just a second. Right? Oh, hey do you like The Jamie Kennedy Experiment? Punk’d and all that kind of stuff?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are gonna be my accomplice. Just go along with it, OK?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just follow my lead. Don’t pimp me, all right? Come in. So, uh, Corporate just said that I don’t want to…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You got a fax.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thank you. Pam, can you come in here for a sec. Just have a seat. I was gonna call you in anyway. You know Ryan. As you know, there is going to be downsizing. And you have made my life so much easier in that I am going to have to let you go first.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why? Well, theft and stealing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stealing? What am I supposed to have stolen?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Post-it Notes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Post-it Notes? What are those worth, 50 cents?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: 50 cents, yeah. If you steal a thousand Post-It Notes at 50 cents apiece, and you know,  you’ve made a profit… margin. You’re gonna run us out of business, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I am.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can’t believe this. I mean I have never even stolen as much as a paperclip and you’re firing me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But the best thing about it is that we’re not going to have to give you any severance pay. Because that is gross misconduct and… Just clean out your desk. I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Pam starts crying] You been X’d punk! [Laughing] Surprise! It’s a joke. We were joking around. See? OK. He was in on it. He was my accomplice. And it was kind of a morale booster thing. And we were showing the new guy around, giving him the feel of the place. So you… God, we totally got you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re a jerk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know about that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is the most important thing for a company? Is it the cash flow? Is it the inventory? Nuh-uh. It’s the people. The people. My proudest moment here was not when I increased profits by 17% or when I cut expenses without losing a single employee. No, no, no, no, no. It was a young Guatemalan guy. First job in the country, barely spoke English. He came to me, and said, “Mr. Scott, would you be the godfather of my child?” Wow. Wow. Didn’t work out in the end. We had to let him go. He sucked.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How are things?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good. I thought you were going out for a drink with…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no, I just decided not to. How’s your headache?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s better, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good. Good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s great

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is…?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um… Are you…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Am I walking out?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, I… Do you want to…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great. Let me just…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Car horn honking] Oh, Roy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Listen, have a nice weekend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, definitely. You too. Enjoy it. [looks at camera] You know what, just come here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute. My father’s name, also Dwight Schrute. My grandfather’s name, Dweide Schrude, Amish. That’s my family. I don’t know where they came, the Amish, came from originally. Uh, Amland.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holding up a Dundie and pretending it is talking] Hello. I’m Michael Scott. I’m the best boss in the world.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My name is Jim Halpert and I am a sales rep, which is a very important job. Um, without me dozens literally dozens of small businesses would go paperless. They would have to write on their hands, or bed sheets, or who knows you know. Total chaos, total chaos. I mean or they could get their paper somewhere else. Staples maybe. I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam has been with us for… forever. Right, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I guess.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, at one time or another every guy in the office has sprayed on Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Messages?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: People respond to the human touch and that’s what I give them. I can look at a client and I can say, “Hello, how are you? How’s business been going?” And we can go back and forth for sometime and uh, then I’ll say, How much, how many reams do you want?” And they’ll order it and then I’ll take care of all the sales. I’ll make sure that they get that paper. And they appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, right here. Three Stooges. High five. [Michael and Ryan high five] Oh, Pam. It’s a guy thing, Pam. [camera cuts to Pam then back to Michael] Now, who was the one before Curly?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, Shemp.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Curly? Very good. Curly Joe DeRita.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Just Curly. Joe DeRita was different.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, comedy’s kinda my thing. Watch this, here’s Curly Joe. Mmm. Me, me, me, me, me, me. Me, me, me, me, me, me. Oh, I forgot. Here we go. [Yelling in cod German] I’m Hitler. Right. [Continues with cod German] Me, me, me, me, me, me. Curly Joe Hitler. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All these people are walking around and they’re happy and their lives are just going along, ignorance is bliss. But if they knew what was lurking on the other side of that fence that furry monster. [imitating monster] “I’m gonna get you, downsizing.” No. They wouldn’t… They’d freak. And I’m not going to play God. They look to me for support. And they look to me for guidance and leadership. And I think if I could lie to them and it serves them, then that’s what I’m going to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So this is our sales staff. They are the ones who are making calls and making us lots of money. [comes to a screeching halt and laughs] This is accounting. The numbers dudes. Do not let the job description fool you, they are all completely crazy. Especially that guy, he is a mental patient. [camera zooms in on Kevin] Not literally of course, that wouldn’t work. The last place you’d want somebody like that is accounting. [hides behind office plant] “Very interesting, but stupid.” Artie Johnson. It’s a crazy place.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: My name is Angela and um, I’m in charge of the accounting department. There are three of us, Kevin and Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It’s my job to keep the books in order. And, um, I… I’m, uh, immediately below my supervisor.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oscar, how do I describe him. He’s like a stapler. Do I need a stapler? Yes. But, I’m still the one that has to push it down.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: There’s a lot of anxiety. I don’t want to get laid off. This place is like five minutes from my house.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don’t wanna be laid off. This is a good job for me. ‘Cause I need my nights free. I’m in a band.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Not very worried about downsizing right now. Because, uh, I think you’ve met Kevin and um…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can I just say one thing? Um, my friend is Jewish, Art Geller. And a couple of years ago he, um, showed me how you can plant a tree in Israel, so I planted a tree. So… You know ’cause… Yeah we work in paper. Well, you know, I try to give back.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have a lot of cat figurines on my desk. I think cats, really, are old souls. And, uh, Phyllis thinks so too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What you don’t know… Well, it can hurt you, but if you don’t know it won’t hurt you. Then, you can just be happy for a little while at least.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, John Belushi. What a crazy guy. Phew, freaked myself out this morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I thought I found a lump. I checked the, uh… I check the jewels every month. This time… You know, it’s a little different. It was fine. It was fine. But freaky, man, you know. Testicular cancer, God. Cancer, whoa testicles. So… What’s, um… What you eating?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Smoked turkey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, place around the corner. Nice. All right. See you later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I need to speak up? [grabs boom microphone] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Documentary Crew Member
quotes.text: [boom microphone drops into the camera shoot] Can you move it out? Can you move it? Is that all right? Can you make that work?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s fine.

quotes.speaker: Documentary Crew Member
quotes.text: [new take] No, you don’t even need … That’s fine. We’ll keep it…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m sorry it makes me nervous.

quotes.speaker: Documentary Crew Member
quotes.text: Understood, but it is what we need to capture what you’re saying as clearly as possible.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I understand. It’s in a blind spot because I’m trained in several martial arts and one of them, uh, includes, uh, an awareness that the masters bring, uh, of anything on all sides of you. It could be behind you or whatever. This is directly in a blind spot, so I’m trained to respond negatively to something right above my head. [new take] This now I have an eye on. You see, it’s on my periphery and if I needed to block it, attack it, stop it somehow. [does a martial arts move with his hands] I could come right out. I mean, I know you’re doing your job, but…

quotes.speaker: Documentary Crew Member
quotes.text: [talking over Dwight] It’s…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m doing my job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think better to be a happy idiot then a, um… Then someone who knows the truth.

episodes.title: Diversity Day
episodes.description: Michael's off color remark puts a sensitivity trainer in the office for a presentation, which prompts Michael to create his own.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, uh, can I help you out in here?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Oh, I’m all set, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gotcha. Good. I’d go with the rows. That’s a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today is diversity day and someone’s going to come in and talk to us about diversity. It’s something that I’ve been pushing, that I’ve been wanting to push, for a long time and Corporate mandated it. And I never actually talked to Corporate about it. They kind of beat me to the punch, the bastards. But I was going to. And I think it’s very important that we have this. I’m very, very excited.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s the thing. It’s very sturdy paper and on the back it says, “100% post-consumer content.” What? Hello? Uh-huh. Wait. What? I’m sorry, Mr. Decker. I think I’m losing you. [Shedder whirring] Hello? Hello? Yeah. Hold on one second. I don’t know. Hold on one second.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you really have to do that right now?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes I do. I should have done it weeks ago actually.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mr. Decker, I’m sorry about that. What were you… Can you hold on one second? Yeah, just one second. Thanks. [Power off, silence] Hello? That’s it. Perfect. So what I was saying… [Dialing tone] Hello? Thanks, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Retaliation. Tit for tit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is not the expression.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, it should be.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is my biggest sale of the year. They love me over there for some reason. I’m not really sure why but I make one call over there every year, just to renew their account, and that one call ends up being 25% of my commission for the whole year, so I buy a mini bottle of champagne, celebrate a little. And this year I’m pushing recycled paper on them for one percent more. I know. I’m getting cocky. Right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Solitaire?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, Freecell.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Six on seven.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know. I saw that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So then, why didn’t you do it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m saving that ’cause I like it when the cards go T-ts-ts-tch-tch-tch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who doesn’t love that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Oscar! How are you doing, man?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you have a good weekend going there?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It was fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh yeah, I bet it was fun. [to Mr. Brown] Oh, hey! This is Oscar—

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Martinez.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right. See? I don’t even know, first-name basis!

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Great. We’re all set.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hey, well, diversity, everybody, let’s do it. Oscar works in… here. Jim, could you wrap it up, please?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, uh, Mr. Decker, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s diversity day, Jim. I wish every day was diversity day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? I’m actually going to have to call you back. Thank you. Sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on people, let’s get ’em in. Get in the cards! Get in the cards!

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Thank you. Thank you very much. OK. Thanks for filling these out and I promise this’ll be quick. At Diversity Today, our philosophy is about honesty and positive expectations. We believe that 99% of the problems in the workplace arise simply out of ignorance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? This is a color-free-zone here. Stanley, I don’t look at you as another race.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Uh, see this is what I’m talking about. We don’t have to pretend we’re color-blind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly, were not…

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: That’s fighting ignorance with more ignorance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: With tolerance.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: No. With more ignorance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ignorance.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Right. Exactly. Uh, instead, we need to celebrate our diversity.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s celebrate.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Right. OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Celebrate good times. Come on! Let’s celebrate diversity. Right?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Yes, exactly. Now here’s what we’re going to do. I’ve noticed that…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Here’s what we’re going to do. Why don’t we go around and everybody… everybody say a race that you are attracted to sexually. I will go last. Go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have two. White and Indian.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Actually, I’d prefer not to start that way. Michael, I would love to have your permission to run this session. Can I have your permission?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Thank you very much. And it would also help me if you were seated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Thank you. OK. Now, at the start of the session, I had you all write down an incident that you found offensive in the workplace. Now, what I’m going to do is choose one and we’re going to act it out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A few of the ground rules?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey why don’t you run it by me and I’ll run it by him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, can we steer away from gay people?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Um…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m sorry. It’s an orientation. It’s not a race. Plus a lot of other races are intolerant of gays, so…paradox.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Well, we only have an hour.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I figured it would save time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Why don’t we just defer to Mr…

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Mr. Brown.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah. Oh, right! OK. First test. I will not call you that.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Well, it’s my name. It’s not a test. OK? Um, so looking through the cards, I’ve noticed that many of you wrote down the same incident, which is ironic, because it’s the exact incident I was brought in here to respond to. Now, how many of you are familiar with the Chris Rock routine? Very good. OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How come Chris Rock can do a routine and everybody finds it hilarious and ground-breaking and then I go and do the exact same routine, same comedic timing, and people file a complaint to Corporate? Is it because I’m white and Chris is black?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: So we’re going to reenact this with a more positive outcome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will play the Chris Rock guy. I would like to see someone else pull this off.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Well, let’s have someone who wasn’t involved in the reenactment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, I will play guy listening.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Great. Guy listening. Ok, anyone else remember?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I remember.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Great. You’re the Chris Rock guy and you’re guy listening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin is a great guy. He’s a great accountant. He is not much of an entertainer.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Basically, there are two types of black people and black people are actually more racist because they hate the other type of black people. Every time the one type wants to have a good time, then the other type comes in and makes a real mess.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. He’s ruin… He’s butchering it. Could you just let me… [As Chris Rock] Every time… Every time black people want to have a good time, some ignant ass… [Bleep] I take care of my kid!

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Wait a second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Bleep] They always want credit for something they supPOSED to do!

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [As Chris Rock] What you want a cookie?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Now, this is a simple acronym. HERO. Uh, at Diversity Today, we believe it is very easy to be a HERO. All you need are honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me, I’m sorry, but that’s not all it takes to be a hero.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Oh, great. Well, what is a hero to you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A hero kills people, people that wish him harm.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A hero is part-human and part-supernatural. A hero is born out of a childhood trauma, or out of a disaster that must be avenged.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Ok, you’re thinking of a superhero.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We all have a hero in our heart.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Now, I need you to take these forms. This kind of expresses the joint experience we had today. And I need you to look ’em over and sign them as kind of a group pledge.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Clears throat] I don’t think I can sign this.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: I can’t leave until you do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, OK, it says here that I learned something and I knew all this stuff already, so… I know, I could sign something that says that I taught something, or that I helped you teach something, so… Pam! Where is she? Pam, could we change something on this?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Michael, can I talk to you candidly?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: We both know that I’m here because of the comments you made.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here’s the thing. This office, I think this is very advanced in terms of… racial awareness and it’s probably more advanced than you’re used to. That’s probably throwing you off a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Um, it’s not throwing me. I need your signature.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, well I know. You told me that several times.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Yes, but you’re not listening to me. Yours is the only signature I need.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Those are my instructions from the Corporate offices to put you through this seminar for the comments that you made. The reason I made copies for everyone was so you wouldn’t be embarrassed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, here I am thinking that you actually cared about diversity training. And you don’t.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Don’t worry about dating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I won’t.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: OK. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “I regret my actions. I regret offending my coworkers. I pledge to bring my best spirit of honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness…” Open-mindedness, is that even a word? “…into the workplace. In this way, I can truly be a hero. Signed, Daffy Duck.” [Laughing] He’s going to lose it when he reads that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, hi. Is Mr. Decker around? Oh, well, could you just have him call me after lunch? Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “I pledge to always keep an open mind and an open heart.” I do believe… in that part of the pledge I that just read. But a pledge? Come on. I mean who are we, the Girl Scouts? No. Look… the guy, “Mr. Brown,” he got us halfway there. He got us talking. Well, no. I got us talking. He got us nothing. He insulted us and he abandoned us. You call that diversity training? I don’t. Were there any connections between any of us? Did anyone look each other in the eye? Was there any emotion going on? No. Where was the heart? I didn’t see any heart. Where was my Oprah moment? OK, get as much done as you can before lunch because, afterward, I’m going to have you all in tears.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right? Everybody pretty? Come on. Here we go. It’s time. Let’s do some good.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, we’re not all going to sit in a circle Indian style are we? [Laughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get out.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, this is not a joke. OK? That was offensive and lame. So double offensive. This is an environment of welcoming and you should just get the hell out of here. OK, let’s go. Let’s do it. Come on. Let’s have some fun, everybody. Here we go. Take a seat. Cop a squat. And um… thanks for coming in. Um… Diversity… is the cornerstone of progress as I’ve always said. But don’t take my word for it. Let’s take a look at the tape.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the tape] Hi. I’m Michael Scott. I’m in charge of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products here in Scranton, Pennsylvania but I’m also the founder of Diversity Tomorrow, because today is almost over. Abraham Lincoln once said that, “If you’re a racist, I will attack you with the North.” And those are the principles that I carry with me in the workplace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Questions? Comments? Anybody? Jim?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have something here. I want you to take a card. Put it on your fore… Don’t look at the card. I want you to take the card and put it on your forehead and… Take a card, take a card, any card. Um… And I want you to treat other people like the race that is on their forehead. OK? So everybody has a different race. Nobody knows what their race is, so… I want you to really go for it, cause this is real. You know, this isn’t just an exercise. This is real life. And… I have a dream that you will really let the sparks fly. Get ‘er done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why? Because Martin Luther King is a hero of mine. There’s this great Chris Rock bit about how streets named after Martin Luther King tend to be more violent. I’m not going to do it but it’s…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh this is a good one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, hi. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Fine. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Push it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I admire your culture’s success in America.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Bom bom bom-bom bom. Come on Olympics of Suffering right here. Slavery versus the Holocaust. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Who am I supposed to be?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that was inadvertent. We didn’t actually plan that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Lots of cultures eat rice, doesn’t help me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Um… Shalom. I’d like to apply for a loan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s nice, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, do me. Something stereotypical so I can get it really quick.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK, I like your food.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Outback steakhouse. [Australian accent] I’m Australian, mate!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, come on. “I like your food.” Come on stir the pot. Stir the melting pot, Pam! Let’s do it. Let’s get ugly. Let’s get real.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. If I have to do this, based on stereotypes that are totally untrue, that I do not agree with, you would maybe not be  a very good driver.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man, am I a woman?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’ll notice I didn’t have anybody be an Arab. I thought that would be too explosive. No pun intended. But I just though. “Too soon for Arabs.” Maybe next year. Um… You know, the ball’s in their court.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you watching?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Chappelle’s Show.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I downloaded it on her computer. I hope she doesn’t mind. She just had a lot of extra space.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No way. I think she likes this stuff.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Great. She’s cute, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, you know, she’s engaged, but…

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, no, the girl in the… sketch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. She’s hot.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You wanna go to the beach?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You wanna get high?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think you do, mon.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Stop…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. All right. No. It’s good. You just need to push it. You need to go a little bit further. All right. OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Voice raised, Indian accent] Kelly, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I just had the longest meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Welcome to my convenience store. Would you like some googi googi? I have some very delicious googi, googi, only 99 cents plus tax. Try my googi, googi. [Lowering voice] Try my googi, googi. [High-pitched voice] Try my googi, googi. Try my… [slap!]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [trying not to cry] All right! All right! Yes! That was great, she gets it! Now she knows what it’s like to be a minority.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on the phone] Mr. Decker, we didn’t lose your sale today, did we? Excellent. OK. Let me just get your… what’s that? No, we didn’t close last time. I just need your… Oh. W-What code were you given? Oh, OK. That’s actually another salesman here. I can redo it if you want to do that. Oh, he gave you a discount? No, I don’t blame you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just hated it when that guy was in here. Mr. Brown, if that was his real name. I mean, he had never met any of us before, and here he was telling us how to do our thing. I just wanted… I just wanted to do it our way. You know? On our own. Man I should have gotten some food.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Italian accent]Maybe some spagh-etti.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Kevin. You can take that off that thing, OK? That would really, really have shown him up, wouldn’t it? If I’d brought in some burritos or some colored greens. Or some pad Thai. I love pad Thai.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It’s collard greens.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It’s collard greens.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That doesn’t really make sense. Because you don’t call them collared people, that’s offensive. Hmmm… OK, well, it’s after five. So… Thank you very much. Buena vista Oscar. Thank you. Good job. Oh, my man. Thank you Brazil. Nice.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Pam is asleep, resting her head on Jim’s shoulder] Um… Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [stirs] Mmmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We can go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh… Not a bad day.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Thanks for filling these out. I promise this will be quick. We only have about an hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I would like to see us erase 100 years of racism in an hour.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Does this company have 100 years to erase?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, the country.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Oh right, more like 200 years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, more like a 1,000.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Okay, um. Uh, I’ll try to make this quick.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am a salesman, okay. And I don’t think we should be doing this during prime sales hours. If you can prove to me that diversity is going to help my sales, I’ll go elephant running with James Earl Jones. I really will, but not on spec.

quotes.speaker: Deleted Scene 3 Mr. Brown
quotes.text: HERO, at Diversity Today, we believe it is very easy to be a HERO. All you need are honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just think that HERO? It’s cute, but it’s… It’s empty, you know? It’s easy. Dwight, you know what, I came up with some terms of my own. Could you put these on the board? The first one is Inclusion, New Attitudes, Color-blind…

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Oh, nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Expectations….

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. Sharing…

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And tolerance.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, that spells incest.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Oh, my sorry. That is not appropriate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it’s not ideal but you have to give me some credit ’cause I made it into a word.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Yeah, but it’s not appropriate. This is not helpful as a memory aid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will give you a number of reasons why it is, actually. Okay, first, incest is bad. Racism is bad. No brainer, right? Two, incest. We’re all a family, right? We’re all brothers and sisters. Racial message? Um? Number three, and this is a fact. The states where they have a lot of racism are the states where they have a lot of incest. Okay? And finally…

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Okay, Michael, I just…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, wait. Final one, final one this is important. The more we can encourage interracial dating as a society the further away we get from incest, literally.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It would’ve been just as easy for him to spell insect. Of course, that wouldn’t have made any sense either.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Does anyone have anything else at all? Anyone besides Michael?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I have something.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: Yes, please.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, well I grew up here in Scranton and when I was a kid the guy who lived next door was a former baseball player, who actually played pro ball before the leagues were integrated. And he had the most incredible stories about…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. I’m sorry, I’m sorry this guy’s a temp and I should’ve told you that.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. An outsider’s perspective would probably be pretty helpful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, but no, seriously. Uh, you know, he’s not a member of the full staff so, uh, Ryan you wanna just step outside?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What do you want me to do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, maybe you should go down to the parking lot. You know what. Yes, go down to the parking lot and check to se if any of our guests have parked in the handicapped spots. Cool? ‘Cause the handicaps get a raw deal. Oh, you know what. That ties right into New Attitudes. New attitudes about handicap people. Very important.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Brown
quotes.text: I’m sorry, Michael. We’re actually out of time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, um, there’s good things about Michael. He uh, uh… Yeah, definitely. Um…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “In this way, I can truly be a hero. Signed, Daffy Duck.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] He’s going to lose it when he reads that. Doh! Hogan! Not again, Hogan! Get Col. Burkhalter on the phone! [laughing] I’m kind of a Hogan around here. And kind of, Jan is kind of Col. Burkhalter, then Dwight is Schultz. But, it’s… Oh, God. We have fun. We have fun. ‘Cause he’s gonna be pissed. [making voice] No doubt about it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Freecell.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Solitaire is a one-player game. It can’t have two players.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I mean.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What’s your win rate?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Seventy-six percent. What’s yours?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re not allowed to play two-player. You need to start over.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re doing fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are we going?  [Dwight puts four fingers in front of the camera to start a countdown] Don’t do that. Just say action when we’re ready.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, Michael Scott, Diversity Tomorrow, take four. And action.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mumbling] Should I… turn, no. Do it again.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Diversity Tomorrow, take five. Action.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi. I’m Michael Scott. I’m in charge of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products here in Scranton, Pennsylvania but I’m also the founder of Diversity Tomorrow, because today is almost over. Abraham Lincoln once said that, “If you’re a racist, I will attack you with the North.” And those are the principles… Damn it. Okay, sorry. Don’t laugh; please don’t laugh this time Dwight. You’re… it’s, it’s bugging me. Let me give myself a countdown, ready? Three, two, one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Take six.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just let me do it! God! Three, two, one. Hi. I’m Michael Scott. I’m in charge of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products here in Scranton… Keep the camera steady please! People are gonna get sea sick watching this. Ready? Three, two, one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Action.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t. Please don’t say anything. [sighs] Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And action… Lights, camera, action. Whenever you’re ready.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could I count myself down please, Dwight. Three, two, one. Hi. I’m Michael Scott. I’m in charge of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products here in Scranton, Pennsylvania but I’m also the founder of Diversity Tomorrow, because today is almost over. Abraham Lincoln once said that, “If you’re a racist, I will attack you with the North.” And those are the principles that I carry with me in the workplace.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cut.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [wandering around the room during his diversity exercise] I want you to push it. I want you to push ’cause breakthroughs are right around the corner. Something’s going to pop here. Something’s going to pop between a party. Feel what it’s like to be in someone else’s skin. What does it feel like to be a different race? It feels pretty bad doesn’t it. So let that come out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I marched on Washington back in the day. I went to the Washington Monument and the Lincoln Memorial, U.S. Mint, congressman talked to our class. It was pretty cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Talk like you’re talking to that race. I have a feeling that this could get kind of volatile. So keep it going. [camera shows Devon sitting outside with West Nile]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, what’s going on here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: People treat us like the race on our forehead. And then we guess what race we are.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, good. Good luck. Doing good. [goes to the index cards and writes another race down]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man, am I a woman?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How embarrassing is it? That’s not fair. Here…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s not fair.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Try this. [takes Dwight’s ‘Asian’ race and switches it with the one he wrote]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Go get ’em.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. [clears throat] So, am I a hunter gather culture?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do I live near a harbor or an ocean?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I’m an inland. Am I a mountainous?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Am I nomadic?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, okay, okay, okay. I think I got this. Um, I am treated in a foreign way with a great deal of prejudice. Am I one of those tribes in Africa? The piggies, or whatever?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. But I am, I am human, right? [Pam hesitates]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight’s new race is ‘Dwight’] I could be French.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [takes his ‘Dwight’ race off his forehead] Damn it, Jim! That’s not funny, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay. Here we go, breakthrough radar. What happened? What happened here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It didn’t have anything to do with race.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, all right. Let’s keep on track. Keep on point. Let’s do it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One time we had an ethnic festival in Scranton. One time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Try my googi, googi. [Lowering voice] Try my googi, googi. [High-pitched voice] Try my googi, googi. Try my… [Kelly slaps Michael] All right! All right! Yes! That was great, she gets it! Kelly thank you. [claps] She’s not here, but she gets it. That’s what we have been looking for. The whole time. [trying not to cry] Oh, man. This is what I thrive on. You know? It’s like Don Rickles on acid, man. Right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, why did she slap Martin Luther King?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What card was she?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think she wasn’t wearing a card.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s good. This is good. We got it happening now. All right? Let’s keep it rolling. Let’s round it up.

episodes.title: Health Care
episodes.description: Michael leaves Dwight in charge of picking the new healthcare plan for the staff, with disastrous results ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam. Pamela. Pam-elama-ding-dong. Making copies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m not making any copies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s go. Messages. Stat. Lots to do, lots to do. Information superhighway.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nothing new.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Lay them on me. What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There’s nothing new.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s not what you said earlier.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, do you want me to repeat the messages that I gave you before for the… [nods toward camera]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The most sacred thing I do is care and provide for my workers, my family. I give them money. I give them food. Not directly, but through the money. I heal them. Today, I am in charge of picking a great new health care plan. Right? That’s what this is all about. Does that make me their doctor? Um… Yes, in a way. Yeah, like a specialist.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So, which health plan have you decided on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to go with the best, Jan. I am going to go with the one with the acupuncture, therapeutic massage, you know, the works.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Wait, acupuncture? None of the plans have acupuncture. Have you looked at them closely Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think it was you who didn’t look closely enough at the Gold Plan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: The Gold Plan? I’m not even on that plan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I’d recommend it. It’s very good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You gotta crack these things open.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know the whole reason that we’re doing this, is to save money. So you just need to pick a provider and choose the cheapest plan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that is kind of a tough assignment. Um… It won’t be popular decision around the old orifice.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It’s your job. So…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it’s a suicide mission, you know.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael… maybe… I mean…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There, there…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Sometimes a manager, like yourself, has to deliver the bad news to the employees. I do it all the time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [scoffs] When have you ever done that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m doing it right now. To you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Last night on Trading Spouses, there’s… have you seen it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. I have a life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Interesting, what’s that like?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You should try it sometime.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. But then who would watch my TV? That is…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs]… your problem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jimbo! Ha haaaaa. Ah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s a decision that needs to be made, and I’m having an unbelievably a busy day. So I’m going to let you pick a health care plan for our office and then explain it to your co-workers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Gosh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is a great offer. Thank you. I really think I should be concentrating on sales.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. I just don’t think this is the kind of task, that I… am going to do. You know who would be great for this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Any time Michael asks me to do anything, I just tell him that Dwight should do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. I can do it. I’m your man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right now, this is just a job. If I advance any higher in this company then this would be my career. And uh, well, if this were my career, I’d have to throw myself in front of a train.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, first, let’s go over some parameters. How many people can I fire?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, none. You’re picking a health care plan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, we’ll table that for the time being. Two, I’ll need an office. I think the conference room should be fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can use the conference room as a temporary workspace.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to self] Yes, I have an office. [to camera] Bigger than his.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope, you cannot use it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, I take it back, it’s a workspace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Temporary workspace. You can use it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If Dwight fails, then that is strike two, and good for me for, ah, for giving him a second chance. And if he succeeds, then, you know, no one will be prouder than I am. I groomed him. I made him what he is today. Unless he fails, and we’ve talked about that already.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What did I do? I did my job. I slashed benefits to the bone. I saved this company money. Was I too harsh? Maybe. I don’t believe in coddling people.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In the wild, there is no health care. In the wild, health care is, “Ow, I hurt my leg. I can’t run. A lion eats me and I’m dead.” Well, I’m not dead. I’m the lion. You’re dead.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: There’s no dental, there’s no vision, there’s a $1,200 deductible.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Pam, Michael Scott. How’s tricks?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I am in my office. I am swamped. I have work up to my ears I’m busy, busy, busy. Can’t step away. I just wanted to check in and see how everybody’s doing. Everybody cool out there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Actually, people are really unhappy. Um, Dwight sent around this memo and people are freaking out ’cause the…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam! Whoa, whoa, I’m sorry, I’m sorry, I, I, I, I gotta go. I’m getting a call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No you’re not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have to make a call after I finish… my work. You know what? Uh, just don’t let anybody in my office under any conditions today. I’m just too busy. Too swamped, you know? I am unreachable. I am incommunicado, capisce?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Oh, gah, here we go again. Gotta go, I have to take this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Still no one calling.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, what…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, knock, please. Please knock. This is an office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It says “workspace”.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If it’s the same thing, then why did you write “workspace”?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just knock, Please? As a sign of respect for your superior.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You are not my superior.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh gee, then why do I have an office?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought it was a workspace?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. Dwight. Are you really in charge of picking the health care plan?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. And my decision in final.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is a ridiculously awful plan. Because you cut everything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aww, times are tough, Pam. Deal with it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You cut more than you had to, didn’t you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, why did you do that? You work here, don’t you want good insurance?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t need it. Never been sick. Perfect immune system.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, well, if you’ve never been sick, then you don’t have any antibodies.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t need them. Superior genes. I’m a Schrute. And superior brain power. Through concentration, I can raise and lower my cholesterol at will.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why would you want to raise your cholesterol?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So I can lower it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He literally won’t come out of his office.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: He’s got to come out sometime. To go to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin! That’s inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, can I talk to you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, uh, I would love to, but I am really busy. Rain check?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Michael. Michael, please, can we talk to you about this memo?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, what? Which memo?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight’s health care memo. I told you about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it a good plan?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s a great plan. It saves the company a fortune.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It’s like a pay decrease.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, he made huge cuts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cuts? What? Wow, Dwight, did you make cuts?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, you said…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no , no, you know what? I said nothing specific because I was so busy. Why don’t you go in there and find these people a plan that will work for them? OK?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can handle that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK? All right. Do we feel good? All right. Good. Plus, there’s some other good news. Today, at the end of the day, I will have, for all of you, a big surprise. OK? So hang in there, and I will see you at the end of the day. Right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This is not good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It’s ridiculous. Did you talk to him?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You let him walk all over you. It’s just pathetic.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What are you guys talking about?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Nothing, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I know what the surprise is? Hell no! It doesn’t matter. The point is, they’re not unhappy anymore. They’re out there thinking, “Wow, my boss really cares about me. He has a surprise. He’s cool. I… what a great guy. I love him. I… love him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, everyone. Gather round. Step forward. It has been brought to my attention that some of you are unhappy with my plan. So what I’d like you to do is to fill this out and write down any diseases you have that you might want covered and I’ll see what I can do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, you know what Dwight? We can’t write our diseases down for you because that’s confidential.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, well, I didn’t say to write your name down, did I? Fill it out, leave it anonymous. Or, don’t write any disease down at all and it won’t be covered. Sound fair? Good. I’ll be in my office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Workspace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Come with me. We are going on a little mission. Operation Surprise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where are you going?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, headed out. Part of my busy day, you know. Meetings. [Giggles] Couldn’t find the knob.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, basically, I want to do something nice for my employees. Atlantic City, OK? They have this thing where they send a bus, right, for free. Picks everybody up, you head down there, get to the hotel, room is comped, they give you a pile of chips, and your food, everything just kind of all-inclusive, free kind of weekend.

quotes.speaker: Travel Agent
quotes.text: I don’t know of anything like that, but, um, you know what you might want to do, is just call those casinos directly. Um, maybe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I did, so…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait. What are you writing? Don’t write Ebola or mad cow disease. Right? ‘Cause I’m suffering from both.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m inventing new diseases.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, let’s say my teeth turn to liquid and then, they drip down the back of my throat. What would you call that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought you said you were inventing diseases? That’s spontaneous dental hydroplosion.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on his cell phone] Calling you to ask you a little favoroonie my friend. Um, trying to give the troops around here a little bit of a boost. And I was thinking that maybe we could take them down to take a spin on your big ride.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: You mean the elevator that takes you down into the mineshaft? It’s not really a ride.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Its says here that it’s a 300ft drop.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: It goes 300 feet into the earth, but it moves really slowly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So it’s not a free fall?

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: It’s an industrial coal elevator.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, all right. Well, once you get down into the mine, what… you got laser tag or something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, so I don’t know what the surprise is. Am I worried? No. No way. See, I thrive on this. This is my world. This is improv. This is Whose Line is it Anyway?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damnit! Damnit Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right, who did this? I’m not mad. I just want to know who did it so I can punish them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, someone forged, uh, medical information and that is a felony.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, whoa. ‘Cause that is a pretty intense accusation. How do you know that they’re fake?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, leprosy? Flesh eating bacteria. Hot-dog fingers. Government-created killer nanorobot infection.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You did this, didn’t you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes you did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No I didn’t.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know it was you. Fine. You know what? I’ll have to interview each and every one of you until the perpetrator makes him or herself known. And until that time, there will be no health care coverage for any one!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Killer nanorobots?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s an epidemic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The problem, Jim, is that people who are really suffering from a medical condition won’t receive the care they need, because someone in this office is coming up with all this ridiculous stuff. [reads off of paper] “Count Choculitis”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sounds tough.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why did you write that down Jim? Is it because you know I love Count Chocula?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think you need to confess…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …the fact…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing? Those are my keys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good luck. [closes door and locks it]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim! Damnit! No! Jim! Let me out! Jim! Let… [Without looking, Jim throws his keys to his left, they land on a shelf next to Stanley]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [looks at keys, continues talking on phone] …the light green or green…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [answering phone] Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me out or you’re fired.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, you can’t fire me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes I can. I’m manager for the day. Clean out your desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, can you hold on? I’m getting the, ah, beep. [presses button on phone]] Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, Jim. It’s Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Pam! How are you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim! Open the door!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good, how are you? Busy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m doing OK. Getting excited for the weekend though. What are you up to?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I’m not bothering you, am I?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, not at all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You don’t have anything you’re doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have nothing to do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!
