quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh great. Um, no, this weekend? Nothing. I’m not really doing anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I might go to the mall.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The mall?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I need new shoes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, interesting, what kind of shoes?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, hello. Uh, this is Dwight Schrute calling for Jan Levenson-Gould.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This is Jan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hi. Dwight Schrute calling, acting manager, Scranton branch. Listen, I needed your permission to fire Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: From sales?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Where’s Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He is not here right now. He put me in charge of the office.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Dwight, listen to me very carefully. You are not a manager of anything. Understand?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s not entirely true, because he put me in charge of picking the health care plan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK, when Michael gets back, you tell him to call me immediately.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Call you immediately. Good. Oh, hey, listen, um, since I have you on the phone, um, can I fire Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No. Please don’t use my cell phone ever again.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, this is your cell, I thought this was your… [dial tone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, everybody, Ice-cream sandwiches! Aaaahh! [laughs] Here you go. Take one, take one. It’s all good. Phyllis, think fast. Ya-bome! Oh, oh, I see Angela. Angela? Right? Waaaaah! Oh, hey temp. Why don’t you take two? Because you don’t get health care. And uh, faster metabolism.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Did you get the kind with the cookies? Instead of the…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don’t you just eat it, OK? And here you go, Stanley the manly.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This isn’t the big surprise, is it? Because we’ve been having a pretty horrible day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, nope. Nope. This isn’t the surprise. It’s surprising, um… because you didn’t expect it. But you will… you’ll know it when you see it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael. Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [under his breath] Oh, Christ.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I tried being rational, OK? And what happened? The employees went crazy, I got no help from corporate. That leaves me with no options.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m now going to read out loud your submitted medical conditions. When you hear yours read, please raise your hand to indicate that it is real. If you do not raise your hand, it will not be covered.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What about confidentiality?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what? You have forfeited that privilege. I have tried to treat you all as adults, but obviously I am the only adult here. Number one, inverted penis.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Could you mean vagina? Because if you do, I want that covered.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I thought your vagina was removed during your hysterectomy?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: A uterus is different from a vagina. I still have a vagina.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, great. Dermatitis. Thank you Angela. I’ll make sure that’s covered. OK, now. Who wrote this, hysterical one? Anal fissures?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That’s a real thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, but no one here has it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Someone has it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Do you think we should go ?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don’t know, Kevin. This is important. I don’t want… [spots Michael through the blinds] There he is.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What is he doing?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, what? You could be referring to anything.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: OK, the health care plan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why did you put Dwight in charge of that? He did a horrible job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, Dwight? Did you raise benefits?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I most certainly did not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh come on! That’s horrible! Aaah… Thanks, Dwight, for a crappy plan. Ah, Damn! Oh, mmm, I wish I had time to change it, but Jan needs it by five, and… what time is it, what time is it? [looks at watch] Ah, it’s after five. Oh, oh it’s awful. So, well, OK. See you guys on Monday.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What about the surprise?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… Yes. Exactly. Thank you Angela, for reminding me. Terrific. Um, before I tell everybody what the big surprise is, would you like to tell me what you think the big surprise is?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We all think you don’t have a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, I have some news for you. There is a big surprise. And… here it is. Here we go. And the big surprise is… Brrrrrrrr! Drum roll… Brrrrrrrr! Brrrrrrrr!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I am backed into a corner, that is when I come alive. See I learned improve from the greats, like, um, Drew Carey and Ryan Stiles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clapping hands] God, yeah… Ah! This…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Robin Williams. Oh, man, would I love to go head-to-head with him. Oh! That would be exciting. [as Robin Williams] “Hi. I’m Mork from Ork.” Well, I’m Bork from Spork. Nanoo, nanoo. Jibelee, baloobaloo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, um… Jan wants you to call her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [heated discussion in the ‘Dwight Schrute Workspace’, door opens] I did not dismiss you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, you have no right to ask those questions.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You came into my office voluntarily.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Because I don’t want my benefits slashed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, maybe they won’t get slashed if you answer all my questions.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I’m reporting you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know when ever a worker is promoted above their peers there’s always going to be a little bit of jealousy. Uh, it’s natural. And that’s going to lead to goofing off and that’s okay that’s fine. As long as they are willing to suffer the consequences.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael I need to talk to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry, too busy can’t even come to the door.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [opens door] Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, no… [hurries to get up from chair]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, Michael I… [blinds rustle] … inside.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what. I, um, I’m out the door. I’m going to a meeting. Pam, I’m headed out to another meeting. So see you later. Uh, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We stole Dwight’s trashcan and she found some of his early attempts at his sign.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, here’s uh, this is very simple. “Dwight’s Workspace,” nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, this one interesting the power comes from the font in this one. “Schrute Space,” very medieval, very England. Um, this one’s forceful, this one’s very Dwight. “Quiet! Dwight Schrute Working,” it’s good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I really heard him on that. This one’s interesting I’m not really sure what he meant by this. Um, “Dwight Schrute Privates.” Tough to say.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you know what, Dwight. What if you got a really serious disease like Ebola.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Psssh, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it could happen. Have you ever seen the movie Outbreak?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. Well, have you ever seen the movie Unbreakable? ‘Cause that guy couldn’t get sick, just like me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Have you ever seen the movie Sixth Sense? Maybe you are already dead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Unlikely.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You promise these are confidential?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you just mark on that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t think so, no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You made a “P.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wrong. [walks away] Thank you Jim. Kevin. Stanley. [whispering] Pam, Jim, Kevin, Stanley. Pam, Jim, Kevin, Stanley. You finished?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Here’s the rest of them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That was… unauthorized.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it is time to call in a little favor. A buddy of mine runs this tourist attraction, actually it’s big. It’s probably one of the most popular in the state. So…

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on his cell phone] Hey, hey Craigers, my man! It is Michael Scott here. [silence] Dunder Mifflin, we supply your office paper.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: Oh, I think we already did our order this month.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. No, actually to ask you a little favoroonie my friend. Um, here’s the deal. Um, trying to give the troops here a little bit of a boost. And I was thinking that maybe we could bring them down to go on your big ride.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: You mean the elevator that takes you down into the mineshaft? It’s not really a ride.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it says here that it’s a 300ft drop.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: Well, it goes 300 feet into the earth, but it moves really slowly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So it’s not a free fall?

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: It’s an industrial coal elevator.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, okay. So um, once you get down into the mine, what do you do? Is it like, uh… Do you have laser tag down there or something?

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: No, you just look around. It’s a historically preserved coal mine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s it?

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: Well, there’s the adjacent Anthracite Heritage Museum. They got some really interesting old mining tools. There’s also a photo mural exhibit. Uh, bat guano sculpture. [Michael hangs up cell phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, he’s a small client. They don’t really buy much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why do you want health care, Pam? Hmm? Why do you want it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: In case I get sick.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why don’t you just go ahead and use Roy’s health care plan, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because we’re not married.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But you’re engaged. Aren’t you and maybe you’ve set a date for the wedding, hmm? And because you know you’re going to get married you don’t have to take our health care plan seriously.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We haven’t set a date. [Dwight laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You really expect me to believe you haven’t set a date? I think you have. Sure Pam, sure. But you know what, you’ve been engaged for three years and I know you’ve set a date. And you know what else, I know you’ve got coverage under Roy and I know that you wrote down those fake diseases. Admit it. Admit it, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shut up, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wrote down… I didn’t give you permission to.. I didn’t…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m not talking to you anymore.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, I uh, I have something to confess.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re doing the right thing. Go ahead. What ‘s your confession?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let it out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You’re a jackass.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. You wanna do this the hard way. We’ll do this the hard way. You wrote down those fake diseases didn’t you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. Was that the hard way?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know you did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, then why are you wasting everybody else’s time interrogating them?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, because I want to know who wrote those diseases down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You want you to take this pen and this piece of paper and write this down. Write this down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I, Jim Halpert…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, slow down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …confess to health care fraud.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: One second ’cause that sounds really good. Is jackass one word or two? [Dwight sighs] One, right? ‘Cause, ’cause of the show, it’s one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One word.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ve really learned from the greats. The great improvisers, Drew Carey, Ryan Stiles, uh, the Brady guy not so much. He’s more the signing, Wayne Brady. Um, Robin Williams. Oh, man, would I love to go head-to-head with him. Oh! That would be exciting. [as Robin Williams] “Hi. I’m Mork from Ork.” Well, I’m Bork from Spork. Nanoo, nanoo. Jibelee, baloobaloo. [as Robin Williams] “That’s Good morning, Vietnam!” Well, hello to you. You know it would be… God. And you know what, sometimes when I’m watching somebody like um, like Jay Leno. He’ll be half way through his step [snaps his fingers] And I will already be laughing at the punch line. He hasn’t even gotten to it. He doesn’t even know what it is it. So it’s fun, you know it’s fun having a mind that works like that. That is just a few steps ahead of… comedically ahead of like what’s going on. Like I’ll watch T.V. and I’ll be watching a show and I will think, oh, I know someone’s gonna walk in here right now and say something funny. And then they do. Or, um, I know they’ll be like oh boy that person deserved to be slammed down. There’s going to be some sort of insult. And there is. You know, there’s like, “Oh you’re… God your butt is fat.” And I knew it. I know it’s like I knew they were going to say that. I knew they were gonna go there. Don’t go there. Um, but other… You know it’s like uh, you know Leno, um and Letterman, Carson, you know. Need I say more? No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, um… Jan wants you to call her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’re all going bowling!

episodes.title: The Alliance
episodes.description: Just for a laugh, Jim agrees to an alliance with Dwight regarding the downsizing rumors.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael!?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! God. Dwight, come on…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wanted to talk to you about the downsizing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s no downsizing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I, but if there were, I’d be protected as assistant regional manager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Assistant to the regional manager Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, so I don’t have to worry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, look, look. I talked to corporate, about protecting the sales staff. And they said they couldn’t guarantee it if there’s downsizing, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But there’s no downsizing, so just don’t…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bottom line. Do I need to be worried?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm, mm, mm. Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It looks like there’s gonna be downsizing. And it’s part of my job, but… blah! I hate it. I think the main difference between me and Donald Trump is that, uh, I get no pleasure out of saying the words, “You’re fired.” [as Donald Trump] “You’re foir-ed. Uh, you’re foir-ed.” It just makes people sad, and an office can’t function that way. No way. [as Donald Trump] “You’re foir-ed.”  I think if I had a catchphrase it would be, “You’re hired, and you can work here as long as you want.” But that’s unrealistic, so…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s a real shame, ’cause studies have shown that more information gets passed through water-cooler gossip than through official memos. Which puts me at a disadvantage, because I bring my own water to work.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why’d you do this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I didn’t do it. What do you mean? Oh, the water cooler was brought over here for… maintenance. So what do you guys hear? What’s the scuttlebutt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get set for Operation Morale Improvement starring Michael Scott. Now, I think I have had a little stroke of genius in that I have had my assistant Pam… Smile, Pam. I have had her go out and find out whose birthday is coming up, so we can have a little celebration for it. Not bad, not bad at all. All right. And the birthday person is… drum roll please. Here we go, who is the birthday, birthday person?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who is it? Who’s the birthday?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um… Actually, we don’t have any staff birthdays coming up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Next person on the…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …calendar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, umm… that would be Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! All right, come on down Meredith!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But it’s not until next month.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um… uh, OK. Well, great, well, you know, it’ll be a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You still want to have a party?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, why not? Sure. Go ahead, live a little. Come on, Pam. Come on, shake it up. Shake it up! Shake it up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [grabs cell phone off desk] Brrrp! Uh, Spock, are there any signs of life down there? Well, let me check Captain. Eeee. Eeee. Eeee. Eeee. No, Captain. No signs of life down here. Just a wet blanket named Pam. Brr-rrrp. Star Trek.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, uh, for decorations, maybe we could… it’s stupid, forget it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I was just going to say, maybe we could have streamers, but that’s dumb, everybody has streamers. Never mind.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, yeah, I think that’s a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What color do you guys think?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, there’s green, um, blue… yellow… red…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about green?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think green is kind of whoreish.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This was tough. I suggested we flip a coin. But Angela said she doesn’t like to gamble. Of course by saying that she was gambling that I wouldn’t smack her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: These are my party-planning beeyatches. Pulled off an amazing ’80s party last year. Off the hook!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I was thinking, if you haven’t already got a cake, um, maybe going for one of those ice-cream cakes from Baskin-Robbins. Those are very good. Very Delicious.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Meredith’s allergic to dairy, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She’s not the only one that’s going to be eating it, right? I think everybody likes ice-cream cake. It’s not, uh, it’s not just about her, so…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It is… her birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mint chocolate chip! That’d be good, how about some, mint chocolate chip?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, so listen, I was thinking that it might be a good idea if you and I formed an alliance. ‘Cause of the downsizing? I think an alliance might be a good idea, you know. Help each other out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you want to form, an alliance, with me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely, I do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good, good. Excellent, OK. Now we need to figure out who’s vulnerable and who’s protected…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: At that moment, I was so happy. I mean, everything Dwight does annoys me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you get your tickets?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: To what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The gun show. [Rolls up his sleeve and kisses his bicep]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I spend hours thinking of ways to get back at him, but only in ways that could get me arrested. And then here he comes and he says “No, Jim, here’s a way.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There’s one other thing and this is important. Let’s keep this alliance totally a secret. Don’t tell anyone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: An alliance?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What does that even mean?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think it has something to do with Survivor, but I’m not sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, I know that it involves spying on people and we may build a fort, underground.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim! Hey. Hi, Pam. Listen, could I talk to you a second about the… paper products?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you tell Pam about the alliance?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? Oh no no no. Dwight, no. I’m using her, for the alliance. Who knows the most information about this office? Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right, that’s good, good, pursue this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well I’m trying to. Do you see what I’m doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But listen, I’m going to have to talk to her a lot. All right? And there may be chatting, and giggling. And you gotta just pretend to ignore it. Wipe it away.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to the camera] Can you get her? She’s right there. [camera zooms in on Meredith at here desk] That is Meredith, the birthday girl. And this… is Meredith’s card. Happy Bird-Day. [laughs] Um, let’s see. Jim, Jim wrote, “Meredith, I heard you’re turning 46, but, come on, you’re an accountant. Just fudge the numbers.” Not bad, pretty funny, I don’t appreciate condoning corporate fraud though. Uh, here’s the thing. Whatever I write here has to be really, really funny. Because people out there are expecting it. I’ve already set the bar really high. And they’re all worried about their jobs, you know. It’s kinda dark out there. Can you imagine if I wrote something like, uh, “Oh, Meredith. Happy Birthday. You’re great. Love, Michael.” [pretends to vomit and laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They seem awfully chummy, don’t you think?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, what do you think that’s about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Only one way to find out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m on it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You are not going to believe this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? I believe it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, tensions were high in the kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I could tell, from the body language.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Kev, that looks good. What is it? Turkey?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Italian.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, Italian. Nice. Wow! You got the works there. Red onion, provolone…

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Toby and Kevin, they’re trying to get Angela kicked off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good, let ’em. It helps our cause.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I don’t know, if Kevin’s in accounting, and Toby’s in Human Resources and they’re talking…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, they’re forming an alliance

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I love their sandwiches.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I love their sandwiches too.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Their bread’s really good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Their bread is very good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it. God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, listen, we need to assume that everyone in the office is forming an alliance and is therefore trying to get us kicked off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: God… Damn it! Why us?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Because we’re strong, Dwight. Because we’re strong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [staring at birthday card] Meredith, Meredith… Meri… Mary had a little lamb. Mary… Meredith had a little lamb. Don’t bring that lamb to work or it’ll poop on the floor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Oscar! Come on in. What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Uh, I’m sorry to bother you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, not at all. Come on in. What’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: My nephew is involved with, um, a charity for cerebral palsy, and I was wondering if maybe you’d like to… you know… if…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Donate to the charity?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God. Of course I would. Get it over here. Get that over here.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’m always good… for some serious buckage. Wow. Two dollars, three dollars? People out here do not care about diseases. I am going to give you… $25.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That’s… that’s… that’s very generous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my gosh, well… Listen, Oscar, generosity and togetherness and community all convalescences into… morale. That’s what I say, so…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispering] Hey, Jim, can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure, what’s up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I don’t know, I’m just like, I’m going a little crazy ’cause I keep overhearing all these conversations between Michael and corporate about like, staff issues?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, he’s making me take notes on these meetings and I’m, like, “These people are my friends.” But he’s all like, “This is confidential. You can’t tell anybody.” But I just feel like I want to… aaah. Just promise me you’re not gonna say anything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, will not, I’m not going to tell anybody. This is between you and me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jackpot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That was beautiful. All her idea too. Awesome. She is so great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looking at birthday card] Meredith, bad breath. Meredith has bad breath.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, you wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. What do you know about Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t think she’d be missed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s not going to be downsizing Dwight, OK? I just, I need to know a little bit more about my friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Name, Meredith Palmer. Uh, personal information, divorced twice, two kids. Uh, Employer, Dunder Mifflin Paper Incorporated. Awards, multiple Dundies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know all that. I know all that. I just, I need something kind of embarrassing, you know. Kind of fun, inside.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She had a hysterectomy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] Which one is that again?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s where they remove the uterus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh God! Dwight, no. I’m trying to write something funny. What am I going to do with a removed uterus?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It could be kind of funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, I am on a deadline here, and just… OK. Thanks, thanks for your help. I’ll work it out. Thank you Dwight. That was a waste of time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, here’s the deal. All right? Pam says that one of the alliances is meeting in the warehouse during Meredith’s birthday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh my God, we have to be there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know, but it’s gonna be a little tough because there’s no good place to hide there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No no, yes there is. Behind the shelves. Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know. I know exactly what to do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [gives Dwight a high five] Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m a deer hunter. I go all the time with my dad. One thing about deer, they have very good vision. One thing about me, I am better at hiding than they are… at vision.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is going to be perfect, OK? Centrally located. Perfect cover. I can hear and see everything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael? Are you done yet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Almost there. Just a sec. Just a second. It is perfect, thank you. Excellent, here we go. It is time, thank you. OK, come on. Let’s go! Get the cake. Here we go. Come on! Shhh. Be quiet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, this isn’t gonna work. The lid’s open.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So tape it down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can’t do that. You won’t be able to breathe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look, I can breathe just fine. OK, but if it makes you feel better, I’ll poke holes in the box.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you, thank you. OK.

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: Surprise!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh! Surprise.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, it’s ah…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s surprise Meredith. One, two…

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: [tunelessly] Happy birthday to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Find a key.

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: Happy birthday…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So do you want me to stay here and, you know, stand next to the box?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you need to go upstairs to the party so people don’t notice we’re both gone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right… That’s good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I trust Jim? I don’t know. Do I have a choice? No, frankly, I don’t. Will I trust Jim? Yes. Should I trust Jim? You tell me.

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: [singing] … birthday, dear Meredith Happy birthday to you…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And many more!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Last year, five years ago…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You were surprised, weren’t you?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You looked freaked, man. We said “Surprise.” You were, like, “What?” “What the hell’s goin’ on here?” Good cake. Why don’t you have some?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Uh, I can’t. Um…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on. A little bit.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I can’t eat dairy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, right. God, too bad. It’s so good.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah, it makes me sick.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? If I were allergic to dairy, I think I’d kill myself. ‘Cause this is way, way too good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He’s in a box?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, he’s in a box. He’s downstairs, in a box, on the floor, near the shelves. I’m serious. Go down there and work your magic.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on her cell phone] Hey where are you? Yeah, we were supposed to meet here. What? Oh my gosh! That ties in perfectly with something that Michael was telling me earlier! I just don’t know what some of the people in, like, accounting are going to do? It said specifically that…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [box falls over] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, good party, huh? Just a little something I whipped up. You know, a little morale boost. No big deal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Speaking of which, I meant to tell you. Very impressive, the uh, donation you gave to Oscar’s charity. What was it? 25 bucks?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you know, money isn’t everything Jim. It’s not the key to happiness. You know what is? Joy. You should remember that. Maybe you’ll give more than three dollars next time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, well, three dollars a mile. It’s gonna end up being like 50 bucks. So… God, I can’t even calculate what you’re gonna have to give.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is Oscar around?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just thought it was kind of a flat, you know… 25 dollar, one-time donation. I didn’t think it was per mile kinda deal. You know, so…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, that’s what a walk-a-thon is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It says it right on the sheet. Look, look at the sheet. It says, “However many dollars per mile.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right. Got it. Yes. So it does. Um…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I just think it’s kind of cheap to un-donate money to a charity.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no. That wasn’t what I wasn’t, that wasn’t… No. It-it-it’s not about the money. It’s just… it… it’s the ethics of the thing, Oscar. How’s your nephew? Is he in good shape?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How many miles did he do last year?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Last year, he walked 18 miles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Son of a bitch. That is impressive.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Happy Birthday. [gives Meredith her card]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Read it out loud. And say who wrote everything so we know whose is the best.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: “Happy Bird-day” Um… “Meredith, good news. You’re not actually a year older because you work here, where time stands still.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [under his breath] I don’t know about that.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: That was Stanley. “Meredith, happy birthday, you’re the best. Love, Pam.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [pretends to vomit] Huh! Thanks, downer.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: This is from Michael. “Meredith, let’s hope the only downsizing that happens to you is that someone downsizes your age.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because of the downsizing. Rumors. And because you’re gettin’ old.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No, I… I get it. It’s funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] You didn’t get the joke. So, that’s cool. That’s, you know what? Actually… I have a bunch of these, good ones, that I didn’t use. Um… Oh, where’s that? Oh, OK, here’s a good one. Um… “Hey Meredith, Liz Taylor called, she wants her age back and her divorces back.” ‘Cause Meredith’s been divorced like, twice. Is that right?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You’re right. You’re right. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Divorce. Um… OK, “Meredith is so old…”

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How old is she?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody? If… could do it? “Meredith is so old…”

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: How old is she?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “She’s so old, she went into an antique store and they kept her.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That wasn’t even mine. I got that off the Internet. Website. Um, don’t get mad at me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Uh, nice party Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This isn’t my fault. Ladies, not your best effort. The streamers?  I think we could have done better than that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Phyllis wanted red, I didn’t.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, boy… You…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, we… all right. People, hold on, hold on. Just a second. OK, I think we’re losing sight of what is really important here. And that is that we are… a group of people… who work together. I was… I really wasn’t gonna flaunt this. I have made a very sizable donation to Oscar’s nephew’s… walkathon. $25.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Per mile.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Per mile, yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I retire, I… don’t want to just disappear to an island somewhere. I wanna be the guy who gives everything back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A check for the kids, and for the team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want it to be like… “Hey, who donated that hospital wing that is saving so many lives?” “Um, well, I don’t, I don’t know. It was anonymous.” “Well, guess what, [whispering] that was Michael Scott.”  “But it was anonymous, how do you know?” “Because I’m him.”

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thank you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come here. [hugs Oscar and In a low voice] Don’t cash that till Friday, OK?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Really? Today?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, Happy Birthday.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, I could say something.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, don’t. Don’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, OK. I have something that totally tops the box.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, tell me, tell me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. I have just convinced Dwight that he needs to go to Stamford and… [Pam starts laughing]… spy on our other branch. No no no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But before he does so, I told him that he should dye his hair to go undercover.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughing] That’s perfect!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If we can get him to drive to Connecticut… and put peroxide in his hair…

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [yelling] What the hell is this? What are you trying to cop a feel or something? Huh Halpert?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, dude, no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, dude, no, I was just, listen! Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: God, I don’t even, I don’t even know how to explain this. Uh, um… Dwight, uh, asked me to be in an alliance. And then um… um… we were… we’ve just been messing with him. Uh, because of the whole alliance thing. Um…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s just office pranks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s stupid. It’s, it’s just office pranks.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [looking at Dwight] An alliance? What the hell is he talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have absolutely no idea.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do I feel bad about betraying Jim? Not at all. That’s the game. Convince him we’re in an alliance, get some information, throw him to the wolves.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [With blonde hair] That’s politics baby. Get what you can out of someone, then crush them. I think Jim might have learned a very valuable lesson.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good, excellent, and file sharing off and done. Security software, 128-bit encryption, firewalls. Get up, I’ll install it on your computer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pssh, stupid. Identity theft happens all the time. I can become you like that. [snaps fingers] But no one can become me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No one wants to be you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not true. And if they did, they couldn’t because I’m password protected.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is your password Frodo?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. [typing on keyboard]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you just change it to Gollum?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. [typing on keyboard]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [telephone rings] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Hold please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All righty then, well I see you’re going for the whole bored supermodel thing. “Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. May I help you?” [takes a drag from an imaginary cigarette] Smoke, smoke, smoke, smoke.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I wasn’t really going for anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. I get it, I get it, I get it. A child is born, “Oh, oh-hum.” A beautiful sunset, “No, I’ll catch the next one.” Right? Unicorn walks into the office, “Oh, do you have an appointment?” [laughs] Okay, look Pam this is not meant as a criticism, but let me tell you what you’re doing wrong. You are the voice of this company, right? And when clients call and you’re not smiling they can hear that in your voice. It is a real turnoff.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you being serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I am, absolutely. So, the next call we get I’d like you to smile. I’d like to see a big smile.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [waits for call]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No one’s calling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, somebody will. And we’ll wait.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes there’s a lot of time between the calls.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know, we will wait.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We will wait for the call and you will smile.  Let me try something, just while we’re waiting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell me if I’m smiling or not. [covers face with hands] Hi Pam, how are you? Was I smiling?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, let me try this one. [covers face with hands] Hi Pam, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I mean you can tell.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I could tell.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wasn’t smiling that time and they can tell too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That was a good example.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. All right, when we get a call I’ll come back and you’ll do the smile.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. [telephone rings]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Show time! It’s show time!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [smiling] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. One moment I’ll transfer you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [throwing away a banana, mayonnaise, and a sandwich from the refrigerator, smells the mayonnaise] God. [drinks from the milk carton and puts it back] Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [looks in  the refrigerator] Hey Dwight, my tuna sandwich isn’t in the refrigerator. You wouldn’t know anything about that would you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was rotting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was not rotting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Any employee may dispose a food item…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop. Dwight, stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …that risks contaminating the other food item. Read the official kitchen regulations memo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, you wrote that memo. Okay, it’s not an official memo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, uh, not my problem. Okay, this is a paper factory not a bacteria factory.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, it’s not a factory at all. Do you have to do what you are doing? [Dwight is tapping each of the bobble heads on his desk and making them bobble]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, if they don’t bobble, what’s the point?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: My nephew does it every year. Anything you could give would be fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay, but I don’t want to be put on a mailing list.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We need to assume that everyone in the office is forming an alliance and is therefore trying to get us kicked off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: God… Damn it! Why us?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Because we’re strong, Dwight. Because we’re strong. God, it’s freezing, I gotta go in. You stay though for like five minutes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [talking over Jim] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You don’t want to arouse suspicion.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ll stay for ten.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good. I like it. You know what. Pretend to smoke. [Dwight pretends to smoke]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do a poem for Meredith’s birthday or uh, limerick. Limerick. Um, [knock on  door] there was a girl from Dunder Mifflin. Come on in. Who had a big, smifflin.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hi, do you mind if I sign the card real quick?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, not at all come on in. [Toby signing the birthday card] No, no. You can’t. No, red hair is my area. We have it on tape, so…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It’s just a birthday card.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was going to put that in my message, Toby. All right? So just cross it off. Cross it off, now. [Toby writes on birthday card] What are you doing? Oh come on, you’re ruining it. Toby, come on.  Just, look at that. That’s wrecked. Ass. Get some white out.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: There’s some right there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s my white out. Get your own white out. Just… what’s the matter with you? God. [Toby leaves] Okay, um, there was a girl from Dunder Mifflin. Who had a big, puttifflin. [thinking out loud] Mifflin, spifflin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, by the way. Have you heard Dwight say the word immunity, yet? Because if I can get Dwight to say the word immunity, it might be the greatest day of my life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, yeah. What do you know about Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t think she’d be missed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s not going to be downsizing Dwight, OK? I just, I need to know a little bit more about my friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Name, Meredith Palmer. Uh, personal information, divorced twice, two kids. Uh, Employer, Dunder Mifflin Paper Incorporated. Awards, multiple Dundies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know all that. I know all that. I just, I need something kind of embarrassing, you know. Kind of fun, inside.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She had a hysterectomy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Which one is that again?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s where they remove the uterus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh God! Dwight, no. I’m trying to write something funny here, okay. What am I going to do with a removed uterus?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It could be kind of funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Come up with a joke that I can use, okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Help me out here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Hey Meredith, where’s your uterus?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, not a uterus joke Dwight. Please. Something useable. A joke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If I find a joke for you, will you grant me immunity? [cut to Jim holding his hands up like a champion]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: From the downsizing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s not going to be downsizing, Dwight. You know what, I am on a deadline here and just, okay. Thanks. Thanks for your help. I’m… I’ll work it out. Thank you Dwight. [Dwight leaves] Thanks for coming in, that’s always… Always helpful when I give him a call. Call him in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meredith. Oh, oh man, ah gosh. I can’t remember why I came over here. Ha, ha.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I hate that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. Ugh, that is so annoying. [makes fart noise] Brain fart. By the way, do you remember any funny interactions we may have had recently that I’ve forgotten about? Just, you know we  bumped into each and you said, “Brr, brr.” And I went, “Argh, Argh.” You know? Anything? [shakes her head ‘no’] Well, if you think of something, let me know. ‘Cause I like to know. ‘Cause I’m going crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar, uh for future reference just think you should know, that you should probably make it clear that your nephew is doing the walkathon and that he doesn’t actually have cerebral palsy. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I never suggested…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. I know you didn’t intend to, but I just I got the idea and I, uh, I just don’t it has a lot of ethical merit to make people think something. You know? And then prey on their emotions.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, if I gave you…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, hey it’s just kinda uncool, okay? I, just… Play fair, you know, play fair.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: “Meredith, let’s hope the only downsizing that happens to you is that someone downsizes your age.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because of the downsizing. Rumors. And because you’re gettin’ old.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No, I…I get it. It’s funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] You didn’t get the joke. So, that’s cool. That’s, you know what? Actually… I have a bunch of these, good ones, that I didn’t use. Um… Oh, where’s that? Oh, Okay, here’s a good one. Um…”Hey Meredith, Liz Taylor called, she wants her age back and her divorces back.” ‘Cause Meredith’s been divorced like, twice. Is that right?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You’re right. You’re right. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Divorce. Um… Okay, “Meredith is so old…”

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How old is she?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If everybody… could do it? “Meredith is so old…”

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: How old is she?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “She’s so old, she went into an antique store and they kept her.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] What’s the difference between Meredith and Michael Jackson? Michael Jackson’s surgery was unnecessary.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You’re talking about my hysterectomy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! Thank you. God. She gets it. [laughs] We just picked the best one right? Just had it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispering] I’m so sorry. [Angela, Phyllis, and Pam all whispering] … seriously, we’re just…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, no, no. Come on. No. Don’t comfort… don’t comfort her, that’s not… She doesn’t need comforting. We’re just joking around. I think she’s… No that’s very unprofessional. I think she’s being very unprofessional over there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m only going to ask you this once. Are you part of an alliance?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well played.

episodes.title: Basketball
episodes.description: Michael and his staff challenge the warehouse workers to a basketball game with a bet looming over both parties.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Jim] Hey, you ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, all right, secret sign. Hey, Ryan. [Ryan holds up his bag] Very good. Excellent, excellent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today at lunchtime we’re going to be playing the warehouse staff at a friendly little game of basketball. My idea.  Last time I was down there, I noticed they’d put up a couple of hoops, and I play basketball every weekend. So I thought, “This might be kinda fun.”  And so I started messing around and… I’m sinking a few, you know. Swish, swish, swish. Nothing but net. And their jaws just dropped to the floor. African-Americans! So… you know, it’s really just a good friendly game, a reason to get together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, Pam, thank you ma’am. Messages, please. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, can I talk to you, please? Privately? In your office? I think I should be on the team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. And that’s not me being mean, Dwight. That is based on your past behavior.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to camera] When I let him come to my pick-up game…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I apologized for that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Dwight] I vouched for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I vouched for you in front of Todd Packer, Dwight.  All right, here’s what I’m going to do. The hand strikes and gives a flower. You are not going to play basketball. But I need somebody to come in and take over the holiday and weekend work calendar.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can handle that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Excellent, it’ll be fun. Because corporate, uh, wants someone to be here on Saturday. And so we’re going to have to have some people come in on the weekend, and I know nobody’s gonna want to do it and I know everybody’s gonna complain and bitch and I don’t want to have to deal with that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And that’s why you have an assistant regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is. Assistant to  the regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to camera] Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it’s not. It’s lower, so…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s close.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So we need someone to work this Saturday and I think that, that should be…Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: God, this is so sad. This is the smallest amount of power I’ve ever seen go to someone’s head. Phyllis, can you believe this?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Keep me out of it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My fiance has plans for us this Saturday.  So I really hope that Dwight doesn’t make me work. Maybe I should sleep with him? I’m kidding, kidding. Totally kidding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, managing by walking around. This is our warehouse. Or, as I like to call it, the whorehouse. But don’t you call it that, I’ve earned the right.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Fine, don’t worry about that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And here we have “Mister Roger’s Neighborhood.” Come on over here. Hey, this is Ryan. He’s temping upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And this is the foreman. Mista Ra-jahs.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It’s not my real name.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it’s Darryl. Darryl is Mista Ra-jahs.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Darryl Rogers?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Darryl Philbin. Then Regis, then Rege, then Roger, then Mister Rogers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] And that is Lonny. And this is Roy. Roy dates Pam. You know, the uh, the best looking one upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You still getting it regular man? Huh? I mean, I can tell her it’s part of the job!  Rapport!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone] No, no, I know that the warranty’s expired, but isn’t it supposed to last longer than two years if it isn’t defective? OK, fine, three years.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam gets a little down.  Her toaster oven broke. Um, which she got at her engagement shower. Um, for a wedding that still has yet to be set… and that was three years ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, um, one o’clock sharp and we’ve got a game on.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We’re loading at one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I see, you’re chickening out on me. You’re bailing on me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, we got a truck going out at 1:15. So, that’s the busy time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well, I’m glad that some time is a busy time because whenever I’m down here it doesn’t seem too busy to me. Oh, oh. You can dish it out, but you can’t take it. OK, fine, have it your way. [clucking and dancing like a chicken]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right, fine, you know what? One o’clock.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, see you at one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are we ready for the game?

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: [half-heartedly] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I… yeah, yeah. I know, grumble, grumble. But you would follow me to the ends of the earth, grumbling all the way. Like that, uh, dwarf from Lord of the Rings.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gimli.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nerd. That is why you’re not on the team.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just trying to be helpful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, [in a nerdy voice] “I’ll help, Elwyn Dragonslayer, uh, ten points, power sword.”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, so, let’s put together a starting line-up, shall we? Stanley of course.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I’m sorry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, what do you play? Center?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why “of course”?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I don’t know. I don’t remember saying that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, I heard it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, people hear a lot of things, man. Um… other starters… Me, of course. I heard it that time.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’d like to play if it’s just for fun. I played basketball in school.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [ignores Phyllis)] Um… Yeah. Who else? We have Jim. We have Ryan, the new guy, right? Untested. Willing to prove himself now. A lot of passion, a lot of heart.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: But, I’m getting paid to skip lunch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, this is business. The, uh, business of team building and morale boosting. Uh, who else?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I can help out, if you need me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will use your talents come baseball season, my friend. Or if we box.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I have a hoop in my driveway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I have a sports bra.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, look. [Dwight throws paper at the garbage can]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Missed it…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Close. All right, uh… Me, Stan the man, Jim, Ryan and Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I be team captain?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’m team captain.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I be team manager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I am the team manager. You can be assistant to the team manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Assistant team manager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, we’ll see who’s working this weekend then.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, you’re in charge of the vacation schedule now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Threat neutralized.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hits Pam in the head with a piece of paper] Off the backboard!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Please don’t throw garbage at me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Pam with a zinger. Hey, Pam, how would you, like to be our cheerleader today? You know, some, ah, pigtails? A little, ah, halter top, you could tie that up. And you know, something a little, just, youthful, for a change. Just this once?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t think so Michael. Besides, I can’t cheer against my fiance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’ll do it. Wear a little flouncey skirt if you want, and…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I bet you would. Just try not to be too gay on the court. And by gay I mean, um, you know, not in a homosexual way at all. I mean the uh, you know, like the bad-at-sports way. I think that goes without saying.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe Angela would cheerlead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah right.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’ll do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yuck, that’s worse than you playing. … ‘Cause we need you as an alternate in case somebody gets hurt. That’s where we need you. Blessed be those who sit and wait. You made it, suit up, you’re on the team! All right, cool! Very good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh-oh. Oh-oh. A spy from the warehouse. Trying to figure out our plays, huh, man?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Just getting a tea bag.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh ho, oh, he’s running. He’s running. He’s running, but he can’t hide because you know what? One o’clock, you better bring your ‘A’ game. Because me, and my, posse guys are gonna be in your face. Right in your face!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Why don’t we make it more interesting? Loser buys dinner at Farley’s.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa-ho. I like the way you think. You know what, I’m gonna take that one step further. Loser, works, on Saturday.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, that’s not as much fun. You know what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You’re on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Cool, you’re on. [to Dwight] Don’t screw this up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to camera] Classic beginner’s mistake, eating before a game.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Has anyone seen the first-aid kit? [Dwight holds the kit up] How many times have I told you? I’m the safety officer, not you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Basketball? It was kind of my thing in high school. And I’m, yeah, I’m looking forward to playing. You know, I think I’m gonna impress a few people in here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You coming down?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I’m just forwarding the phones.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You gonna wish me luck?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, you’re gonna need it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that trash talk from Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughing] I’m just saying, Roy is very competitive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And he wants to take the WaveRunners to the lake this Saturday so…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I’m going to the outlet mall on Saturday, so if you wanna save big on brand names and Roy has to work, which he will, because I’m also competitive, you should feel free to come along.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I think I’m gonna be up at the lake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think I’ll see you at the mall. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, there he is! Secret weapon! All right, guys, come on, let’s bring it in! Here we go!  OK, listen, this is just going to be a friendly game, right? We are all on the same team here, the Dunder Mifflin team. Of course, if you beat us, you’re fired. That’s a joke.  OK, let’s do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Have a good game man.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah, you too. Should be fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, everybody stretch out a little bit. Stretch it. Full stretch. Ryan, you wanna stretch?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I stretched before I came.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, Ryan, you have Darryl. I have Roy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? I thought I’d take Roy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Actually, I think Roy is their best player not Lonny. So, Dwight, you uh, have the East German gal. Uh, who else we got… Um…OK, all right, you guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [taking off his shirt] OK, we’ll be skins!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aw, come on Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Shirts on or off?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On. Just put it on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You sure?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Uh, Pam? You kind of have your foot in both camps, why don’t you do the uh, jump ball OK?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Don’t listen to him Pam. Trust me, tip it my way or you’re sleeping in the car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley!  What? You gotta be kidding me! !?! [Roy steals the ball, and goes for a lay up] Oh… Here we go! [Lonny shoots and makes it] Who’s on him? Somebody get him!

quotes.speaker: Teammates
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: That’s what I’m talking about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Over here, over here. [Jim saves the ball from going out of bounds and passes to Michael] Here we go. Three! [Shoots and misses] Let’s go to the zone! We’re going to zone!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: De-fense! [clap, clap] [Michael joins in] De-fense! [clap clap]

quotes.speaker: Michael and Dwight
quotes.text: De-fense! De-fense!

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Worker
quotes.text: [Roy scores] Well done team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who’s got Roy? [Jim does a behind the back move around Roy for the basket]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Woo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [misses a half court shot] Aw, come on! What is wrong with me today!? Usually hit those. [Dwight scores] Dwight, I was open. All right, let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Roy bumps Michael to get around him] OK, foul. Charging. Charging. That’s a foul.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, I’ll take it. [misses free throw] OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I am playing hoops all of the stress and responsibility of my job here just melts away. It’s gone, I’m in the zone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [misses another shot] What is wrong with me today?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who am I? Am I Michael Scott? I don’t know… I might just be a basketball machine. What’s Dunder Mifflin? I’ve never heard of it. Filing? Paperwork? Who cares? Possible downsizing? Um… well, that’s probably gonna happen, actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim! Jim! Jim, right here, Jim! Give me the ball! Ryan, cut! [Michael looks away and misses Jim’s pass] Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My bad.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [scores] Here we go. Here we go. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: [dancing] Where you at? Where you at? You over there? I’m over there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is cool. Is that like the Robot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Ryan scores] Nice! Come here! [gives Ryan a chest bump]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Can we just do one? That’s cool, that’s fine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You have one more free throw shoot. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: All right, let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Worker
quotes.text: Watch your back Madge.

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: Hey! Come on man!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on! Hey, Dwight. Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scores] Yeah! [points to Madge] In your face!

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: Yeah, like that counts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Dwight, Dwight…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Football is like rock and roll, it’s just bam-bam-boo… And basketball is like jazz, you know? You’re kind of… Dupee-doo, dupee-do. It’s all downbeat, it’s in the pocket, it’s like… [singing] Dupee-do, dupee-do, dapee-dah…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Du-du-du-du-dupee-do, de-do-do-do. Du-du-du-du-dupee-do, de-do-do-do. Harlem Globetrotter…

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [steals the ball, scores, mimics singing] Du-du-du-du-dupee-do. Your ball.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, time, time out. Come on, sales, over here. Bring it in! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s going on? What’s going on? You’re playing like a bunch of girls.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? Let me take Roy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, switch. Take it up a notch, come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shoot, shoot it.  [Roy hits Jim in the mouth with his elbow] Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Foul! Naked aggression!  Oh, that is… You all right Jim? Suck it up.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Block, block, block!

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: He’s afraid of you now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Jim makes a shot after pushing off Roy] Ouch! Oh, how much does it hurt? How much does it hurt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Jim pushes Roy to the ground and makes another shot] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What the hell man?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Take it easy.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, you take it easy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Darryl scores] Watch the long passes, you guys!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [Dwight steals the ball from Ryan] Same team, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scores] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Phyllis scores] Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! In, your, face! Angela, what’s the score?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You’re ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, baby, here we go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Jim has the ball] Jim! Jim! Right here! [runs into the elbow of the guy guarding him] Ow! God! Hold it!

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Foul! Foul!

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: I’m sorry. You all right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that hurts.

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: Sorry, I didn’t mean to do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s your problem man? Gah, just clocking me for no reason?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Take your shot man!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. That was a flagrant, personal, intentional foul. Right there.

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: No it wasn’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mocking voice] Yes, it was. You know what, I’m just being fair.

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: Oh, really? No, I just put my arm up…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Game over. Game over. That is it! I’m sorry, you know? I hate to do it this way but, you know, that’s just… we’re having a friendly game. It’s a shame. This is a damn shame, but we’re like a family here and that just, that won’t fly.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is a cold pack…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here, give me that. You have to break the interior bag. [bag explodes]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Wait, what does that mean? What is it, a tie? What’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, let’s just say whoever was ahead won.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That was you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was us? Really? I didn’t, I didn’t know. Great, I mean, I guess you guys are working Saturday. Your face.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, no, no, I’m not coming in on Saturday.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, this isn’t happening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um… well, you guys, you know, I’m the boss so…

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: So what’s that? We’re coming in on Monday, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey…

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Monday?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] You guys believed me? Come on. Dogs, you know, you should know me better than that. No, oh, do you think that would’ve been good for morale? No. No. No. Exactly, no. I’m embarrassed it was even that close though. So… nah, of course, we’re coming in Saturday. Good game. Word.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Pam] …so I talked to the scout, it looks good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I didn’t sign anything.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey baby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [to Jim] Look at Larry Bird. Larry Legend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, he’s, uh, pretty good, huh? [to Roy] Let’s get you into a tub.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah? Let’s get you into a tub.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, what a game, huh? What a game.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What time do we have to come in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on. Let’s not be gloomy here man. We’re all in this together. We’re a team. You know what? Screw corporate, nobody’s coming in tomorrow. You have the day off. Like coming in an extra day is gonna prevent us from being downsized. Have a good weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The great thing about sports is that it is all about character. And you can learn lessons about life even if you don’t win. But we did because we were ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [slams palms on desk] Pam, Pam, thank you ma’am. Messages, please. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: New pants?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, yes. Thank you for noticing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Abercrombie & Fitch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, they look that good? Wow. [Mike Myers voice] Oh, Pam please behave. Mike Myers, genius. Um, no actually I got them at a fancier place. Target.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, could I talk to you for a second, please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In your office? [in Michael’s office] You know that is why you have an assistant regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yes. Assistant to  the regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to camera] Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it’s not. It’s lower.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That look?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What look?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like trying to find the camera, to give the camera a look. Okay, we’re done. Is that your stomach? I keep hearing somebody’s stomach. [whispers] God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, you uh, see the Sixers game last night?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [howls like a wolf] Oww whoo whoo! The Answer was on fire!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Iverson. Yeah, always man. It’s very important.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, man! Man I tell ya. Iverson has maybe got me beat by like 20 pounds, 3 inches. [makes ‘pop’ noise with his mouth]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What? Iverson’s not fat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, neither am I. We both look good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I have a nickname on the court, um? Well, The Answer would be nice, but it’s taken. So, uh, probably The Question. The Answer dishes to The Question. The Question back to The Answer. Answer over to The Question. The Answer, whew, [makes shooting motion] three points. The Question, whew, whew, [makes shooting motion] six points. Nothing but net. Question, who’s the best player in the league? Answer, The Question. Or the Drunkmeister.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I can’t work Saturday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, have a seat. [Kevin sits down] Okay, why not?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I’m in a band.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Marching or garage?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It’s a Steve Miller Tribute Band.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I tell you what. You give me a tape of your band and a tape of the Steve Miller Band and I’ll get back to you. That is all.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Mello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Packer. Pac-man.

quotes.speaker: Packer
quotes.text: Whoa. Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pac-man [imitating the noises of the video game Pac-man eating dots]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Is this Michael Scott? My secret lover. My intercom, I told you never to call me here. Never! [Michael’s laughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not your lover! I’m am not Michael Scott, I am Dr. Bergerstein. Your proctologist.
