quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Bergerstein!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, yes. Ah. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Bergerstein!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s not a Jewish joke, so don’t worry.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] I want my money back you greedy Hebrew. Bergerstein!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] No, hey, hey , hey. You know what I just wanted to remind you about the game today. One ‘o clock. Big game, big game.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [sounds sick on the phone] I can’t make it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm. No, you said you could man. We’re counting on ya. You know you’re playing point guard.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] I… I’m not coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Hey… I mean, although it’s just for fun, you know we want… I was counting on you man.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [on the phone] Oh, God! Stop whining. You know, you only come to the pick up game once a year. You little bitch. [Michael picks up phone, takes it off speakerphone] All right, yup. Hey, okay. No problem, you know, best you can do. Hey, you know. Hey, nice talking to you too. All right take care. [sighs] Michael Scoot. That’s funny. He’s a good friend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [eating Tootsie Rolls from Angela’s candy on her desk] Mmm. Good. Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: They’re one per person. [points to sign “Please take one!!]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Would you like to have a vacation this year? That’s what I thought. [continues eating Tootsie Rolls] Mmm, delicious.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I though we were saving money for the wedding, but apparently Roy thought it was more important to buy two WaveRunners. I don’t really ever get to use the other WaveRunner that’s supposed to be mine because his brother uses it and they race.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, you’re the new schedule guy, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m trying, yup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, I hear that. You know what? This little baby might come in handy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On one condition. You…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Forget it. It’s just a dry erase board.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no it’s not. Okay, check it out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, that’s insanely complicated and the first thing I’m going to do is erase it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you’re not because I spent hours on it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, then keep it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I will. Okay, fine. You’ll be back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [misses a  free throw badly] I… I think you can play. Like you could when you were a kid. I think you can never give up the play. Because if people stop playing, then they stop living. It’s like a shark. If a shark stops playing he stops living. And sharks are very playful creatures.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Dwight holds the first aid kit up] I’m the safety officer, not you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Isn’t that crazy? I’m a Volunteer Sheriff’s Deputy. Lackawanna County says that it’s okay for me to perform CPR, but for Michael my lips aren’t qualified enough for his perfect little face. It’s nuts.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Is that really necessary?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [wearing a face guard] I’ve almost had my nose broken a dozen times.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Worker
quotes.text: [back to the basketball game] Let’s go Lonny.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Michael steals the ball] Yeah, Michael. Go Michael. [makes shot]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Birdie. He’s not the guy with the cheeks. Kenny G. Is… if you knew jazz, you’d know who I mean. Kenny G. God. Glad I remembered that. Jazz people know who he is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [back to the basketball game] Dwight, pass it to Jim! Pass it to Ryan!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, my ankle!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley, gotta play hurt.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, actually no I don’t Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just want you know, you’ve been a big disappointment to me today, okay.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [in pain] Oh. Go away.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m in. I’m in. Here we go. [Lonny gets around Michael to score and he ends up in front of Phyllis] Zone, Phyllis! We’re playing zone!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Kevin makes seven straight shots from the free throw line]

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: [Michael hits a half court shot] Ah! [clapping]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! Yes! All right. We got game!

episodes.title: Hot Girl
episodes.description: Michael is just one of the many male staff who start vying for the attention of an attractive saleswoman in the office.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Are you listening to me Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Affirmative.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What did I just say?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You just said, let me uh… check my notes.  You just said…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Alan and I have created an incentive program to increase sales.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey how is Alan?  Tell Alan that the Mets suck! Okay? From me, big time. Go Pirates!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m not going to do that Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We’ve created an incentive program to increase sales.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, huh.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: At the end of the month you can reward your top seller with a prize worth up to a thousand dollars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa. Howdy-ho. Wow, a thousand big ones. That’s cool. Do I uh, do I get to pick the prize?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, yes. Yes you can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, question: Does top salesman include uh, people who were at one time such outstanding salesman that’ve been promoted to…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, Michael. No. You can’t win this prize.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t mean me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, first what we have to do is find out what motivates people more than anything else.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sex.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s illegal. Can’t do that.  Next best thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Torture.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tah, come on Dwight. Just help me out here. That’s just stupid.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, there’s a…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Burger with cheese!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There’s a person here…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And fries!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There’s…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And shake! What? Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There’s a person here who wants to sell handbags.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. No vendors in the office. That is a distraction.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, I told her you’d talk to her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam. Pam. Come on, I’m busy. So just tell her to go away.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [exhales loudly, looks out window and sees Katy] Oooh, alright I’ll talk to her.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: This one is hand embroidered.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right girls break it up, you’re being infiltrated. Cock in the henhouse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cocks in the henhouse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t say cocks. Oh, what is your name, my fair lass?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Katy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, Katy. Wow. Look at you. You are, uh you’re like the new and improved Pam. Pam 6.0.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam looks embarassed at Michael – Katy looks sympathetically at Pam]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, look. Oh hey, no catfights you two. I’m  against violence in the workplace.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So am I.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nobody cares what you think.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Doesn’t matter.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So uh, you know what? I usually don’t allow solicitors in the office but today I am going to break some rules, and you can have the conference room. It’s yours. All day.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Wow, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There’s an HR meeting in there at 11:30.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, lets put ’em in the hallway. Give ’em some chairs. Right? Decisiveness. One of the keys to success according to Small Businessman.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do. I read Small Business man. I also uh, subscribe to USA Today and American Way Magazine, that’s the in-flight magazine. Some great articles in that. They did this great profile last month of Doris Roberts and where she likes to eat when she’s in Phoenix. Illuminating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is my conference room. So please, uh, make yourself at home. Whatever you need, I’m right on the other side of this wall. [knocks on wall]  used to be a window here. There’s not anymore. So, that’s where I will be.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Katy unpacks her handbags]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So if you need anything else, something to make you more confortable just don’t hesitate to ask. I’m right here.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I guess a cup of coffee would be great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait a second. I should have spotted another addict. Uh, gotta love the ‘bucks.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s like a slang for Starbucks. They’re all over the place. Oh, man, that place is like the promised land to me. What a business model too. Ah, too bad we don’t have the good stuff here.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Regular coffee is fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nah, it’s not. it’s spppplllibbb

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: No really it is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, here’s the thing. Y’know I do my best to be my own man and go by the beat of a different drummer and nobody gets me, and they’re always putting up walls and I’m always tearing ’em down, just breakin’ down barriers, that’s what I do all day.  So a coffee, regular coffee for you. High test, or unleaded?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Bring it on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Woo, I will. I will bring it on. Ah, all right.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So are you jealous ’cause there’s another girl around?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: She’s prettier than you though.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s a very rude thing to say, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [nods]

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: So do you like the periwinkle and the purples?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The purse girl hits everything on my checklist. Creamy skin. Straight teeth. Curly hair. Amazing breasts. Not for me, for my children. The Schrutes produce very thirsty babies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [handing Katy a mug of coffee] There ya go. Nice steaming cup o’joe.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have an idea.  Why don’t I introduce you around, you know you can kind of get your foot in the door, meet potential clientele, right?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Gosh, I would love to but, my purses, I should, um…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, um, well, we could have Ryan take a look. Ryan, would you look after the purses, please?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m installing File Share on all the computers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, bladdy-bluda-blah-blah. Techno-babble. Just do it, okay. We have company. Right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You should sell a lot here because this branch made over a million dollars last year. Not that we’re all millionaires. I’m probably closest. So here’s Oscar. Oscar, this is Katy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I’m on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oooh-ooh. Oscar the grouch. Right? I thought of that.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: That was on Sesame Street.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. I know. I made the connection. Can you believe he’d never heard that before he worked here?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: No, I don’t believe that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, it’s unbelievable.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s nice having Katy around. It’s another person for Michael to um, interact with.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here is Toby from Human Resources. Katy, Toby.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Hi

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hi, nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby, Katy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, um did you go to uh, Bishop O’Hara?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, me too.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Cool. What year were you there?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Eighty-nine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby’s divorced. He uh, guh recently, right?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You and your wife, and you have kids.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: A girl.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh that so – that was really messy. He slept one night in your car too?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [looks resigned]

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I should probably get back to my table.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Alright. Cool.  See ya in a bit. [looks at picture on Toby’s desk] Oh, she’s cute.  Cutie-pie. Back to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I live by one rule. No office romances. No way. Very messy. Inappropriate. No. But, I live by another rule: Just do it. Nike.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, Jimmy what do you think of that little purse girl, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cute, sure, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Why don’t you get on that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She’s not really my type.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What are you gay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmmm, I don’t think so. Nope.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What is your type?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [glances at Pam] Moms, primarily. Yep. Soccer moms. Single moms. NASCAR moms. Any type of moms, really.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: That’s disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Stay away from my mom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Too late, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [Katy walks through breakroom] Man, I would be all over that if I wasn’t dating Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We’re not dating, we’re engaged.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Engaged, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam and I are good buddies.  I’m sort of Pam’s go-to guy for her problems. You know with stuff like work, or uh, her fiance Roy. Or uh… Nope, those are pretty much her only two problems.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She’d be perfect for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hmmm… she’s been talking to Michael a lot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, what? You’re Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Assistant to the Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you know what Dwight? He’s your work boss, okay? He is not your relationship boss.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s true.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Plus you have so much more to talk to this girl about, You’re both um, salesmen. I mean that’s something right there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: True. Plus I can talk to her about the origins of my last name.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s all gold.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Guys are usually my best customers, they buy the high end stuff like the beads and the sequins and stuff. For gifts, you know?  They don’t know what they are looking at. So I make suggestions.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. Here’s the thing okay, you just keep talking to her.  If you hit a stall you have a perfect fall back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What’s that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You buy a purse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t want a purse. Purses are for girls.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, that’s not necessarily true. Do you read GQ?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I do. There like mini briefcases, alright?  Lots of guys have them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Like those?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. Listen, you are spending way too much time talking to me, when you could be talking to her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I’m just going to use the bathroom, and then I’m going…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. You don’t need the bathroom. You’ve got it. Go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, shhhh stop… stop whatever you’re doing because this is going to be good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [smiles]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [mimicing Dwight in high-falsetto voice] Hi my name’s Dwight Schrute and I would like to buy a purse from you. Good lord, look at these purses! This is something special. Oh my God is this Salvatore Di-chini-asta?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [mimicing Katy] Oh definitely, definitely step in and out of it like that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, well I want to stress test it. You know, in case anything happens.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh! That was really. [Dwight hits purse against table] This is necessary to do to really give it a good workout. This is the ooooh… This is the prettiest one of all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m going to be the prettiest girl in the ball.  Oh, how much?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, God. It’s sad. It’s so sad.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispering] Here he comes, shhh…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [gives Dwight a thumbs-up – mouths the word] Good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [smiles in agreement]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He did pick a good one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re horrible.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: This one’s really good for a hot date.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, what’s that?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m engaged. So…

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Congratulations.  You need a hot date more than anyone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I wished, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Giggle-giggle, juji-juji, I get it, I get it. Divine Secrets of the Ya Ya Sisterhood over here right?  [to Katy] So how’s that uh, coffee from earlier?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, I knew it. Guzzled it down. You greedy little thing.  So, uh, Pam is this your lunch break, or was that earlier when you were eating in the kitchen with those guys?

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam sheepishly hands Katy the purse and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: [whispers] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Busted.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: [to Pam] Come back…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hey, I want to show you something. Come here I want to show you something.  I know you are going to like this. Picked it up today. A thousand big ones.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Is that from Starbucks?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. This is a Starbucks digital barista. This is the mack daddy of espresso makers.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Wow. Is that for the office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I know what you’re thinking. You’re not prying this out of my hands, but don’t tempt me because I’ll give it to you!

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I wouldn’t think of it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Coffee is the great incentivizer in the office. It’s a drug. It is quite literally a drug that speeds people up. It’s not the only drug that speeds people up. You hear stories about Dunder Mifflin in the eighties before everybody knew how bad cocaine was. Guh. Man, did they move paper!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Katy reading text message on her phone] Oh the rotating um, steam wand. [Katy looks annoyed] What? What’s the matter?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Oh, nothing.  My ride just bailed on me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, oh! God. I’m sorry. Is there…?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Oh no, it’s um…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where you going? Nearby? Because I can give you a ride.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: No…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Seriously. No, really.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: No. I really don’t want to inconvenience you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God! No, no, no, no. No inconvenience. I mean I’m out of here at five sharp.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: At five?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can go earlier. ‘Cause I’m the boss. You know, whatever. I’m out of here slaves.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay, I guess that would be, I guess that would be okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Sounds good. Sounds good.  Five o’clock sharp.  I will give you and your purses a ride home.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay. Cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Great. Cool. Cool. [takes deep breath – looks at camera] Yeah, okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I should have never let the Temp touch this thing. I had all these great icons and now I have four folders. So..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s actually better this way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No it’s not. Because I could just click on the icon and then I’m onto—

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael could I ask you something? I wanted to ask your permission to ask out Katy. I know it’s against the rules and everything. Because…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no it’s not against the rules.  She’s not a permanent employee so it’s not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you, Michael. I appreciate this so much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But I think you should just know that I am going to be giving her a ride home later.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She asked me for a ride and so I am going to give her a ride home.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is that all it is? Just a ride home? Like a taxicab?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, might be a ride home.  Might be a ride home and we stop for coffee and dot-dot-dot…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please. Please, I am your inferior and I’m asking you this favor. Can you promise me that it will just be a ride home?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. I cannot promise you that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You cannot promise me, or you won’t promise me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you love her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] Dwight, no. I don’t know. It’s too early to tell. I don’t know how I feel. [Dwight sadly looks away]

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I think you’ve made a really good choice, she’s really going to like that.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hmmm…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Espresso?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re welcome. Thank you.  Hmmm-hmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Is that from the machine that was in your office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ummm-hmmm…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I thought that was the incentive prize for the top salesperson.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very easy to clean.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Stanley walks out]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Like he’s going to win anyway, right? [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did we get any mail?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I gave it to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes you did. Yes, you did. Just checkin’. Just checkin’, double checkin’, checkin’ on the check. Thoroughness is very important in an office and…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, can I..? [points to the door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, of course. Uh, Pam, one more thing. Um, how do girls your age feel about futons?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A futon?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [nods]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He’s a grown man

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s what he said.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s sad. Or it’s innovative. Well, you know the futon is a bed and couch all rolled into one. [Jim sees Roy and trails off]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [not looking at Roy] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Are you still mad at me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy…

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Come on [begins to tickle Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cut it out.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Come on, you mad at me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stop it. [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Are you still mad at me now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [giggling] Cut it out.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Are you mad at me now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stop. [giggling]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Huh? huh?  Come on… Come on, Pammy I was just kidding.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [breathless] Stop, I can’t breathe.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I was just kidding.  You know I didn’t mean it. I can’t…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim is a great guy. He’s like a brother to me.  We’re like best friends in the office and I really hope he finds someone.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: You seem to like to touch things. Did you try the velvet?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don’t like to necessarily touch things. I’m just… I’m shopping.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Oh no, it’s fine that you, um. Here, what about the raspberry one? It’s really uh, kind of festive. It’s got a lot of personality.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, uh no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, how’s it going?  Good. Can I talk to you for a second? In private?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I don’t think so I’m really busy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It will just take a second.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I can’t.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just for a minute.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I really can’t.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please? I wanted to talk to you in private because I wanted to ask you out on a date.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok was that no to talking to me in private, or was that no to the date?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Both.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dejected, Dwight walks out slowly]

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: What colors do you like?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Gray. Dark Gray. Charcoal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you like to help me with a special project?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I would love to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in Michael’s car] Okay, just throw out all the empties.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You don’t want to recycle them?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, yes. Throw them away in the recycling bin.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you want this? [holding a full bottle of water]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What about this bottle of power drink?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, what flavor?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Blue.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Blue’s not a flavor.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It says flavor: Blue Blast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Blue Blast. Yes, put that in the trunk, and there should be an unopened Arctic Chill back there. I want that in the passengers cupholder. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m Jim, by the way.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I’m Katy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi Katy, nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: You sit out there, don’t you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I do. That’s what I’m best known for. Sitting out there. Alright, let’s talk about purses.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay, um…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Katy but you know what, don’t try to sell me one. Okay, seriously ’cause I’m just here to learn.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, so I know about most of these, but you know you can…

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What, stop! Whoa! That’s my Drakkar Noir.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, this is Rite Aid Night Swept.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it is a perfect smell-alike. I’m not paying for the label. Right here. Give it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, it’s empty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not it’s not, there’s some in the straw. [Michael opens bottle and wipes straw along his neck] There, now you may throw it out.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Wow. How many filet-o-fishes did you eat?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s over several months, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [Under his breath] Still.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m bored.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you for choosing me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I’m kidding. Um, so you got big plans this weekend?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, well I think I’m gonna see Katy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you guys going to do?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, man I don’t know. Uh, dinner, drinks, movie, matching tattoos.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And stuff… yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I, I was gonna say, I think that um, we’re gonna help Roy’s cousin move.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ‘Cause Roy’s got a truck.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, huh. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is cool. Well, I’ll see you Monday though, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, I’m gonna head back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think in order to be a ladies man, it’s imperative that people don’t know you’re a ladies man, so I kind of play that close to the chest. I don’t know, what can I say? Women are attracted to power. And I think other people have told me that I have a very symmetrical face. [laughs] I don’t know. I don’t know. Maybe they’re right?  I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure you don’t want me to help you with that?  Cause I can grab that no problem.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Goodnight, it was nice to meet some of you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See you later. Goodnight. Goodnight, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Goodnight, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where you going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know. Grab a drink, I think?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: With us?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I uh, I probably should have told you, I don’t need a ride now ’cause Jim can take me home after so you’re off the hook.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Great. Off the hook. Excellent. Okay, cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I got this. [taking Katy’s bag from Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, have fun.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t drink and drive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Take it easy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Have a good night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You too, have a good night.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: You got that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. You sold a lot, so it’s lighter.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Good. Here. Squeeze it inside.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright now, I’m gonna warn you. Don’t freak out, okay?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is a really nice car. In case you haven’t noticed, this is a Corolla. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: It’s a… it’s a very nice car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You’re not going to freak out?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I have a special someone?  Uh well, yeah of course. A bunch of ’em. My employees. If I had to choose between a one-night-stand with some stupid cow I pick-up in a bar, and these people? I’d pick them every time.  Because with them, it is an everyday stand and I still know their names in the morning.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The perfect girl for me would be Konikotaka. She has the most amazing story. She was orphaned at age 10 when both her parents were assassinated, and she was taken in by a wealthy, but very cruel, businessman. So she practiced aikido in secret for years until she could avenge the death of her parents. She’s also a survivor of monster rape.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is really well made. Good stitching. Excellent fabric. [shakes the purse from side to side by it’s handle] You sell a lot of these?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: It’s very popular, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I knew it. Is it waterproof?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I’m not sure. It’s faux snakeskin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Snakes are waterproof. So, I’m betting that it’s waterproof. Do you know the difference between a snake and an eel?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ‘Cause I could look it up real easily.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: You’re really into reptiles, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My belt’s made out of alligator. Check it out. [lifts shirt]

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Oh, um, it’s okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight. Dwight. Dwight! Okay, that’s it. Keep it in your pants.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was just showing her my belt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, don’t do that. Where are your glasses?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He wears glasses. Did you know that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not all the time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, now suddenly he can see. [laughs] Okay, take off. See ya. Bye-bye. [gives coffee to Katy] There you go steaming hot cup of joe.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I know your hero. Yeah, saving you from Animal Planet Jack over there. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Ha. Yeah, asks a lot of questions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah he is the worst.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s the um, saying, “once their laughing they’re… that’s… Once they’re laughing that’s 50 percent of them being horizontal. So, not that I’m just… Not that that’s my… that’s what I’m trying to do, but I think it helps kind of melts the ice. Breaks the ice, melts… Breaks the ice and melts them. Melts their hearts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Al Gore… for the Internet. Can send messages from one side the global to the other in the blink of an eye. Can you believe we couldn’t do that ten years ago?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: We could do that ten years ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right, but 20 years ago we couldn’t and that is amazing. Here’s Toby from Human Resources. This is Katy. Toby, Katy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, did you go to Bishop Ohara?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, me too.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Cool, what year where you there?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking over Toby and Katy] Toby’s divorced. God, that’s hard. That really ripped you up. She got the kids right? That’ll damage ya. Sorry man. That’s uh, that’s a bad one. How much you paying her? What can, you can’t even afford anything now, right? You’re all right though, right? Don’t ask me for a raise. [laughs] Cup of Soup’s a good idea though. That’ll… that’s a good budgetary thing to do.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It’s just a snack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, they’re good snacks. They’re good food, good meals, good lunch. Roman noodles are good too. You still sleepin’ in the car?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ‘Cause he slept in the car a couple times.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Just the once.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you still taking the antidepressants? ‘Cause it was a good idea. ‘Cause it’ll help. It’ll help, man.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I’m gonna go back to my table.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. I’ll see you in a bit. [whispering] She’s pretty cute isn’t she? See you in a bit.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I mean whatever one you want.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Um, I like that one I think. [Ryan hands her a purse]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean, it looks real good, probably.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know Michael’s been talking to her too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you think his chances are?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, Pam I’m not gonna lie to you, he’s chances are none. Um, he’s 41 years old, he is losing his hair and his cell phone ring is “Mambo #5.” So…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] I like that song.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know though. I mean, you know that was a hit.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] 10 years ago.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, was it 10? Yeah, I have it on a mix tape from junior high.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Went well?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think it did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what, just in case she’s looking you should put some stuff in it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Anything. [Dwight begins to fill his new purse] Good. Yup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What else?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Post-it Notes. Wow, that purse holds a lot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s a mini-briefcase.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, oh, I know. Looks great. [Dwight throws the purse over his right shoulder and gets back to work]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Do you like Steve Miller?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: ‘Cause I’m in a Steve Miller Tribute… Tribute Band.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight. I need your stapler.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s in my purse.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, great thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me describe the perfect date. I take her out to a nice dinner. She looks amazing. Some guy tries to hit on her. Uh, now he wants to fight. So I grab him. I throw him into a jukebox. Then the other ninja’s got a knife. He comes at me. We grapple. I turn his knife on him. Blood on the dance floor. She’s scared now, I take her home. I’m holding her in my arms. I reach in for a kiss. I hear something in the leaves. I flip her around. She gets a poison arrow right in her back. She was in on it the whole time. But, I knew.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. That’s looking good. Hey um, Ryan do you have any music I can borrow.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What kind do you like?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, I know, everything really. I love it all. I love music.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, do you  like hip-hop? Do you like indie rock?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I love both of those so much. A lot of ’em.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay. Do you like The Strokes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm hmm. I like ’em.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you like The Hives?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. God. They’re awesome.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You like the Fleebulls, The Glorps?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh huh. Yup. That last thing they did was great.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, I had a feeling you would like those.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool, so maybe hook me up  with some Fleebulls and some Hive.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. This is gonna be good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hi, here you can have this. [Dwight gives Kelly his purse] It’s a mini-briefcase, but you can use it as a purse.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Uh, thank you.

episodes.title: The Dundies
episodes.description: Very much unlike his staff, an overeager Michael can't wait for this year's annual Dundies awards.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight is the Dundies, the annual employee awards night here at Dunder Mifflin. [holds up a trophy of a business man] And this is everybody’s favorite day. Everybody looks forward to it, because, you know, a lot of the people here don’t get trophies, very often. Like Meredith or Kevin, I mean, who’s gonna give Kevin an award? Dunkin’ Donuts? Plus, bonus, it’s really, really funny. So I, you know, an employee will go home, and he’ll tell his neighbor, “Hey, did you get an award?” And the neighbor will say, “No man. I mean, I slave all day and nobody notices me.” Next thing you know, employee smells something terrible coming from neighbor’s house. Neighbor’s hanged himself due to lack of recognition. So…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, you ready for the… the Dundies?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ugh…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know what they say about a car wreck, where it’s so awful you can’t look away? The Dundies are like a car wreck that you want to look away, but you have to stare at it because your boss is making you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in a Fat Albert voice] Hey hey hey! It’s Fat Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in Fat Albert voice] Fat Halpert. [in normal voice] Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So why don’t I take you on a tour of past Dundie winners. We got Fat Jim Halpert here. Jim, why don’t you show of your Dundies to the camera?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I can’t because I keep them hidden. I don’t want to look at them and get cocky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that’s a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mine are at home in a display case above my bed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gyaaah. T.M.I. T.M.I my friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: T.M.I.? Too much information. Ah, it’s just easier to say T.M.I. I used to say “Don’t go there” but that’s… lame.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And here we have Stanley the Manly. Now Stanley is a Dundie all-star, aren’t you Stan? Why don’t you, ah, show them some of your bling.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don’t know where they are, I think I threw them out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no you di-int.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I think I did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: W-why did you…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Say, we got to order some more apa-teezers this time.  We ran out last year, remember?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes we should. I… you know what?  I wanted one of those skillets of cheese, but when I got off stage, [turns to Kevin] someone had eaten all of them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in video] To Oscar Martinez it’s the “Show Me the Money” award! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael has taped every Dundies awards and now, he’s making me look through hours of footage to find highlights.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [in video] That’s supposed to be confidential.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in video] He has the award-ah! …it’s a type of song that we are going to play for the ladies. Hit it, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight starts playing the tune of “Mambo No. 5” by Lou Bega on his recorder]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing along to tune on video] A little bit of Paaam, all night long, a little bit of Angela on the thing…

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Somebody sits in front of the camera on the video, so even though nothing can be seen, Michael can still be heard]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in video]…a little bit of Phyllis everywhere…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, this is the part where Kevin sat in front of the camcorder all night. It’s great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on video] …a little bit of Roooy eating chicken crispers… …a little bit of Jim with some ribs, a little bit of…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It was you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Live and learn.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [quietly laughing] It wasn’t. I swear.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, it was.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, what’s the joke? You’re not perfect either.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We’re not laughing at you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So who are we laughing at?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, just something somebody wrote.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who? Dave Barry?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [laughing] No. No, just something that was written in the ladies’ room wall.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is it? Who wrote it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, it’s kind of private.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [whispering] It’s about Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is defacement of company property. So you better tell me. Kelly, if you tell me, you’ll be punished less.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, now I’m laughing at you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking to the speakerphone] Will her highness, Jan Levinson-Gould, be descending from her corporate throne this evening to visit us lowly serfs here at Dunder Mifflin Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on speaker phone] It’s a, it’s, it’s a two and a half hour drive from New York, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you could take the bus.  You could work on the way here. Sleep on the way home.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wuh… Come on, Jan. This is important. I mean, this is, this is, validation to my employees here that you and corporate approve of this. So…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, we don’t approve of this Michael. I mean, y-you only had the budget for one office party a year, so… we’re not paying for this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um…

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Michael looks at the camera and motions for the camera to leave the office]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to camera] Could you…?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Are you there Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I’m here, I just wanted to, uh, talk to you for a second about that.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Michael closes the blinds]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [The camera tries to find a crack in the blinds]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, what, ah, what is, I mean…

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [The camera pans around to reception, Pam is listening]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …come on, Jan!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [The camera goes to a side of Michael’s office where the blinds are still partially open]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re dropping an A-Bomb on me here.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Really? I’m dropping an atomic bomb on you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah, I mean, what is…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You already had a party on May 5th for no reason.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No reason?! It was the 05 05 05 party…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And you had a luau….

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …it happens once every billion years.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And a tsunami relief fundraiser which somehow lost a lot of money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, no, that was a FUN raiser. I think I made that very clear in the fliers, fun, F-U-N.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, well, I don’t understand why anyone would have a tsunami FUN raiser, Michael. I mean, that doesn’t even make sense.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I think a lot of people were very affected by the footage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is a little character I like to do [places a green turban with a yellow feather on his head], it is, uh, loosely based on Karnack, one of Carson’s classic characters. [puts an envelope to his head] Here we go. The PLO, the IRA, and the hot dog stand behind the warehouse. [tears open envelope and pulls out card] “Name three businesses that have a better health care plans than Dunder Mifflin.”  Here’s the problem. There’s no open bar because of Jan and it’s the reason why comedy clubs have a two drink minimum. It’ll be fine, I just…wish people were going to be drunk.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Phyllis catches Dwight trying to sneak into the girls bathroom]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Dwight, get out of here!!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [The door swings open and Dwight is being pushed out by Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no…

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What were you doing in the ladies room?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …no, no, no, no, it’s not what you think.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Why were you peering over the stalls?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, why were you in there?!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You are a pervert!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What were you doing in there?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You, are, a pervert!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in video] The Dundie award for “Longest Engagement” goes to Pam Beesley.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, everybody! [starts clapping]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam just sits there stirring her drink, rolls her eyes and glances over at Jim]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Jim, at the adjacent table, crosses his arms and glances over at Pam, both look annoyed]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoooo! When is that girl gonna get married? That’s what I have to say. Ah, Roy’s accepting.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [on video] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on video] Thank you Roy. Are there any words you’d like to say, on Pam’s behalf?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [on video] Ah, w-we’ll see you next year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on video] Yeah, oh, hope not! Oh God!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not changing that, it’s the best one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it’s hilarious, you’re right. I just think, um, “world’s longest engagement”, um, we’re all expecting it, you know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s why it’s funny. Every year that Roy and Pam don’t get married, it gets funnier.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well I think if you use the same jokes it just comes across as lazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, [taking it to heart] lazy. Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me, everyone, could I have your attention please. I just wanted to say that the women in this office are terrible. Especially the ones who wrote that stuff about Michael on the bathroom wall. Having a bathroom is a privilege. It is called a ladies room for a reason. And if you cannot behave like ladies, well then you are not going to have a bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re taking away our bathroom?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We are going to have two men’s rooms.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: But where would we…go?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Be prepared to hold folks [Michael comes out of his office] From 9 am to…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …Dwight is banning us from our bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, that’s just ridiculous, so just don’t, I-I don’t have time for this right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nnnnno, there needs to be repercussions…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just don’t, don’t talk-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …for people’s behavior.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t talk-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And it’s-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just STAP IT YAP IT!!!!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, look, I know there have been a lot of rumors flying around about the Dundies this year. How there is no money, and how there is no food, and how the jokes are really bad, but WHAT THE HELL EVERYBODY!? I mean, God. The Dundies are about the best, in every, one of us. Can’t you see that? I mean, okay, we can do better. so, tonight, for the first time, we are inviting all of your friends and family to attend the awards with us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [with a small fist pump] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, not bad, right? So let’s make this the best Dundies ever.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [clapping] Best Dundies ever.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Welcome to the eighth annual Dundies awards.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Quick cut to everybody talking and ignoring Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Before we get started, a few announcements. Keep your acceptance speeches short, I have wrap it up music, and I’m not afraid to use it. [points] Devon!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “The Dundies, how can I explain it? Awards you like to hate it. I’m psyched you all made it. You never had to work so hard and feel that no one notices you.  You’re just a name and number and no one even says hello.” [to Ryan] Card!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The Dundies are kind of like a kid’s birthday party, and you go, and there’s really nothing for you to do there. But the kid’s having a really good time, so you’re, kind of there. That’s-that’s kind of what it’s like.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “You down with The Dundies? You down with the Dundie-“

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [The music stops, Michael looks back at Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The waitress tripped on the cord.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, alright, joke landed. So we are here, thank you all for coming to the 2005 Dundie awards. [takes off sweater to reveal tuxedo] I am your host, Michael Scott. And I just want to tell you please, please, do not drink and drive. Because you may hit a bump and spill the drink!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to waitress] Oh, just put these on the group tab.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope, actually this year, ah, no group tab, we’re going to be doing separate checks.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You said, we could bring our families.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did. And why didn’t ya Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I did, my wife’s name is Terri.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I’m looking forward to meeting Terri.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It’s this person who’s hand I’m holding Michael.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Michael is dumbfounded, Dwight pushes a button on his keyboard that says, “OHHH, YEAHHHH.”]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Dwight, in a low voice] Shut it. [normal voice] Um, good. Speaking of relationships, of all, all way shapes and forms. Um, I was out on a very, very hot date with a girl from HR, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really? We don’t have any girls from HR.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that…for the sake of the story. And things were getting hot and heavy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I was about to take her bra off…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …when she made me fill out six hours of paperwork-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Like an AIDS test?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! [under his breath] God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] Alright, so let’s get this party staaaarrrrted.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey let’s go to Poor Richard’s.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah, let’s get out of here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, guys, where you going? Pam, show’s just getting started.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You staying?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, gotta eat somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And now… to someone who quietly goes about their job, but always seems to land the biggest accounts…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …the “Busiest Beaver” award goes to Phyllis Lapin.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Everybody starts clapping, Phyllis gets out of her booth and makes her way to Michael, she gives Jim a high five along the way]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, way to go Phyllis. Nice work, per usual.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: This says “Bushiest Beaver”.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? I told them busiest…idiots.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It’s, it’s fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, we’ll fix it up. You don’t have to display that.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam and Roy are at the truck, arguing.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …because that’s what happens every time!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: …talking about? He’s a jackass every year.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [Put’s his hand on Pam’s arm] Come on, we’re going to Poor Richard’s.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Breaks Roy’s grip] No, I don’t want to go, I don’t want to.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Pam. Go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If you would have asked me that, then you would know.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Michael has false teeth in and glasses with squinted eyes on them]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in a stereotypical oriental accent] Herro everybodeeee. I’m gonna cwall Jan Revinson-Gould.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey! How are ya? I thought you left?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh no, I just, I decided to stay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’ll just get a ride home from Angela.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh good, I’m just in time for Ping.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [doing impression] Oh, dat wir be fwar. Ah, me so horny.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [The camera zooms to an Asian customer behind Michael, she is looking at Michael in disbelief]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right? You know wat I’m talking ’bout.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to an off camera waiter and still clutching Jim’s beer] Can I get a drink?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This next award goes to somebody, who really, lights up the office.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Cut to Pam still drinking the beer]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Somebody, who I think a lot of us, cannot keep, from checking out. The “Hottest in the Office” award goes to… …Ryan the temp!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. [singing to music] “Hidy ho, you sexy thang. You sexy thang you.” Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What am I going to do with the award? Nothing. I-I don’t know what I’m going to do. That’s the least of my…concerns right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And the “Tight Ass” award goes to Angela.  Not only because she is everybody’s favorite stickler, but because she has, a great caboose.  So…come on down.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Pam starts sipping an empty glass] I think those might be empty.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no. ‘Cause the ice melts and then it’s like second drink! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Second drink?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The “Spicy Curry” award goes to our very own Kelly Kapoor!  Get on up here. Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: “Spicy Curry”, what’s that mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, not everything means something, it’s just a joke.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, but why’d you give it to me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know, it’s just…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: This is a bowler-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. It’s ju- they didn’t have any more businessmen. So…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, but everyone else-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just sit down Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sweaty and chugging water from a bottle] It’s so freakin’ hot in there. Now I know what Bob Hope was going through when he performed in Saudi Arabia. Man! I got Dwight sucking the funny out of the room, but you do what you can do. [Music starts playing in the background] Here we go, he’s early with the cue. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael is singing to the tune of “Tiny Dancer” by Elton John] “You have won a tiny Dundie.”

quotes.speaker: Guy at bar
quotes.text: Sing it Elton.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, thanks guys. Hey, where you guys from?

quotes.speaker: Other Guy at Bar
quotes.text: We just came from yo’ mama’s house.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, alright, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Guy At Bar
quotes.text: Sing ’em a song dude.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, you know what guys, we’re just having a little office party, so if you want, uh…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Something flies by Michael] Hey, you know, cool it guys, really-

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [The guy at the bar throws another object, looks like a wad of wet napkins, this time it hits Michael on the shoulder]

quotes.speaker: Guy At Bar
quotes.text: You suck man!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s cut it. [Dwight turns the music off]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] [with a lot less enthusiasm] I had a few more Dundies to, uh, give out tonight, but, I’m just going to cut it short. And wrap it up so everybody can enjoy their food. Um…thanks for listening, those who listened. [clears throat] This last Dundie is for Kevin, this is the “Don’t Go in There After Me” award. It’s for the time that I went into the bathroom after him, and it was really, really smelly. So…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [give Kevin his award]There you go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yay Kevin. Whoo hoo for Kevin! For stinking up the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [starts clapping] Yeah, alright Kev.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [More people start clapping]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Woo! Hey, I haven’t gotten one yet!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, I have not gotten one either. So, keep going.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: More Dundies!

quotes.speaker: Pam and Jim
quotes.text: [clapping] Dundies! Dundies! Dundies! Dundies!

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: Dundies! Dundies!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [getting his spirit back] Alright, alright, alright, okay. Alright, we’ll keep rolling. Okay, this is the fine work award. This goes to Stanley, for all the fine work he did this year.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Fine work! Fine work Stanley!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know you did.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here here! Speech, speech, speech, speech [other people start joining in]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Well, well, last year, I got great work, so I don’t…

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam starts laughing her cute drunk laugh]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: So, I don’t know what to think about this award. But at least I didn’t get smelliest bowel movement like Kevin. [starts chuckling]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And this next award is going out to our own little Pam Beesley…

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Cut to Pam, her face goes from drunken elation to sober realization]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …I think we all know what award Pam is going to be getting this year.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Cut to Jim’s reaction of scared expectation]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is the “Whitest Sneakers” award! Because she always has the whitest tennis shoes on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get on down here! Pam Beesley ladies and gentlemen! [Pam grabs the microphone from him] Oh, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have so many people to thank for this award.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Quick cut to Jim laughing and staring at Pam with amused wonder]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, first off, my Keds. Because I couldn’t have done it without them. [people clap] Thank you. Let’s give Michael a round of applause for MC-ing tonight because [people start clapping again] this is a lot harder than it looks. And also because of Dwight too.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight stands up, but nobody claps]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, so, finally, I want to thank God. Because God gave me this Dundie.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Quick cut to Jim, he’s doesn’t know whether to laugh or take her seriously, so he gives her an amused/appreciative grin]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And, I feel God in this Chili’s tonight. WHOOOOOOOO!!!!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam Beesley ladies and gentleman. [Pam hugs Michael and gives him a quick peck on the cheek] Oh! Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What a great year for the Dundies.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We got to see Ping.  [Pam nods] And we learned of Michael’s true feelings for Ryan. [Pam nods] Which was touching. And, we heard Michael change the lyrics to a number of classic songs. [Pam nods] Which for me, has ruined them for life. [looks at Pam, who is staring at him, nodding]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Jim looks at the camera, then back at Pam, who is still nodding]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know, what?

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam starts laughing, then suddenly falls off the bar stool]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God! You are so drunk!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you get that? Please tell me you got that. This is all going to be on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Quick, quick, the woman is having a seizure. Grab her tongue, grab her tongue! It’s okay, I’m a sheriff’s deputy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He’s a volunteer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t get into that now. We need something to cushion her head. Throw pillow? A cush-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight come on, come-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s okay, I’m going to use my shirt.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight starts taking off his shirt, but gets stuck]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, get off me!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [A Chili’s employee comes over, Jim helps Pam up, Dwight is stuck in his shirt]

quotes.speaker: Employee
quotes.text: I’m sorry, you’re gonna have to put your clothes back on, people are trying to eat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [struggling] Ahh! I can’t-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Was this year’s Dundies a success? Well, let’s see, I made Pam laugh so hard, that she fell out of her chair, and she almost broke her neck. So I killed, almost.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just want to say, that this was the best, Dundies, ever! WHOOOOOOOOO!!!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa, careful, careful.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [We have a strict policy here not to over serve.  Apparently, this young woman was sneaking drinks off other people’s tables. I Xeroxed her driver’s license and she is not welcome to this restaurant chain ever again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Great work tonight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Watch your step.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks, I had to, uh, check her pupils to make sure there wasn’t a concussion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, that too, but I mean with the audio. Great work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I feel bad about what I wrote on the bathroom wall.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No you don’t.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, here she is. Careful, careful, whoa. Alright, easy. Almost there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, um, can I ask you a question?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Shoot.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam stares at Jim for a little while, then glances at the camera, realizes she’s on camera]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I just wanted to say thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not really a question. [starts to laugh] Okay, let’s get you home, you’re drunk.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Jim opens the door for her]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Goodnight, have a good night. Thank you Angela.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: TMI. Too much information. I used to say, “Don’t go there,” but that is so lame now. Or, “You go, girl.” Or… Um, when did “Where’s the beef?” That was, like, a long, long time ago. It’s funny how the shelf life of these things, like how long they last, like, “Too much information” probably came on the scene… I mean, I didn’t hear it till, like, this month, so it’s pretty recently. Um, but you know, they’re generally good for, like, no more than five or six years.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes, that’s true. I have never won a Dundie. I am more than okay  with that.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I think I’m gonna share some Cadillac Fajitas with Toby. Toby is so cute, except he has that stupid kid.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, I’m the designated driver, which is very important. We need everyone to get home safely. [sighs] But no one ever gives me gas money, and people live all over. It’s expensive.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] Like a gaggle of geese… [jibbering mockingly]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, we need something for Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm-hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do we know about him? He’s an accountant.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He plays guitar, he likes naval history. He’s a bowler.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking over Jim] He’s fat. The fat accountant award.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you seem to have this under control.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The weird part about this whole deal this that Michael truly believes that these awards are inspiring and motivational. I mean, he puts more effort and time and commitment into the Dundies than anything else he does all year. Which is probably why this branch will be downsized.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am the fat accountant.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I need to talk to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here he is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I just thought that you might like to know that someone has written something about you on the ladies’ room wall.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? What did they say? “For a good time, call Michael Scott”?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, no, no. No, I think something bad, maybe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why do you think that? You just immediately go to that, Dwight? Why are you so negative? Why…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I mean, you just come in and you’re just negative…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …and you just walk negatively.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want me to find out what it says?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: By any means necessary?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What does that even mean? What are you… What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s the ladies’ room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just go and find out what it says and who said it and report back to me. But don’t tell anybody that I have anything to do with it because if they ask me, I will say that you are crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. You won’t regret this, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What award would you like to give Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I hadn’t planned on including him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It hasn’t always been easy being a whistleblower. When I was in school, the kids would call me a tattle-tale or a snitch or a worm. So I really identify with those women from Enron. I wrote them letters to tell them how much they inspired me, but they never wrote back. I guess they’re all married.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angela, it’s simple. Just tell me what the bathroom wall says.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don’t talk about what goes on in the restroom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m not asking what you do in there. I just want to know what’s written about Michael.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don’t says those kinds of things out loud. It’s inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I’ll talk. You nod if I get it right. Does it have to do with his butt or his wiener?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think his characters are pretty funny. Especially Ping.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, what should I do, guys? Seriously, do you want me to just cancel the Dundies?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No, we were just hoping you wouldn’t do those characters, like last time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ping? Everybody loves Ping. He’s my most popular character.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I think many people find that character slightly racist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? Well, he is based on the Chinese delivery guy that I have, who talks exactly like that, so, I think you should take it up with him instead of me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Look, I’m just saying that there are many people that are offered by your insensitive skits.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Well, neither of you are Chinese, so what… Why do you care?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis

quotes.speaker: Phyllis

quotes.text: Phyllis, no. No.

quotes.text: Michael, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Phyllis, no, no. Do not listen to her. She’s out of her mind.

quotes.text: That is not true.

quotes.speaker: Michael

quotes.text: What do you think, Phyllis? You think I followed you in there? Like, “Oh good. Phyllis is going to the bathroom, so maybe I get to see her naked from the waist down.” I’m not even attracted to you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, all right, I will do that. I will get to that definitely. Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I don’t know. Maybe after I finish writing, producing, directing, and hosting your awards show. All right, just relax, keep your pants on. Unless, of course, you’re in the bathroom and you should be able to take your pants off in that case without Creepsville Central spying on you. Good.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right, let’s wrap it up. Come on, we’re late. The Dundies are starting very soon. Accounting, let’s go, let’s go. Okay, I gave you fair warning. [turns off their computers] Out. Who’s next, customer service? Meredith, let’s roll.

quotes.text: Here we go. [organizing his costumes] And that. [to waitress] Hey. How you doing?

quotes.text: Okay. No, no, no, no, no. Lie still, lie still.

quotes.text: Put your clothes back on. Get, get right now.

quotes.text: That’s fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, are you all right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m fine.

quotes.text: Right now.

quotes.text: Don’t wanna forget that.

quotes.speaker: Manager
quotes.text: You and your party really need to leave right now.

quotes.text: Absolutely. Is this mine or is this Chili’s?
