quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep it. My gift. [hugs Chili’s Manager] Thank you. Have a good night. See you next year.

quotes.speaker: Manager
quotes.text: That’s fine.

episodes.title: Sexual Harassment
episodes.description: The office reviews its sexual harassment policy in light of explicit e-mails.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] Hey, what’s up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Any emails today?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um… I don’t think so.

quotes.text: No? Um… Check your spam folder.

quotes.text: What?

quotes.text: Um… ‘Fifty signs your priest might be Michael Jackson.’

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs uncontrollably]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Topical.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am king of forwards. It’s how I like to do business, everybody joking around. We’re like ‘Friends’. I am Chandler and Joey and, uh, Pam is Rachel. And Dwight is Kramer.

quotes.text: So the monkey does the sex thing right here! [monkey noises in background]

quotes.speaker: Michael

quotes.text: Um, I…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kay! Oh, you are so bad! Yeah!

quotes.text: [makes laser gun noises]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Boom! Bam! Oh, this guy is out of control! He is a madman! Better get the bleep button ready for him.

quotes.text: bleep, bleep. What’s up, Halpert?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh oh.

quotes.text: Still queer?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh oh! Oh-ho-ho-ho-ho-o!

quotes.text: Todd Packer and I are total BFF. Best Friends Forever. He and I came up together as salesmen. One time, we were out and we met this set of twins. And Packer told them that we were brothers. And so, you know, one thing led to another, and we brought em back to the motel. And then Packer did both of them. It was awesome. So…

quotes.text: Oh-whoa-oh! Oh! Okay. Grade ‘A’ gossip for you, right now. Randall, CFO, resigned. Nobody knows why.

quotes.text: We’re talking blonde incompetent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Like 10 words a minute… talking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, to be fair… blondes, brunettes, you know, there’s a lot of dumb people out there.

quotes.text: Oh! Wow! I didn’t say it! I didn’t say it!

quotes.text: [monkey noises]

quotes.speaker: Pam

quotes.speaker: Pam

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. As a child, did Pam show any traits that would hint towards her future career as a receptionist?

quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.text: Yes, Toby?

quotes.text: Um… I need to talk to you in your office. It’ll just take two seconds.

quotes.text: Um… literally two seconds?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby is in HR which technically means he works for Corporate. So he’s really not a part of our family. Also he’s divorced so he’s really not a part of his family.

quotes.speaker: Toby

quotes.text: It’s really not a big deal, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is a big deal. It’s a big deal! What are we supposed to do? Scrutinize every little thing we say and do all day? I mean, come on!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: And then Corporate is going to send in a lawyer…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Just to refresh you… .

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: NO!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: on our policy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? He! No! Okay, what is a lawyer going to come in and tell us? To not send out hilarious emails or not tell jokes?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Maybe not some of them. Maybe not inappropriate ones.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is no such thing as an appropriate joke. That’s why it’s a joke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everyone! Hello! Everyone. Hi! Sorry to interrupt. I know you’re all busy and the last thing you want is for a major interruption. But Toby has an announcement that he insists on making right now in the middle of the day. [to Toby] So, take it away.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, okay. Corporate would like us to do a five minute review of the Company Sexual Harassment policy so I’ll go over that later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wish you luck, Toby. I really do. But you are going to have a mutiny on your hands and I just can’t wait to see how you handle it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A guy goes to a five dollar… lady of the night and he gets crabs. So, the next day he goes back to complain. And the woman says “Hey. It was only five dollars. What did you expect? Lobster?” This is what’s at stake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Time to bring out the big guns. I’m heading down to the warehouse where jokes are born. Find a killer joke that’ll just blow everybody away at the seminar later. And remind them what is great about this place. So… ah! Here they are. [to Warehouse guys] Guys! Wondering if I could, uh, get your help for something. I’m looking for a new joke to tell and it needs to be just killer. And it does not need to be clean. So whatcha got?

quotes.text: Like a joke? A knock-knock joke?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, yeah, no, well… I mean better. Better than that. The type of stuff you guys tell all day.

quotes.text: Well, [points at Michael] those are some awful tight pants you have on. Where’d you get em? Like Queers R Us?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Boys R Us!

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Guy
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, alright. Well, yeah, but, you know… a joke but not necessarily at my expense.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Man, we can see all your business coming around the corner, okay? You need to, you know, hide the… good thing you don’t have a lot of business to start with.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oooh, okay. That was still about me.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey.

quotes.text: What?

quotes.text: I don’t feel bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I don’t.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You look like you feel bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Little package!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, not exactly what I was looking for but thanks guys.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse guy
quotes.text: Little package! Little package!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You look good.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hiding from his momma.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse guys
quotes.text: [kissing noises, sheep baaing sounds]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So remember, intent is irrelevant. And that’s it. Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um… I just wanted to say that… Just, my Mom’s coming in today.

quotes.text: MILF!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Usually the day we talk about sexual harassment is the day that everyone harasses me as a joke.

quotes.speaker: Pam

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Great point.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Um… in fact, basic rule of thumb, let’s just act everyday like Pam’s Mom’s coming in. All right. That’s it. Um… if anybody has any questions about anything, you know where I sit in the back.

quotes.text: Uh, yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Toby

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know. It’s good. It is not over. It is not over til it’s over.

quotes.text: It’s over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did he tell you everything? Obviously, he didn’t because you all still look relatively happy. Albeit bored. Do you realize what we’re losing? Seriously?

quotes.text: Exactly! Mmwwah [blows kiss to Angela]! Can we afford to lose email forwards? Do we want that?

quotes.text: Um… what about office romance?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Office relationships are never a good idea. Yeah. So let’s just try to avoid them. But, um, if you already have one, you should disclose it to HR.

quotes.text: No! No! Catherine. Remember her? Remember how hot she was?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ok, you know, Michael…

quotes.text: I’m in an office relationship. It’s special. Um… she’s nice. She’s shy. She’s actually here. You want to meet her? Hold on one second. Oh, my God! Put on a shirt! Put on a… . I told you that you’d be on camera. I’m sorry, she’s European. No, I told you that you’d be on camera. Stop it.

quotes.text: What if Pam was a lesbian? What if she brought her “partner” in to work? [to Toby] Would that be crossing the line?

quotes.speaker: Michael

quotes.text: Okay, I’m lost.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, then let’s act it out. Pam, you will be girl A and girl B will be… Okay! We’ll use the doll. Pam. Pam?

quotes.text: [Crossing the Line: Rules for the Modern Workplace]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wish Todd Packer was here because he would love this. I wonder if anybody else would like to do this. Hey! Um… we have to watch, uh, Toby’s video that he’s showing us in order to brainwash us and I was wondering if anybody would like to join in? Going to be fun. Got my great pizza. Whataya say? Jim?

quotes.text: That’s what she said. Pam?

quotes.text: Uh… my mother’s coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s what she sai [clears throat]  Nope, but… Okay. Well, suit yourself.

quotes.text: Hey, Toby.

quotes.text: Hey Dwight.

quotes.text: You said that we could come to you if we had any questions.

quotes.text: Where is the clitoris? On a website, it said at the crest of the labia. What does that mean? What does the female vagina look like?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Technically, I am in Human Resources. And Dwight was asking about human anatomy. Um… I’m just sad the public school system failed him so badly.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, maybe when you get really comfortable with each other, you can ask for that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. Good. And…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I should get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Man in Video
quotes.text: In today’s fast-paced business climate, it can sometimes be hard to know when a comment or an action crosses the line. Let’s take a look at a couple of scenarios and ask ourselves ‘where is the line?’

quotes.speaker: Video
quotes.text: [Scenario 1:

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [to cell phone] Yes. Yes, I did. Okay. Well, we can talk about that later then. [to Pam] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, you are never going to believe this. The girl in the video we’re watching that Corporate gave us… Darryl banged her! Aaand is about 90% sure.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Don’t ever let this little bitch drive you around town. We got, uh, lost for half an hour.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t have any DUI’s so I can drive myself, but thanks.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Where is Michael Snot? Sniffing some dude’s thong? Probably.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you are the lawyer, Mr. O’Malley? I know a lot of lawyer jokes.

quotes.speaker: Mr. O’Malley
quotes.text: I love lawyer jokes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it’s probably because you don’t get ’em.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I said before that I was king of forwards, you got to understand that I don’t come up with this stuff. I just forward it along. You wouldn’t arrest a guy who’s just delivering drugs from one guy to another.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You seem a little bit agitated, Michael. What’s the problem?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The problem is that I am the boss and apparently I can’t say anything.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, that… that’s true in a way. You can’t say anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where’s the line? Where’s the line, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do you need to see the video again, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’ve seen the video.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [to Jan] He talked the whole time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I didn’t. [to Jan] Huh, what? [everyone looks up at blow-up doll]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Attention, everyone! Hello! Ah, yes! I just want you to know that, uh, this is not my decision, but from here on out… we can no longer be friends. And when we talk about things here we must only discuss work-associated things.  And, uh, you can consider this my retirement from comedy. And in the future, if I want to say something funny or witty or do an impression, I will no longer, ever, do any of those things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Does that include ‘That’s What She Said’?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmmhmm. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow! That is really hard. You really think you can go all day long? Well, you always left me satisfied and smiling, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: THAT’S WHAT SHE SAID!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael. MICHAEL!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, please.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: There he is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mwah! [kisses hand and salutes office]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: There he is. Good one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You would have done the same. You just didn’t think of it first.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Mike… Michael. Please. I… I… really.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s… That’s…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: That’s not my sense of humor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [to man entering office] Hello. [introduces] Jan. Mr. O’Malley. This is my lawyer, James P. Albiny.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Wha…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I believe you may recognize his face from the billboards. He specializes in Free Speech issues.

quotes.speaker: Albiny
quotes.text: [to camera] And motorcycle head injuries, worker’s comp, and diet pill lawsuits.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This guy does it all.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [to Albiny] ‘Scuse me, I’m sorry. [to Michael] Michael. Mr. O’Malley is your lawyer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Mr. O’Malley is our Corporate lawyer. We have him on retainer. To protect the company as well as upper level management, such as yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I’m not in trouble?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am so used to being the bad boy. I am so used to fighting Corporate that I forget that I am Corporate. Upper management. They hooked me up with an attorney. To protect me. You can’t be too careful about what you say. Mo’ money, mo’ problems.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, let’s get you out of here, James. Um… I think we’re under an hour still, so…

quotes.speaker: Albiny
quotes.text: Yeah, but I did a lot of paperwork at home before I got here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. We’ll talk about it later. Thanks for coming in.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Um… hello.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [ecstatic] Oh my god!

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Finally made it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hello!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love my Mom. Okay. That’s probably really the most obvious statement ever.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: This is all yours?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. I’m in charge of this whole area.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Oh, my goodness. That’s great.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: So a guy goes home, tells his wife, “Honey. Pack your bags. I just won the lottery.” She goes, “Oh my god! That’s incredible! Where are we going?” He goes, “I don’t know where you’re going, just be out of here by five!” [men laugh] Boom!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is where I used to keep my computer.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Oh, right! I remember…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But then I moved it.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: with the picture.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, but I uh… I switched stuff around because I actually needed like more room for organization. So…

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So this is like, um, an organization station…

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: [to Roy] Oooooh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Well, there he is!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: How are ya?

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Hi, handsome!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You look great!

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Oh, thank you! So! We ready for dinner?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you know… actually, I kind of need to stall a bit. But, it’s okay, because I am very used to killing time.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Oh, I don’t believe that.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Okay, I’m going to go wait in the parking lot. And what kind of tunes you want for the ride? Little, uh, classical? Or oldies?

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Oh, anything is fine.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: All right, I’ll see ya.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: So which one is Jim?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mom!

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: I just wanted to know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: All right. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ten minutes.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Then we can go to dinner.

quotes.speaker: Pam’s Mom
quotes.text: I’ll make myself busy.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: There’s this guy. He’s at a Nymphomaniac Convention. And he is psyched ’cause all these women are smokin’ hot perfect 10’s, except for this one chick who looks a lot like, uh… [points at Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No, no, no. That crosses the line.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Ex-squeeze me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not you. Kevin. Just unwarranted. Hostile work environment, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Packer said it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. You said it. He pointed. A point is not a say. Look. Kevin, we are a family here and Phyllis is a valued member of that family. Like a grandmother.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’m the same age as you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know about that.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We’re in the same High School class.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I have a late birthday and usually September’s a cut-off point. [to Kevin] You know what? You just crossed the line. Okay? There’s a line and you went over it. And you must be punished. So go to your corner.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You mean where my desk is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, your corner. Go.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay. I have a lot of work to do anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmmhmmm.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Oh my. They really got to you, didn’t they?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They didn’t get to me. I got to them. I am still the same old Michael Scott. New and improved. You know what? I love Phyllis. You know what else? I think she is gorgeous. I think she is incredibly, incredibly attractive person. [to Phyllis] C’mere, c’mere, c’mon!  Come on! Come on.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oooh!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You don’t have to worry. I’m not going to…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not worried.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: …report you to HR.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? The only thing I’m worried about… is getting a boner. Good work today, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Times have changed a little. And even though we’re still a family here at Dunder-Mifflin, families grow. And at some point, the daddy can’t take a bath with the kids anymore. I am Upper Management. And it would be inappropriate for me to take a bath with Pam. As much as I might want to.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He said what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good morning, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good morning, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nothing. You look nice today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You look real thin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t get what you mean.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You just… You look good. Your shirt looks… You look real good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you said I looked thin, so what does… Does that mean I’m like thin weird or thin handsome or… [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thin handsome, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, well, of course. Of course. [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, Jim, no! Don’t drink directly from the can. Okay, I’m serious. It’s all over the Internet. They use the same shipping company as a rat poison, and it gets on the can. [Jim takes a drink] Well, you’re an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What can I say, Dwight, I live a very dangerous life.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Email chiming] [snickers] Did you see that?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I saw it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You can see her…

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It’s fake.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: How do you know?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: She wouldn’t do that. She’s a Senator.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Office romance. For example, Pam and I are dating, do we have to disclose that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We’re not dating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, but I’m saying hypothetically if we were dating…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We’re not dating, I’m engaged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Roy is dead, and I ask you out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I would say no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You say yes, and we go out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I would drown myself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And now Roy and Pam are dead, and we have your stupid rules to blame, Toby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby actually gets alimony from his ex-wife because she makes more, so that’s kind of embarrassing. Not that I’d mind, but it would never happen to me because I would make the marriage work. People seem to like him because they think he’s one of us, but he’s not. He’s this weird loner who just tells people, “Don’t do this, don’t do that. Hire this person for this reason.” I would complain about him, but who would I go to, to complain about Toby? Toby. Bias. And what does he do about that? Nothing. Because he’s Toby. What kind of name is that? It’s almost a girl’s name. I think I’ve known more girls named Toby than guys. He just kind of makes my skin crawl a little bit. Toby is the devil. Toby’s the devil.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know we’re having that harassment thing this afternoon.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes when we IM, I send you that little winking face with the lipstick.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. I realize that might be harassment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, it is harassment and I’m going to be suing the winking face. I’ve hired the angry face as my lawyer and you will be hearing from him pretty soon.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. [IM chiming] [laughing]

episodes.title: Office Olympics
episodes.description: Ready to finalize his deal for a new condo, Michael is away with Dwight while Jim rallies the staff together for office games.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m an early bird, and I’m a night owl. So I’m wise, and I have worms. Oh, breakfast.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I got your sausage, egg and cheese biscuit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yummy, yummy. Thank you, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What was the thing, ah, you needed me to come in early for?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um. The sausage, egg, and cheese biscuit. But thank you. And why don’t you take a couple hours. The office is yours. “Home Alone,” “Risky Business.” Take your pants off, run around. Whatever you gotta do.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m just going to take a nap in my car until work starts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. [Removes biscuit, leaving only sausage, egg and cheese.] Healthier. Gotta watch those carbs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today, I, Michael Scott, am becoming a homeowner. Investing in real estate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Diversifying. Smart.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is. Yes it is. It is very important to own property. Back in olden days, they would not even let you vote unless you owned property and they’d throw you in the stocks and humiliate you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And it worked. They should bring the stocks back. People’d obey the law, there’d be less troublemakers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [looks bored. Taps finger on desk. Head falls to desk]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Every so often, Jim dies of boredom. I think today it was the expense reports that did him in. And our deal is that, it’s up to me to revive him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You see Dwight’s coffee mug?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes when he’s not here, I try to throw stuff in it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No way. Let’s do this [crumples post it and throws into mug. Misses.] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wind.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Try paperclips. Oh wait. This message. For Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Perfect. [misses]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You should go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Yes. Final walkthrough.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sign the papers at the condo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You have your lawyer there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I don’t need one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I be your representative?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t need a representative.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think I should be there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m good. I can make sure things are up to code.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Dwight. I’m fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, I’m always the guy you rely on at work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, this isn’t about work. This is closing on a condo, it’s completely personal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So you’re taking a personal day?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Except that, this is about my living arrangement, and as boss, I need to have a living arrangement in order to do work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, I’ll make you proud.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Fine. Yes, you can come.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! As your representative?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: As my associate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No it is not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have been Michael’s #2 guy for about 5 years. And we make a great team. We’re like one of those classic famous teams. He’s like Mozart, and I’m like Mozart’s friend. No. I’m like Butch Cassidy, and Michael is like Mozart. You try and hurt Mozart; you’re going to get a bullet in your head courtesy of Butch Cassidy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, most honorable Pamera. Not offensive, because that’s the way they talk in movies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You headed out?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are. Dwight and I are going to the big thing. So why don’t you have everybody work on their expense reports and I’d like them in by the end of the day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Have a great time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We will. Um, did you do the thing I asked you to do about the magazines?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I changed them to your new address.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. The Small Business Man?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maxim? American Way? Cracked?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, I changed your Cracked magazine subscription.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How about, uh, Fine Arts? Aficionado Monthly?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [shakes head]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: NO, well can you get on that, because I don’t just read Cracked.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. See you soon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What kind of shocks you got on this baby?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know, regular. Normal ones. Nothing fancy. Not my style. What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [tries to open sun roof] I want to put the top down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? No, Dwight. It’s fifty degrees outside.  Don’t… please…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But then no one can see us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I… Just… Would you put it up? [roof opens] Ok. Fine. Just leave it down. Whiner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Check it out. [points at sunglasses] Terminator.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do not understand what you spend your money on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [paper football lands on desk] Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Oscar, on these new expense reports, do we really have to go back to last quarter?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah. It’s a terrible system, I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [points at paper on desk] What does 2005 season mean?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Eh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait a minute, what is this?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It’s a scoreboard.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Kevin and I play this paper football game when Michael’s out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Or when we’re bored.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God!  Wait, this goes back two years.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We’re bored a lot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [flicks football onto Kevin’s desk] OH!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Sweet!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes!  So close.  I really love the paper triangle flicking and hitting things game.  Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We call it Hate Ball.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Because of how much Angela hates it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, do you guys have any other games?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Sometimes we play “Who can put the most M&M’s in their mouth?”

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You play that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You should ask Toby to teach you Dunderball.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Home, sweet home.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Which one’s yours?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right there. My sanctuary. My party pad. Someday I can just see my grandkids learning how to walk out here. Hang a swing from this tree. Push them back… wait… [turns around] no, it’s this one, right here. Home, sweet home.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [bounces ball off wall with Toby] So that’s what this sound is all day.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Michael, this is Bill. He’s the head of the condo association.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, how are you? Nice to meet you, Bill. Bill. Mr. Bill. OHHH NOOO. MR. BILL. OHHH! SNL? When they pull him apart? He’d always get rolled over by something.

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice to meet you too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is smaller than your old place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, small. I’m buying it and I’m not renting it. So, it’s still an upgrade. He doesn’t know anything about property ownership. Kind of an idiot. Um.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Actually, I do own property. My grandfather left me a 60 acre working beet farm. I run it with my cousin, Mose. We sell beets to local stores and restaurants. It’s a nice little farm. Sometimes teenagers use it for sex.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Are we ready to sign some papers?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Actually, no. We have a couple of questions, about the neighborhood.

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: It’s very safe. It’s very clean. Also, it’s very accepting of all lifestyles.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: It’s a very gay-friendly neighborhood.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Good. That’s good. It’s good to be accommodating of that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let’s go check out the master bedroom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stanley. Just played Dunder Ball with Toby. What about you, you got any games?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yeah, I got a game. It’s called “work hard so my kids can go to college.”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fair enough.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This, my friends, is the master bedroom. Check out the cathedral ceilings. Those are like seventeen feet high. We have cable readiness. [points at wall] Right there. I am going to totally pimp this place out. I am going to put a surround sound system. I am going to put a plasma screen right against this wall.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. Terrible idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m putting my bed right over here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no. This is a shared wall. Neighbor throws his wife into the wall, plasma screen hits the floor. Totally smashed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then I will get a warrantee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Warrantees don’t cover it, plus they’re a rip-off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well then I won’t get a warrantee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shh Shh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So that’s the problem, is solved. What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen. [puts ear to wall] Can you hear that? Oh man. These babies are thin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sings Olympic theme song] This scented candle …andle …andle. Which I found in the men’s bathroom …room …room. Represents the eternal burning of competition. Or something.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It smells like cookies.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes it does. Yes it does my friend. Ok, we will be competing for gold, silver and bronze yogurt lids.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Now the bronze are really blue, and they’re also the back side of the gold, so no flipping. K? Honor system.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I do play games. I sing and I dangle things in front of my cats. I play lots of games. Just not at work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let the games begin. [sings Olympic theme]

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: And then, I just need you to sign here at this arrow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What kind of mortgage did you get?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh… Ten year.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Well, ten over thirty, so thirty year total.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? Wha? You said ten.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Ten year fixed, over thirty. Thirty year total.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ho, thirty years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, ok, ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow, you’ll be paying this off in your mid-seventies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Forget about retiring when you’re 65. Hey, I’ve got an idea. You know that extra bedroom? If the whole girlfriend thing never happens, that’s where the nurse can live.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Alright. Oh boy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, this is it.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Whenever you’re ready.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um. Oh. [moves stove burner] Oh, ok. Is that suppose to come off?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Actually yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, look! Cool. Carpenter ants.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um. I’m going to take a little breather for a second. Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We’ll be here waiting for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A thirty year mortgage at Michael’s age essentially means that he’s buying a coffin. If I were buying my coffin, I would get one with thicker walls so you couldn’t hear the other dead people.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Whenever you’re ready, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh. [breathes deeply, head at knees]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You have what is the national sport of Icelandic paper companies. And I’m blanking on the name, can you help me out Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim, they refer to it as Flonkerton.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hum.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: In English, box of paper snowshoe racing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fair enough, but I like Flonkerton.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The thing about Jim, is when he’s excited about something, like the Office Olympics, he gets really into it and he does a really great job. But the problem with Jim is that he works here, so that hardly ever happens.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, who will be challenging Kevin in Flonkerton? Anyone?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’ll do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes! Phyllis! [claps] Phyllis, just put your foot right through here [lifts strap on box of paper]. Right through the flonk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The ceilings are lower than they were last week. That, I don’t… I don’t…

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …know if you showed me this same unit or not.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Michael, this is the unit you saw and…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where are all the hot people? I was told that there would be all these attractive singles.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Who told you that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: As far as I can tell, I’m the best-looking person here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s a basic principle in real estate, that you should never be the best-looking person in the development. It’s just sorta common sense, because if you are, then you’ve no place to go but down.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Is this a financial thing? If it’s a financial thing, what some people do is they rent out the third bedroom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: That’s some extra income for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am not going to rent the third bedroom. I want a price reduction or I am a-walkin.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: You will lose $7,000 if you walk away right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ehhhh….

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I made the right decision. I’m glad I signed. I’m a homeowner. Right? Good to be a homeowner. Diversifying. This is good. This is fun. We’re having fun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Totally having fun. Can you imagine those poor saps stuck at the office today? [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here we go.  Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Go!  Go!  Go!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pair of shoes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dig deep, dig deep! OHHHhhh! It’s Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Phyllis by a nose. Gold medal in Flernenton.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Flonkerton.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you, delegate from Iceland.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [empties bowl of M&M’s into his mouth]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow! Ok. No one else should even try! Gold medals! Give him medals. Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s something else Dwight wanted to talk to you about. I have a surprise for you, for helping me out today.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You didn’t have to…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. I insist. I insist. Because you’ve really done some great work. Great work. And that is why, I am going to let you move into my third bedroom and pay me rent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why did I do it? Because I believe in rewarding people for their efforts. Ah. I rewarded Dwight with the room, and he is rewarding me back, ah, with $500 plus utilities.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t even know what to say.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m thinking, lock into a four year commitment, we’ll go month to month after that. Or, until I start dating, have a girlfriend, then you’re, you know, you’re gone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question. Where can I put my terrarium?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What the hell is a terrarium?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s a fish tank for snakes and lizards.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, so an aquarium. Ah, that will not come into this place.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question. My grandparents left me a large number of armoires.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you sure you don’t want to play?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on Angela, don’t you have a game?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have one, yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, let’s play, what is it?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I call it Pam Pong. I count how many times Jim gets up from his desk and goes to reception to talk to you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We’re friends.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Apparently.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Very nicely done. I think that’s H-O-R for Stanley, and H-O for Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Are you calling me a ho?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my god. Phyllis, coming alive. I like it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question. What about carpooling, who pays for the gas?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We take separate cars.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question. Can sometimes I drive your car and you drive mine?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why would we do that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just for fun?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question. Who is the primary on the fire insurance?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: EHHHHNT. Game over. Offer revoked. Dwight. I’m sorry, but you reach out and you try to be a nice guy, and help out a friend, and this is what happens. This is what I get. Oh god. I’m … Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank god. It was nice of him to offer, but I live in a nine bedroom farm house. I have my own crossbow range. It’s a perfect situation for me. Although two bathrooms would have been nice, we just have the one. And it’s under the porch.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ah…

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: OH!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who had someone from Vance Refrigeration?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ryan Howard. Ryan! [claps] Gold medal.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I made something for our closing ceremonies.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? [looks in box] Oh my god. Where did you have time to make that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Automatic voicemail.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright Pam, alright [gives her hi-five]. Nice work!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sees Angela making check mark on tally sheet]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: A little bit more and I would have had it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know you can always refinance your mortgage. We had a 15 year on our beet farm.  We paid it off early.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, you know what? Nobody cares about your stupid beet farm. Beets are the worst.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: People love beets.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nobody likes beets.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everybody loves beets.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nobody likes beets, Dwight. Why don’t you grow something that everybody does like? You should grow candy. I’d love a piece of candy right now. Not a beet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let’s get this roof going.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it! [smacks Dwight’s arm]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Final lap. Final lap. Time to beat is 1:15.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oscar!

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: Go! Go! Go!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Time to beat is one minute, 15 seconds. Here they come. [Michael and Dwight enter] Guys?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing. Guys? Timer’s still going? Er?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s my stopwatch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [hands expense report to Oscar] Here you go. All done.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I filled out the expense reports. That took about five minutes and then I closed two sales at lunch time. So, about as productive as any other day. If not more so.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I figured I could throw it away now, or I could keep it for a couple of months and then throw it away. I mean, it was really nice of Pam to make them, but what am I going to do with a gold medal made of paper clips and an old yogurt lid?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have 59 voicemails.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm. Hey, can you ignore those and do something for me instead?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, today. 5 o’clock. Closing Ceremonies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Notify the athletes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Jim. Slim Jim. What’s going… What’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing. I just wanted to congratulate you on your condo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Thanks. Thanks. It’s very cool. It’s a three bedroom, gay-friendly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, would you mind coming out here for a second? I just have something for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: These are the Closing Ceremonies. Step up. You’re on the top one.  [Michael stands on podium] Congratulations to Michael, because he closed on his condo. So, gold medal. [everyone claps]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t really know what to say. Um, I’m not one for making speeches, but ah, my heart is very full at this moment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And for Dwight Schrute, the silver medal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get up here, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Silver medal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep, not as good as gold. [national anthem plays] Why are you playing the national anthem?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um… ‘Cause your condo’s in America.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. [doves move across cord] What the hell is that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Those are the doves.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey. Morning.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, Pam? Can I see you in here for a second? It’s important, so…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. What? What is this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I found Dwight’s wallet in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God. What are we gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know. I don’t know. I don’t know what the best play is. Do we tear everything up, or do we buy a horse on the Internet? I mean, I don’t know what to do. What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know. I know what to do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Put everything back exactly how you found it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight. Jim and I found your wallet in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What did you do to it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m serious. What did you do to it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, I swear, we didn’t do anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nice try. [on the phone] Cancel card. Cancel card. Cancel… card.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I mean, you’ve got, you’ve got stuff here. You rented “Mermaids.” You can’t… It’s a movie. You can’t deduct that, you know that.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It’s not an office expense.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Next year, you should file your stuff in a basket.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Remember last year he slipped by with “Stripes.” He rented “Stripes,” he had it for a week.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Please…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: And that got through, so maybe he’s thinking he can do that from now on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Please, please. Please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are the specs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay. I’ll tell you. Let’s see here. Three bedroom, two bath…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [talking over Michael] Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …contemporary townhouse. Two car parking…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [talking over Michael] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …wall-to-wall carpets…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [talking over Michael] God, what a steal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …all fixtures included. Yes, this is… This is looking good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Does it have a deck?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think it does.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have you seen it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Does it have a deck?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think it has a… Yeah, it has a deck. They call it a porch, but it has a deck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When a man is laying on his deathbed there are four things that go through his mind. Was I well-loved? Check. Did I express myself? Did I let my light shine through? Check. Will an attractive woman cry at my funeral? Check. Probably more than one. Check. Check, check, check, check. Lastly, did I achieve success and own real estate? And when I close on this condo, I will be able to check that one as well.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do you call it? Schruteball?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. How about skeet Schruteing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you just come up with that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm-hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is good. That’s it. That’s what it is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. [cup tinkles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, Somebody went in. That was a team effort, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Home owner. About to join an exclusive club, Dwight. Maybe some day these people out here will know what that feels like. Maybe not. Who knows? Not my problem. [groans]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are we ready?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are we gonna do it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is all mine. All the way down around the corner. It’s a shared space, but I can use it whenever I want to,

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, so I called in a favor to my buddy at the police department.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, the volunteer Sheriff station.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Um, these are the crime statistics for the surrounding square mile over the past four years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, anything bad?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Two charges of loitering,

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: one noise complaint, several speeding tickets.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you own a gun?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’d think about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t need a gun.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello! How are you? I’m, uh, just about to close on 126 over there and I guess we’re going to be neighbors. Very cool, very cool. So, uh, so what’s the vibe? What’s the vibe of this place?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Uh, I don’t know. It’s pretty quiet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… That’s gonna change. [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because I loves to party and I’m gonna be partying my butt out at this place.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Okay, but there’s an 11:00 noise curfew.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hi, I am Dwight Schrute, Mr. Scott’s associate.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Who is Mr. Scott?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Him. I have got a couple of questions about the neighborhood. Have you had any problems with prostitution, crack dealing, gang violence, etcetera?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here’s a question for you. I have a convertible. Is it safe that park that in my driveway. [Man steps back inside his house and shuts the front door] All right. See you soon. Good guy. Um, cool.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So it’s like volleyball.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay, you get a one-second hold on the ball…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Toby

episodes.title: The Fire
episodes.description: A fire in the kitchen relegates the staff to the parking lot as help is on its way.

quotes.text: Would that make you happy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you had your cell phone, it would make you happy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight. Hey!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You can’t go in yet!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, don’t! He is an idiot. The man is an idiot, ladies and gentlemen.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What if he dies in the fire?  And that’s the last thing you ever said to him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t say it to him. I said it about him.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: …Jim.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Definitely Jim.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Definitely, definitely, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Come on, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: How about you Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um… Oscar’s kind of cute.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I like Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ooh, Toby!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the background] How long does it take to find a cell phone? I don’t know either.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Is there anybody else.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [clears his throat]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on the phone] Hey, where are you? Oh good. Yeah. We’re just here, we’re playing Desert Island. It’s when you pick your five favorite DVDs…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Seriously, where the hell is Dwight? Hey, call my cell phone. It’ll make it easier for him to find.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What’s your number?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I gave it to you in the car.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I saw you program it in.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You got to… you got to give it to me again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Alright.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Now I have it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I better tell somebody. [to fireman] Excuse me, sir…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight!? Great goin’. God, Man! Why did you go in there? What… Everybody was scared out of their wits, man? Oooh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughing] Everyone, okay? Uh, I have an announcement. Apparently, in business school, they don’t teach you how to operate a toaster oven. Because some smart, sexy temp left his cheese pita on oven instead of timing it for the toaster thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. Okay. Well, I guess they don’t teach how to operate a toaster oven in business school.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s exactly what I said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, did you miss that day there, Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Were you absent?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toaster Oven 101?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You failed?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I am so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! I know what’ll impress everybody, I’ll start a fire. Oh, man. Bad idea. Bad idea jeans.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have a song. Attention, everyone! That I want to sing. That I wrote especially for this occasion when I was up there among the flames. Ready? [sings to Billy Joel’s “We Didn’t Start the Fire”] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning since the world’s been turning!

quotes.speaker: Dwight and Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning—

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everybody!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] …since the world was turning.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can’t believe I started the fire.

quotes.speaker: Dwight and Michael
quotes.text: [sing gibberish to “We Didn’t Start the Fire”]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing]  … Marilyn Monroe!

quotes.speaker: Dwight and Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eat it! You gotta eat it. You have to eat it!

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: How are you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I’m good. It’s good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good to see you, too.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I’m hungry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I am too.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Oh, I have been thinking the whole way over and I have my answers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What answers?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Um, for the… the desert island.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh! Right! Right, right, right, come-ah on, on, on. [to everyone] Ladies and gentlemen! Gather around! We have one more participant. Come on, be polite. Be polite. [to Katy] Desert Island. Five movies. Go.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay, um, first, Legally Blond.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I forgot what a super, nice girl Katy is. And just… good for Jim! They are so cute together. And, um, what an adorable car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I think the game’s over… People are like leaving. There was a bigger crowd last time. Do you just want to go to lunch?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Alright! You want to drive?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: [looking at Roy and Pam] They are soo cute.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m really sorry, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Answer me this, though.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Was it worth it? Was it worth it temp?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Was it worth it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m really sorry, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The fire guy! The fire guy!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sings] Joe McCarthy, Richard Nixon, Studebaker, television, North Korea, South Korea, Marilyn Monroe, Ryan started the fire!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Rule five – safety first,  i.e. don’t burn the building down. Okay? That should be a no brainer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… look! Ryan is book smart. And I am street smart. And book smart.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ll give you the rest of the ten tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Seventy and clear, that’s nice. Where’s that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m Michael’s number two. He’s one, I’m two. He’s Alpha, I’m Beta. He’s A, I’m B. It’s easy. Whatever Michael is, I’m one less.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Rule three: Reach for the stars. And if you fail, see rule four. Rule four:

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know Michael’s every move. It’s not something you can just pick up. I could write a book about him. Literally. I started once, but Michael made me stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, how’s it going, man?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Good. What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, nothing much. What’s up with you?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m good, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. Good, I’m good, too. How’s it cracking?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, fine. What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what you would love? Guns N’ Roses. When I was your age, I loved Guns N’ Roses. Do you like Guns N’ Roses? I’ll make you a tape.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ll make you two tapes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don’t have a tape player. So…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Someday, temp. I’ve got a couple of shirts that don’t fit so well anymore. I’ll bring them by. Okay, see you later.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael and I have a very special connection, like an umbilical cord. And the thing is with Ryan is that I don’t want him to trip on it, or get it caught around his neck.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Sixty-three, sixty-four, sixty-five, sixty-six, sixty-seven, sixty-eight. [snickering] Sixty-nine. Seventy. Seventy-one, seventy-two, seventy-three.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I like fire drills. You know what’s the greatest? Like, when you were in school and the teacher would let you have class outside.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, the best.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, it was great because it was like you’re supposed to be working, but nothing ever gets done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, we had outside classes all the time and we never did anything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [chuckling]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Actually if I had fewer outside classes, I probably wouldn’t be stuck here at a paper company.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re not stuck.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, there is a real fire, but it’s okay. Everyone got out fine. This is why you practice these things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yes, I ran out first. A captain is always the first one on the ship and the last one off the ship. And this parking lot is our ship when the building is on fire. So, I ran out onto the ship.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, DVDs. Five movies. What would you bring to the island? Toby, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Say Anything, The Shining, Annie Hall, that’s too obvious.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Those are like my favorite movies. I didn’t really think you could win Desert Island, but I think you just did.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Toy Story 2, one of the best movies I ever saw. I went for my daughter and stayed because you can’t leave your daughter in a theater.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Toby and I used to sit together until Michael moved us because he thought we talked too much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kevin, do it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Uh, Cannonball Run, Cannonball Run II, [snickering] Weekend at Bernie’s, Weekend at Bernie’s II, and, oh, Groundhog Day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Groundhog Day.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I have a client who watches that movie once a week, at least.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I should put you in touch with him. Maybe we could get together and work on that account.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I would love that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, guys, guys, guys. That almost sounded like business, and we are trying to focus here today, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was Ryan’s age, I worked at Arby’s and then I worked selling cutlery for a while. Cutlery that could decimate a penny, I kid you not. There were these shears that could cut straight through a penny. So I have life experience and work experience that Ryan doesn’t, and will never have.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And then you go to school for three years.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: For two years, and it’s only at night, and then it’s on your resume forever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. And just out of curiosity, how much is it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: $650 bucks

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A semester?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: A credit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It’s an investment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, it sounds like it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I think it’s worth it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If I could change the life of one person, just one person. I… Actually, that’s shooting kind of low. I already did that when I was born. I changed two people’s lives. Mom and Dad. Um, if I could change the lives of 5,000 people… 10,000. No, five. I’d be satisfied with 5,000. I… 10,000 though, that’d be something. Wow, 10,000 people. Because, you know what? Even one is amazing.

episodes.title: Halloween
episodes.description: Michael is pressured by corporate to fire someone, which puts a damper on the office Halloween party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Happy Halloween, everyone! [notices Pam, in her cat costume] Oh… that’s great!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey… Happy Halloween. Jan called.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh… OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know why she’s calling. It’s the end of the month, and I was supposed to let somebody go by the end of the month.  And somehow I’m supposed to put on a costume and smile. [dials a number on his speaker phone] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: [on phone] Jan Levinson’s office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Sherri. Michael Scott returning.

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: Oh, she’s in a meeting. Uh, she just wanted the name of the employee you let go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I’m gonna wait till the end of the day. Because the book said it’s best to wait till the end of the day.

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: I just need the name of who you’re planning to let go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know… yet. I will have to call her back.

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: I know she wanted the name.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay… Sherri?

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you were getting fired, how would you wanna be told so you could still be friends with the person firing you?

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: Jan wants the name as soon as possible, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: Mm-Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ll call her back. [talks softy, to himself] Wish I could fire Sherri.

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: Hey, I’m still here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No?

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Sherri
quotes.text: Hanging up now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I mean you hear about layoffs in the news, but when you actually have to do it yourself, it is heavy stuff. It’s… these are people’s lives you’re talking about.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [entering] You wanted me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [notices Michael’s costume] Papier-mache?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeeesh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, Pam, I have to let somebody go today. This is, uh, the hardest thing I’ve ever had to do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why did you put it off until Halloween?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because it’s very scary stuff.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think it’s gonna put a damper on the party a little.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re worried about the party? There’s a man’s life at stake here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So it’s a man?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Or a woman. A human life. If you had to guess, who it would be based on their job performance… and who you think deserved to be fired – who would that be?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just answer the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And… sometimes you just let it go to voicemail.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re costume is fantastic! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. I sent away for it in July from a catalog. [bobs his head around, causing the costume head to jiggle around]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh no, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t. [Michael laughs] Aah! [laughs, then leaves] Okay…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, man. Okay, I have to fire somebody.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [eyeing Jim’s costume] What is that?! What are you supposed to be?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m a three hole punch version of Jim. ‘Cause you can have me either way. Plain White Jim, or Three-hole Punch.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That’s great!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, well look… [pulls his hood over his head and pops up his light saber] What about me?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What are you? A monk?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am a Sith Lord. [looks at Jim] Oh big deal. Three round pieces of paper taped to a shirt. This cost me 129 dollars.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You guys excited about the party?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s gonna be fun.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looks to Oscar] Oh, boy… look at you! Haha. Showing your colors. Bet you wish you wore a dress every day.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What are you implying?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All good. Happy Halloween. What happened to all those spooky decorations that we had? The cobwebs and such?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You know, I don’t know. We put them all up last night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you know what? Go buy some more. I’ll approve the overages. Sound good?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.  Oh, yeah, also about budget stuff. Um, I’m  going to need you to find, like a, a full employee salary, plus benefits, like fifty grand. I’m going to need you to find 50 grand in the numbers.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: But we don’t keep two sets of books.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that’s not what I’m saying. Just, you know, find it. Pretend that your jobs depend on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm-hm-hmm. Interesting take on Dorothy. I love it. Hey, you know what would even be better? Soccer ball and cleats.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “Bend It Like Beckham.”

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, like … the movie about the Indian girl who plays soccer?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] Yeah. That would be perfect.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean, I guess I could do that. I don’t really play soccer or anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I don’t really have two heads. So…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, what are you again? Oh, right… Three-hole PUNCH! [punches Jim in the chest and cracks up laughing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, greatest strength.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, okay…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A dog-like obedience to authority

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But that doesn’t sound good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, okay. Um, how ’bout, the ultimate team player? [Pam laughs and types]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight is… special. But, I don’t believe that his talents are being used in this office. So Pam and I have put his resume on Monster.com, Google, Craig’s List. We’re really interested most in jobs that take Dwight out of state. Um, preferably Alaska… or India.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He’s a gun nut.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um. He sticks to his guns.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, I looked through all the budgets. And there is one department…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: … that has three people…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: … doing the work that could be done by two.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This is great. [Angela shakes her head] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who do you think it should be?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim. Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Jim brings in money.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Eh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stanley. Pam. Oscar. Meredith. Kevin. Angela.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s not a popularity contest. Although it does make sense to fire the least popular because it has the least effect on morale.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One of the warehouse guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [turns to the fake head, listening] What? There was someone left off that list? Who?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who is he saying?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re right, I didn’t even think of him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, that’s actually a really good idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, not me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah… I could.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not saying that’s what he said.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know that’s what he said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [listening to his head] What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tell him, not Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is not a very nice thing to say about him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tell him to stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Quiet, you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I agree. He’d land on his feet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Make him be quiet.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Those aren’t chips and dip.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I made brownies.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Uh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: … What?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m just trying to figure out why you’re sabotaging things.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I made brownies.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: And I made cookies. Same category.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m guessing Angela’s the one in the neighborhood who gives the trick-or-treaters some toothbrushes. Pennies. Walnuts.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Dunder-Mifflin. This is Pam. [listens] Uh, yeah. [snaps her fingers in the air, getting Jim’s attention] Just one second. I will, uh, transfer you to our manager, Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Jim
