quotes.text: Um… Whoa. [picks up ringing phone][in managerial voice] Michael Scott here. Yes, I am regional manager of this orifice. Mmm hmm. Dwight Schrute is amazing. Yeah. No, he is actually the single greatest employee of his generation. Mm  hmm. You know what? I’m gonna tell you what. You hire Dwight K. Schrute, and if he does not meet, nay, exceed every one of your wildest expectations, well then, you can hold me, Michael Gary Scott, personally and financially responsible. Okay. Okay. Okay-kay-kay-kay-kay. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stanley, could you come with me, please.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: As Assistant Regional Manager…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: To the.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look! I’ve got some bad news. You’re fired. You need to pack up your things and go. [Stanley laughs.] I’m serious, Stanley. It’s over.  I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [laughs, and imitates Donald Trump] You’re fired. Get your fingers off my phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So. How did it go with Stanley? How… how’d he take it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He wouldn’t listen to me

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahh, come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you want to fire him, you’re going to have to tell him yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t wanna fire Stanley. I never said that. I’m certainly not going to do it myself. Get those big, baleful, eyes staring at me. Yikes. Just, okay, just… [waves Dwight away]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering on the phone] Cumberland Mills?! And how did you get my resume? Oh no, no. I’m very flattered. Don’t get me wrong. I’m just not sure that it’s my official resume or if it’s something that maybe a satisfied customer posted online. What does it say under martial arts training? Oh. Okay, I’m gonna have to supplement that. Could I have your fax number?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Would I ever leave this company? Look, I’m all about loyalty. In fact, I feel like part of what I’m getting paid for here is my loyalty. But, if there were somewhere else that valued that loyalty more highly, I’m going wherever they value loyalty the most.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh… hey.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, your dress is stuck in the back. Kind of just…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh. [fixes his dress]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] So you got the fax? So why didn’t you add it to the res… ? What do you mean? Of course martial arts training is relevant. Oh, excuse me! I know about a billion Asians that would beg to differ. Uh, yeah, I get a little frustrated when I’m dealing with incompetence. Well, you know what? You can go to hell, too. And I will see you there… burning. Fine! Okay… oh wait! So you’ll let me know when you’ve made a decis… [stops and hangs up phone.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim is really talented. And he should be the one who’s getting a better job offer. Like, for real.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don’t take this the wrong way, but… you should go for that job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um… it’s in Maryland.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, but I mean, look at the salary. And it’s definitely a step up. And a challenge.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.  Yeah. You know what? Maybe… maybe I will. [starts walking away]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is called leveraging an offer. [walks into Michael’s office] Michael, can I talk to you for a moment?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I just thought you should know that I was just offered a job with better pay, better benefits and a better title at Cumberland Mills.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fantastic!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I turned it down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?! That would’ve solved all my problems.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Out of loyalty to this company…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you idiot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: … so I was hoping to be made Assistant Regional Manager officially.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you left, I wouldn’t have to fire anybody.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But then you wouldn’t have me here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Big deal. Oh, it would’ve worked out so well. Can you get it back?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s in Maryland.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can call. Can you call ’em?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t. I… I suppose I coul… no. They never really made me an offer anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wohahah! Why are you torturing me?! God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Honestly, I don’t think Michael has the slightest clue of who he’s gonna  fire. I think he keeps hoping that someone’s going to volunteer. Uh, or be run over by a bus before the deadline. But in the end, really, what’s going to happen is it’s gonna be the first person to give him a dirty look in the hall. And therein lies the true essence of his charisma.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clearing his throat and interrupting Jim’s talking head] Can I speak to you a minute?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um… yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, I really didn’t mean to…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Help. Me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m sorry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to role play firing me. I want you to fire me, and I will take it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, you want me to be you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to be me, and I will be Creed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, are you firing Creed?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. That’s just the first thing… came… in head.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We should switch seats in order to…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, that’s a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. [they stand up] Excuse me.[They sit down] I’m really sorry, but I have to let you go. And it’s purely budgetary. It’s not personal…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aaaahh! I’m gonna kill myself!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m going to kill myself, and it’s your fault!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s an overreaction.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Corporate is really breathing down my neck. And they’re saying this has to be done by the end of the month.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is this you? Are you being you, or is this Creed? Are you…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I… this is Creed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m improvising, so just try to keep up. [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, hold that thought. Hold that thought.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I’m very angry, and I want…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [picks up the phone] Michael Scott here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m gonna kill you. I’m going to kill you for firing me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Toby? Mm hmm. [looks back to Michael] I really have to take this Creed, so it was really worth…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get off, get off. No, no. OK.. just get off.[sits back down in his chair and waves Jim off.] Just, just… yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What happened?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It wasn’t me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. That was like crazy. ‘Cause I was…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, hey… Creed?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are great. Very ambitious. And I feel like you want more than this little office has to offer. And I understand that you’d wanna just spread your wings, and fly the coop.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What are you telling me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I… we’re gonna have to… You… you want something better.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: No, I don’t. I wanna stay right here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you wanna leave.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: No, I wanna stay here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why… why are you making this so hard?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Um, I think there’s a misunderstanding, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think you’re right.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Can I go?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, of course  you can’t go. We haven’t even started this horrible process of… okay, Creed. I need to let somebody go today. They told me I need to let somebody go. And as much as I think you’re a great guy, and I like you, you’re… you’re, goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Let’s fight it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Let’s call Jan and fight this thing together like the old days.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What old days? What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Did you start the paperwork yet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s right here on the desk, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You don’t have to do this, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can’t, I can’t…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Undo it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can’t change anything. This is the way…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: No, you have the power to undo it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t… okay, just listen.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Michael, undo it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I went hunting once. Shot the deer in the leg, had to kill it with a shovel. Took about an hour. Why do you ask?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have to fire someone today, okay?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Fine. Fire someone else. Fire Devon. He’s terrible. I am so much better at my job than Devon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well… I already picked you. And you know that. So, unless I just go through with this, you’re always gonna look at me as the guy who almost fired you.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no, no. I will forget so fast. You will be my savior. You’re they guy who gave me my life back. Thank you. I knew you’d see it my way Michael. God Bless you. You’re a fine man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Listen, you will not regret this either. Devon is terrible; No one’s gonna miss him. Good, good, good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Devon, could I talk to you for a sec?

quotes.speaker: Devon
quotes.text: Creed’s an idiot, you know that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, he…

quotes.speaker: Devon
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no, no! You had it right the first time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, maybe I did.

quotes.speaker: Devon
quotes.text: Exactly. You gotta go with your gut, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Huh. No! I can’t, no. I can’t go back. I would look like an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Devon
quotes.text: That’s why I’m being fired?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Devon
quotes.text: So you might not look like an idiot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. It was all the stuff that I said. It was the business downturn, the cutbacks, and, and…

quotes.speaker: Devon
quotes.text: This is unbelievable!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just hope that you and I can remain friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Devon, wait, please.

quotes.speaker: Devon
quotes.text: What!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, look. In addition to severance, and everything, I want to give you this gift certificate to Chili’s. From me. Okay? No hard feelings.

quotes.speaker: Devon
quotes.text: [takes the gift certificate and tears it up] Kevin, Jim, Pam, Kelly, Toby, Oscar, Meredith, Phyllis, Stanley, or the temp. If any of you wanna meet me for a drink, I’m going to be at Poor Richard’s. And the rest of you can go to hell!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [watching nearly everyone leave] What about the Halloween party?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, hey, Jim. Wait, stop. Um, I’m sorry… for pushing you towards Cumberland. Seriously, if you left here, I would blow my brains out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [motions for her to follow him] Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s just a figure of speech, you know? Blow your brains out? Come on. All it really means is that we’re friends. Who else is she gonna talk to if I’m gone, right? I mean, if she left, I wouldn’t blow my brains out. Of course, I would take that job in Maryland. Because it’s double the pay, and soft shell crab just happens to be my favorite food.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I  love Halloween. You know, it’s just, it’s just fun. Every year, it’s just fun. Last Halloween I came as Janet Jackson’s boob. It was topical. People got a… a big kick out of it. The year before that, I came as Monica Lewinsky, and I wore a stained dress. The year before that, I also came as Monica Lewinsky. And before that, I was O.J. It was pretty funny. Oh, I wish you were here last year.

quotes.speaker: Children
quotes.text: [ringing the doorbell of Michael’s Condo] Trick or treat!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He… Hey, hey, hey, hey! How you doing? Wow! You guys looks great.

quotes.speaker: Kid
quotes.text: I’m a bumble bee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You look great! And you’re a princess?

quotes.speaker: Kid
quotes.text: A fairy princess.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A fairy princess. You’re very… .

quotes.speaker: Kid
quotes.text: I’m a lion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re a lion. [trying to to open a bag of candy] Wow, I want to hear your, your… Oh! [the bag tears open, spilling all the candy] Oh, okay, that’s all yours. That’s all yours. Grab it, grab it. You know what? You guys are getting all of these.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you. Big Jim. And Phyllis. Working hard, Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course. You’re always working hard.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep it up. And there’s Stanley. No costume? Well, no, not trying to fit in. I wish I had your confidence, I really do.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Something wrong, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. What could possibly be wrong? Everything’s great. Just keep living your lives. Everything’s gonna be fine. [sighing] You are all such wonderful, innocent people.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What’s up, Hef?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, do you have the name of the employee you’re letting go? I’d like to start working on out-placement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine. If you are so anxious to see a head roll, it’s you. There. You brought it on yourself. Too bad. Can’t say that I’m sorry. It’s a relief.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don’t report to you, Michael. I report to the head of HR in New York.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You asked for a name, I gave you a name. Now you’re not doing your job. Why don’t you just resign?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: They would just send someone else. You need to have an HR representative.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just know that if I could have fired you, I would have.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I know, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m going to have to do this Sopranos-style. Just whack him. Guys, could you take the freight elevator, please?

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
quotes.text: Hey, you wanna see a really messy show? Follow us around. Come to our office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? That’s my foot.

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #2
quotes.text: Ass, ass, ass…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You guys…

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #2
quotes.text: …ass, ass, ass, ass, ass…

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
quotes.text: Hi, Mom!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will handle it in the best way possible, but in case he or she goes postal, you will be available to subdue. Am I correct?

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know. Hey, are you on our payroll or are you employed by the building?

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Building.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, shoot. Okay, well, just have your pepper spray ready.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: You’re on your own.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. All right, this is it. By the time I get back to our floor, I will have decided. [elevator bell dings] Wow, that’s  a fast elevator.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a proposal, everybody. Listen up. Now, Corporate has been really breathing down my neck to make some pay cuts, but I refuse to fire anyone. So, I was thinking that maybe all of you would take a 10% pay cut and that would save the money. Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yeah, We’re not doing that. I have kids in college. Make a decision.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, great. Fine. Well, then, if anyone is annoyed later at what goes down, you know who to blame. Stanley. Not the guy who was trying to be creative. [turns around to find Toby standing behind him]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, it’s almost 5:00.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Leave me alone, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want some coffee?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: No, no. I had some, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [slurping] Oh, wow. How long have you worked here? How many years, Creed?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Fifteen years, I think.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, that’s right. Fifteen years and three months. Wow, you were hired before I was. Must be thinking about retirement.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh, no. I need the money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What do you mean, “Why?”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s just that you never got married and you live in an apartment.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don’t know. I got nephews.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah. And I buy them stuff, you know. Oh, made some bad investments. Why are you asking me this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just trying to be your friend.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Well, you never asked me about my life before, is all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course, I did. I always… Yes, I do.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Do you have something specific you wanted to talk to me about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you pulling my leg or…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have no clue why I’ve asked you in here?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I do not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, here we go. This… um, here’s the deal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Actually, I have. I have been on a hunting trip. I shot a deer in the leg. I had to… I had to hit him, I had to hit him with a shovel for about an hour, so he… That’s good eating, though. Venison’s very gamey. It’s hard to watch, though. It’s hard to… It’s hard to hit another living thing in the face with a shovel for about an hour. That… I haven’t been hunting since then. I, I… ‘Cause that’s, you know, where’s the joy in that? Where’s the… There’s no sport, really. Especially when you’re the one with the shovel. And they’re the one just lying there. Um… I would have rather hit it with my car or something and just… I was just smacking the hell out of that thing. That was a mess. And we just left him there. I didn’t eat it. I didn’t want to eat that. That guy. Why do you ask?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on the phone] This is Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: His name was Devon.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The human being man’s name was Devon.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Devon. The… Oh, is this the man that you…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking over Jan] Yes, yes, yes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: The person that you fired, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, it is.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Is that what you’re… Okay. Oh, you sound a little… A little upset.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, well, I am. A little. Justifiably. My Halloween is ruined.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I have to say that I am impressed, Michael. I know… I know how hard that was.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you? I don’t think you do. Devon was one of my best buddies. And now he hates me.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I’m glad you did it, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking over Jan] You’re glad?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And so, good job. Good job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks. Thanks so much. You think it was good?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah. Good job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking over Jan] Think I did a good job? Great. I feel good. I’m gonna give myself a pat on the back.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [talking over Michael] Yup. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There. I’m doing it. Right there. Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re supposed to be a cat?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You know, guys, Michael has really incredible decision-making abilities. Michael’s really incredible at making decisions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [camera pans over, Michael is sitting in a chair] Yeah, blah, blah, blah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pussy. Here, pussy. Pussy. Pussy. Here, pussy, pussy. Meow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You people are revolting. By far, the least popular people here. I should have fired you. Who knew Devon was so popular and had so many friends. So well-loved.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I feel like I made the right choice. Things happen for a reason. I wasn’t destined to go to Cumberland Mills. Just like Anakin Skywalker was destined to become Darth Vader, I am destined to sell paper here at Dunder Mifflin. That’s what I was put on this earth to do.

episodes.title: The Fight
episodes.description: Jim rallies the staff together to witness a showdown between Michael and Dwight at Dwight's martial arts school.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where is my desk?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is weird.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is not funny.  This is totally unprofessional.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, well, you’re the one who lost the desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I didn’t lose my desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, calm down.  Where was the last place you saw it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, who moved my desk?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you should retrace your steps.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, I am going to tell Michael and this entire office will be punished!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Colder… warmer… little warmer… there you go, ooh, warmer… warmer… warmer… warmer… warmer … cold, cold, cold, back up… ooh, ooh, warmer, hot, red hot, hot, very hot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [In bathroom, answers phone] Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [On the phone with Dwight] Hi, Dwight, um, what sort of discounts are we giving on the 20 lb white model.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, I’ve given you this information, like, twenty times.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s by the ream?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, yeah, ream.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …now, $9.78, signs and discounts 7%.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, thank you, gotta get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wash your hands, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [On the phone] Right, oh let me just check the pricing list.  Hold on one second…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Also on the phone] Sensei, hello it’s Sempai…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Umm…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what, let me give you a call right back. I’m going to uh, find it and then I’ll call you back, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, I just had a ques-… Yes Sensei. Arigatou gozaimashita. Hai.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Was that your mom?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, that was my Sensei.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I thought it was your mom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am now Sempai, which is Assistant Sensei.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Assistant to the Sensei, that’s pretty cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Assistant Sensei.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am a practitioner of Goju Ru Karate, here in Scranton. My Sensei, Ira, recently promoted me to purple belt, and gave me the duties of a Sempai. Not that a lot of people here in America know what a Sempai is, but it is equally as respected as a Sensei.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don’t want to stay until seven again this year.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t really have any control over that Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael tends to procrastinate a bit whenever he has to do work. Umm, time cards, he has to sign these every Friday. Purchase orders have to be approved at the end of every month. And expense reports, all he has to do is initial these at the end of every quarter. But once a year, it all falls on the same Friday and that’s today. I call it the Perfect Storm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing and tapping on his coffee mug] I don’t want to work, I just want to bang on this mug all day.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Did you ask me here for any specific reason?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uhh, yes, I did, here’s the dizzle. I have a very top secret mission for you. I want you to update all the emergency contact information.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Why is that secret? [Pam knocks and walks into Michael’s office]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Pam] Hello, oh God, busy work. Ahh, get away, cretin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Umm, I put stickers so you know where to sign.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, thank you. I know where to sign.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s just last year you…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Last year they were out of order, weren’t they Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, the last pick-up for overnight deliveries is at seven. So you need to have them signed by then. Or much earlier.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Chillax, Pam. Stop Pam-M-S-ing. That’s pretty good. Um, actually, I’m sending Ryan on a top secret mission. Tell her what it is.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Updating emergency contacts.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, is that really a priority?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it a priority? Oh I don’t know, um, what if there is a tornado, Pam? People’s legs are crushed under rubble. “Please, would you be so kind as to call my wife? No, I can’t because we don’t have any emergency contact information because Pam said it wasn’t a priority.” Think. Think with your head, Pam. Ok, well. She walks out. That’s the problem with being a boss is that when you are tough they resent you and when you are cool they walk all over you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Catch-22.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Catch-22. Yes. Why don’t you give me your contact information to start with, ok, what’s your cell?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, Larissa Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What’s her address? [Ryan’s cell phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: 117 Mount Bergin St.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in his office on his cell phone, talking in a fake high voice] Hey Ryan. This is Michael Jackson calling from Wonderland.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you mean Neverland?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is Tito.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Calling from… [Ryan hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Reading Jim’s palm] You’re major and minor lines cross at a ridge – that sucks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You making this up as you go along, aren’t you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I am just following the website.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, at least I don’t have cavities.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, you have very nice teeth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Who is your emergency contact? [Ryan’s phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Stacy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [looks to see who is calling but doesn’t pick up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Taps on the glass in his office to get Ryan’s attention] Pick up.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in a high pitched voice] This is Mike Tyson.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight. As Sempai, do you think there is ever going to be a day where humans and robots can peacefully co-exist?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Impossible. The way they’re programmed… You’re mocking me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No I’m not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look, I’m going to offer you a little piece of advice. I’m not afraid to make an example out of you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, that’s not advice. What advice sounds like is this:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And this is more a ying-yang thing. The ‘Michael’ all cursive, the ‘Scott’ all caps. Left brain, right brain. Or, duality of man.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Could you practice on the forms?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No women or children, unless provoked.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, Roy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Warehouse guy. Doesn’t count.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok. Michael? Could you beat up Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, I don’t think that would happen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Because we’re friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because I would kick his ass.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, Dwight’s a purple belt, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So? I’ve beaten up black belts.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, how did you know they were black belts?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They told me. After. You see, I used to run with a very tough crowd. Street Fighter types. Real, real bad people, I’m just lucky I got out.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Is your wife still your contact?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Um, ex-wife. Yeah. Um, her last name is ‘Becker’ now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: ‘Kay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You don’t need to write ‘ex’.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And after that, nobody ever messed with the ‘Damn Rascals’ ever again.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sounds tough. When you’re a Jet, [starts snapping] you’re a Jet all the way, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You were a Jet?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Have you signed the expense reports yet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, in theory, I have. I just need to cross some t’s and dot some i’s. Alright, I’m going to be in my office if anybody needs me. [Puts Dwight in a headlock] Hoo-hah. Oh, wow, sleeper hold. That’s my rebuttal. Shhh. Hoo. You are the weakest link.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Argggg!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m friends with everybody in this office. We’re all best friends – I love everybody here. But sometimes your best friends start coming into work late, and start having dentist appointments that aren’t dentist appointments. And that’s when it is nice to let them know that you can beat them up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just hit me. You’ll see.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can’t. I just got a manicure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, queer… [realizes he is on camera] eye. Queer eye. That’s a good show. Important show. Go ahead. Do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just have Dwight punch you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh yeah, that would be kind of worthless because I know a ton of fourteen year old girls who can kick his ass.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know a ton of fourteen year old girls?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What belt are they?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, Dwight is a wuss. When we rented ‘Armageddon’…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … he cried at the end of it. He did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I told you, it was because it was New Year’s Eve and it began to snow at exactly midnight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Bruce Willis. Are they going to leave him on the asteroid?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, I’ll punch you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, here we go. Alright, come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kiyah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fuuuaaaahhhhh… oohhhhh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did I want to harm Michael? The one man I’ve been hired to protect? No, I did not.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you ok? Are you sure you are alright?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. [Jim opens office door for Michael] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I come from a long line of fighters. My maternal grandfather was the toughest guy I ever knew. World War II veteran. Killed 20 men then spent the rest of the war in an Allied Prison Camp. My father battled blood pressure and obesity all his life. Different kind of fight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, he has to be stopped. Please, please, please, please, just ask Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, I’ll buy you a bag of chips.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: French Onion?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Obviously.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Kevin, who he is teaching to fight] Take this pen and stab me with it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Pam knocks on his door] Go away.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just have a quick question.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I haven’t signed them, ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, it’s not that. Um, I was just wondering, since I’m probably going to have to stay late, could you ask Dwight to stay late too so he can walk me to my car?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come in. Um, Pam, I hate to break this to you but Dwight can’t stop you from being mugged. He’s just not tough enough.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He’s a purple belt. That’s really high.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I could beat up Dwight. That’s ridiculous. I could murder him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s just out there, you…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, so that’s what they are saying?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, alright, where is Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, Kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hi-yah!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Wow, that’s actually pretty cool Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Now watch, let me take you from behind.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Watch out Kelly, he might sucker punch you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I didn’t sucker punch you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In case you remember, I was defending my honor… like a samurai.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? Well, the offer, Dwight, was for one punch which I absorbed. I had no idea that there would be a second punch. So, catch-22.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, fine. Tit for tit. Give it your best shot. Two punches. Go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, if we were in a bar right now, there would be two punches:

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, well, we are all getting excited to see this fight. The Albany branch is working right through lunch to prevent downsizing, but Michael, he decided to extend our lunch by an hour so we could all go down to the dojo and watch him fight Dwight. Fight… Fight, fight, fight, fight, fight, fight, I’m coming, fight…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I recognize that. That is Japanese for California Roll.

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: Uh, no, it’s not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think it is. A guy told me about that.

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: Actually, it’s a symbol for eternal discipline.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Reading Pam’s palm, while she has on extremely padded gloves] Wow, that is really interesting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Your love line- I’m just kidding. I can’t see anything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, look closer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim moves his head closer and Pam taps him gently in the face] Oh, ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Once point for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Gently taps Pam on the forehead] Tied up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, you’re dead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What, what are you going to do? Bring it, Beesley. Bring it. Oh yeah, good move. Not such an ultimate fighter now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, put me down. Put me down. [Meredith turns and looks at Jim and Pam] Oh my god, hey, put me down. Hey…

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: Ok, gentlemen, listen up. After a clean strike to the chest, stomach, or kidneys, I will separate you and award a point. The first person to three wins. Alright?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, Sensei!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alotta rules. Alotta rules. On the street we didn’t have any rules. Maybe one – no kicks to the groin, home for dinner.

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: Shi mate!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hiii! [kicks Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: Alright, break.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What the hell was that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: Dwight – awarded a point.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eat it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, that’s the way you want it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Two more.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Play dirty, huh? Ok, game on, man.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Sweep the leg.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m comin’ atcha man. Ok, purple belt, ok. I got him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got his pants.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was my pants.

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: No points for pants.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, you have… No, you have something… God, you look like such an idiot! [Lots of yelling and flailing of arms by Michael and Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: Clean single kick, gentlemen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go on, I dare you to kick there again. Kick there again, I dare ya.

quotes.speaker: Ira
quotes.text: Ok, break. Break.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No holding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can’t see. You can’t see. Good boy. Good boy. Great boy. Two points, three points, four points. I win. I win. [Michael is using his head guard to hit Dwight] Eight points. Nine points. [Begins to hock a loogie]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, stop it! Come on! Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Open your mouth.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You talkin’ to me? You talkin’ to me? “Raging Bull.” Pacino. Oh, I want that footage. I want it. I need it. Ah, I have to get back to work. I have lots of work… Oh, oh check this out. Come here. [Michael opens his blinds and looks at Ryan in the parking lot] There he is. Mr. Temp. Having lunch by the car. Let us play with him. This’ll be hilarious. [Calls Ryan on the phone, Ryan doesn’t pick up after seeing that Michael is calling] Oh, we’re playing phone tag.

quotes.speaker: Ryan’s Voicemail
quotes.text: Seven new messages. First New Message. [Michael’s voice] “Hi, Ryan. This is Saddam Hussein.” Next new message. “Hi, Ryan. This is your girlfriend… and I’m mad!”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My emergency contact is Todd Packer. Todd F. Packer. Do you know what the F. stands for?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Fudge?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knock at the door] Yeah… uh, come in. Oh, hey Karate Kid. The Hillary Swank version. Hi. How are ya?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need to change my emergency contact information from Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ok, to what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just put “The Hospital.” Contact number:

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Later Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Later, Kev. [Puts French Onion Potato Chips on Pam’s desk] Have a good weekend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, you too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Knock at the door] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I have the emergency contacts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, just throw them on the chair. I’ll take it from here. So, whatcha up to this weekend?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, hanging out with some friends, probably.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you’re doing anything crazy, give me a shout.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, alright, I’ll um, see you Monday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Michael, did you finish yet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This close. Dwight, may I speak with you for a minute?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m busy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, [points at himself] busier. Making the time.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael, can’t your conversation wait till Monday.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: We want to go home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you don’t even have anyone to go home to, Toby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The shipping place closes in a half hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, but I’ve been carrying the load on my back all day, and if everybody would just chip in a little bit, it’d might help me out. What do you say? Let’s gangbang this thing and go home. Good? Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is illegal.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don’t care.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have been testing you the entire day. Did you know that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I am happy to say that you have passed. So effective immediately I am promoting you from Assistant to the Regional Manager to Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I don’t know…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know, I know, I wouldn’t be offering it if I didn’t think you could handle it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can handle it. I can. Wow. So I guess this will just be my office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, title change only.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ll have Pam send out a memo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. Three month probationary period. Let’s not tell anybody about this right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just a formality.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Absolutely but not really.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I have so much to learn from you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes you do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you, Sensei.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And, ditto.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I told Dwight that there is honor in losing. Which, as we all know, is completely ridiculous, but there is, however, honor in making a loser feel better which is what I just did for Dwight. Would I rather be feared or loved? Um, easy. Both. I want people to be afraid of how much they love me. And I think I proved that today at the dojo.

quotes.speaker: Master
quotes.text: [Dwight grunts] Great. Excellent. [Dwight yells] All right. That’s okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight’s pager goes off] Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold on. Hold on. Sorry, just one second.

quotes.speaker: Master
quotes.text: Dwight, you can’t use your pager in here, I told you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I just…

quotes.speaker: Master
quotes.text: Dwight…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s a sales call.

quotes.speaker: Master
quotes.text: Ten push-ups. Ten push-ups!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can… Yes, sensei.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do I feel bad that I haven’t bonded with the other students? No, I’m not there to make friends. I’m there to attack people.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What about Oscar? Could you beat Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No problem.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know.  He looks pretty scrappy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Unless he has a shiv, in which case it wouldn’t be a fair fight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: True. Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No women or children. Unless provoked.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Roy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Warehouse guy. Doesn’t count.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Michael. Could you beat up Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I don’t think that would happen. See, I used to run with a very tough crowd, street fighter types. Real, real bad people. I’m just lucky I got out. I was a bad ass mo-fo. Stanley knows what I’m talking about.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ve never lost a fight. You know why? My motto. Never say die.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You just said it. You just said it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that’s not how I meant it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Die. You just… You said it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut up, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Do you think he’s signed them yet?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Signed what?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Forget it. Is that chocolate-vanilla swirl?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Just chocolate. Angela? For the last time, I did not eat your chocolate-vanilla swirl.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Don’t look at me. [smiles at camera]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don’t know why I write my name on things.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Are you going to happy hour later?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I’m still recovering from last night. But maybe.

quotes.speaker: Master
quotes.text: Sir, your shoes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Master
quotes.text: You’re gonna have to take them off. It’s a sign of respect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Well, in my office, if you took off your shoes, it would be a sign of disrespect. Stinkyfeetville. Kind of a ying-yang. [exclaiming] Oh, stretchin’. I like to stay tight. Compact. [Dwight screaming]

quotes.speaker: Master
quotes.text: Here’s your gear. Please put this on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you have, do you have anything in, like, black?

quotes.speaker: Master
quotes.text: Okay. Gentlemen. [to Michael] You ready? [to both Michael and Dwight] Okay, listen up.

quotes.speaker: Alyssa
quotes.text: Hi, sensei. Hi, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Master
quotes.text: [to camera] That’s Alyssa. My senpai. She just qualified for regionals.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alyssa? I guess she’s technically the senpai. But nobody really respects her. The only reason she got into regionals was because her competition was a bunch of 13-year-old girls. Put me in that division. Let’s see how she does.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God, you look like such an idiot. [both yelling] [grunting]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stan the man.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hi, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you hear about the fight? Well, it wasn’t much of a fight, actually.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No. Are those purchase orders signed?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I opened a big can of whoop-ass on him.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Huh? What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I went medieval on his heinie.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Are those purchase orders signed?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Stanley. I don’t tell you how to do your job, do I? He…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Look, I just want to have a job, Michael. If we don’t get these purchase orders…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Grow a pair, Stanley. Right? There not gonna downsize because I miss a lot of deadlines. That’s not how business works, okay? [sighs] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: For the record, let me just say, Michael Scott has no honor. If he lived in Japan, he would be an outcast. Well, that’s not totally true, ’cause Asians worship chest hair. I had a friend, a hairy friend, who lived in Japan. He told me the women would line up to satisfy his every need. So, and he wasn’t even that attractive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [door opening] All right. Here you go, Princess. Just finished with part one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is what you had Ryan do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, under my tutelage.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, what about the other stuff that has to be in today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you didn’t badger me with so many questions, Pam, I could be done with it by now.

episodes.title: The Client
episodes.description: With Michael and Jan Levinson-Gould away from the office to land a new client, the staff discovers an unproduced screenplay in Michael's office.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [entering office] Hey, have they left for the big meeting yet?  I’ve got Michael’s lucky tie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.  They’re in the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait, are those Michael’s Levis?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, who dry-cleans jeans?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael and his jeans.  He gets in them, and I’m not exactly sure what happens.  But I can tell you, he loves the way he looks in those jeans.  I know that’s why he started casual Fridays.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Ryan] I’ll take those. Thanks. [throws jeans under her desk]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This is a projection of the county’s needs…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, graphs and charts, somebody’s really been doing their homework.  Looks like USA Today.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thirteen schools, uh, two hospitals…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So this possible client they’re talking about, actually a big deal.  It’s Lackawanna County.  Our whole county.  And if we get this, they may not have to downsize our branch.  And I could work here for years.  And years.  [groan] Years.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So when we get to the Radisson, I’d like to, um-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I changed it.  To Chili’s.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Radisson just gives out this vibe, “Oh, I’m doing business at the Radisson”.  It’s kind of snooty.  So.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You had no right to do that, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here’s the thing. Chili’s is the new golf course.  It’s where business happens.  Small Businessman Magazine.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It said that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It will.  I sent it in.  Letter to the editor.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Alright.  But you will let me run this meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh huh, uh huh. [under his breath] Power trip.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: She had done a background check on me, she had it printed out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah.  And she was asking me about stuff, line by line, while we were having dinner.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That is unbelievable.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We are doing worst first dates.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, I win!  Ok, it was a minor league hockey game. He brought his brother, and when I went to the bathroom, the game ended and they forgot about me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok, that’s a joke.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, they had to come back for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, when was this?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Umm… it was not that long ago.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Wait, not Roy.  Say it’s not your fiance. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I always knew Pam has refused to go to sports games with Roy, but I never knew why.  Interesting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, let’s do this thing.  [to Pam] Wish us luck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good luck, Michael. Good luck, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [under his breath] Kiss ass.  Ok, probably going to go late tonight.  Burning the midnight tequila.  So, I think you could all just take off now.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, shouldn’t take more than an hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do you always shut down the entire office when you leave for an hour?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no.  That would not be efficient.  Actually, they just don’t get very much work done when I’m not here.  [Jan stares at Michael] That’s not true.  I know how to delegate, and they do more work done when I’m not here.  Not more.  The same amount of work is done, whether I am here or not. [another Jan stare]  Hey, everybody, listen up.  This is what we’re gonna do.  You sit tight, until I return.  Sound good?  Doesn’t matter, it’s an order.  Follow it blindly, mwahahaha, ok?  Alright, ciao.  [to Oscar] Adios!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So which way is Chili’s?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I’ll drive.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, no, that’s alright.  I wanna leave straight from there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s just a couple blocks away, so… boy, you really don’t know Scranton, do you?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I know Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: At all!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You ever been to Scranton, Jan? Dar de-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: If it’s a couple blocks away-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dar de dar.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan Levinson-Gould.  Jan is cold.  If she was sitting across from you on a train and she wasn’t moving, you might think she was dead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We should come up with a signal of some sort.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Why would we need a signal?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, in case one of us gets into trouble, the other one can signal-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What kinda trouble are you planning on getting in, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I… it could be either of us.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You’re gonna let me do the talking, we agreed on that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeees.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello?  Christian?

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thought that was you.  Hi.  Michael Scott.  This is Jan Levinson-Gould.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Just Jan Levinson.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No Gould?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No. [To Christian] Thank you very much for meeting with us.  Have you been waiting long?

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: No, not long.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, Jan, what happened?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is Gould dead?  What uh-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, we got divorced, ok? [to Christian] I’m so sorry.  Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, you’re kidding me!  Do you wanna talk about?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael. [to hostess] Uh, could we have a table for three, please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When did this happen?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We’re in a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Hostess
quotes.text: This way, please.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Christian.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, after you.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mouths “Wow” to the camera]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I thought we could start by going over the needs of the county.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: Right.  Well, Lackawanna County has not been immune to the slow economic growth over the past five years.  So for us, the name of the game is budget reduction-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Awesome blossom.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Christian] I think we should share an Awesome Blossom, what do you say?   They are awesome. Want to, Christian, blossom?

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, it’s done. Actually, [turns around] Megan, may we have an Awesome Blossom, please, extra awesome?  Now it’s done.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I heard a-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: If you have a-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very very funny joke the other day.  Wanna hear it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Christian, you don’t have to listen to this.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: It’s ok, I like jokes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Just the one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just one joke.  Ok.  Well, if it’s just gonna be one, I will think of a different joke.  Umm… let’s see… choo choo choo.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, it’s Michael.  I need you to go into my office and check some data for me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Michael on speakerphone] Ok, you want me to read ’em?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok. Um, a fisherman is walking down Fifth Avenue walking an animal behind him-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope.  Told it.  Not as good as you think.  Pick another one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok.  There’s a transcript between a naval ship-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh ho ho, yea!  Bingo! And a lighthouse.  Yes.  That is hysterical.  Could you start that one from the beginning?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.  There’s a transcript between a naval ship and a lighthouse.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is this real? [Pam dumps Michael’s screenplay on Jim’s desk]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It is a screenplay.  Starring himself.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Agent Michael Scarn.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of the FBI.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How long is this? [flips through pages]  Oh, Pam. Good work! Oop, wait, stop.  Drawings.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, those are drawings.  In case the writing didn’t really put a picture in your head.  And there he is, in the flesh, Agent Michael Scarn.  Now we know what he looks like.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: First guy says “Well, I’m an astronaut, so I drive a Saturn”.  And the second guy says, “Well, I am a pimp, so I drive a cheap Escort”.  And the third guy says “I gotcha both beat, I’m a proctologist, so I drive a brown Probe”.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: Ohhh no! [laughs] Oh my God, that’s funny!  I almost had Awesome Blossom coming out of my nose!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [to waitress]  Excuse me, could I have a vodka tonic, please?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do we all have our copy of “Threat Level: Midnight”, by Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, let’s get this started.  I’m gonna be reading the action descriptions, and Phyllis, I would like you to play Catherine Zeta Jones.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That’s the character’s name?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, you guys should not be doing this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why not, Dwight?  This is a movie.  I mean, this is for all of America to enjoy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You took something that doesn’t belong to you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Brought it in here-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you want to play-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Made copies of it-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The lead role of Agent Michael Scarn?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [making the mouth on his tie talk]  Yum! Yum yum yum! [Christian laughs]  That’s delicious!  I love it!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We would probably be upset with ourselves if we went this whole night without talking business, so, Dunder-Mifflin can provide a level of personal service to the county that the warehouse chains just can’t match.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: Well, we are out to save money.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What’s the bottom line?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bop! Be blah bop, be boo boo bop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s why I wanted a signal, between us, so that I wouldn’t have to just shout non-sense words.  That’s her fault.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did somebody say “baby back ribs”?  Hmmm? Hmmmmm?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I don’t think Christian has time for that.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: I have time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] I want my baby back, baby back, baby back [Christian laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael and Christian
quotes.text: [singing] I want my baby back, baby back, baby back-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Chili’s baby back ribs…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [reading the screenplay] Inside the FBI, Agent Michael Scarn sits with his feet up on his desk.  Catherine Zeta Jones enters.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sir, you have some messages.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not now!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: They’re important.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, what are they?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: First message is:

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, I have acted before.  I was in a production of “Oklahoma” in the seventh grade.  I played the part of Mutey the Mailman.  They had too many kids, so they made up roles like that.  I was good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If it isn’t my old partner, Samuel L. Chang.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Agent Michael Scarn, you lost some weight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you for noticing.  Now keep me company for one more mission. [Pam gets up to talk to Roy]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, uh, I have to work late.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [looks around conference room] You’re joking right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael Scarn takes out a nine-millimeter gun and shoots the-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pow! Pow! Pow!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hahaha, Agent Michael Scarn, you so funny.  Word.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael’s movie?  Two thumbs down. [Smiles] Heh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A man sitting several seats down, who has a gold face, turns to Michael Scarn. [out of character] Uh… Ooh, Oscar, you wanna play Goldenface?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Mr. Scarn, perhaps you would be more comfortable in my private jet?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, perhaps I would, Goldenface.  Sam, get my luggage.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I forget it, brutha.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Samuel, you are such an idiot, you are the worst assistant ever.  And you’re disgusting, Dwigt. [out of character] Wait, who’s Dwigt?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here’s what we think happened.  Michael’s sidekick, who all through the movie is this complete idiot who’s causing the downfall of the United States, was originally named Dwight.  But then Michael changed it to Samuel L. Chang using a search and replace, but that doesn’t work on misspelled words, leaving behind one Dwigt.  And Dwight figured it out.  Oops.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: D-W-I-G-H-T.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, you know what? I am done with this.  That’s it, the end.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, some of us wanna keep reading, so-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, you don’t speak for everyone, Jim. Ok, announcement.  My uncle bought me some fireworks.  Anyone who wants to see a real show, come with me outside now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s actually a good idea.  We’ll all take a brief intermission. [To Pam]  Hey, are you hungry?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: So after watching my mom go through so much pain, I decided to keep that promise, that I made to her, and take care of her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woo, well, this brings us to Jan.  Truth or Dare?  Tell us about your divorce. Ohh, ohh.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh no, Michael, Michael, please.  No, really.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, so you’re not gonna play?  She’s not playing.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: It’s not fair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She’s not playing the game.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We’d been fighting for a while-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check please.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: He didn’t want kids, but I knew that going into it.  But he also knew that I did.  I guess I thought that he would change his mind; he thought that I would change mine.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: You didn’t.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I was stupid.

quotes.speaker: Michael and Christian
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you were not stupid.  Gould was stupid.  Right?

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: That’s right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know?

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: You were really brave!  You, you put your arms out there, you slit your wrists.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s true.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: You said “World, this is my blood!  It’s red, just like yours.  So love me!”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I had plans to meet a friend tonight.  Which I had to cancel.  But this is cool, too. I’m not a complainer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Pam lights a candle] Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For the bugs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice.  That’s excellent, because bugs love my famous grilled cheese sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes… nice!  I can’t remember the last time someone made me dinner.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: Right down the street?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh huh, Kenneth Road, born and raised.  Spent my whole life right here in Lackawanna County and I do not intend on movin’.  I know this place.  I know how many hospitals we have, I know how many schools we have.  It’s home, you know?  I know the challenges this county’s up against.  Here’s the thing about those discount suppliers.  They don’t care.  They come in, they undercut everything, and they run us out of business, and then, once we’re all gone, they jack up the prices.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s bad.

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: It’s terrible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It, you know what, it really is.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh- [Michael signals for her to shh]

quotes.speaker: Christian
quotes.text: I don’t know.  I guess I could give you guys our business, but you have to meet me half way, ok, because they’re expecting me to make cuts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, corporate’s gonna go ballistic, but, uh, you think we could Jan?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, I guess I’ll see you in [looks at watch] ten hours.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you going to do with your time off?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Travel.  I’ve been looking forward to it.  It’s gonna be… really nice.  Gonna find myself.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [points to Jim’s iPod] You have new music?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. [Pam puts her hand out for an earbud] Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [waving to Christian]  See ya.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Bye… thanks. [pumps fist] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We did it!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We got it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nailed it.  Nailed it!  Come here.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I am really- [Michael kisses Jan] Thrilled. [Michael and Jan kiss again] Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What!?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Goin’. Ok.  Where we goin’?  Doesn’t matter.  Goin’ to the go go. [nervous laugh] Oh-ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [waking up on office couch] Michael?  Michael? [goes into Michael’s office]  Michael?  [looks out Michael’s window] His car’s not in the parking lot.  I should check the accident reports. [taxi pulls into Dunder-Mifflin parking lot] Who’s this?  Jan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Morning, Pam.  Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, nothing happened.  I-I swear, nothing happened.  What, I’m, totally being serious.  A gentleman does not kiss and tell, and neither do I. [laughs] No, seriously, guys, I’m not, I don’t want to go into it at all.  It’s off limits.  Fine, I took her back to her hotel and we made out for a little while.  It was great.  I mean she told me about her divorce, we talked for about five hours, she fell asleep on my arm.  So.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you do her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jan Levinson-Gould.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, no, no, no Gould.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you do her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is none of your affair because she is your boss-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And she is your boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And she is a woman.  She is a strong, soft, thoughtful, sexy woman.  And you know what?  I don’t think that I can sit here and let you talk about her that way without me defending her honor. [to camera]  Jan, I defend your honor.  [to Dwight]  Is that all?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Jan didn’t come back for her car last night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What!?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Could it be that Agent Michael Scarn has finally found his Catherine Zeta?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I don’t know… [Jim laughs, phone rings] Oh my God.  This is Jan’s cell.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know we have to register as a consensual sexual relationship with HR.  My question:

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Some might even say that we had our first date last night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why might some say that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cause there was dinner, by candlelight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dinner and a show, if you include Michael’s movie. [Pam nods reluctantly]  And there was dancing and fireworks.  Pretty good date.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We didn’t dance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You’re right, we didn’t dance.  It was more like, swaying.  But still romantic.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Swaying isn’t dancing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Least I didn’t leave you at a high school hockey game.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have some faxes to get out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, come on, Pam.  I-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, we didn’t dance.  I was totally joking anyway.  I mean, it’s not really a date if the girl goes home to her fiance.  Right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have you ever heard of Doctor David Friendly?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Doctor David Friendly’s Egg Yolk Diet.  It’s, it’s kind of unique.  It’s just, my diet the last couple months has consisted mostly of eggs yolks and cottage cheese.  And, um, what you do, you don’t just have the egg yolks, it’s not like a Rocky thing.  You do like hard boiled eggs and I got one a those melon ballers [shot of Michael peeling boiled egg] and I, it’s just like a little ice cream scoop, and I just scoop out the middle of the egg and just pop it in my mouth.  I don’t even, I don’t even use a plate anymore.  Uh, the first couple weeks I did, but you know what, boom, I keep a melon baller in my desk so if I have a hard boiled egg [Jenna breaks as Pam and laughs] I know, I know!  But you know what?  It’s perfect.  I know it sounds ridiculous, it sounds ridiculous, but you know what?  Dr. David Friendly, he came up with this thing.  The guy, I think he was like four hundred pounds when he started, and he started with this… I, well, the melon baller was my idea.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Most of that is good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [throwing away food from the fridge] Not today, Kevin.  Cannot be around carbs today.  You know what one loaf of bread would do to my abs?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m almost there, so we should have plenty of time to go over the presentation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And, uh, hmm, excuse me, I’ve also confirmed the meeting this afternoon at four p.m.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Conflict!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a conflict with that.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I have a pajama party.  At the Playboy Mansion.  With the bunnies.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.  I need you to take this seriously.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can’t get out of it!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, alright.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Are you hearing me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m hearing you, meeting confirmed.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This is a very important-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meeting confirmed.  Would you like your confirmation number?  Please grab a pen, because I will only be repeating this once.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [sighs] I’ll see you in ten minutes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is a closer?  A closer is a sales term for someone who always gets the job done.  And that is me.  A B C, always be closing.  Glen Garry, Glen Ross.  “Hey, gimme the Glen Ross leads.”  “No way, they’re just for closers.”  “Do you know who you’re talking to?” “I’m Michael Scott.”  “Really?  Well, take any lead you want.”  “No thanks, I don’t need ’em.”  Because I have a client list [taps screen] right here in my computer.  [sighs] So suck on that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t know, I think I was just staring at my desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?  Do you wanna get back to that?  I could go.  I should go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, do you mind leaving?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, not at all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s very important.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Do you think they’ll get the account. [Stanley stares at her] How come you never answer me?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I’m sorry, Phyllis.  No, I don’t think they’ll get the account.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [reading screenplay] Bullets are flying everywhere.  Ooo, wait, last page, big finish.  Here we go. Agent Michael Scarn kicks open the plane door with a karate chop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A kick and a chop are two totally different things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it’s just a movie, Dwigt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It doesn’t make any sense.
