quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, now it doesn’t make any sense.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Don’t jump Agent Scarn! There are no parachutes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just then, Agent Chang gets a bullet in the head.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! So close to retirement.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Another bullets heads towards Agent Michael Scarn, but he jumps out of the plane without a parachute.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Is that it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup, I guess so.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Does he die?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I sincerely doubt it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have to say, I think this is a terrible movie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What was my worst first date? Umm. It was a couple of years ago. It was a lunch date, actually, it was right down here, at Cugino’s.  And we had just met, and we really hit it off, it was, it was kinda nice.  Umm, huh.  And, uh, then, as it turned out, it wasn’t even a date, because she was actually in love with someone else.  So, best first date is also my worst first date.  Oddly enough.

episodes.title: Performance Review
episodes.description: Instead of talking to his employees about their work, Michael uses their annual review time to gather feedback on his "relationship" with Jan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [bouncing on an exercise ball] You should get one of these.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you even know what this is?  It is a fitness orb and it has completely changed my life.  Forget everything you thought you knew about ab workouts.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Done.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This ab workout is specifically designed to strengthen your core. [knocks things around Jim’s desk] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: S’ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Numerous health benefits, strengthens your back, better performance in sports, more enjoyable sex.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You’re not having sex.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Plus, improves your reflexes [knocks over more stuff] see, I would have caught that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, you know what, uh, how much is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s only twenty-five bucks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.  Um, ok. [pops Dwight’s orb with scissors]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, could I see you in my office?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s performance review day, company-wide.  Last year, my performance review started with Michael asking me what my hopes and dreams were, and it ended with him telling me he could bench-press 190 pounds.  So, I don’t really know what to expect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, you’re trustworthy-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And a woman-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I want you to listen to a voicemail from my boss. [Jan on recording] “Michael, it’s Jan. I guess I missed you.  I’ll, uh, be there this afternoon for performance reviews.  I hope it’s understood that that will be our only topic of discussion. See you soon.”  First impressions?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, just off the top… I think she’ll be here this afternoon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My boss is coming in today, the lovely Jan Levinson-Gould will, well, no Gould. The Gould has been [makes slashing neck hand motion] swack, divorced.  Um, the awkward part is that this will be the first time that we’ll be seeing each other since, well, uh, it was really nothing.  We just sort of got caught up in the moment.  The vulnerable divorcee gives herself to the understanding, with rugged good-looks, office manager.  Just, uh, she didn’t want it to continue for some reason.  It, we both, I didn’t want it, we both didn’t want it to continue.  Was not professional.  Um, when people say something’s mutual, it never is.  But this was mutual.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [playing Jan’s message] “I guess I missed you.” I guess I missed you.  So, she misses me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She missed you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But then she goes on to say “that will be our only topic of discussion”.  That doesn’t mean anything, those are just words.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have one idea of what it means.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Yeah, what, what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well I don’t think you’re gonna be very happy with this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhh, great.  Well, now I’m in a terrible mood.  Let’s do your performance review-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because she’s conflicted.  She has to be professional, but she’s fighting feelings… for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, why, that’s great news?   That, that, then why would, why would I not like that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, just cause, that, you work together, and it might be awkward.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow, wow.  Alright, let’s listen to that again. [plays Jan’s message] “Michael, it’s Jan.  I guess I missed you”.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, hey, listen, Jim.  Here’s a little tip for your performance review.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tell Michael that we should be stocking more of the double-tabbed manila file folders.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We don’t have double-tabbed manila file folders.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, yes, we do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, we don’t.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, it’s a new product.  So, you should just suggest that to him and he’ll be sure to give you a raise.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright… well, I’m not asking for a raise. I’m gonna actually be asking for a pay decrease.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, that is so stupid.  What if he gives it to you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I win.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ugh, you know what?  I am going to zone you out for the rest of today.  I need to stay focused, and I don’t have to see you tomorrow or Sunday and please don’t call me, and we’ll see how things go on Monday.  Uh, stupid.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, wait; one thing.  Uh, by tomorrow, you mean Saturday, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, duh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Duh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Today is Thursday.  But Dwight thinks that it’s Friday.  And that’s what I’ll be working on this afternoon.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Sometimes women say more in their pauses than they say in their words.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, yes.  Let’s listen to it again.  And this time, really listen to the pauses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God, Stanley, that’s frickin’ brilliant. How do you know that?  Did you learn that on the streets?  Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, no, that’s ok.  I did learn it on the streets.  On the ghetto, in fact.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No kidding.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It’s all about my bonus.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael and Jan definitely made out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ohh…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe more.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Eck!… Oh! Also, it is Thursday, but Dwight thinks it’s Friday.  So, keep that goin’.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yea!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good work, Stanley. Great performance review.  Stanley in the house, everybody.  Woo!  Angela, your turn.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I actually look forward to performance reviews.  I did the youth beauty pageant circuit.  And I enjoyed that quite a bit.  I really enjoy being judged.  I believe I hold up very well to even severe scrutiny.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jan’s on the phone for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh; Angela, you were totally satisfactory this year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Interesting.  Jan is calling me.  Maybe it wasn’t so mutual after all. [puts Jan on speakerphone] Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan!  To what do I owe this pleasure?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I am returning your many calls.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, hello to you, too.  Um, yeah, I was just um, I just wanted to get some closure on uh, what transpired between us at the meeting we had in the parking lot of the Chili’s.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No. No, we won’t be discussing that, Michael.  The only things I wanna talk about during your performance review are your concrete ideas to improve your branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, surely this uh, review is a formality because of what happened uh, at our meeting in the parking lot of Chili’s.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, your review is anything but a formality, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I expect you to forget anything that you think may have happened between us and exhibit completely professional behavior.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Been thinking about you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ok, that is an example of completely unprofessional behavior.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, I don’t see how that’s unprofessional. Just-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Are the cameras with you…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: …in your office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They are not.  Yes, they are. [Jan hangs up]  That’s my girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I heard they made out and had sex.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, they just made out.  That’s it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, I heard they made out and had sex.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don’t talk about it.  Office romances are nobody’s business but the people involved.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Romances?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, I have ideas on a daily basis. I know I do.  I have a clear memory of telling people my ideas.  Um, is there any chance you wrote any of my ideas down?  In a folder?  A “Michael-idea” folder?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s unfortunate.  How ’bout the suggestion box?  There’s tons of ideas in there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What suggestion box?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The suggestion box that I put out, and people could be put in suggestions anonymously?  Maybe there’s prizes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Uh, I think I remember that from back from when I first started.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don’t you find it and tell people to get theirs… never mind, I’ll tell them.  Hello, everybody?  Yeah, uh, attention, please.  Jan Levinson’s coming, very soon, and so, we’re going to have our weekly suggestion box meeting, so you can all get your constructive compliments in a.s.a.p.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Don’t you mean constructive criticism?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What did I say?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You said “constructive complements”; that doesn’t make any sense.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Kelly, that was neither constructive nor a compliment, so maybe you should stop criticizing my English and start making some suggestions. ‘K?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, Dan, this is Jim, and it is about 11:15, and I wanted to know what you were up to tomorrow, which is the fifteenth, and that is a…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Saturday.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [pumps fist] …Saturday, so just let me know what you’re doing tomorrow, Saturday, for lunch. Ok, talk to you soon.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone]  We’ll address this in the meeting then. Ok. Ok, bye-bye. [to Pam]  Could you please tell Michael that I’m here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, Jan.  How are you?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m good; how are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Nice to see you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. [tries to kiss Jan’s hand] Ok, why don’t we just step into my office?  We’re gonna go in here.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Can we please go in your office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep, right after you.  Apres-vous. [mouths to Pam] No calls.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oooo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright [takes Jan’s coat].

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s nice to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Nice to see you too, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Not like that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know Michael, I think I need to make something clear right off the top.  I’m not going to discuss anything with you other than Dunder-Mifflin business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Period.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do we understand each other.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m a little confused.  ‘Cause first it’s all like kissy-kissy.  And then it’s like all regret.  Because “Oh, I regret that.”  But, “Wait, I’m still gonna call you.”  But, but, “We’re just gonna talk business.  And I may come down and fire you if you don’t do your job.”  But what were talking about when we first kissed?  Business.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So are you still in the middle of the performance reviews then?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, I finished all of that.  I’m very fast.  I’m not too fast.  Not like wham-bam-thank ya ma’am.  But I do say thank ya ma’am.  But, I’m, I’m not like wham-bam.  Not that there’s anything wrong with wham-bam.  If it’s consensual.  [cold Jan stare]  We’re talking about office stuff.  Can I ask you a question?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is a business question. It’s nothing personal, I promise.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you wearing a new perfume today?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How is that a business question?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you’re wearing it at the office. And [smells Jan] it, I’m sorry, but no offense, but it’s really sexy.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Please don’t smell me, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, how’s it goin’?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, did you see “The Apprentice” last night?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Course, it’s on every Thursday night, so how could I miss it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can you believe who Trump fired?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that was unbelievable.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who?  Who was it?  Who did he fire?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You didn’t see it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I went out and got drunk with my laser tag team last night.  Crap!  I never go out on a Thursday night; what the hell was I thinking?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t understand- [phone rings] Hold on.  Sorry. [answers]  Yes, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, it’s time for the suggestion box meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m kind of in the middle of something. I wish you wouldn’t interrupt.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You told me to buzz you about the suggestion box meeting when Jan was here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did not, not, not use those words.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, I’d like to sit in on that meeting [to Pam] is it happening right now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it’s in like ten minutes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Everyone’s waiting in the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Great.  Very good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are we here?  Because I value your opinions.  Now, I know a lot of don’t think that I read your suggestions, but I do.  I just sift through them every week and I really look and scrutinize to see what you guys are writing.  Um, so, let’s, uh, just read some of these suckers.  Alright.  Number one:

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I can’t, I can’t-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t understand why you’re so upset.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Please sit down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let me ask you-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You’re gonna sit here and I’m gonna go sit over there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, let me ask you this.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Please, sit yourself down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let me ask you something.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where did you get your outfit?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [loud metal music playing in a stairwell; Dwight pacing] You are giving me this raise!  I deserve this raise! [plays air guitar] Yes! [kicks] Yes! Yes! Hiya!  The least you can do is keep my salary consistent with inflation! Keeya eyah!  Yes!  Why are you gonna give me this raise?  Why?  Because… I’m awesome! I am awesome!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just don’t understand why you have to pretend like nothing happened.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Because nothing did, Michael.  It, I’m not going to say anything more about it, and I would advise that you do the same

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m sorry, am I interrupting?  Oh God; were you guys making out?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, Dwight; come in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you want Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am ready for my performance review.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, great.  Your performance has been adequate.  You may leave; goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Is this how you’ve been conducting all the reviews, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You wanna talk now, good; OK, Dwight, leave.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, wait, I would like to discuss my raise?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why on earth would we give you a raise?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is an excellent question. Thank you for asking.  Let me bring up one word:

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Look, I know it’s your job, I know you have to ask, but I promise you, I’m not gonna discuss it with him, I’m certainly not gonna discuss it with you.  [digs a cigarette out of her purse] Do you have a light?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And in conclusion, I think that Lex Luthor said it best when he said “Dad, you have no idea what I’m capable of”.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s from Superman?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Smallville.  And that is why, I feel, that I deserve this raise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you think Michael and Jan actually…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t really wanna picture it.  But thank you, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How do you come back from that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, you don’t, I don’t think, come all the way back, you know.  Especially working together.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I mean doing that with Michael. How do you come back from that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: As a human being.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, no, I don’t think you can.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m heading back to New York; Alan and I will conduct your performance review over the phone tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait, wait, wait, come, I just, I just wanna know why?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, now is not the time or the place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, so you’re saying that there is a different time or place?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, I am saying we are never having this conversation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, ok, well never as in ‘never ever ever’, or never as in there’s still a chance?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Never, for me, always means ‘never ever ever.’

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just want to know, from the horse’s mouth, what is the dealio?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, it has nothing-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Am I too short?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: With your looks, ok?  It’s your personality.  I mean, you’re obnoxious, and rude, and, and, and stupid, and you do have coffee breath, by the way, and, and I don’t agree about the b.o., but you are very, very inconsiderate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Really.  You’re, you’re, you’re a great guy, ok?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I appreciate that, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And you were very sweet, and you stayed up with me and talked with me, cried with me, and I appreciate that-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I wasn’t, I didn’t cry-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: At this time in my life.  I just am not in the place right now where I’m looking for a relationship, so we can still work together, we can still be friends but… ok?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So my looks have nothing to do with it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ohhh, God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan is not in a place where she feels she can have a relationship right now.  And it doesn’t matter how great a guy I am.  And that is all I needed; I’m good.  I can go home now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, it’s 12:20; where the hell’s Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ummm… no idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Never missed a day, my ass.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Jim bows to Pam; she bows back] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [running through parking lot] I’m here! I’m here! I’m here! It’s ok!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar, I’m ready for you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Today is performance-review day, company-wide, and I’m a little concerned about my review. I exceeded my sick days and my personal days because I just couldn’t take it. And I don’t have a good answer for him, when he asks me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, I don’t know what to say.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, you’re in accounting…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes, I’m in accounting and I’m sorry and all the extra days. I know I passed my limit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, good, good, good. Something to work toward, being here more. I’m a big believer in people being here more.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what this is?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you don’t.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Then why the question?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is a visual aid for my performance review. Budget is tight, and if anyone is getting a raise, it is gonna be a fight to the death. And I intend on winning that fight. “Dwight: determined, worker, intense, good worker, hard worker, terrific. Dwight.”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have one, too. Jim. Jim, Is Jim. My name is Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s a total waste of your “M.”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You have a better idea?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, magnificent worker, marvelous worker, more money for this worker. Man, I like this worker. Mighty worker.  That’s good. That’s good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’ll use that.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I am not going to discuss anything with you other than Dunder Mifflin business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Period.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do we understand each other?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “I am not going to discuss anything outside of Dunder Mifflin business, period.” Okay. Now, why would Jan say she only wants to talk business and then make it clear that she is on her period? God, I don’t understand women. How about a clear signal, right? Is that too much to ask?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, that’s… It’s great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, it is.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. You have fun?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you go to first base?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hell, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you go to second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kind of, yeah. Over the shirt, my elbow, but…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, so close call at second. Was there an infield fly?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, yup, wait, yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pop-up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, there… Later there was.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, you got the signal from the third-base coach. You know what I’m saying? Like if there was a fly out to deep right, you know. A runner on second. He tagged up, didn’t he?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t, you know, it was… It was dark, for one thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Office romances. Um… [laughs] I think you should probably ask Pam ’cause she’s in an office romance, technically.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s just push on, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pushing on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s next. Just keep it. “Look on the supply shelf.” What? What is that? All right, Ryan, look on the supply shelf, would you?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah. It’s another note.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: “Look on the windshield.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Does it specify which windshield?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’ll check them all.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This ought to be good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which one?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no, no. It’s on the Miata.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He sees it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What does it say?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He can’t hear you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, field trip’s over. Come on. Could we please get back to this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [clapping] Come on. Let’s get back to this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, don’t break any lands-speed records getting back, okay, Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I’m back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Christ Almighty.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: “Look under the sink in the men’s room.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, next suggestion.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Next suggestion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “Don’t…” Okay, that’s blank. Don’t. Just…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: “Don’t sleep with your boss.” Do you think this is referring to you boning Jan?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, let me make something clear. As embarrassing as this is, I feel that it needs to be said. There is nothing romantic or sexual going on with Michael and myself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: The other night, I gave him a polite congratulatory kiss because he just closed the biggest deal of his career. And that’s it. If anything else has been implied, Dwight, or inferred, Michael, Creed, it’s just not true, okay? It’s not true. So… Is everyone straight on that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Crystal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There’s one more suggestion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How pleasant. You can…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: “Way to go man, Jan’s really hot.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I think we’re good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God. When Dwight said no one wants to come in on a Saturday…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I almost lost it. That was too good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, that is because that is the gift that keeps on giving. Oh, my God. I left today’s paper on my desk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You mean yesterday’s paper.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? Yes, that is exactly what I mean. Wow. You are very good at what you do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, temp.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look, we’re twins.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bet you I got mine for less than yours.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I bet you did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Getting a little something that calm the nerves?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What nerves?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: For the performance review. Oh, wait, you don’t get one. You’re a temp.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Actually, I had mine already.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re lying.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Why would I lie about a performance review?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why would Michael give you one before me?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I think because my name is before yours in alphabetical order. [coins dropping]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How did it go?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Fine. He actually gave me a small raise, which I did not ask for. [hits vending machine] It’s stuck. [Dwight begins throwing his entire body into the vending machine] It’s cool, it fell.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Wild Side playing] You are gonna give me this raise. Ya! Yes, you are. You are gonna give me this raise. Ya! Ya! The least you can do is keep my salary consistent with inflation, right? You are gonna give me this raise! Why? Because I’m awesome, awesome, yes! Yes! Yes! Thank you for your time, dude. Champ. My lord, mi amigo. Mi amor. Ha! Wild side! I am ready. [groans]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, that got a little out of control. Jan’s taking a break, which is fine. I’m doing the same, just chilling. Getting my mind off of us. She’s right. I need to be more professional at the office. When I’m at work, I need to focus on work. I should call her ex-husband.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, is this R. Gould? Hi there. My name is Michael Scott, I work at Dunder Mifflin. I believe I work with your wife, ex-wife, Jan. Yeah, that’s right, yes. Um… I was wondering if I could ask a personal question about her. Mmm-hmm. Okay, well, could I ask anyway? Uh-huh. Well, I’m just gonna ask. When you guys were dating was she sort of easy to get and then really hard to get?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, that Gould is a real interesting guy, a gem. I can see why he and Jan are no longer together. If my conversation with him is any measure of their relationship, he was verbally abusive, he was curt. He was… He had an inability to communicate, shall I say? He was emotionally unavailable. I don’t know how she dealt with that as long as she did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Never…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Never for me always means never, ever, ever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then, Gould wasn’t kidding.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing, I just…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What did you say, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Did you call my ex?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I did not.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Gould, you said, Gould.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe I did. Maybe I  called him, I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How dare you, Michael? My personal life is off-limits to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, how dare you do that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t do that. I… Maybe he called me.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Why would he do that? Why would he call you, Michael? Why would my husband call you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ex-husband, you have to let it go.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I mean…

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: “Look under the suggestion box.” “I can’t believe I kept this up all day.” Signed, me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is an office? Is it a group of people? Maybe. Is it an idea? Of course, yes. Is it a living organism? Exactly, yes. And any single cell organism has to have a spine, and that’s me. But the spine is always controlled by a brain, and that is Jan. But the brain needs a heart, and that is me again. So ironic. You know what? The heart is smarter than the brain. But the brain is so effing hot.

episodes.title: E-mail Surveillance
episodes.description: Michael decides to set up e-mail surveillance for all company e-mail, and discovers that Jim has invited everyone over for a barbeque except him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is Friday morning and it is another beautiful day in Scranton, Pennsylvania.  [sees man in a turban outside] Oh my God. Ohhh. [dials phone number] Pick up, pick up, pick up, pick up.  Oh, we have a serious problem here. [goes out onto office floor] Alright everybody, lock the doors, turn off the lights.  Pretend you’re not here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are we in danger?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s no time to think about if this is real.  Just, shh, everybody. [knock at the front door]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, should I call the… [Michael waves his hands] What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The IT tech guy and me did not get off to a great start.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I tried to install it myself, but, uh, you guys have these things so password-protected…

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: That just means you have to enter your password.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh…

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: What’s your password, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, umm… [looks at Post-It on computer]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mi-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: AH! Guh-oood.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please don’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, I’m sorry.  What is going on in there? Why is he here?  What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can’t tell you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You have to tell me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t have to tell you anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look, Michael, I know you don’t want to have to think about this, but if something were to happen to you, God forbid, then I would need to know in order to take over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, nothing is going to happen to me, ok?  I’m in the best shape of my life.  Look at this. [flexes his arms] Brrr!  That’s strong!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, but that doesn’t matter, you could get a brain aneurysm-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not going get a brain-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or get hit by a car-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or a bus or a train. Get poisoned, fall in a well, step on a mine, choke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, oh, ok; if I step on a mine in Scranton, Pennsylvania, and die, you can have my job, ok?  Why don’t you just go… away?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are certain things a boss does not share with his employees.  His salary, that would depress them.  His bed, it—  And I am not going to tell them that I’ll be reading their e-mails.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So how do you search?

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: By keyword phrase.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Try “profits”.  No! Try “Michael Scott”.  “Michael” “boss” and “funny”. [Sadiq (IT guy) types; result pops up] Oh my God, wow!  [chuckles]  E-mail from Stanley. Stanley,  Terribly nice guy.  [reads e-mail]  “Sorry I didn’t write back sooner; I can’t go to the game tonight because my boss Michael is an ass and making me stay late.”  Well, Stanley’s an ass.  Not one of our harder workers.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, what’s the deal, Michael?  Why are you spying on our computers?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, everybody; Oscar’s gone crazy!  What other ghost stories do you have for us?  That I’m a robot? [robot voice]  I will destroy everything in my path-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Actually, it’s just-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Beep! Bop!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bommmm. Bop! Onk onk.  [Tin Man voice] Oil can. Oil can.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Tin Man.  Actually we just a got a memo from IT saying you’re doing e-mail surveillance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, what? No. That defeats the whole purpose.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So it’s true?  You have access to our e-mails?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what the problem is?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I think I do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The problem is that when people hear the term “big brother”, they immediately think it’s scary or bad, but I don’t. I think, wow, I love my big brother.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I gotta erase a lotta stuff.  A lot of stuff.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh hey, just so ya know, if you have a lot of sensitive e-mails, they need to be deleted immediately.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. [Pam overhears]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispers to Jim] Hey.  Something just happened.  Dwight just told Angela that she has to deleted all of her sensitive e-mails immediately.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you think that they’re like-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, right, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [humming]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uhhh, ew, ew, ew… Maybe?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s like squishing a spider under a book.  It’s gonna be really gross but I have to look and make sure that it’s really dead.  Sooo… [to camera guys] If you guys see anything… ?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight, um, my friend is kinda into these two girls that he works with.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One is tall and brunette, and the other one is short, and blonde, and perky, and kinda judgmental.  Who do you think he should choose?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Does he have access to their medical records?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ummmm…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think one of the greatest things about modern America is the computerization of medical records.  As a volunteer sheriff, I can look up anyone’s psychiatric records or surgical histories.  Yeast infections.  There are a huge number of yeast infections in this county.  Probably because we are down river from that old bread factory.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meredith has an E-vite from Jim.  Barbeque at Jim’s tonight.  Tonight?  Wonder where my e-vitation is.  Click on guest list.  Angela, Stanley, Oscar, Meredith, Phyllis, Kevin, Creed.  Must be… .[scrolls down list] No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Angela-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How’s it going?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It’s ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Listen, are you bringing anyone to Jim’s party tonight?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.  Are we supposed to?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. I mean, I don’t know, I don’t think so.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hmm… [Pam reaches towards vending machine] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s always a distance between a boss and the employees.  It is just nature’s rule.  It’s intimidation mostly, it’s the awareness that they are not me.  I do think that I am very approachable, as one of the guys.  But maybe I need to be even approachabler.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That’s pretty young.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Michael]  Are you gonna eat with us?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course.  Hangin’ with my crew, crew that I am one of.  Hangin’ with my Cup of Noodles.  This is a meal in a cup.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh hum.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hot, tasty.  Reminds me of college.  Lived on this stuff.  Brain food.  Mmmm… You know what I really, really miss about college?  The parties.  Everybody’d go.  The athletes, the, the nerds, professors.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The professors would go to the parties?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah!  They were the most fun.  We always invited them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s true. I’m having a party.  I’ve got three cases of imported beer, a karaoke machine, and I didn’t invite Michael.  So three ingredients for a great party.  And it’s nothing personal, I just think that if he were there, people wouldn’t be able to relax, and you know, have fun, and my roommate wants to meet everybody.  Because I’m pretty sure he thinks that I’m making Dwight up.  [sighs]  He is very real.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to cameraman] What? [looks at Dwight eating a Baby Ruth] Ohhhh… Yes!  Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question:

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, Dwight thinks that tonight is a surprise party for Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really? That’s great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe we can get him to hide and wait somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] Oh man.  Oh, you know what, speaking of which, I was just trying to get a handle on, you know, numbers for food and stuff.  So do you think that Roy’s gonna come, or…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no, he can’t make it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, ok, cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Almost quittin’ time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup, it’s, uh, four o’clock.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One more hour.  Take care of anything you forgot to do. Hey, you know, I don’t know if you have any plans tonight, but if ya don’t, we could hang out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, um… .I can’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have plans.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh hmm, definitely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do, too. I do, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do, yeah. Big plans.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Because you said “do you wanna hang out”-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight, I can’t do it tonight, no.  Improv class, I have improv class, hanging out with my improv buds-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aw, that sounds like a lot of fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s the best.  It’s the best.  I would not miss it for the world.  But if something else came up, I would definitely not go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Improv sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is. Ok.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [someone coughs] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think Stanley just coughed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Pam.  Do you need me to walk to your vehicular transport?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.  Oscar, got big plans tonight with-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I’m on a call.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin, big man, big man, what are you doing tonight?  Where are you off to?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: My brother is in town and we are going to see the Alaska Film Festival at the Scien-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, alright.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Angela, rushy, rushy.  Where you rushin’ off to?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m just leaving for the day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well duh.  Where ya headed?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Charity.  Bake drive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Liar!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are a liar.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, I’m not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, oh ho, Dwight, Dwight, my loyal compadre.  You and I are hangin’ tonight.  The two of us.  We are celebrating our freedom and our manhood.  You know what?  Why don’t we watch that show that you’ve been wanting to watch, that stupid Battleship Galaxy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Battlestar Galatica.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s, whatever stupid show you want-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To watch tonight

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’re watching it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Unfortunately, I’ve got plans. I have to go to practice.  Soccer practice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t know you played soccer, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Clarinet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You, too, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have fun tonight!  Whatever it is that you’re doing, and I’ll see you Monday. [to the camera]  He has no idea!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Quick announcement everybody, if I could have everybody’s attention.  We do have wine in the kitchen, and, uh, there is beer available on the porch and despite what you might think, it’s not all for Meredith and Kelly, so please enjoy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!  You really think this is a good idea, huh? A hide-a-key rock?

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.text: Hey, you must be Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don’t work with us.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s because Mark’s my roommate.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.text: Hey, I love the Birkenstocks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks.  Yeah, I always keep an extra set in the car, for special occasions.  Jim, come here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When is the guest of honor coming?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, uh, later-ish.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He’s gonna love it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great. [to a group of guests]  Just wanna let you guys know that we will be taking the tour like I promised-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!  Just in time!  You wanna go on the group tour? We were just about to leave.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, the group tour is now leaving, then.  Ladies and gentlemen, just a few things that we are gonna be pointing out to you today, you will be able to see both bedrooms and, uh, if we’re lucky, maybe get a chance to peek into the bathroom, who knows.  I have to remind you that flash photography is prohibited and as much as you can, please refrain from touching things. I know you might want to.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, is Katy coming?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, actually, I haven’t talked to her in a while.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Huh, is it ok if I call her?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We can talk about that later.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, let’s get right into it.  I need two people for the first scene.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [In Horshack voice from ‘Welcome Back, Kotter’] Ooo Ooo Ooo Ooo, Mr. Cart-air, Mr. Cart-air.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, Michael.  And… anybody?  How about Mary-Beth?  Come on. Ok, so you start us off Mary-Beth.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Great. [skips] La la la la la laaa…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [fake kicks in door] Boom! Detective Michael Scarn.  I’m with the FBI.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Think about this; what is the most exciting thing that can happen, on TV, or in movies, or in real life?  Somebody has a gun. [gasps]  That’s why I always start with a gun, because you can’t top it, you just can’t.

quotes.speaker: Girl acting Pregnant
quotes.text: I’m supposed to meet my doctor here?  Have ya seen him?  He’s a very angry midget.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Boom!  Freeze!  Michael Scoon, FBI.  You know what you did.  Boom! Boom! Boom! [shoots at Pregnant Girl and another actor]  Yeah, you thought that you could get away with your little ruse, didn’t you?  Didn’t ya!?  Well, you didn’t, because I know where ya hid the diamonds.  I been on to you and your little friends for weeks.  [another actor steps in]  Boom! Boom! Boom!

quotes.speaker: Actor
quotes.text: I’m not even in the scene!

quotes.speaker: Actress
quotes.text: Again!?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Boom! Boom!

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Stop, stop, ok, stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Boom! Boom!

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: You shot me, great.  Now stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: You can’t just shoot everyone in the scene.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, if you hadn’t stopped the scene, you would have seen where it was going.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, what about the scene they set up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Boring.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: No, it wasn’t.  No more guns.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I could of-

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: No. No. Michael, I want you to give me all the guns you have.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Just, I want you to get rid of all your guns and give them to me.  Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yehhhehh.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Yeeehh, ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim’s bedroom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: See, I knew we lost somebody on the tour.  It’s-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool… This is your desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is my desk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Your home office?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My home office, this is it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Down.  You have to sit down so I can get the full effect.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, sure. Will do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, wait, so that would make me [walks to side of room] like right here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, that… Yep, that feels about right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And Dwight would be like-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what?  Let’s just leave that image out of it, because this is a happy place.  Happy thoughts, Pam.  Happy thoughts.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Umm, [gasps] yearbook!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, you don’t have to, ummm.  Alright, yes, that’s not gonna be awkward at all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [finds Jim’s picture] Ooooohhh no!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You were so dorky!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Freeze!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m in.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: You wanna go over the rules one more time?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no.  I’m looking in my wallet for money so you can tell me my fortune.

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: I promise it’s worthit .  Ooo, I can see you walking out of here and you’re thrilled with your reading.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you… [whispers to Bill]

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Michael, what did you tell him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Then why are his hands up?  Bill?

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: He told me he couldn’t show it to me, but he has a gun.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, let’s call it a day.  Nice job, Bill.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, it’s good.  Good work, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Angela, burger? Dog?  Havin’ fun?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I got sap on me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Chicken, hot dog, burger.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m a vegetarian.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There is soda inside.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Guh.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I didn’t think the premium laser color copy batch would sell as well as it did.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, it surprised us all.  I’ll tell you why.  Because when they—

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I’m sorry guys; can we please not talk about paper?  There’s gotta be something else we can talk about.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think it’s alright. Jesus drank wine. [Pam overhears]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Phyllis, come here for a second.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Have you heard anything about any secret office romances?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You tell me.  Well, you do mean you and Jim right?  Oh God.  I am so sorry, I thought, you guys hang out all the time and you’re talking all the time.  I’m sorry!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s ok.  It’s ok.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [smacks Ryan’s hand]  Not so fast… Fire Guy.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: How do I get to Bernie’s Tavern from here?

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: Oh, don’t worry.  We’re all gonna carpool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So Bernie’s, huh?  We’re all going to Bernie’s? [to camera]  Go to Bernie’s?

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: Oh sorry, we’re not going as a group, it’s just a private friend who just happens to know all of us from different ways is throwing a private birthday thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right, right, right.  Well guys, I’d love to go to Bernie’s with you, but, you know, I have an office party.  A big office party I need to go to, so…  Can’t get out of it.

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, see you later.  Nice job, Bill.  Not.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [singing] Here I go again on my own.  Going down the only road I’ve ever known…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh by the way how’s your side project going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah I gave that up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, it turns out I was, um, just grasping at straws.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just because two people are hanging out, it doesn’t mean that they’re together,  you know?  Like people can just be friends.  And I think that it was really unfair to think that there was anything else going on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [singing]  Just turn around now, cause you’re not welcome anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Surprise! [laughs]  Everybody!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Dwight…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow!  Who opened the morgue for this thing?  I’m just driving by, thought I’d drop in.  [to Jim] There’s some wine. I would love a glass, if you’re gonna open it.  Here ya go Temp, take my jacket!  [sees Sadiq] Oh, come on! That guy?  He is a good guy, not a terrorist.  Karaoke, I love it!  I am a karaoke fiend.  I call dibs. I got next, I got next up.  Come on, let’s get this party started, ha! Ok?  Where’s that wine?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, yeah, this is a duet, so, need somebody else, Pam?  You wanna come up and sing this one?  Need somebody else.  Takers, please.  [singing]  Baby when I met you there was peace unknown. Kelly?  Tried to get you with a fine tooth comb.  I was soft inside, there was something goin’ on.  This part goes to the, uh, girl.  You do something to me that I can’t explain.  Hold me closer and I feel no pain.  In every beat of my heart, we got something goin’ on.  Tender love is blind—

quotes.speaker: Michael and Jim
quotes.text: [singing] It requires a dedication, all this love we feel needs no conversation.  Divided, together, uh huh.  Making love with each other, uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’re making love!

quotes.speaker: Michael and Jim
quotes.text: [singing] Islands in the stream, that is what we are, no one in between, how can we be wrong?  Sail away with me…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Talk! Just talk!

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I am-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Funny story:

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Oscar shakes his leg] You’re going to have to stop that. [Oscar moves over] I can still feel it.

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: Do you have a question or something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um…

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: About my turban, maybe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope, nope.  I actually wear a turban sometimes.  Wanna see it?

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Got it right here. [pulls out Karnak turban]

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: Why do you have that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Comedy; it’s funny.  It’s Johnny Carson, Karnak.  It’s, um, put it back.  Huhhhh, did you have Johnny Carson in your land?

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: In Pittsburgh?  Yeah, but I never really watched him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. You were forbidden.

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: No, I’m much younger than you.  I watched Conan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, I’m gonna, uhh, get a cup of coffee.  Do you want some coffee er-

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Or some tea or hummus or something?

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: No, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, this isn’t good.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It’s fine.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You don’t even know what I’m talking about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Should have done this a long time ago.  Tons of personal e-mails, huge time wasters.  Uh, uh huh.  Wow, like Kevin, rating the best bars in Scranton?  Poor Richard’s number seven?  Idiot.  Stupid load.  [phone rings]  Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Michael, accounting needs your approval on-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I’m busy right now. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here’s a helpful suggestion for Jim.  Jim, instead of e-mailing Amazon, to try and get that CD that you didn’t receive, I suggest that you go to Visa and tell them to cancel the charge.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, definitely didn’t need help with that, but, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s seems like ya did though-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim.  Lots of e-mails to Amazon, lots of wasted computer space.  Alright, let’s get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, I assumed Michael was already doing this.  That’s why I only use my personal e-mail account.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [moves chair to Jim and Dwight’s desks] Ooo, bleh bleh bleh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where’s your tie?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know.  Just felt like taking it off.  Man, work can be just so damn frustrating don’t ya think, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, yeah, I guess.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What’s going on, Michael.  Talk to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know, same old stuff.  Same old.  Boss just been ridin’ my ass.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no! Jan!?  What’s goin’ on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t wanna talk about it.  I just wanna hang out, just be one of the guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The most important one of the guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s not the point.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s exactly the point.  You’ve hit a slump. It happens to the best of us.  You just have to remember, you know-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where you come from, and who you are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know, you have worked so hard for this.  You are the boss; you can buy and sell us with just a snap of your little finger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok yes, I would never do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, no one can snap with their little finger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ha.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, this is hardly the time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, this is completely the time, this is perfect time.  This is just guys gently ribbing each other, it’s what it’s all about, just hangin’ out.  Enjoying friends, all being the same.  Worker bees.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And their king bee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, just bees, just bees hanging out, buzzing around.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Master bee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not a master bee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Queen bee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m just a bee, Dwight, ok, just a bee, just buzzin’.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey babe.  Hey, how are you!?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You look good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, um, I was wondering if it’d be ok if I go to Lonny’s poker game tonight.  I promise, it’ll be like the last time for a while.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We were supposed to go to the barbeque at Jim’s house.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Oh, man.  Um, could you go without me? Make something up, say I like, ate something, or…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uhh…

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Huh, huh?  You’re the best.  You’re the best!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I might be late.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Ok, don’t wake me up cause I’m playing ball in the morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Alright, bye. [Pam looks around the office]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to the cameraman] Did I miss anything?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Five o’clock.  Time to go get my improv on. [drinks]  Little bit of the comedy juice.  Mmm.  Alright, see if you can guess what this is. [roars and flails his arms]  That is a dinosaur getting ready to go to improv class.  Just a taste of the improv.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need to know… who shot Johnson!

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Uh, President Johnson.  Um-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut up!

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a right mind to shoot you right in the head.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I, I killed him. You’re right! It was me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just shut up!  I don’t wanna hear anything more from you.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: No, listen to what she’s saying.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Alright, I’ll be quiet if we can make some kind of deal.  A deal?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pow! Pow! Pow! Pow!  No deal.  Not with Michael Scarn, FBI.  Michael Scarn doesn’t make deals.  Michael Scarn shoots and then asks questions later. [blows on his fake gun]

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Good, good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She was kind of tripping me up, cause she was, um, I was trying to get something going, when I was over her with the gun, and she like kept changing the story.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I don’t think… he was saying-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you kept-

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: He kept saying “shut up”-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Going into nuclear something; that’s not where the scene was going.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I-

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: It goes wherever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it goes, it goes in the best direction, and that was not the best direction.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I felt like he was ordering me around, cause he-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, he, Michael Scarn, that character, orders people around, and that’s, you should of just gone-

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: All your characters order people around though, and-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: There’s stronger choices.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t think there’s any stronger choice than being a really strong character.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: We’ve seen you do that character before though.  I mean, you know, that’s cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it’s, like, well, it’s, you know, when refine it, refine a character down to its essence,  that’s…

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Like Jim Carrey or something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Right, well I wasn’t saying that-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Nah, I know, I just meant that… he shot me, I just-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Or Ryan Stiles, something like that.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Yeah, ya know maybe, he made me get on the ground, and I didn’t feel safe in this game.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You shouldn’t have been, ’cause you were dealing with Michael Scarn.  That was exactly what I was hoping to achieve, so that is probably the best thing you could have said, that’s a compliment.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: You succeeded.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good work.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And in this room here, if you look closely, you will find out a few clues about who lives here.  Um, he likes biking, obviously, and uh, what else?  Uh, he likes tour guides, I guess.  And if you’re very perceptive, you’ll notice that he didn’t do a great job of cleaning his room [kicks water bottle under bed].  Ok, and uh, that’s the tou-

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And he’s really into penguins or something?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, thank you, Ryan, uh, I don’t know, I think I made the mistake one day of telling someone that I like penguins, and here we are.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, I’m sorry.  I gave you a penguin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And that’s why it’s on my desk, Phyllis; it means a lot to me, and now that I know it was from you, it means even more.  Moving on!  Uh, ok, so that’s the end of the tour for now, and if you liked it please tell your friends:

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, for the next exercise, let’s everyone pair up.[everyone picks a partner] And everyone got somebody?  Ok, good. [Michael is partner-less] Uh, ok, uh, why don’t you go out in the hallway and go through all the rules in your head.  Ok, you take a break and sort of run through the rules in your head.  Ok, stay there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ll just throw out some suggestions.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, you guys wanna start? [to Michael]  Don’t throw out any-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They’re in a whorehouse.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Suggestions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And he’s a proctologist. [to teacher] What?

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: We don’t need a suggestion for this one; it’s gonna come from them. [to other students] It’s a game called “Yes, and?” and uh, you will say the first sentence.  And uh, you’re telling a story-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: First sentence is:

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Why don’t you turn it up? [Ryan moves to turn up the grill]  Uh! Not so fast… Fire Guy.  Think we need some more heat, Fire Guy?  Hey, Fire Guy, maybe we should burn Jim’s house down.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That’s really funny.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, Kelly; I called him Fire Guy.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Good one, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah… hey Stanley-

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: He called me Fire Guy.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, good one. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It never gets old.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Never gets old.

episodes.title: Christmas Party
episodes.description: Seeing the party is headed for disastrous boredom, Michael breaks corporate policy to buy alcohol for the staff.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go. Get the door.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we are.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go. Push!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh god.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Push!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, turn it around.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really shove it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’ll break it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shove it through! Break it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You shove it. Shove it back! Here we go. Don’t break the branches, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I got a splinter.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, suck it up. We all have problems. Hey, everybody, look what we have! [laughs] Nice, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ve got it leveraged. Push. Straight up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On three. Ready? Big, one, two, three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One, two, three. [they push the tree up and it breaks through a ceiling tile.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Merry Christmas!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did it work?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [holds up the piece of tree he just cut off with a paper cutter] Well, sort of. Why did you get it so big?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A, that’s what she said, and B, I wanted it to be impressive. The biggest day of the year deserves the biggest tree of the year.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But what are we going to do with this hacked off part?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that is a perfectly good mini-tree, Kevin. And we are going to sell that to charity. That’s what Christmas is all about.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So this year, for the first time ever, I got Pam in Secret Santa. And I got her this teapot, which I know she really wants, so she can make tea at her desk. But I’m also going to stuff it with some inside jokes. Like, this is my high school yearbook photo. She saw it at the party, and it really makes her laugh. Not sure why. What else .. ooh. This is a hot sauce packet. She put this on a hot dog a couple years ago because she thought it was ketchup. And it was really funny, so I kept the other two. [holds up a miniature pencil] This would take a little too long to explain, so I won’t. And this is the card. Because Christmas is the time to tell people how you feel.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Is there anything we’re missing? Phyllis, you got the lights?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes, I got those cute little ones. [Angela looks at her disapprovingly] Do you think I should have gotten the big ones?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We’ll see.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Angela drafted me into the party planning committee. Her memo said that we need to prepare for every possible disaster. Which to me seems excessive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [comes into the conference room in a Santa hat and beard]  Merry Christmas! Ho, ho, ho, [points to Ryan] pimp. I’m kidding. What do we got, what do we got? How many plates are we getting?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Fifty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Double it. Double everything. Double ice cream. Double napkins. Double it. On me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was a tough year. I had to fire somebody this year. This party has to really rock. Check it out. Christmas bonus. 3,000 G’s. I got this for helping save the company money. So I guess some good came out of firing Devon after all. Maybe I should call him and tell him that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want people to cut loose. I want people making out in closets. I want people hanging from the ceilings, lamp shades on the heads. I want it to be a Playboy Mansion party. And also, I want you to spread the word that I will have my digital camera. And I’ll be taking pictures all along the way. And the best and craziest thing that happens will be on the cover of the newsletter. Incentive.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You do realize that we can’t serve liquor at the party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I know. Damn it. Stupid corporate wet blankets. Like booze ever killed anybody.

quotes.speaker: Kevin & Oscar
quotes.text: One, two, three. [they lift and start to move a desk]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You guys should use a hand truck.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Do we have one?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [having trouble with a plastic tablecloth as Pam stands idly by] Will you help me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! No way! It… no.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Come on, Mike, let me borrow the hat for just a couple of hours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You wanna be Santa?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have you ever seen Santa?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, I’ve seen Santa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Who cares?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I’m sorry. It just doesn’t work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I would like to be the elf.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That makes sense because he has elfish features.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [now wearing an elf hat and ears] Okay, everybody listen up! It is time to get your presents, wrap them, and place them under the tree like so. If you do not get your present wrapped and under the tree within the next five minutes you will be disqualified from Secret Santa. All right? No exceptions except Michael.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I got Angela. She is into these posters of babies dressed as adults. I got her one of those. I felt kind of weird buying that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I got Creed. And to tell you the truth, I don’t know anything about Creed. I know his name’s Creed. I know he works right over there. I think he’s Irish and I .. I got him this shamrock keychain.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I got myself for Secret Santa. I was supposed to tell somebody, but I didn’t [smiles happily].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You get something good this year?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think I did a pretty good job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah? Who did you have?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I can’t tell you cause it’s a secret.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think I got something pretty nice for my guy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I spent a lot of dough. Lot of dough. Wow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, there’s a $20 limit, right? So .. ?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I wanted this party to be really special so I sorta went above and beyond.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s great. Well don’t tell me who it is, cause I can ..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was Ryan. Yeah. I have Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gather round. Secret Santa, let’s go. Let’s go. Come on. Stanley, no, I’m going to handle the cord. Okay, safety reasons.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I know how to plug something in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I want to do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, let’s count it down, like Rockefeller Center. Ready?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Three, two, one. [very dim lights come on the tree]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not great.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’m sorry, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think the tree looks nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, I could get some flares from my car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. Shake it off, everybody. Just, let’s do Secret Santa.
