quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Presents are the best way to show someone how much you care. It’s like this tangible thing that you can point to and say, “Hey, man, I love you this many dollars worth.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: First present, Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [rips off the wrapping] Shower radio. Neat.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, good, that was from me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thanks, Kelly. You know I was gonna get one of ..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Okay. That’s enough. Let’s keep it moving on. Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, cool. [opens his plastic bag]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: That’s from me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great. Where did you get it?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don’t know. It was so long ago.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He obviously forgot to get me something, and then he went in his closet and dug out this little number [holds up way-too-short sleeves] and then threw it in a bag.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yep. That’s exactly what happened.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [opens up her present] Oh, my god! Thank you very much, Santa, whoever you are. It’s awesome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There’s a little more to it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right, next. Ryan. [tosses present]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, don’t!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [unwraps present] Whoa, a video iPod.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa. Wow. Jeez. Somebody really got carried away with the spirit of Christmas. That was me, I got a little carried away.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Wasn’t there a $20 limit on the gift? This is 400 bucks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don’t know that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, you left the price tag on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? Oh, shoot. Wow. Okay, well, who cares? It doesn’t matter what I spent. What matters is that Christmas is fun, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hey, for me. What is in here? [opens a handmade oven mitt] Oh, come on.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I knitted it for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: An oven mitt? Okay. [walks out]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So Phyllis is basically saying, “Hey Michael, I know you did a lot to help the office this year but I only care about you a homemade oven mitt’s worth.” I gave Ryan an iPod.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Should we just keep opening up the presents?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We don’t do anything until Michael gives us further instructions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got it! We are going to turn Secret Santa into Yankee Swap.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is Yankee Swap?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One person chooses a gift. The next person can either choose a gift or steal that person’s gift. If your gift gets stolen, then you can steal somebody else’s gift or choose a new gift.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought that was called Nasty Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, we call it White Elephant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I call it fun!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why are we doing this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because it’s better. Because it’s more special.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It sounds mean.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut it. No, it’s not. Okay, just give it a shot.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Michael should have asked the party planning committee first. He’s not supposed to just spring things on us out of nowhere. [starts to cry]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Meredith is up first. Here’s the deal. You can either pick a new gift or you can steal somebody else’s gift that they’ve already gotten, like the oven mitt.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I’ll take the teapot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, shouldn’t we … I bought that specifically for Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yankee Swap! That’s what makes it fun. Pam, you can steal the oven mitt now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’ll take the iPod.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And I have to give it to her? I don’t have a choice?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, now you can steal the oven mitt, the old shirt or the shower radio or pick a new gift.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [after Ryan opens a new gift – a nameplate saying ‘Kelly’] That was meant for Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, I figured.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think this is going great.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [unwrapping the poster] Yikes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, it’s for Angela, so ..

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That’s like, the creepiest thing that I’ve ever seen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angela, you’re up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’ll take the poster. Some people like these.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I will steal the iPod.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everyone wants the iPod. It’s a huge hit. It is almost a Christmas miracle.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well, Oscar, you little gourmand, you have the next turn.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I’ll take the … teapot.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, moving along. Meredith, let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I really want the iPod.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s already been stolen this round. Pick something else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holding oven mitt] I hope nobody takes this baby, cause this is great. Wow, look at that fine craftsmanship. Somebody really put a lot of work into that. It’s beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I’ll take the oven mitt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sucker! See, I wanted somebody to take it. Boom! Reverse psychology.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Reverse psychology is an awesome tool. I don’t know if you guys know about it, but basically you make someone think the opposite of what you believe and that tricks them into doing something stupid. Works like a charm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [opens present] “In addition to these paintball pellets, your gift includes two paintball lessons with Dwight Schrute.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You and me, Michael. Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who wants to take paintball lessons? How is that better than an iPod?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I never said it was better than an iPod.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael keeps bragging about his iPod, but you know what? Two paintball lessons with someone as experienced as I am is worth easily, like, 2 grand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [shooting paintball gun at target] Take that, Saddam!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Last gift. Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I want the foot bath.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That’s the thing I bought myself. I’m really psyched to use it. [pauses] Maybe I should have taken the iPod. Oh, shoot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, steal something or pick the final gift.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I want the iPod.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure you don’t want the teapot?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I mean, it’s an iPod. But ..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry, I ..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. No. Definitely. It’s ..

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay, well, I guess I will take that book of short stories.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! There you go. I want the teapot. Gracias.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Got to be kidding me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yankee Swap is like Machiavelli meets … Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [after Phyllis leaves suddenly] What is she so upset about?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe because you hated her present so much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on! I think that Yankee Swap was a big hit! I think it’s a success and I’m the one who ended up with Dwight’s stupid paintball pellets.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, but, Michael, the point is that we all bought gifts for specific people.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: And you should have just bought a $20 gift like everyone else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I didn’t. I got a big bonus because I fired Devon, and I used the money to buy something awesome. Sue me!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You got a bonus check?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How much?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It wasn’t. It wasn’t that much. It was $3,000.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: All right, I’m done now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Unbelievable. I do the nicest thing that anyone has ever done for these people and they freak out. Well, happy birthday, Jesus. Sorry your party’s so lame.

quotes.speaker: Liquor Store Clerk
quotes.text: It comes to $166.41.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, now, you’re the expert. Is this enough to get 20 people plastered?

quotes.speaker: Liquor Store Clerk
quotes.text: Fifteen bottles of vodka? Yeah, that should do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool, cool. Box it up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I bought this teapot for Pam, and I know she really wants it. So, can I trade you for it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No trades.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on, it’s a shamrock keychain. Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: “A real man makes his own luck.” Billy Zane. Titanic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look, it has sentimental value, Dwight. Can I buy it from you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. I want it. I’m going to use it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You don’t even drink tea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: True. But I get sinus infections, and sinus infections can be cured by making your tea from green tea leaf stems ..

quotes.speaker: JIm
quotes.text: Okay ..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: .. and pouring it directly into your nose, like so. [demonstrates]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: To think that my gift for Pam will be used for that, it’s a little too much to handle.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: This is awesome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know. It’s totally going to change the way I work out.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah, I was gonna get you one of these for Christmas, and now I don’t have to. I’m gonna save a ton of money.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So what are you going to get me instead?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I don’t know. Probably like, a sweater or something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh-oh. Looks like Santa was a little naughty.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is Christmas spirit, as in spirits, booze.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: We can drink?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: We’re really not supposed to serve alcohol.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Zip it, Toby! Just .. I mean, it’s a party. Come on. If I can’t throw a good party for my employees, then I am a terrible boss. Who wants a drink?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Me. Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go, here we go!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: The deal is that this is my last hurrah, cause I made a New Year’s resolution that I’m not going to drink anymore. During the week.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hi guys.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Does everybody know my boyfriend, Bob Vance?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Kevin Malone.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Stanley Hudson.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ryan Howard.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What line of work you in, Bob?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I think after I lost Culpepper and T.O it was over, man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, I need McMahon, Deion Branch to have big games or else I’m done.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: It’s possible. I can’t believe you traded Shaun Alexander, man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I had to. I needed defense.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Come on! Shaun Alexander? He’s the best back in the league.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It’s defense.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Oh, no. That is not worth it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It is worth it.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Never.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Are you kidding? You wait.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Anybody making out in here? [checks hallway] Not yet, give it time. Oh, hey, Ebenezer, boink. [takes picture of Jim] Okay, how’s it going in here? [takes picture of Meredith and Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We’re running low on cups. Do you want me to just run out and get some?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: There should be some ..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. We’ll find some, don’t leave the party.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis, Meredith, Michael, Kevin
quotes.text: One, two, three. [do a shot]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kudos to Ryan, king of the party committee.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I really did not do anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, no. No false modesty, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, you don’t have to answer calls during a party. Just thought you should know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] No, I was just checking out my present. [holds up teapot]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But ..

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I traded with Dwight. Just, I figured, you know, you went to a lot of trouble and it means a lot. And also, Roy got me an iPod or was going to get me an iPod, so ..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, either way. This is an amazing gift because it comes with bonus gifts. Look inside.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [opens teapot] Oh my god! The yearbook picture!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I think I made the right choice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God! It’s incredible. [Jim reaches and steals his card back before she can notice it] Is this the Boggle timer?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I didn’t think you were going to get that one. I really didn’t.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is so awesome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not bad. And if it couldn’t go to Ryan, you are the guy I’d want it to go to.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [grabbing Michael around the neck] Merry Christmas, asswipe!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No way. Oh, you’re kidding me. Packer! Yes! Todd Packer, ladies and gentlemen!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: [rapping] What’s up my nerds. Check it out. [points at the mistletoe stuck down his pants]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, no. Oh look at that. Icing on the cake.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Pacman need a drinky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, let’s fix you up. Who wants to fix up .. Toby. Toby’s gonna fix you up.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [listening to music through headphones] Yeahhh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Darryl. There you go. [hands him the Santa hat] You earned it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That’s okay, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. I really, really want you to have it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right. Thanks, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [looking at Xeroxed butt pictures] Whose butt is that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Mine.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, how did I not guess that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [coming out of his office] Lampshade on head! It’s happening!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [as Jim decorates a passed out Todd Packer] Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, hello there. [Kelly leans up and kisses him] But what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You shouldn’t do things like that. The man is supposed to do that.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thanks for the party, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Oh, hey. Listen up. We’re going to Poor Richard’s. Who’s in?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I’m in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael? Poor Richard’s?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, that sounds good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Christmas is awesome. First of all, you get to spend time with people you love. Secondly, you can get drunk and no one can say anything. Third, you give presents. What’s better than giving presents? And fourth, getting presents. So, four things. Not bad for one day. It’s really the greatest day of all time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Meredith. Heading over to Poor Richard’s?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool, cool, cool. Do you need a ride? [Meredith drops her top. Michael takes a picture] All right, let’s head out. Sounds good. Do you have a coat?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Towards me.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Towards me. That’s good, towards me. Towards me. Towards me, towards me. Okay, I’m good. I’m good, I’m good.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Okay, okay. [gasping]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Creed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Remember on that animated special when they taught the uh, the monster to put the star on top? That’s Dwight. Dwight’s the monster that we taught to put the star on top of the tree. You take his teeth out, and he could put the star on top of the tree.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you want me to help you with that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Phyllis and Angela and Meredith are helpers. I guess Angela’s kind of… Angela’s little. Phyllis and Meredith are not little. Pam is sort of a medium helper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Christmas lights? Good. Tinsel? Good. Star? Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight is… Dwight looks like Spock to me. He always wears the ears, and I always give him grief about looking like Spock, and he hates it because he has a different pair of ears that he wears to be Spock, for some reason.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question, Pam. Is Roy coming to the party?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, well, you didn’t tell me that. Now, he will not be allowed in unless we register him on this list.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do I look like I’m kidding? [Pam shakes her head ‘no’] Phyllis, stag, I assume.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’m bringing someone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I invited someone to the party. Bob Vance. He works at Vance Refrigeration next door. That’s how we met. [whispers] He’s my boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everyone, please remain calm until we receive further instructions.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just let us open up the presents, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Absolutely… not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What separates humans from jungle beasts? The fact that we have rules. When humans give each other gifts, they do it properly and orderly. When bears give each other gifts they just rip open a fox carcass and present it to their mate. I prefer the human way.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Man, I really wanted that. I really wanted the shower radio, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, thank God you didn’t steal my oven mitt. And Oscar, you little gourmand, your turn.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I’ll take the tea pot.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So, I guess, you really didn’t want the shower radio that bad.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, I just like tea.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don’t know why Oscar didn’t like the gift. I know he wanted a shower radio. I mean, I totally remember him telling me that he wanted one.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Kelly had me last year, too, and she gave me the same exact thing. I only have one shower.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar, paint ball pellets.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I guess I’ll take the last gift. Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was supposed to be for Meredith, ’cause she said she likes my drawings.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Thanks. I wish I could’ve had it. Do you wanna trade?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Like anybody would want an oven mitt. [Phyllis gets up and leaves the party]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So, hey, you wanna trade?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes, totally, ’cause I was just gonna throw this out anyway.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Really? You were gonna throw out a book?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Rap music playing] [singing] The time is now, the place is here And the whole wide world is filled with cheer My name’s DMC with the mike in my hand And I’m chilling and cooling just like a snow man

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [singing] So open eyes Lend us an ear We wanna say Merry Christmas and Happy New Year [Darryl whooping] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I’m the DJ because I really know how to heat up a party.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do enjoy a drink now and again, but tonight, no. I am also an officer of the law and I’m unofficially on the clock. I need to stay sober and alert. Also, on a personal note, I’m not at my best when I drink.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I actually got that for you. I had you originally.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, cool. It looks really interesting. What did you end up with? [Ryan pulls Creed’s old coat out of a bag] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I didn’t want anything else, so I figured at least I could give it to a homeless guy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What did you end up with?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Your shower radio.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You like music at least?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I love it. I actually used to have a radio show back in the ’70s.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You’re kidding. What was your DJ name?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Whacky-weed Creed.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Turns out that Creed is a pretty interesting guy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You behaved very badly tonight.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Sorry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See, that’s what Christmas is all about to me, is when you see someone open a gift and you think, “Man, I wish I got that.” I mean, that’s just such a great feeling, to watch other people envying a gift that you gave to somebody else. I don’t know, it’s just… I don’t know, just makes you kind of feel good.

episodes.title: Booze Cruise
episodes.description: The Dunder Mifflin staff go on a mandatory "booze cruise" to hear Michael give a motivational talk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello. Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What’s up, buddy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is not funny. Why is my stuff in here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that’s weird. Oh, dollar for a stapler, that’s pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, well, I’m not paying for my own stuff, okay? I know you did this, because you’re friends with the vending machine guy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who, Steve?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, Steve, whatever his name is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry. What do I want? What do I want… Oh, it’s a pencil cup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no. That’s my pencil cup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I don’t think so, I just bought it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, I think so, and you’re going to hand it over to me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love these.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, fine. Where’s my wallet?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, there it is. J1.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But I don’t have any…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here, you know what? You can have some nickels.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [putting quarters in] Five, ten, fifteen, twenty, twenty-five…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, everyone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good morning, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Where are we going this afternoon?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! Ha ha ha!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Last week, Michael sent out this mysterious memo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: “It’s time for our first quarter camaraderie event, so pack a swimsuit, a toothbrush, rubber-soled shoes, and a ski mask.”

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A ski mask and a swimsuit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So that he can have us rob a bank, and then escape through the sewers.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And brush our teeth.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley! Bo banley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I need to know…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Banana fana fo fanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What we’re doing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Be my mo manley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You said bring a toothbrush.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Is this an overnight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe. The suspense is just so exciting, isn’t it?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Should my wife tell her boss she’s not coming in tomorrow?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe, I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Not maybe. Yes or no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, no. But… okay, don’t spoil it for everybody, all right? But we are going on a booze cruise on Lake Wallenpaupack.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: In January?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s cheaper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is not just another party. This is a leadership training exercise. Right? I’m going to combine elements of fun and motivation and education into a single mind-blowing experience.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is now time to unveil the destination of this year’s retreat. We are going on a harbor cruise of Lake Wallenpaupack. It’s a booze cruise!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I have a test for business school tomorrow night. Is it okay if I skip the cruise and study for that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. This is mandatory. But don’t worry, you know what? You’re gonna learn plenty. This is gonna turn your life around, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m already in business school.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, this…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Wait, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why did you tell us to bring a bathing suit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To throw you off the scent.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, but I bought a bathing suit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, just keep the tags on and you can return it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I took the tags off already.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that’s not my fault, okay? Just.. we’re not going to pay for a bathing suit. Okay, I know what you’re all thinking, “Who is this smart little cookie?” Her name is Brenda… something, and she is from corporate. And she is here, like you, to learn from what I have to say.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am a great motivational speaker. I attended a Tony Robbins event by the airport last year, and… it wasn’t the actual course. You have to pay for the actual course. But it talked about the actual course. And I’ve incorporated a lot of his ideas into my own course.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Leader… ship. The word “ship” is hidden inside the word “leadership,” as its derivation. So if this office is, in fact, a ship, as its leader, I am the captain. But we’re all in the same boat. Teamwork!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Last year, Michael’s theme was “Bowl over the Competition!” So guess where we went.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now, on this ship that is the office, what is a sales department? Anyone?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: How about the sales department is the sails?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Darryl, the sales department makes sales. Good. Let me just explain. I see the sales department as the furnace.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: A furnace?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeesh, how old is this ship?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about the anchor?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What does the furnace do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, let’s not get hung up on the furnace. This just… it’s the sales… I see the sales department down there. They’re in the engine room, and they are shoveling coal into the furnace, right? I mean, who saw the movie Titanic? They were very important in the movie Titanic. Who saw it? Show of hands!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m not really sure what movie you’re talking about. Are you sure you got the title right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Titanic?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think you’re thinking of The Hunt for Red October.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’m Leo DiCaprio! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael stands in the front of the boat and says that he’s king of the world within the first hour, or I give you my next paycheck.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, everyone in the engine room drowned.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! Thank you, spoiler alert. You saw the movie, those of you who did. They’re happy down there in the furnace room. And they’re dirty and grimy and sweaty, and they’re singing their ethnic songs, and… actually, that might be warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The… no, no. No, I didn’t… okay. Well, okay, in a nutshell, what I’m saying is… leadership. We’ll talk more about that on the boat. Ship.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aye aye, Captain.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] A three-hour tour, a three-hour tour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, you are Mary Ann! We have the Professor and Ginger, welcome aboard. Angela, you are Mrs. Howell. Lovey. [to Kelly] Uh… the native. Sometimes they come from neighboring… [to Stanley] We have one of the Globetrotters, I am the Skipper, and Dwight, you will be Gilligan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Actually, I’m the Skipper. But you can be Gilligan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’d rather die. Hi, I am Michael Scott, I am the captain of this party.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: I am Captain Jack, I am captain of the ship. I’m also captain of anyone who sets foot on the ship. [to boarding passengers] Hi, welcome aboard.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In an office, when you are ranking people, manager is higher than captain. On a boat, who knows? It’s nebulose.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, look! I’m king of the world!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Okay, all right! Welcome aboard! I am your captain, Captain Jack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I am the regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin, Michael Scott. Welcome, welcome!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Okay! So…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! So…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Please. The life preservers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: They are located underneath the seats, all along the border of the boat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But don’t worry, you are not going to be needing life preservers tonight.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Well, we might, okay? Please let me finish, okay? Thank you. So, the Coast Guard requires that I tell you where the safety exits are. On this ship, it’s very easy. Anywhere over the side. [Dwight laughs loudly.] Not only am I your ship captain, I am also your party captain! Whoo! We’re gonna get it going in just a few minutes here…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m your party captain too! And you are gonna put on your dancing shoes later on! So we are gonna…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Okay, Michael, if you don’t mind…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Rock it!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Please, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If the boat’s a-rockin’, don’t come knockin’!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Your company’s employees are not the only people on the boat tonight, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’re all gonna have a good time tonight!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Why don’t you let me and my crew do our job. You just sit back and have a good time. All right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hm? Okay. Yep.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: You guys, it’s like we’re in high school and we’re at the cool table. Right?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Pam, were you a cheerleader?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, she was totally Miss Artsy-Fartsy in high school. She wore the turtleneck and everything!

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: That’s hilarious.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s not hilarious, but…

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Where did you go to school?

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Bishop O’Hara.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Piss slop who cares-a? We played you! You… you really look familiar. Did you… you cheered for them, didn’t you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, no.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Yes, I did! [chanting] A-W-E-S-O-M-E! Awesome! Awesome is what we are! We’re the football superstars! A-W-E-S-O-M-E!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I remember that! We crushed you like 42-10!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Having fun?

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Yeah. Everybody’s really nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Well, that is what Scranton is all about. Not like you New Yawkers.

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: When are you going to start the presentation?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, we already sort of started it back at the office and on the dock with the Gilligan thing, so… right now, I was thinking. Yes. Okay, listen up all you Dunder-Mifflinites! I would like to talk to you all about life preservers. Now, one important life preserver in business is IT support.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Not now, Mike, we’re doing the limbo! That’s right, partiers, it’s time to limbo, limbo, limbo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Limbo, whoo!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: All right! I need a volunteer to come up here and hold my stick. Who’s it gonna be?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Me.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Okay…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Me! Me, me, me.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Uh… usually it’s a woman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m stronger.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Hey, I got an idea! How would you like to steer the ship, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Keep us on a steady course. Keep a sharp eye out. I’m counting on you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was the youngest pilot in Pan Am history. When I was four, the pilot let me ride in the cockpit and fly the plane with him. And I was four. And I was great. And I would have landed it, but my dad wanted us to go back to our seats.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: All right, all right, that was great! Now it’s time for the dance contest!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But before that, I have to do my presentation.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Nope! Dance contest!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, we’ll have a motivational dance contest! Hit it! Yeah, okay, dancing! It is a primal art form used in ancient times to express yourself with the body and communicate!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sometimes you have to take a break from being the kind of boss that’s always trying to teach people things. Sometimes you have to just be the boss of dancing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] What do you do with a drunken sailor? What do you do with a drunken sailor? What do you do with a drunken sailor early in the morning?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey, come inside and talk to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t. Do you want us to run aground, woman?!

quotes.speaker: Darryl and Katy
quotes.text: [chanting] Snorkel shot! Snorkel shot!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Whoo! Who’s next? Come on, Pam! Come on! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I’m not going to do that.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That’s what I’m talking about!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, why don’t we find like a quieter place to hang out?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I’ve just gotta wait for Darryl to do his shot. Just a minute. Come on! [chanting] Darryl! Darryl!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s getting kind of rowdy down there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. [chanting] Darryl! Darryl! Darryl!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes I just don’t get Roy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, I don’t know. So… what’s it like dating a cheerleader?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, um… [A long silence.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m cold.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: So, what’s this presentation all about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! See, this is of general interest. It is about priorities and making decisions, using the boat as an analogy. What is important to you? If the boat is sinking, what do you save?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Women and children.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. Salesmen and profit centers.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: That’s a stupid analogy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, obviously you don’t know anything about leadership.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Well, I was the captain of a PC-1 Cyclone Coastal Patrol Boat during Desert Storm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow. You should be the motivational speaker.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. He gives me real responsibility, Michael. Captain Jack delegates. He’s let me steer the ship for the last hour.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: I’d like to be engaged. How did you manage to pull that off?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, I’ve been engaged for three years, and there’s no end in sight. So… you don’t wanna ask my advice.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Suppose your office building’s on fire. Jim, who would you save?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um… let’s see, uh…  The customer. Because the customer is king.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not what I was looking for, but a good thought.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: He’s just sucking up!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: When you were in the Navy, did you ever almost die?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Oh yeah, oh yeah. And I wasn’t thinking about some customer. I was thinking about my first wife. The day I got back on shore, I married her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? I would save the receptionist. I just wanted to clear that up.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hello, everybody, could I have your attention for just a second? Could you listen to me for a second? We were up at the front, and we were talking about what’s really important, and… Pam, I think enough is enough. I think we should set a date for our wedding. How about June 10th? Come on, let’s do it! Come on, Pam!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t want to take credit for this, but Roy and I were just having a conversation about making commitments and making choices. Right? Did I motivate you?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, it was Captain Jack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well… could have been either one of us, because we were pretty much saying the same thing.  Congratulations. That is great!

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: We gotta celebrate! Hey, I got an idea, I got an idea. I can marry you right now, as captain of the ship!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! I can marry you as regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, I want my mom and dad to be there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Then I’ll give you away!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Do you think that’ll ever be us?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: What is wrong with you? Why did you even bring me here tonight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know. Let’s break up.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Whoa. What?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: This is where Captain Jack drives the boat.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Seasick? Captain Jack says you should look at the Moon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Captain Jack is a fart face. I’m on medication.

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Really? What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Vomicillin. Okay. All right. It’s time to be boss. It’s time to motivate. Let’s blow some minds here. Okay, guys, guys, cool it. Everybody, Dunder-Mifflin Scranton employees, Brenda, I have some very, very urgent news I need to tell everybody right now. Listen up. The ship is sinking! Okay? We’re going down, right now. Just wrap your heads around the reality of that. Shh, please! Everybody, it’s my turn now, okay? Captain Jack is gone. In five minutes, this ship is going to be at the bottom of the lake! And there aren’t enough spaces on the lifeboat! Who are we gonna save? Do we save sales? Do we save customer service? Do we save accounting? This is a business scenario. Right? It’s a scary… it’s a…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Hey! Hey! What the hell is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s a predicament, and it’s something that each and every one of us has to think about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m in the brig. See? The boat’s not as corporate-friendly as advertised. What was the deal with the guy jumping overboard? What was… if he had just waited and heard what I had to say, he would be motivated right now and not all wet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is somebody there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What happened to you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Captain Jack has a problem with authority.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, right, because you announced that his ship was sinking?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He just totally lost it. If you ask me, he caused the panic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What a night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it’s nice for you. Your friend got engaged.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She was always engaged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Roy said the first one didn’t count.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s… great. You know, to tell the truth, I used to have a big thing for Pam, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? You’re kidding me. You and Pam? Wow. I would have never have put you two together. You really hid it well. God! I usually have a radar for stuff like that. You know, I made out with Jan…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah? Yep. Well, Pam is cute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. She’s really funny, and she’s warm. And she’s just… well, anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, if you like her so much, don’t give up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She’s engaged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: BFD. Engaged ain’t married.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Never, ever, ever give up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t worry, Michael. I’m taking us to shore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s a fake wheel, dummy.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Are you all packed?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes, I brought my duffel bag and a sleeping bag.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Where do you guys think we’re going?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Definitely some place you can swim.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Maybe Florida.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Did you hear something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knocking] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hello, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Can we come in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course, yeah, yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, every man’s dream.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, really? A surprise visit from his boss?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Two ladies at once. What? Why are you looking at me like that? Okay, you heard something. Um, yeah, it’s a booze cruise, but it… There’s more to the story than that. It…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: A booze cruise? What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Leadership off-site. Uh, booze cruise is just a rhyme…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, we discussed the IRS’s regulations.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I don’t even know why I said booze cruise. I don’t even think there’s booze on the boat.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, this event has to have legitimate business content to be tax deductible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We discussed that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course, of course. Yes. Yes. Look, I have a whole program planned. Jan, this program is going to change people’s lives. I am going to be dropping serious knowledge all over the boat.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good. This is Brenda Matlow from corporate training.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I thought she could attend tonight, and if your event is appropriate, you could give it to other branches.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, cool. Cool. And maybe you could attend tonight and then you could stay over at my house for the night. Awkward. That’s… You know what. Brenda, could Jan and I have a moment alone?

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Jan said if you asked me that I was supposed to say no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? You seriously said that? Okay. Brenda, could Jan and I have a moment alone?

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Sure…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: I mean, no.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, you know, I’m gonna go now, and…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good luck, Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ll see you later.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, see you later. And try to be professional.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ll call you later.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, that’s all right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s like…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You call me if you need anything, Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ll call you, too. [to Brenda] So. You are probably gonna get carded, so I can make you a fake ID. We have a laminating machine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is a sales department? Oscar, what do you think?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don’t know what the categories are of workers on a boat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not giving you the answer. Deck hands is one. And…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, oh, can I be the first mate?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’m first mate. You’re second mate. I’m first mate, as the captain.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about the anchor?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, the anchor is the only thing that kind of slows the ship down. Toby is the anchor. Oh, God. He, well… [to Brenda] Tell you about Toby later, he’s awful.

quotes.speaker: Brenda
quotes.text: Yeah, I know Toby from Jan’s birthday.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, Brenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey, Toby. So… It’s an analogy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Toby running to get on the cruise] Hey! What’s wrong with you? You missed the boat.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I got lost.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Idiot.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: We can go back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. That’s his punishment for not being here on time. Too bad, anchor!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I guess I shouldn’t have stopped for dinner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On the high seas, Captain Jack is the leader. On the land it’s Michael. On the ramp up to the boat, I was a bit conflicted. But now that I’m here, I’ll follow Captain Jack to hell and back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Captain Jack, what kind of fish they got in this lake?

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Perch, bass.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know, my grandfather told me there was a monster here that eats Catholics. Have you heard…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: I haven’t heard that, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If the hull is breached for any reason or the boat is overtaken, I am a volunteer Sheriff’s Deputy, and you can count on me.

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: That’s good to know, Dwight. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your problem now, Captain Jack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. You know what the best way of studying is?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: At home, not on a boat?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Flash cards.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Flash cards. Doesn’t really help me right now because I’m on a boat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are gonna get seasick if you keep reading in here.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Captain Jack
quotes.text: Yeah! All right. All right. That was awesome. All right, looks like the guitar player’s gonna take a little break. So this’d be a great time to head on over to the taco bar. All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is a great way to kill this party. Not on my watch. Let’s, uh,… Let’s rock. Let’s rock some stuff here, okay? [playing badly] Okay… I’m hearing a little too much reverb. [feedback echoing] Can we down the reverb? All right. Follow my lead. [playing Smoke on the Water] Does you guys know that? Take the bass. Take the drums. What?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Do you want me to give it a shot? Just…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? I don’t think it’s in…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s not in tune. I don’t know if you can…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don’t know, let’s try.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …make much of out of it, Creed. Good luck to you. I don’t know. It is a defective ax, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Guys, E, blues. Follow me, okay? [playing well]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Back in the ’60s, I was with the Grass Roots. We toured with Janis Joplin, The Doors, Cream. We had a lot of fun, And now I do quality assurance for a paper company. As you can imagine, drugs played a part. They still do. My work calls last about 90 seconds, and that’s about as long as I can concentrate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Those slide moves are just bush league. I hope I die before I’m old.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [throwing up]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [speaking Spanish] Por favor, tequila seoor.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think you’ve had enough.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What you say, bitch? You know, you might be right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’ve been to the lake before?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yes, I have. [kisses Pam]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Should have done it a long time ago.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, you should have.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I do what’s right whenever I figure it out. I love you, babe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Love you.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: You should make a toast.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I really don’t want to.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Jim, come on, don’t be shy.

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Everybody, everybody? There is a toast. Come on…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! Toast!

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Yeah, toast! Toast! Toast!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks, Katy. Um, didn’t really prepare anything to say. We’re all caught pretty unprepared with this whirlwind courtship. I guess I just wanna say that Pam is the greatest. My best friend. And she’s awesome. And…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, okay. My turn, my turn. Is this thing on? Uh, I want to congratulate the happy couple. You know, they say that marriage is an institution. And I say, who wants to be in an institution?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s my line! That’s my line, That’s… I always say that at weddings. So I’ll just think of something else to say. I… [band starts playing]

quotes.speaker: Katy
quotes.text: Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Jim. You got a hat?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [to Angela] So this is…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [storms out of Michael’s office] Well, we’re not going to Florida.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh. Someplace with a pool, then?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [gives Phyllis a look]

episodes.title: The Injury
episodes.description: Michael's "injury" from a George Foreman Grill distracts the staff from Dwight, the one with the real injury.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: …Lord of the Rings trilogy, if you see it back to back, it’s really long.  But it’s good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [off camera] Yeah, that’s right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam! It’s Michael.  Help me!  I need help right now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, what’s wrong?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m hurt, I have hurt myself.  Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, wait wait wait wait…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ungh, this is not looking good Pam!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, do you need me to call an ambulance?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I want you to pick me up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait a second, I thought you said that you were hurt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am hurt. I hurt my foot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m sorry? Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [exasperated]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want to come to work.  But I need you to come and pick me up. [Jim lunges across Pam’s desk and puts Michael on speakerphone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OH GOD!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, whoa, Michael…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s, okay, it’s Jim.  Just say again, uh, really loudly what happened.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, buhhhh, I burned my foot very badly on my Foreman Grill and I now need someone to come and bring me into work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You burned your foot on a Foreman Grill?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I enjoy having breakfast in bed.  I like waking up to the smell of bacon, sue me.  And since I don’t have a butler, I have to do it myself.  So, most nights before I go to bed, I will lay six strips of bacon out on my George Foreman Grill.  Then I go to sleep.  When I wake up, I plug in the grill, I go back to sleep again.  Then I wake up to the smell of crackling bacon.  It is delicious, it’s good for me.  It’s the perfect way to start the day.  Today I got up, I stepped onto the grill and it clamped down on my foot… that’s it.  I don’t see what’s so hard to believe about that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, could you come get me?!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, I have to stay here and answer the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, could someone come and get me please, Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, you should stay home and rest.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s no toilet paper here.  Could Ryan… tell Ryan to bring toilet paper.  Could you tell ’em that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Can you hop?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I tried hopping, Kevin, and I bumped my elbow against the wall and now my elbow has a protruberance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [panicked] No one wants to pick me up!?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [silence, Dwight enters the office] What is going on? What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, is, um, sick and he wants one of us to rescue him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not sick! I’m burned!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m coming Michael!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m gonna save you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t… is that Dwight?  I do not want Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hold on Michael! I am coming! Wait there!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t want Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, why don’t you call your girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t have a girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But you said that you went out with her this weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was all made up.  Just someone come, ok?  Anyone.  Anyone but Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sounds of a car crash] What was that…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What was that?! [everyone runs to Michael’s office window]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohhhhhh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He hit the pole!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s broken right, he can’t…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my gosh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh Dwight, Dwight, [Dwight pukes on his back windshield]  Ohhhhhh!

quotes.speaker: Jim and Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is he ok?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He’s still driving… Dwight, you forgot your bumper!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hellooo? … Please don’t send Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Morning everyone.  Don’t freak out. I forbid anybody to freak out.  Clearly, I have had a very serious accident, but I will recover, God willing.  I just want to be treated normally today.  Normal would actually be good, considering the trauma that I’ve been through.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You missed two big conference calls today, one with corporate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you explain why?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I didn’t mention that you cooked your foot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Burned my foot, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please stop popping my cast.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, where are you shipping your foot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ha ha ha.  So where are you shipping…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Your foot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.  Pam, messages please?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You didn’t have any.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really, well, it, uh, seemed very important to you earlier that you needed to stay and…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And do my job?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, your job is being my friend, Pam.  OW! God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [holding mini-fan]  It slipped.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s just that before, you said that you didn’t want any special treatment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t want any special treatment, Pam. I just want you to treat me like you would some family member who’s undergone some sort of serious physical trauma.  I don’t think that’s too much to ask.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you want some aspirin, because you seem a little fussy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I don’t want some aspirin, yeah I’m a little fussy.  Aspirin’s not gonna do a damn thing.  I’m sitting here with a bloody stump of a foot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Pam, I’m assistant regional manager, and I can take care of him. Part of my duties are to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?  Part of your duties are to what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You just said “part of your duties are to” something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I didn’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, you did.  What is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where is my cornbread?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.  Did you get all dark meat like I like?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes. I ordered three full rotisserie chickens worth of all dark meat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where are the yams?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: They were out of yams.  I got you creamed spinach.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you go to the one in Stroudsburg?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And they had no yams?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: They had no yams.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How strange.  Because they always have yams.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aw, man, is that a Prism Duro-Sport?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’ve seen one of these?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, they’re like an i-Pod only they’re better ’cause they’re chunkier and more solid.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy gave it to me for Christmas.  I’m trying to figure out how to put songs on it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no no no.  Don’t go there.  I know this Russian website where you can download songs for two cents a piece.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, I’ll write down the address for you.  Only, the only thing is, is that all the songs are in Russian. … Kidding!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! Ha, haha.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why would they all be…?  Ok, see you later, Pan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Pan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam… PAAAM!?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [phone rings] What.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come here please.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tell me before I come there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to rub butter on my foot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, please?  I have Country Crock.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, ow.  Ryan! … Ryaaaaan … RYYYYAN!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: These covers are totally indestructible.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. Throw it.  I promise it won’t break.  Chuck it. [Pam throws her mp3 player]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no, it’s broken.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, it’s fine.  I told you it wouldn’t break.  You could throw it all day long.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That is so cool.  Thanks Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, I guess Pam and Dwight are friends now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh God no, Dwight isn’t my friend… Oh my God!  Dwight’s kind of my friend!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, nope, no one is helping me out at all Mom.  No, I’m not gonna call Jan.  She’d just worry… drive down here and make a big thing… Who told you that?  No, it was mutual.  What is Pam doing chatting with you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Huh. Do you like candy?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It’s alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cause you’re sweeter than candy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What is wrong with you? [Dwight pats Angela on the rear and runs away laughing]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Wow, you just dive right into it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know, around age twelve, I just started goin’ for it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [loud noise in bathroom] No! Guh! OW! Awww, help, help me!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What, what happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I fell off the toilet.  I’m caught between the toilet and the wall.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What do you need?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh, not you.  Someone else.  Get Pam.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don’t think Pam’s gonna want to come into the men’s room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get Ryan.  He needs to lift me. [Ryan shakes his head] and he needs to clean me up a little bit.  Bring a wet towel.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ryan, is, uh, dead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, he’s not.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Dead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just saw him.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No.  Can’t, can’t you just get up yourself?  I… You only grilled your foot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh, forget it.  I’ll just get up myself.  No!  Uh, aaaahhh!  Ah!  Oh God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you think Dwight’s bein’ a little weird today?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, he’s actually been really nice and helpful.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And that isn’t weird?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can I have everyone’s attention please?  Phyllis, Oscar, Ryan, who’s supposed to be dead, can I ask you all a question?  Do you all know what it’s like to be disabled?  Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Um, I had scoliosis as a girl.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, never heard of it.  No, a real disability, not a woman’s trouble.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: When I was a teenager, I was in an iron lung.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wuh, how, how old are you? Look, the point is, I am the only one here who has a legitimate disability, although I’m sure Stanley has had his fair share of obstacles.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I’m not disabled and neither are you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, [lifts up cooked foot] what does this look like to you Stanley?!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Mailboxes, Etc.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shuuut it, ok, well, well you know what, disabilities are not things to be laughed at or laughed about.  You people are jerks.  Imagine if you had left Stevie Wonder on the floor of that bathroom instead of me.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, we wouldn’t.  We love Stevie Wonder.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sigh] I burned my foot!!!  Ok, twenty minutes, conference room, everybody’s in there!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [looking up at Creed] Dad?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: While we are waiting for our special guest to arrive, I wanted you all to take a look at a few of the many, many disabled icons who have contributed so much to our society.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Quick question: uh, why is Tom Hanks on the wall?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Twice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good question.  Forrest Gump: mentally challenged, Philadelphia [points to a picture from Big]:

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I want to clamp Michael’s face in a George Foreman grill.

quotes.speaker: Billy Merchant
quotes.text: So, there are just a couple things I want to remind everybody of…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok…

quotes.speaker: Billy Merchant
quotes.text: First is parking.  You can’t block the freight entrance with your car, even if your blinkers are on.  Does anybody have any questions? [to Dwight, whose arms is raised]  Yes. Yeah? yes…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, you have your hand up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ignore him.  You know what?  We’re not that different, you and I.  When I clamped my foot into a non-stick…

quotes.speaker: Billy Merchant
quotes.text: You know what Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah…

quotes.speaker: Billy Merchant
quotes.text: Let me stop you right there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Billy Merchant
quotes.text: And leave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you see Born on the Fourth of July?  I was under the impression that Billy would be more like that guy.

quotes.speaker: Billy Merchant
quotes.text: What’s wrong with that guy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You mean today?  He stepped on a George Foremen grill and he burned his foot.

quotes.speaker: Billy Merchant
quotes.text: No, not Michael.  The moon-faced kid who crashed into the pole.  He looks like he has a concussion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [popping his bubble wrap cast] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I found the pudding cups you wanted in a gas station in Carbondale!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You did it!  Look at you, and with the plate and the napkin.  Very nice.  Thank you, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You are very welcome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you get the yams?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, the gas station in Carbondale did not have fresh yams!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sigh] Ok, I’ll just have the pudding.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You sure?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeh.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  I feel better.  Ryan brought me some chocolate pudding and his kindness healed my foot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, baby, I am feelin’ better.  My body’s literally healing itself.  It is amazing what the human body is capable of when you have a powerful brain.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I ground up four extra-strength aspirin and put them in Michael’s pudding.  I do the same thing with my dog to get him to take his heartworm medicine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, finally feel the blood coursing through my foot veins.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [hits his head on his desk]  Uh, ugh, ohhhh…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, ok, I think we need to take him to the hospital because I’m pretty sure he has a concussion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, now you feel some compassion for him.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: He needs to go right now, and you’re his emergency contact.  I think that you should go with him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don’t you go with him?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I, barely know him…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I want Michael to take me…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can’t take you, I don’t have my car and yours is all vomity.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You can take my van!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, ok, that’s, great.  No, I can’t drive.  Jim why don’t you drive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’ll go.  I’m still recovering. So let’s just, Ryan, could you get my coat please.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Slowly, slowly.  Let’s just get to the elevator.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Choo choo choo choo choo choo…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?  What, stop…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Vietnam sounds.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Dwight falls onto the couch] Stop, stop, stop, stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tired… [Jim grabs spray bottle from planter]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You can’t lay down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Want to take a rake… .

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wake up. [sprays Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, here, let me help you Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m just gonna get…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, Pam, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Get up, get up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re the best.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just keep him awake.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It smells like chicken soup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have to go to the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where we going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just want to say goodbye ok?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ll be back, I mean…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, I know, but it’s gonna be different.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s just hard to explain.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aw, Pam, you’re adorable [taps her nose]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my goodness!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [giggles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, huggy hugs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shotgun!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You don’t think you should sit in the back with Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The rules of shotgun are very simple and very clear.  The first person to shout “shotgun” when you’re within the sight of the car gets the front seat.  That’s how  the game’s played.  There are no exceptions for someone with a concussion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God, a mini-van.  What is Meredith’s problem?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I think she has a kid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah she has one kid, no husband.  She’s not gonna find one driving this thing around.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where are we going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on, get inside.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where are we going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We’re going to Chuck E. Cheese.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Chuck E. Cheese?  Oh, God, I’m so sick of Chuck E. Cheese.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We’re going to the hospital, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, just sayin’.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, what are you drinking?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I found it under the seat.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God, Dwight, put that down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m thirsty.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Give the bottle to Michael [sprays Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Give the bottle to Michael!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m thirsty!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give it to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight… [to Jim] You just keep your eyes on the road. [to Dwight]  Give me the bottle or you’re fired.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can’t fire me, I don’t work in this van!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give it to me Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. [takes a drink]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me the bottle!!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Michael] Will you stop?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gimme the bottle, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael stop.
