quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [drinks] Mmmmm…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just give it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael stop. [sprays Michael, then Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop, stop it! Stop spraying! [Dwight whines] Gimme the bottle!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop [sprays Michael]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My eyes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop spraying me!  Gimme the bottle!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My eyes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, what is your middle name.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Danger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sigh] Something with a “K”.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s Kurt.  Wow, I am so sad that I know that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do I write under “reason for visit”?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Concussion. [Michael scribbles something out] What did you write?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing.  I wrote “bringing someone to the hospital”.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So you thought they meant your reason for coming to the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No… you know what Jim, this isn’t about me anymore.  I made a miraculous recovery, which is more than I can say for him. [Dwight falls towards Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on Dwight. [sprays Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hi Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ahhh.  Mweehaa

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Doctor, what is more serious, a head injury or a foot injury?

quotes.speaker: Doctor
quotes.text: A head injury.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you don’t have all the information. The foot as been fairly severely burned and healed quickly, very quickly, actually like suspiciously quickly.

quotes.speaker: Doctor
quotes.text: [to Dwight] So, I’m ordering a CAT scan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look since you have the machine up and running, can I just stick my foot, we take a look?

quotes.speaker: Doctor
quotes.text: Well, for a burn, you really just need to look at the outside of the foot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, what kinda machine is that?

quotes.speaker: Doctor
quotes.text: Does the skin look red and swollen?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s what she said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s my joke, damnit Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Lab Tech
quotes.text: Ok, no electronics past this point.  Camera, sound equipment…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s ok, they’re with me.

quotes.speaker: Lab Tech
quotes.text: No metal of any kind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, well, I guess this is where we leave you off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t want to do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, well you should of thought of before you crashed your head on your way to pick me up.  We’ll, see you when you get out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine. Fine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Jim.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, what is going on, is Dwight ok?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh hmm, he should be fine, but, uh, they brought him in for a CAT scan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can’t believe he’s getting a CAT scan.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael went in there with him too.  It’s pretty sweet.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really? Michael went in with him?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But they shouldn’t be much longer now, so we’ll be back soon.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, that’s uh, good news [Pam sees Angela eavesdropping] Uh, yeah, no I’ll let you go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What’s up, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just wanted to let you that Dwight’s gonna be ok.  The doctor said there’s a really simple treatment for a concussion, so he’ll probably even be back at work tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just, uh, thought you’d want to know that.

quotes.speaker: Lab Tech
quotes.text: Ok Mr. Schrute, inhale with me on three.  One, two, uh Sir? [Michael tries to put his leg in the scanner] Stop that. Stop. Stop that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Jim popping Michael’s bubble wrap cast] You should put butter on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, that’s what she said.  See, haven’t lost my sense of humor.  No, no need, it was a non-stick grill.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’ve had a Foreman grill for about six years, I’ve done about 85% of my cooking on it, but I’ve never burnt myself, probably because I don’t use it as a pillow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I always keep a stash of bubble wrap at my house.  Some days, hectic, tiring days, I just like to go home and zone out and click on the tube and pop a few.  Very soothing.  [to the interviewer] Want to try?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, that’s probably not gonna last too long, you should go to a hospital and get a real cast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right, I’m gonna spend the day in the hospital, bujehh.  Bureaucracy and germs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And doctors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, so, no thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pssht.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Constructing a home-made cast?  Genius.  Filled with foresight.  Like in the pioneer times, if you lost a leg, they would then use the bone of the leg for a cane.  They wasted nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, I don’t want to hear… you talk.  Pam, could I have a word with you in my office?  [stumbling] Oh, oh, oh.  Alright.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: My assignment is to make a temporary disabled parking permit for Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ooo! Who made popcorn? [Michael rubbing butter on his foot]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [on speakerphone] Well you know, frankly a lot of us have been saying this for a long time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I’ve been sayin that.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, and I, uh, I think that the very fact that we’re including it in our agenda frankly, is a big step forward.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you know I used to be in HR?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I’m sorry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I used to be in HR.  I was a Hell raiser.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh, ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right? [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh, great.  Why don’t we move on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. Movin’ on.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Great.  Because you that I think the very fact that [Michael mutes the call]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ry-an.  You’re here.  Whatcha got, whatcha got?  Alright, Panic Room, Maverick, Nell, Sommersby, The Accused.  Where’s Little Man Tate?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: They were out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh come on.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: At three different places.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh man.  It’s not a Jodie Foster afternoon without Little Man Tate, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm, I’m telling you the best cure in the world is comfort food.  You know how they say “stuff a cold”?  Well I don’t care you’ve got, the flu, Lyme disease, emphysema, you eat an entire dark meat chicken, you can walk on the moon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look, I feel fine.  As a volunteer sheriff’s deputy I have been trained to notice all the signs of a concussion.  One of them is slurred speech, ok?  Number three, shortness of breath.  There are four things you have to remember.  One:

quotes.speaker: Doctor
quotes.text: We need to get your friend into the CT machine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Into a machine?!  Ok. Uh, that’s bad, will you stay with me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, will you please call my cousin Mose?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’m not calling your weirdo cousin.  Twenty-seven years old, never left the beet farm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh God.  Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guh-od.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, I’ll stand near you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Next to me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Next-ish.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Spanish language telenovela dialogue from the waiting room T.V.]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m gonna pull the car around.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh shh shh shh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you speak Spanish?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Do you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I don’t.

episodes.title: The Secret
episodes.description: Jim fears the secret he told to Michael, in confidence, will be revealed to the staff.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not much what’s up with you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I can not believe I fell for that. [laughing] Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, ah, ah, what? What? Where’s the funny? Give it to me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Umm, is it me or does it smell like up-dog in here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s up-dog?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothin’ much what’s up with you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, oh, wow! I walked right into that. Oh, that’s brilliant!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Stanley, is that jacket make of up-dog?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I’m on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm, what flavour coffee is that? Up-dog?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What’s that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know, nothin’, what’s up with you?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [low] No, damn it!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What does what mean?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The thing you just said?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just forget it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight! Hey is it me or does this place smell like up-dog?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What’s up-dog?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gotcha! [laughing] Oh, God. [low] Crap! Nothin’ how ya doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. How are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [mouthing] So close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [low] Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today is spring cleaning day here at Dunder Mifflin. And yes I know its January. I am not an idiot. But, if you do your Spring cleaning in January; guess what you don’t have to do in the spring?  Anything.  They say a cluttered desk means a cluttered mind.  Well I say that an empty desk means a…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Empty mind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that’s not… no, that’s not what I was going to say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Meredith, men’s room. Make sure you replace the urinal cakes.  They’re worn down. Kevin file drawers. Angela kitchen. Oscar dusting. Where is Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: He’s out sick.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s unacceptable.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I agree it’s unacceptable. [longing look]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whhh… What are you guys doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oscar is out sick.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On a Friday? [Dwight nods]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I do some of the talking?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will do all the talking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, let him know that I’m here.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What difference does it make whether your here?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, Oscar its Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yechh, yeah, um, heard you were under the weather?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah I think I came down with the flu.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? Oh, that is a shame.  You know it’s cleaning day here today? Could have used some of that famous Hispanic cleaning ethic.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, I feel terrible about it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ask him his symptoms. I’m on Web M.D.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are your symptoms?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I have the chills.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Umm, hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I feel nauseous and my heads killing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Checks out.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael is there anything you need from me? I’d like to go back to bed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need you to go back to bed. I need you to get better. See you Monday.  Unless you’re still sick.  So have a great long weekend.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I’ll just be sleep— [Michael hangs up the phone before Oscar can finish]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok. First impressions?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He sounded sick.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Which is exactly how you’d wanna sound like if you wanted someone to think you were sick.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s exactly what I was thinking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question? May I investigate?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Drop what you’re doing. Make this a priority. Because an office can’t function efficiently unless people are at their desks doing their jobs.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I bought my veil.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God! That is so exciting! Can I be a bridesmaid?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ummm…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Listen, you don’t have to answer now. But how are you going to do your hair?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok. I was thinking about wearing it down. Kind of like, I don’t know, like loose with big curls and…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You’d look like an angel. I’m seriously going to cry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wowweee. Mikey likey. Why don’t you wear your hair like that all the time.  It’s much sexier. [Pam puts hair back up] [Michael walks by Jim] Man, this must be torture for you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. On the booze cruise I told Michael about some feelings I used to have for Pam. I had just broken up with Katy and had a couple drinks. And I confided in the world’s worst confidant.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Jim-bag.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Remember that thing I told you on the booze cruise about Pam? That… was… personal so if we can just keep that between you and me. That would be great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Umm, hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who else knows?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nobody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim and I are great friends. We hang out a ton, mostly at work. But, the fact that he told me his secret and no one else knows says everything about our friendship.  And it is why, I intend on keeping that secret for as long as I possibly can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My lips are sealed. [singing] My lips are sealed… Bangles.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. Great. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Can you hear me, they talk about us…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen Temp. I am conducting a little investigation so I’m no longer going to be able to head up spring cleaning.  Do you think you can handle it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, I think I can handle it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you think? Or do you know?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I think.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [low] Oh God, here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, whatcha gettin’?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m going with grape.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, good stuff, good stuff. Did you see the game last night?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which one?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Any of em?  So, uh, what’s the 411? Any news on the “P” situation?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know what you mean.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: P-A-M. P-A

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, uh, ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No it’s okay, we’re talking code.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen Stanley. How long does it take you to pick out a soda?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m going to take off actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, well, cool. [Michael walks by Jim] Still deciding?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael presses a button for Stanley] Peach iced tea. You’re going to hate it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey Oscar how ya doin’? Dwight Schrute calling.  Listen a little question for you, buddy.  I called six minutes ago and no one answered. So I was wondering if you could explain. Oh, I see, so. Sounds like you’re too sick to come into work but your well enough to go to the pharmacy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There are several different ways to tell if a perp is lying. The liar will avoid direct eye contact. The liar will cover part of his or her face with his hands, especially the mouth.  The liar will perspire.  Unfortunately I spoke to Oscar on the phone so none of this is useful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s Grrrrrrape! Soda.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Tony the tiger.  You don’t hear that much any more.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not so much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, what is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, really nothing? Fact: You are drinking grape soda. You never drink grape soda.  Fact: You are talking to Jim. You never talk to Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fact: I love grape soda. I always have. Fact: Jim and I talk all the time. We tell each other secrets.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok. So what is the secret Michael?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, I had asked Michael if I could head up the Oscar investigation and he said that only Dwight was capable of handling such sensitive material.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is that true?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, I don’t know, yeah, yeah, yeah it is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you Michael.  I know your telling the truth.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can tell. I won’t let you down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whooo, nice. That was, that was slick.  What are you doin’ for lunch?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know probably just gonna eat my ham and cheese sandwich in the break room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh nonsense [lifts leg and puts it on Jim’s desk], no way, no. Why don’t, why don’t I take you out to lunch? My treat.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that’s alright, thank you though. It’s, I, gotta do some cleaning, should probably stick around here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey you know what we could do? We could spread out a blanket in the break room.  Have a little picnic order some ‘za. Talk about you know who.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, ah, no but no. You know what let’s go out. That was a good idea.  Let’s go out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know just he place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [at Hooters] Oh man, you should order milk. Get it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why do I like Hooters? Well I will give you two reasons, the boobs and the hot wings.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, here we go, here we go. Bogy at 3 o’clock. Hi.

quotes.speaker: Dana
quotes.text: Hey I’m Dana. Welcome to Hooters.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’re not worthy. We’re not worthy. Hello Dana, I am Michael and this is Jim and we are brothers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope we’re not brothers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m his boss actually.  And I treat him well. I’m taking him out to lunch cause I can afford it and he can have whatever he wants.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I just have the ham and cheese sandwich, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dana
quotes.text: And for you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell me Dana, how is your chicken breast?

quotes.speaker: Dana
quotes.text: Oh, it’s great. It’s served with our world famous wing sauce.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmmm, sounds yummy.  I will have a chicken breast hold the chicken. [Giggles]

quotes.speaker: Dana
quotes.text: Is that what you really want?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’m gonna have the gourmet hot dog.

quotes.speaker: Dana
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who took all the black ones?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s a communal bowl.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, how did Oscar sound when he called in?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sick, like lots of sniffling. I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sniffling how?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Umm. How many different ways are there to sniffle?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Three.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, it was the second one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, good, thank you.  That wasn’t so hard now was it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nuh-uh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you like best about Pam?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, I really don’t want to talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it her boobs, or…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, she’s easy to talk to I guess and she’s got a really good sense of humor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Never get’s any of my jokes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What about you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Her boobs, definitely.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that’s not what I meant.

quotes.speaker: Dana
quotes.text: Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dana
quotes.text: And I understand we have a birthday today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhh happy birthday Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dana
quotes.text: Ready girls? Front side.

quotes.speaker: Hooter’s Girls
quotes.text: You put your front side in; you put your front side out. You put your front side in and shake it all about. You do the hokey pokey and you turn yourself around. That’s what it’s all about. Whoo, hoo!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woo! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks, thanks Dana.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hilarious. Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What did you guys talk about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Holds up Hooters t-shirt] Just you know politics, literature.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I hate you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Quick Oscar update. I have conducted interviews with everyone in the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just go to his house and see if he’s sick. I could have done this Investigation in like twenty minutes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Including prep time?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just do it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: If I had to I could clean out my desk in five seconds and nobody would ever know I had ever been here.  And I’d forget too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael messes up hair to look like Jim’s] Expenses.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael is that a wig?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. It’s… I wear it like that sometimes. Is that a wig?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is from Hooters.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, it’s a business lunch.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Did Toby approve this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No he did not. I don’t need his permission.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You just got your corporate credit card back. Do you really want me to take it away again?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uhhh it’s ridiculous. They took my card away because I spent $80 bucks at a magic shop. What they don’t understand is that I bought the stuff to impress potential clients. So business related, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I put a cigarette through a freakin’ quarter.  And you know what Toby? They almost bought from us.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I’m not processing this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look Jim needed a relaxing lunch, he has been depressed and it has been affecting his productivity.  How is that not work related?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: He seems fine to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re not his friend, you don’t know. He is in love with a girl he works with who’s engaged.  So just cut me some slack. Please?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Phylis
quotes.text: Angela who would you choose Jim or Roy?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It’s nobody’s business, Phyllis. Roy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jim has got it bad for Pam.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh ho!  Which one is Pam?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well she’s the… Hey Michael so do you think Jim will try to break up the wedding?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what Kevin? Jim is a friend of mine, so the only people that this crush really concerns is Jim and Pam… and me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: As a volunteer Sheriff’s Deputy I have been doing surveillance for years.  One time I suspected an ex-girlfriend of mine of cheating on me.  So I tailed her for six straight nights.  Turns out she was, with a couple of guys actually so… mystery solved.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Jim, why didn’t you tell me you had a crush on Pam?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well the cats out of the bag. I used to have a crush on Pam and now I [hesitate] don’t. Riveting.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice… she is so hot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you find anything good in your desk?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, coupon for a free sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Score.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It expired in August, and my cell phone charger from two years ago.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Big day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Big day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey oh, listen, um, I told Michael on the booze cruise. It’s so stupid. Um, I told Michael that I had had a crush on you when you first started here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well I thought that, I figured you should hear it from me rather than, I mean you know Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And seriously, it’s totally not a big deal, ok? And when I found out you were engaged, I mean.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I know, like, I kind of like, I thought that maybe you did when I first started.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh you did?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I mean, just ’cause we like got along so well.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, you saw through me, great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So are you going to be like totally awkward around me now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah, yeah… hope that’s okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm, hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And Pam it was like three years ago so I am totally over it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stay low… This is it… There he is. He’s been gone for at least two hours. Who is that? Come to Papa… Oh yes. Let’s roll. I knew it! You are so busted. Ice skates, shopping bags? I think I know what’s going on here. You weren’t sick at all.

quotes.speaker: Gil
quotes.text: Who’s this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is Dwight Schrute. Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Gil
quotes.text: Gil.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Are you going to tell Michael?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How bout this. I don’t tell Michael and in exchange you owe me one great big giant favor.  Redeemable by me at a time and place of my choosing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Guess what I found out about Oscar tonight? He was lying about being sick. Should I have reported Oscar’s malfeasance. Hmm, probably, but now I know something he doesn’t want me to know. So I can use his malfeasance to establish leverage.  Otherwise, it’s just malfeasance for malfeasanceses-ses sake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know, I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Umm, what happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I, oh, just, um, I know I was trying to, expense reports. And then God, Toby, you know he just… I know. I’m just, I just hope that, I just hope that [starts to get choked up] this doesn’t affect our friendship! Stupid, this is so stupid.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, hey, wow, wow. Listen man it’s, you know what. It’s not a big deal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, I’m fine, no I know, I’m good, I’m good, it’s just.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look its one day, everything’s gonna be alright. No big deal. You good?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah I’m good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Creed did you organize the menu book?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh, I thought that was more on a volunteer basis.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, that was mandatory.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh, I thought it was a volunteer thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, here’s your schedule for next week. Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah I’m fine. Look, about you and Jim.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no, that’s, you don’t have to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I feel it’s my responsibility as your boss slash friend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, really, it’s okay. I know that Jim had, like a crush on me when he first started. But that was a long time ago, so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It wasn’t that long ago. It was on the booze cruise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim had a crush on me on the booze cruise or he told you about it on the booze cruise?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yehhh, okay, shuuttt it Michael. I’m done. That’s it. I’m out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ready?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People are always coming to me. “Michael, I have a secret.  Your the only one I trust.” No thanks, because keeping a secret can only lead to trouble. Like I was watching Cinemax last weekend.  This movie, Portrait of a… Prostitute something. Secrets of a Call… More Secrets of a Call Girl. And the lead character, Shila, is framed for murder. She goes on the run and winds up working at a bordello in Malibu. I don’t, I don’t want to live like that. I like it here. I don’t want to be Shila, I like being Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello. Pammy want a cracker?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No thanks. You got a package.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Pam with the dirty talk. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And he’s lining it up. Seems pretty straightforward from here. If Michael Scott sinks it, he’ll win a Buick signed by Tiger Woods.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He totally misses,

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, he meant to put it right next to the hole, that’s much harder to do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Interception. He shoots, he scores, yeah! Michael, try it like this. This’ll be much harder.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. I don’t want to chip my mug. Please get that off the floor. [sets mug on the edge of Michael’s desk]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Jack Nicholson for birdie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jack Nicholas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s a celebrity tournament.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [golf ball rolls under bookcase] I got it. No problem. [clears throat]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you see it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man, it’s really back there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you feel it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. I can barely…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mug falls off Michel’s desk and smashes on the floor] God… damn it, Dwight! That’s great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Should I clean out my desk?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [pulls a brand new mug out of his desk door] That won’t be necessary.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t be fooled by the phrase “dust bunnies.” They are vicious little bitches and if they get inside your disc drive, God help you. They will bring your computer to its knees. They sit in corners hatching, defecating, laying eggs. And their sole purpose in life is to eat dead skin, which humans in this office shed by the boat load. Especially Creed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look at all them out there, my little worker bees buzzing away.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If they’re the worker bees, you’re the Queen bee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I am the King bee,

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Queen’s higher.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, King is higher. Then Ace. I am the Ace bee.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: People Magazine, crossword puzzle, keep or toss?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep. I will finish that later.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It’s from ’99.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I know when it’s from, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: 18 across. Mary-Kate and Ashley blank.” Michael wrote, “Judd?”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I rushed a few fraternities, but you know what? I don’t believe in paying for friendships. So, I made a decision not to accept any offers. And fortunately none were made. Which was good, so nobody’s feelings got hurt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Temp, shouldn’t you be monitoring the progress of people’s cleaning efforts?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Everything seems pretty much under control.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. Well, I’d hate to see it blow up in your face.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How would…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let’s table that. So, temp… You seem to be pretty close to this Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Not really.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Getting defensive?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You seem a little nervous. You shouldn’t be.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Dana.

quotes.speaker: Dana
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep the change. Here you go buddy, happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, you what, seriously, you should have it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. I have the long sleeve. And actually, you know what we should do? We should wear them tomorrow to work, it’ll be hysterical.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, tomorrow, that’s gonna be tough ’cause I already laid out my outfit, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Tuesday. Whenever. You’d better try it on, make sure it fits.

episodes.title: The Carpet
episodes.description: Michael's office becomes the victim of an odorous prank which subjects the office to his punishment.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [catching Jim looking at him at Pam’s desk] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, nothing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam’s on vacation and she gets back tomorrow, so it’ll be nice to see her.  It’ll be nice, and, uh, she set a date for the wedding with Roy.  Uh… June.  Summer.  So, that’ll be nice.  And that’s that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [again catching Jim looking at him] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, nothing.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Jim’s been looking at me kind of a lot all week.  I would be creeped out by it, but it’s nothing compared to the way Michael looks at me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Spamster!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, Pam plus Spam plus…?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hamster.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome back!  How was your vacation?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you get lucky?  Oh!  Boink!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy and I just got back from the Poconos.  I get ten vacation days a year, and I try to hold off taking them for as long as possible, and this year I got to the third week in January.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am Pam.  Spicoli guy.  Oh, God.  Names, numbers.  Okay. [walking into office] Whoa!  God!  Yuck, yuck.  Yuck.  Yuck!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow!  What happened in there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is stink in there, my God!  What is… what is that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looking at pile on Michel’s carpet] Oh… I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it a bird?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I don’t think it’s a bird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God!  How could that happen?  How could… right in the middle of the carpet.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What’s goin’ on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, somebody vomited right in the middle of the carpet in my office.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [taking a look] I don’t think that’s vomit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check it out.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check it out.  Don’t be a wuss, just get… no, I’m not holding your coffee.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, that’s ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael. [tapping on door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is it?  No, just tell me what it is.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [pounding on door] Michael, I … I … I gotta get outta here.  I can’t hold my breath that long.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Open the door up!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It smelled terrible.

quotes.speaker: Pam and others
quotes.text: [after going in to check out the smell]  Phew.  Oh!  No, mm-mm. [leaving quickly]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I cannot believe a pipe burst and left that in there.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That’s no burst pipe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do you know that?  What is it, then?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hi guys.  Somebody makin’ soup?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as cleaning lady with mask leaves] Here she comes.  All cleaned?  Great. [walks into office]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughing] It’s still stinky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is worse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She probably scrubbed it into the fibers of the carpet.  Total permeation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [while in his reeking office]  I am a big Fear Factor fan.  I’m a big fan of anything Joe Rogan does, actually, so this is sort of like my audition tape.  Um… [clearing throat]   I can’t stand it [gets up to leave], I can’t stay in here another second.  No!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!  Welcome back!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, how was the resort?  Did you ski a lot?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A little.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good!  What’s goin’ on here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?  I did not do that.  That sounds disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [barely stifling laughter] It wasn’t me.  Um… it wasn’t me. [regaining composure] It was not me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [smelling the stink] Oh.  Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [giggles at Roy]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sitting at Jim’s desk]  Hey Jim.  I thought that we would be desk buddies while they changed my carpet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That might be a little difficult with the one computer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… It’s …

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But there’s definitely a desk open in the back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reluctantly] Yeah …

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: …which I guess I’ll be taking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no!  Seriously, I don’t mind sharing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no, seriously, I’ll be in the back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Are you moving back here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, just for the day while Michael’s at my desk.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Because Toby used to sit there, but he had to move over there because of an allergy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Allergy to… the desk?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [shaking head] Weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [putting his feet on desk] Yeah, yeah, yeah.  Old bullpen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [putting his feet on desk] Ha ha ha… the old bullpen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t ape me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The pressures of my office are insane.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [agreeing] Mm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just… you couldn’t understand, but man, you guys have it so easy out here, you know?  I used to sit right here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No way!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And who had your office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ed Truck. [exclaiming is disgust]  Ed Truck was the manager before me.  Horrible.  He hated fun.  It was like, “Oh, Ed Truck is walking toward us.  Stop having fun.  Start pretending to do work.”  What a jerk.  He’s… You know what?  I swore to myself that if I ever got to walk around the room as manager, people would laugh when they saw me coming and would applaud as I walked away.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to Jim] I’m serious.  My closet doors will not shut.  I mean, it only takes so long to measure to make sure that clothes will hang up because aren’t all hangers like that big?  So I don’t understand why the closet engineer didn’t think of that.  So now I’m doing this new thing where I just leave piles of clothes on the floor and then I walk around the piles to get an outfit…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know who used to sit at that desk?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That guy Miles who quit to form his own company?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-mm.  Todd Packer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I thought he was out on the road.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He was, but, uh… that desk was empty.  He’d come in and sit there sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was in training, many years ago… not so long ago… I worked side-by-side with a fellow named Todd Packer, and together we rocked the office [picture behind Michael falls].  Packer and I once spent the whole day with our pants off, and when people noticed, we convinced them that they were crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will gladly pay you Tuesday for a hamburger today.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [on phone] Excuse me one second, please. [to Michael] What is it that you need right now that you can’t wait until I’m off the phone with a customer?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, a customer, well, sound the alarm. [laughs] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Another time, Packer held this guy’s head in the toilet for like a minute.  Guy had no sense of humor about it.  Probably why he wasn’t hired.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [after Michael punches him in the arm] What did you hit me for?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Charley horse!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Charley horse!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You shouldn’t have hit me, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay.  Gah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Once, as a joke, Packer banged every chick in the office. [giggles]  It was hysterical.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to Jim] Beyonce, pink the color, Pink the person, hot dogs, basically anything that is awesome. Snow cones…

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey Jim, Michael wanted me to ask you how to raise your desk chair.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s the lever on the side.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That’s what I told him.  Thanks. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, he is so cute!  Would you talk to him for me and see if he likes me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I don’t think I can…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, please Jim?  Please, please, Jim.  Please, please, please?  He’s so cute.  I like him so much.  And I would do it, but I’m too shy.  Please, Jim, please, please, please, please, Jim. Please, please, please…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispering] Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s send up Accounting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Old fashioned raid.  Sales on Accounting.  Yeah.  Follow my lead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahem.  What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael and Dwight
quotes.text: [as they throw accountants’ files and supplies around] Ahhhh!  Whoo hoo!  Come on, come on, come on, come on!  Sales rules!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah! [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! Oh ho ho [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Should we help ’em pick up their stuff?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no.  We don’t do that.  We don’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Watch out, Pam. You’re next!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re gonna throw my things on the ground?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What happened in Michael’s office was wrong.  I understand it [chuckles], it makes sense [regains composure]  But it… it was still wrong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why would somebody ruin a perfectly good carpet?  I don’t know.  It could be done out of hate.  It could be done out of love.  It could be completely neutral.  Maybe somebody hates the cleaning lady.  And, well, she doesn’t do a very good job, obviously, because my office still reeks like you would not believe.  I hate her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  I am beginning to think that what happened to my carpet was an act of terrorism against the office.  The only thing that makes any sense.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello, am I the 107th caller? [hangs up, dials again] Hello, Rock 107.  Am I the 107th caller? [hangs up and dials again] Hell , Rock 107.  Am I the 107th caller? [hangs up and begins to dial again] I’m totally gonna win us that box set.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jethro Tull…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it. [Dwight hangs up] Stop.  It.  [Dwight beings to dial] Don’t.  Don’t.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need to make a sales call.  Please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone, whispering] Am I the 107th caller?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Roy in Jim’s earshot] …back so soon.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: We can go back in, like, a couple of weeks maybe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, right.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Okay, maybe another month, like, maybe for, like President’s Day or something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, that’s right.  We could do a three-day weekend.  I wonder if I could, like, call in sick on the Friday.  Then I get a four-day weekend.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to unseen co-worker] But it’s so weird to fall asleep.  And I just hate it.  ‘Cause I try to go to bed at, like, 9:30.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Roy as Jim escapes into bathroom] Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, guys.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We haven’t finished getting things in order from your last visit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m just walking around.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Were you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It’s just that we’re really swamped over here, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, and I’m not?  Why would you say that? Because I’m having fun?  You guys just are workin’ for the weekend, aren’t you?  I’m workin’ for the week.  Sales team, listen to me.  This is what we’re gonna do.  I’m gonna up the ante a little bit literally.  Right here, I’m gonna put a crisp one hundred dollar bill.  The person with the most sales at the end of the day gets to keep the cash.  Sound good?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [counting cash] Seventy, eighty, one, two three.  Eighty-three dollars.  Still a lotta money and I’m going to … [moves money after seeing workmen walk by] … I’m gonna leave it right over here where everybody can see it.  I will be taking Jim’s clients today because he is not here and out of sight, out of the contest.  Let’s see who winds up with the cash, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You’re gonna compete against us?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, it is on, Phyllis, it is so on!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is so on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God, this is gonna be fun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael is gonna wipe the floor with us!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] So you have 40 boxes going out, and I will deliver those personally in a Sebring.  Very good, nice doing business with you.  Thank you. [hangs up] Yes! [chuckles] Oh, yeah!  Read it and weep.  Oh!  Oh, look at that! [puts post-it on Phyllis’ forehead]  Look at me, Phyllis!  Oh, what is that?  That’s my sale! [humming then dancing victoriously]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [walking by with new carpet] What… What’s that?  Whatcha doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [stops dance] Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [laughing] I think he’s dancing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  Just …

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That was definitely not dancing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, guys?  It’s none of your concern.  It was official business, so just…

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Paper business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, paper business.  Is this done?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Extreme Home Makeover puts together a house in an hour.  If you were on that crew, you would be fired like that. [snaps]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Somebody did something bad to Michael’s carpet. Maybe that’s all we need to know.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [to Oscar] Who do you think did it?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Are you kidding?  I thought it was you.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Really?  I thought you. [both laugh in Michael’s earshot]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This was no act of God.  A person did this.  A person who works in this office.  Maybe all of them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what?  Today is not a good day for a sales contest.  We’re… we’re not… we’re not doin’ this today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That doesn’t seem fair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You wanna talk about fair?  Does anyone need to smell my old carpet?  You explain to me how that was fair, and I’ll explain to you how this is fair.  Plus I just… I think that picking today was sort of taking advantage.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But you’re the one who picked today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am a victim of a hate crime.  Stanley knows what I’m talkin’ about.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That’s not what a hate crime is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well I hated it!  A lot!  Okay, I… you know what?  If the guilty person would just come forward and take their punishment, we’d be done . [no one comes forward]  Very well.  Then you are all punished.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What’s our punishment?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re all on a time out.  Just sit there quietly. [phone rings, Phyllis reaches to answer]  No.  NO!  [phone continues to ring]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing much.  Let me ask you something.  It’s actually little awkward.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do you think of Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don’t know.  Depends if you like a little junk in … [notices camera] Umm… She’s really cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you interested in her?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, totally.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Did she say something?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She said lots of things.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you know if she’s looking for a long-term thing or if she’d be cool just hangin’ out?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Can you find out?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.  Sure.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to Jim] Oh, long-term, definitely.  Fall in love, have babies, spend every second together… but don’t tell him that, okay?  Just tell him I’m, like, up for anything.  I mean, I’m not a slut, but who knows?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you remember Ed Truck?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Sure.  He hired me.  How’s he doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How would I know?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I thought you might.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My biggest fear is turning into him.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Michael, you should have much bigger fears than that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs]  I wasn’t talking literally, Creed.  Yeah, being buried alive would be worse. Happy?  Why am I talking to you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [meeting Ed Truck in parking lot] Ed?  Hi.  Thanks for meeting me.  Must be kinda neat comin’ back.

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.text: Yeah.  Should we go upstairs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, well, honestly Ed, I really don’t wanna be up there right now.

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.text: So, what’s the problem with my pension?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no.  You’re good.  It was clerical.  You’re good.  Um, well, somebody did something in my office, and I now think that they did it on purpose and it was directed at me.

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.text: Well, what was done?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t get a good look at… it, but it smells horrible.

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.text: Yeah, somebody once did that in my office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that figures.  So how did you deal with people not liking you?

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.text: You can’t expect to be friends with everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well… s-sure I can.

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.text: No.  They’ll always think of you as a boss first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not necessarily.  You can love a boss like you do a father.

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.text: I’m not sure that ever happens.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, okay.  Different management styles.

quotes.speaker: Ed
quotes.text: Why can’t your workers be your workers, family be your family, your friends be your friends?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Last week I would have given a kidney to anyone in this office.  I would have reached right into my stomach and pulled it out for them.  But now, no.  I don’t have the relationship with these people that I thought I did.  I hope they ask, so they can hear me say, “Uh… no. I only give my organs to my real friends.  Go get yourself a monkey kidney.”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, Brenda.  This is, uh, Jim Halpert from the boat.  And I got your number from the corporate directory and, well, I was assuming that you probably gave it to them because you wanted me to ask you out, right?  Um, so gimme a call back.  You can get my number from said directory, um, or just check your e-mail ’cause I just sent you one.  Yikes.  Uh… give me a call back, I hope.  I’ll talk to you later. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You just asked a girl out on the phone!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Hello, yes. I’m looking for a gay nerd named Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who is this?  How did you get this number?

quotes.speaker: Packer
quotes.text: Your mom, you gay nerd!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God.  Packer.  Packster.  Whacky Pack.  How you doin’?

quotes.speaker: Todd
quotes.text: Hey, did you get that package I left for you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh… no.  Did anybody see a package here today?  No.  How big was it?

quotes.speaker: Packer
quotes.text: It was pretty big.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Packer
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you see a big package?  Where did you leave it?

quotes.speaker: Packer
quotes.text: Left it in the middle of your office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? Guys, did you see a big package in my office?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You mean the thing?

quotes.speaker: Packer
quotes.text: [laughs uproariously]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?  Oh!

quotes.speaker: Packer
quotes.text: Special delivery!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was Packer!  Oh, you’re… you are dead.  You are dead, my friend!  That is hilar… Oh, God!  Of course it was you.

quotes.speaker: Packer
quotes.text: Sit on the throne, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.  [laughs and claps] Yeah, yeah!  Oh my God.  It was Packer!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It takes an advanced sense of humor.  I don’t expect everybody to understand.  It was done out of love, just like I thought.  It’s ah… God, these people are so… these are good people.  We have fun. [giggles] We just have fun!  Oh, I’m just so sorry that I threw the thing out.

quotes.speaker: Jim’s voicemail
quotes.text: You have seven unheard messages.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, Jim.  It’s Pam.  I keep looking up to say something to you and then Michael’s there and it’s horrible.  Anyway, I’m bored.  Come back!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, guess what?  I moved my computer so I can’t see Michael’s head.  It’s working.  I think I can have a career as a very specific type of decorator.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim]  Sudoku. Level moderate. 18 minutes. Suck on that, Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] I’ll transfer you.  Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.  Hold, please.  Dunder Mifflin, this is … okay, sorry.  Michael was standing at my desk, and I needed to be busy or who knows what would’ve happened, so thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, what’s that word we made up when you have a thing stuck in your shoe?  Anyway, I have a thing stuck in my shoe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, I have a chance to sneak out of here early, and I’m not messing this up, so I’ll see you tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Calling from my cell phone.  I don’t know if you guys figured out who did that to Michael’s carpet yet, but I have a theory that involves an inter-departmental conspiracy.  Everybody in the office.  We need to talk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think this whole disaster on Michael’s carpet happened for a good reason. Him sitting next to me is a huge gift. This girl I know would say that it was a gift from God, but I don’t know about all that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Obviously, this was Kevin. This is his sense of humor exactly.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: There are so many people with motives, even me. Almost everyone is a suspect. Whoever did this is a genius. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That looks, cool, where is that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That hotel, it looks so romantic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, just somewhere in the Poconos. I was just surfing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I went with my parents to the Shadowbrook Farm once. That was also really romantic. Oh, my God, I wish a boy would take me there. I would need a fun new top. You know what a great color is on me? Lavender, actually.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just give me one second. I’m just gonna grab something to eat.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, you used to share that cubicle with Kelly, right?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And then you just changed desks, right?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: To one without a cubicle.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, you just couldn’t take it anymore, huh?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, that’s how it’s gonna be.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Honestly, I don’t even hear her anymore. It’s like waves crashing against the beach.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Okay, that quantity of cotton fiber will cost you… my screen disappeared. I know. I will click on the bottom and… Yes. I’m getting one of those little hourglass things. Used to have a price chart on the wall, now it’s a little hourglass thing with an arrow next to it. Now it’s just an hourglass thing. Uh-huh, yeah, well, or I can call you back. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Excellent, good, good. Well, our truck is going out first thing tomorrow morning. So…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: …cases of typical format and coated white paper. Okay, thanks again so much. All right, bye-bye.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: 20 cartons of it’s coming, on it’s way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s going on? Anything here?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yes. What yes? A sale or a lead or…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: A sale.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah. Small?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Big.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Huge?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Just big.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you say the sale that I made earlier was huge or…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Big.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Good. No, I completely understand, times are a little tight right now. If it’s alright with you though, I will just give you a call back next month. Great, thank you so much. Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You call that a sales call? My God, what have they been teaching you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re the one who trained me, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, did I teach you to roll over like a submissive dog?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You most certainly did not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I did not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What can I do better?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly, ask me, which you did, so, tell a joke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m not good at jokes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you know a joke?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My cousin Mose told me a joke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Call a client right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And tell him the joke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Strike while the iron’s hot. A joke always works.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Yes, Howard Gruber, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just sell it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Howard, hello. Dwight Schrute. Dunder Mifflin. Yes, and you are my favorite client. Listen, I’m calling you to tell you a little joke. What is black and white and red and can’t think? A nun who has a beet for a head. … No, I’m Catholic, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] I understand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] If I was offensive in any way, I…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell him. Tell him that your supervisor is on the line.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Humor works in…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The old one two. Let’s do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] …crazy ways. I’m going to pass you off to my supervisor. Hold on one second. [whispering] Howard Gruber. It’s Howard Gruber.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Hey Howard. Michael Scott here. Yeah, sorry about that. Dwight is an idiot. I know. No, he’s a little… Little dim. He’s the janitor’s brother, so…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s not true.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Uh-huh? Yeah. Well, you know, like in a fast food restaurant, just to be nice they hire somebody who can’t even find their way to work? That is Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] He’s my best customer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] What can we do to help you out? You know what? I have a discount. Today and today only, on lightweight copier paper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But that’s my sale. This is my sale, Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Uh-huh, yes, I can do that. Absolutely! Perfect. Oh, I’m glad it timed out that way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What Michael doesn’t understand is that when I worked in the fast food industry I was actually commended by management for the three “M”s. McService, McCompetence and McPunctuality.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [laughing] You gotta drink on that one. Too bad.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hell yeah, yeah, yeah. Mo’fo, mo’fo.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You ready?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm. [thumping] [Roy groaning] Now you’ve got to drink.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, look, I know what you’re gonna say. That I’m not standing up for myself. But you know what? It’s complicated and I really don’t appreciate all the badgering.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You could out-sell Michael any day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I really thought these people were my friends. My best friend since kindergarten, Elliot, that’s a friend. Best friend ever. I should call him. Wonder where he lives.

episodes.title: Boys and Girls
episodes.description: Jan comes into the Scranton Branch to give all the female employees a group seminar on women in the workplace. Upset that he is not allowed in on the proceedings, Michael takes all the men of Dunder Mifflin down into the warehouse for some "guy time" with the warehouse workers. Pam is offered a chance to pursue her dreams of drawing and Roy confronts Jim about his feelings for Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So, I’m happy to be here.  It’s very nice to see all of you. You’re all looking well.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Today’s a ‘women in the workplace’ thing. Jan’s coming in from Corporate to talk to all the women about… um… I don’t really know what. But Michael’s not allowed in. She said that about five times.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Women today, though we have the same options as men, we often face a very different set of obstacles in getting there. So…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knocks] Hey, what’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael… I thought we agreed you wouldn’t be here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah… I… You know what… I… I… I just thought about it. I just have a few things I want to say.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hold… Just hear me out. What is more important than Quality? E-Quality. Now studies show that today’s woman, the Ally McBeal woman, as I call her, is at a crossroads…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, just uh… you have come a long way, baby.  But I just… just want to keep it within reason.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They did this up in Albany…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You are not allowed in this session.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And they ended up turning the break room into a lactation room which is disgusting so…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Now you’re really not allowed in this session.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I’m their boss, so I feel like…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m your boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [stands up] Anybody want any coffee or…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We’re fine, Michael. We just need you to leave, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Women in the workplace… yeah, translation “I have been banned from my own conference room so that Jan can talk in secret to all the girls.” Oh! Sorry. ‘Women of the workplace.’ About what? I don’t know. Clothes. Me. Eeegkh!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ladies, I am so, so sorry. Can we start again? We were on such a roll. I… I… really apologize.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yes, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael’s still at the door.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [in the background] So one obstacle is how assertiveness is perceived differently in men and women. Men who are assertive will be admired. They’re called… anyone?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s a terrible idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Them in there all together. If they stay in there too long they’re going to get on the same cycle. Wreak havoc on our plumbing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everyone. Guys. Circle up, please. Come on over. Bring your chairs. Toby, come on over. You’re a guy… too… sort of. Let’s do this!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the background] Well, first of all, I, uh, just want to warm up a little bit. Let’s just clap.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s just clap. Ready? [clapping] Yeah! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s what I’m talking about!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I don’t know what you’re doing here, Michael,

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just having a little ‘guys in the workplace’ thing.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: … but it’s very destructive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why can’t boys play with dolls? Why does society force us to use urinals when sitting down is far more comfortable?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Can you please do this somewhere else, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have nowhere else Jan. This…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We could do it in the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Dwight, excellent idea. Go to the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, OK, Fine. Yeah, actually, perfect. Perfect. You know what? There’s another side to this place, gentleman. And I know we all love our cushy jobs and our fun, exciting office. But do you realize that underneath us, there’s another world. The warehouse world. A world that is teeming with sweat and dirt and life. Life. The bowels of the office. These guys are down there, they are real men doing real man’s work. We are going to learn how a warehouse works.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I think it’s going to work out great. Because managing the warehouse is a very important part of my job. And I haven’t been there in months.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Remember on Lost when they met the Others?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m so sorry about that… um… so where were we? Pam, are you okay taking notes then?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Please? Thank you. very much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So let’s meet the warehouse! Let’s get some shots. Pan around there. This is Darryl, one of our warehouse staff. Darryl, what is your biggest fear?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: My biggest fear is that someone will distract us from getting all the shipments out on time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, Darryl is actually the Foreman here and not Roy, which is cool. There’s Roy riding the big rig. So Roy is actually going to be marrying Pam sometime this summer. And… uh, she’s our receptionist. Sort of a Brangelina thing.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Brangelina is the Brad Pitt and Angelina… Roy…

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I don’t understand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Roy and Pam. It’s a Ram. It’s a Ram thing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [talking to Jim] I bet Roy heard about you liking Pam. I bet he’ll try to beat you up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks for the head’s up, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I’ve got your back if he does. But try to stay out of it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [points at math equasion on chalkboard] Uhhuhhuh. Just in case there’s someone down here who shouldn’t be. A little “Good Will Hunting” situation. All right. Troops. This is an important day. Big day. Now you may look around and see two groups here. White collar. Blue collar. But I don’t see it that way. And you know why not? Because I am collar-blind.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Why don’t we go around the table and all say something that we know we’re good at. I will start. I am good at public speaking.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hi. I’m Meredith and I’m an alch… good at supplier relations.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Great. Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’m good at computer stuff, emails, spreadsheets, all that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [disbelieving] Really?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don’t know. I thought that I wasn’t going to be asked that…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No. Okay. Stop. Go on…

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’ve seen some of your spreadsheets.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Really? I thought they were pretty…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t know how I fit in with these women. Here. Or with Jan. Um… I mean we get along great. Fine. Um… I guess the person I have the most in common with is…

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Jim… Halpert. Hey uh, I, uh, you know heard there’s a rumor going around about you used to have a crush on Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, no, no. No.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No, it’s cool, because I know you’re a good guy. And I know that that crush ended a long time ago, so… you know. We’re cool, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Nope. Yeah. Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You know, it’s great with me cause that way, glad she has a friend at work she can get through the day with. She’s not all bap bap bap bap when she gets home.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. I like talking to her too.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: So, we’re cool, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
