quotes.text: Yep. Cool, man.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Sweet.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [blows a sigh of relief]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, Mike, look. How bout we go upstairs, too. You know learn how the office works. We can all switch places today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… well… okay… yeah, you know what? I don’t think… You.. You’re… My job sucks compared to this. I don’t think you’d like it up there.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: The experience…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys! Want to start unloading the truck?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Let’s go. Step up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check this out! Look at that! Look at that [squeezes blow-up doll] bwup-bwa! [talks in girly voice] Hello! How are… [regular voice] Oh! Kay. That is great. That is good stuff.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: In five years, I’d like to be… five years sober.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: That is an excellent goal.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Four and a half.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I’ll tell you one thing. I am not going to be one of those women schlepping her kids around in a minivan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Great! Uh-huh?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I want an SUV… with three rows of seats.

quotes.speaker: Women
quotes.text: [general murmuring of agreement]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I’ll be honest. One of the goals of these women seminars is to feel out if there’s any standouts. Women who could be a valuable addition to our Corporate life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael wants us to bond so we need topics for conversation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ponies.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How about rainbows?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Flowers.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It’s dangerous, Michael. Come on, get off this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you’re going to, going to hurt yourself.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stand clear.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike. Get off of the lift. Please. Come on now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m fine, I’m fine. I’m fine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Look, would ya… look.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, oh, oh!  We’ll get somebody to clean that up.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We’re the ones that got to clean that up!

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Dammit, Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We ought to have this thing serviced.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So! Guy’s gripe session. Here we are. Now, we definitely live in different worlds but we have a lot in common. We even like the same girls, some of us. That’s going to happen, you know. We’re guys, so…

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: Hey, do you want me to go?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, why? Why would I… ? You could…

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: I’ll go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stay or…

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: …and a big walk-in closet.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh, that’s part of my dream too.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, me too.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Great, great. And Pam, what about you? What is your dream?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well… I always dreamed of a house with a terrace upstairs. Plant flowers on it… stuff like that. Since I was a girl. Um… More seriously though, a husband that I love… Roy. And I love to draw. And I… I did a little in college and I’d still love to do something where I could work with art or graphic design in some way.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: She’s real good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know the company is offering a design training program in New York.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well… I have a job right now, so I can’t really take time off…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, it’s only on weekends and then a few weeks in New York, but I’m sure that I could ask Corporate to help you out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well… it’s just that the weekends aren’t good because, um…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: There are always a million reasons not to do something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s start with the Warehouse. What bothers you as guys, you know?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: My priority is safety.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So it really bothers me when somebody comes in here speeding around on a lift, playing with it like a toy. It kind of gets under my skin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, Yeah. Yeah. Yeah shhh…

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Uh uh uh. Don’t shush me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I… That was just…

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That bothers me too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was breathing.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Pam shushes me. It drives me crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I hate shushing. You know, that’s the thing! What the… ok… what is our beef as human men.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: You know that’s a good question, Hasselhoff. What bugs us?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Alright. Good. Guys ragging on each other. That’s what guys do… and we love it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: All right. Let’s talk about clothing.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’m excited about today. [whispers] I love girl talk.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Dress for the job you want, not the job you have. All right. You can use your clothing to send a message about your ambitions by wearing clothes that reflect what you aspire to be.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m not gaining anything from this seminar. I’m a professional woman. The head of accounting. I’m in the healthiest relationship of my life. I just think it’s insulting that Jan thinks we need this. And, apparently, judging from her outfit, Jan aspires to be a whore.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I hate it when girls insist on taking them out to new restaurants every weekend night and then they’re like “When are we going to go on a date-date?”

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: I hate that too! [general clapping and agreement]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I hate that too.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That sucks so much.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: It totally sucks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah and then they make you drive them to Church the next morning. Like “Gas ain’t free!”

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Yeah, on our salaries, man, what do they expect? You know to take us out every weekend? You know what I mean? We’re not millionaires.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I feel you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, you don’t. You don’t feel us. How can you? You know what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not literally.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You say we’re the same, but we get compensated very differently.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We work the same hours as you and you just said we work a lot harder

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, you do. So…

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: But we get paid a lot less.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Word.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Like next to no benefits.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. God! What is that?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It blows. It blows, man. Gah…

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You know this would not happen if we had a union.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: That’s what I’m talking about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Whoa, whoa. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That’s what we need.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: You know you’re right.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Man, see… That’s what I’ve been sayin’, man. We need to do this finally.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Is that necessary? Because you already sorta have a union… of guys.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It’s more than necessary, Mike. We need this. Roy? You still have that card from the Dockworker’s Union?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: In my truck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dockworker’s?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Man, hook you up.

quotes.speaker: Men
quotes.text: [generalized clapping]

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Come on, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. You know what? I think the problem is the chicks.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Union! Union, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The problem is the chicks. And you gotta blame them.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Are you with us Mike?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah-es.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Welcome to the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Group chant
quotes.text: Michael, Michael, Michael, Mi…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Another issue is inequality of pay between men and women. I’m sure that all of you have felt that before…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knocks] This is important. Ladies, take a breather. Jan, I uh wanna… Can I help you? Um… I wanted to say that the guys downstairs are thinking about forming a union. And they have some good points…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What? A union! What…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t get hysterical.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m not…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Part of my job is knowing how to talk to women.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s… be… rational… here. What are the pros? What are the cons?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: The cons are that everyone will lose their job. Michael. Everyone. Office, Warehouse. What do you think… the… pros… are… here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t talk to me that way please. Just… they’re going to want to hear this from you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You got yourself into this Michael, so you get yourself out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But we’re bonding down there!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: That’s too bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I mean I just don’t want to have to tell them something they’re not going to want to hear.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I don’t want to…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Come on Jan. After all we’ve been through…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael! Michael! Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have a history…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …between us.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Don’t say another word.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I won’t

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Get yourself down stairs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m just saying we have something… Ok. Whatever.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know what… we could get this done a lot quicker if we formed a type of assembly line.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This here is a run-out-the-clock situation. Just like upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Sports metaphors are one of the ways women feel left out of the language of the office. Now, I know this might sound silly but a … many women ask to go over it. So… Fumble means…

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mistake.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Slip.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Right. Par for the course is a golf term. It means right on track. Below par means worse. Wait… that should mean better, that doesn’t make sense.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What about second base? Like if Michael said that he got to second base with you? Does that mean you like closed a deal?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I mean that’s a baseball term, right?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I don’t know what Michael was talking about. I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [in the background] …and you went to Chili’s and he got to second base with you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [in the background] Kelly, I don’t know what Michael’s talking about.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [in the background] He told everybody so I just want to know is that a baseball term…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How’s it going down there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s a complete… well, actually it’s exactly what you’d expect, so… How are the girls?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good. We watched a video about our changing bodies.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Almost.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um… but hey? Something kind of cool. There’s this internship in graphic design that Jan was telling us about. She made it sound, like, really great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice. Well, what’s it all about?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you should do it. That’s great!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s really cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cold front coming into the Warehouse. Uh oh! Better put on your ski boots! Woohoohoowoo. Waaaah! Happy New Year, Darryl! Hey,Darryl. You ever done this?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Are you married?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m divorced.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That must have been hard.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It was. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You were probably feeling really depressed and sad and that’s why you did that thing with Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I think you should all spend a little more time thinking about your careers and less time on personal stuff.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mmmm, I think we’re all okay with the balance we’ve struck.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: At least you don’t have kids. You have no kids, right? Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay. Let’s take five. I think we can all use five.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: How can someone so beautiful be so sad?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Did you take care of the situation?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yuh, yuh, yes! I… I have essentially…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have essentially. Yes. I’ve taken some…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Excuse me. I’ve been told there’s been some interest in forming a Union and that Michael supported it. Obviously he’s not a friend of yours because he didn’t tell you the facts. So let me. If there is even a whiff of unionizing in this branch, I can guarantee you the branch will be shut down like that [snaps her fingers]. They unionized in Pittsfield and we all know what happened in Pittsfield. It will cost each of you a fortune in legal fees and union dues and that will be nothing compared to the cost of losing your jobs. So I would think long and hard before sacrificing your savings and your futures just to send a message. If you have any further questions you can direct them to… to Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dreams are just that. They’re dreams. They help get you through the day. Like the thing about the terrace. It’s nice but… um… I don’t know. It was just something I read in this book when I was twelve. The girl in the book has a terrace outside of her bedroom and she planted flowers on it and I just loved that. Just always kind of stuck with me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So you’re not doing it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How did you know?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why not?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just like no big reason. Just a bunch of little reasons.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy’s right. There’s no guarantee it’s going to lead to anything anyway.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Roy said that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? You have something you want to say?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You got to take a chance on something sometime, Pam. I mean, do you want to be a receptionist here, always?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, excuse me! I’m fine with my choices!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You are?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s impractical. I’m not going to try to get a house like that. Um… they don’t even make houses like that in Scranton. So, I’m never going to… .

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m just going to put this over there.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This is not a good idea right here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You did uh… okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pizza. Great equalizer. Rich people love pizza.  Poor people love pizza.  White people love pizza.  Black people love pizza.  Do black people like pizza?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Um… look guys, I’m sorry. Sometimes Jan can be such a bitch.

quotes.speaker: All the Men
quotes.text: Generalized mumbling agreement. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, watch it, watch it. We have a relationship.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you to our hosts.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey Michael. This ain’t over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahhh! Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it good to be back. Yeah. I mean I love the guy stuff but to run an office you need men and women. You know why? Because you need to have that crazy sexual tension to keep things interesting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam. Uh… hold, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! I don’t know, Pam. I paid $400 for this phone because I liked the ring.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You did?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And now, I realize that you can program or download any ring you want. So, I’m a little overwhelmed.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s a lot of choices. You got to help me here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Which one of these is coolest? What do you think? [classical piano playing] [violin playing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about that one?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. [blues piano playing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, that one was good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dude, are you kidding me? No. That one says, “I am so lame.” Know which one I want? There’s one that sounds like a jackhammer. Just really grabs your attention. It’s like… [imitating jackhammer] You know what I’m talking about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you mean vibrate?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Bushmaster’s hard to beat for long distance. It’s a great point.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. I got a spudgun in my car.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. Shoot a chuck of potato at your face, 80 PSI, bon appetit!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you guys talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight and Roy
quotes.text: [at the same time] Guns.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: How’s that union stuff coming?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Working on it.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Guys! Check it out! Spudgun! Woohoo! Bon appetit! [Darryl’s office window shatters] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That’s my office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There was this film that I saw when I was little. It was about a kid who goes on the most incredible adventure. And even though it was really great, and she had a great time, she ends up back home in Kansas and says, “There’s no place like home.” And that’s how I feel right now. There is no place like home. What the hell was that movie called? [sighs] It’s gonna drive me crazy.

episodes.title: Valentine’s Day
episodes.description: When Michael visits Dunder Mifflin corporate headquarters in New York on Valentine's Day, he and Jan are both in for a surprise. Meanwhile, back in Scranton, the office staff celebrates Valentine's Day grade school style.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I really like Valentine’s Day in this office. It’s kinda like grade school. Everybody gives out little presents and stuff. Like last year, Jim gave me this card, with Dwight’s head on it, it was horrifying and funny and…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Delivery man enters with a bouquet of red roses. Pam stands up to look at card.] Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Delivery man
quotes.text: Would you sign here? [Phyllis gets up from desk and walks over.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy and I are saving for the wedding, so I made him promise not to get me anything too big.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: “Happy Valentine’s Day darling. Love Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration.”

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Isn’t he sweet?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah. Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright Dwight, as you know I am heading to New York today. [Dwight holds up passport.] Doing a presentation on the branch to the new CFO.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you want me to come with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope. The opposite of that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will stay here and run things on this end.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question. Will you be seeing Jan when you’re in New York?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I probably will, why do you ask?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well… It’s Valentine’s Day, and you guys, you know…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Screwed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is your problem?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is a business trip. I would have to be a raving lunatic to try to talk to Jan about what happened between us. Her words, not mine. She sent me an email this morning. But, it is Valentine’s Day. It’s New York. City of Love.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Pam. You heart N.Y., right? You want me to pick you up anything?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The best present would be, you do a good job in front of the new CFO.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dude, I’m gonna nail it. Me in New York? Oh, I own that city. Fuggedaboudit! See ya!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well here we go. On our way to New York. New York, New York. City so nice they named it twice. Manhattan is the other name.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So I broke up with Katy and haven’t been dating anybody else, so this year I don’t have to worry about Valentine’s Day. It’s gonna be good. I invited a couple of friends over. We’re gonna play some cards and I’ll end up winning a lotta money. Because, they’re idiots. It’s gonna be great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What’s this? What is this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I dunno, it’s on your desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, but who put it here? And for what purpose?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was there when I sat down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [opens box and reads card] Happy Valentine’s Day. [pulls out bobble head] It’s me. I’m the bobble head. Yes! [Angela smirks in background] Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The meeting isn’t ’til three, but I always like to come to New York little bit early and hit some of my favorite hunts, like right here, is my favorite New York pizza joint. And I’m gonna go get me a New York slice. [Michael walks toward Sbarro.]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Kelly. What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Nothing. Oh except, oh my God Jim. Last night, Ryan and I totally, finally hooked up. It was awesome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OH, that’s great. I’m really happy for [starts to walk away]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And it was so funny ’cause we were at this bar with his friends and I was sitting next to him the whole night and he wasn’t making a move, so in my head I was like “Ryan, what’s taking you so long?” And then he kissed me. And I didn’t know what to say.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So I said, “Ryan, what took you so long?” And I just said that to him, can you believe that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, Jim, is that embarrassing? I’m embarrassed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, don’t be.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, thank God, because I was nervous, Jim, you will not believe.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I bet.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So nervous, but now — now I have a boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. [Kelly squeals]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [anguished] I hooked up with her on February 13th.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here it is, heart of New York City, Times Square. Named for the good times you have when you’re in it. Most people when they come to New York, they go straight to the Empire State Building, that’s pretty touristy. I come here. Great places to eat. [points] We have Bubba Gump Shrimp, Red Lobster down there. Ya know. This is, this is the heart of civilization, right here.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Woah. [Delivery man with flowers]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Guess what?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Really, Oh, they’re from Bob again.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s great. [Meredith scowls]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody takes the subway in New York. It’s fast, it’s efficient, gets you there on time. It’s a way to [turns and rushes back up stairs] Okay, there’s a guy pooping in a cardboard box down there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is the world famous Rockefeller Center. Founded, of course by Theodore Rockefeller. This is a skating rink and I think the Rangers practice there sometimes and it’s, that’s Tina Fey [points]. That’s Tina Fey from Saturday Night Live. Hello? Hello, hi? [walks over] OH, I’m sorry, I thought you were [Conan O’Brien walks in front of Michael], OK, I thought that was. She, she looked a lot like Tina Fey. [to camera] Hello, hello, I thought that was Tina Fey, but it wasn’t. So… Are you serious? He was here? When, when I was talking to the fake Tina Fey? Come on! And are you, argh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello Angela. Did you hear, somebody rocked the house and got me the best present I’ve ever gotten.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Really? I wouldn’t know anything about that, but I’m glad you enjoyed it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh I did. I did.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I didn’t get anything for Valentine’s Day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I bet you will before the day is over.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Really? Well, I hope I do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would love to live in New York someday. It’s a big dream of mine. Work for corporate, with Jan. It’d be awesome. Go to Broadway shows, eat hot dogs. Scranton is great, but New York, is like Scranton on acid, no on speed, no on steroids. [Michael sees it’s the end of a street.] OK, umm, I think, that’s either the Hudson or the East, so we’re back,  should be back this way. There’s a lotta pressure on me right now. It’s like Michael Jordan, in the NBA finals. Or, like Stormin’ Norman Schwarzkopf, and this presentation is desert storm and as soon as it’s over, we will not have to deal with those Iraqis anymore. Let’s do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Nah that’s alright. Spend money on her, instead of giving it to us. That’s fine. No, I didn’t even have a seat for you anyway. Yeah, hahaha, alright man, have a good night. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Woah, woah [Delivery man with oversized bear]

quotes.speaker: Delivery man
quotes.text: Phyllis Lapin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OH, Holy God!

quotes.speaker: Delivery man
quotes.text: It’s from Bob.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Man, that thing’s bigger than I am.

quotes.speaker: Delivery man
quotes.text: No, it’s not.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh zip it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There they are. What’s up? Hey hey.

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Michael Scott. [sticks out hand for handshake]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Josh Porter, high five. [They high five] Bam.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: You know Dan Gore from Buffalo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, how ya doing? Nobody needs to introduce this guy. Craiggers. [bump fists]

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: What’s up buddy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have been kicked out of every strip club in Albany, is that true?

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: Guilty, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So what’s going on? What I miss?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Not much, they’re uh, I guess running late upstairs, so we’re just waiting for the presentations.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool. Good, good, good. Give us some time to catch up, and… [awkward silence]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam. Hi, How ya doing? Good. Listen, uh may I speak with you… privately?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can’t fire me, Dwight, just ’cause Michael’s not here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Pam, Just. Just, [tilts head away, towards another room]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You need to get something for your girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [same time as Pam] Girlfriend. Yes, and the reason I didn’t get anything for this particular person – who shall remain nameless – is that she’s not really the kind of person you’d think would be into Valentine’s Day. She’s kind of…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tightly wound?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: (smirking) Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, well, sometimes the gift is really about the gesture, you know, like what it means, instead of what it is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You mean, like a ham?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, not like a ham. It’s about doing something, so that the person knows that you really care about her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, I get it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That you remember her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, shut up. I know exactly what to do. [gets up and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: What about you, Craig, you lose anyone?

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: Oh man, Jan, called me in September and said “You gotta fire four people,” and I was just like, “What?” Ya know?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Did you?

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: No, I just ignored her. She’s the worse.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: She is our boss.

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: She ain’t my boss dude. I don’t work for that bitch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ay, Kay. Come on, you know, that’s not. Cool it.

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: What? You like Jan? How can you like Jan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe because she’s my girlfriend. [starts retracting statement] Was, or not my girlfriend. She’s… we hooked up and…

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: You hooked up with Jan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, months ago, just once, It’s, just stupid. Just forget it,

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Yeah, let’s change the subject.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don’t know what he’s thinking, but I would just be so psyched if we just dated forever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Take it slow. ‘Cause it seems like a lot of the time things like that need… [Ryan walks in]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Soda.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [to Ryan] Cool. Hey, so… do you want to… do something tonight? Or…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [under breath] Oh, no, not while I’m here.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I mean, I know it’s Valentine’s Day, or whatever, but there’s totally no pressure at all, of any kind. What so ever. So…

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can’t tonight. I have plans with my friends.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: OK, That’s cool. I completely understand.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Cool. Cool. OK.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Josh Porter, Stamford.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: David [to Josh and shakes hands]

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And Michael Scott, Scranton.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ditto. [to Jan] How are you Jan?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Fine Michael. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: OK. So we are in the process of doing a complete review of the company’s financial strengths. All I’d like to do today is to…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Nervous, no I’m not nervous. Well, I guess I’d be lying if I didn’t say I was a little nervous. Umm, the new CFO is judging me on this too, and well, it is Michael, so. Yeah, I’m very nervous.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: So with the twelve new local accounts, we had a total of four percent organic growth, which was just above our pre-year targets.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: Thanks very much.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: OK, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is a business? Is it a collection of numbers and sales reports? Sure. But as you know, David and Jan, it is much more. [plays video on screen. David and Jan have confused looks on their faces.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Life moves a little slower in Scranton, Pennsylvania. And that’s the way we like it. Because at Dunder Mifflin Scranton, we’re not just in the paper business, we’re in the people business. Let’s meet some of the folks that make the Scranton branch so special.  This is Stanley Hudson, one of our talented salesman. An African-American father of two, Stanley’s dedication is no doubt one of the hallmark’s of the foundation of the business we’re hoping to build our bases on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I shot a bunch of footage around the office, edited it together on my Mac. I was thinking of entering it into some festivals. Probably won’t. You know, not what this is about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And finally, Pam Beesly. Look at her. Look how cute. Not bad at all. As the receptionist, Pam is truly the gateway to our world. Well, I hope this gave you a little taste of what life is like here at Dunder Mifflin, Scranton. What it’s like to walk a mile in Oscar’s shoes. Or try on Phyllis’ pants.  Maybe even one of Angela’s famous brownies. And you’ll know, that you’re home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Questions?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: Wow. OK, OK, thank you Michael, that was great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, thank you.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: But, for right now what, I would really like to know about is the branch’s performance, so do you have that information as well?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, absolutely David. Get that for you. I umm… [hands over report]

quotes.speaker: Delivery man
quotes.text: [with flowers] Can you sign?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [delivering plant to Oscar’s desk] Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Nothing for me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [walks away] Join the club.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whose it from? [to Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: My mom. [puts card in pocket]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It’s frustrating, because we’d be so perfect together.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? Here’s the deal, Kelly. It would be really nice if he was in to you, right? It’d be great, but he isn’t.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, it would be so great if he was.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, he’s not, though. So you just gotta suck it up. You just gotta move on. Try to have some fun. Come to my poker game tonight.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay, cool. Is it okay if I invite Ryan? [Jim leaves]

quotes.speaker: Dan
quotes.text: And that about does it, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK. [looks toward Craig] Craig,

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: Yeah. Here’s the deal. I did not understand this was supposed to be a full on… like report or whatnot.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Um, I’m sorry, what did you think financial presentation meant?

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: I was under the impression this was, more of like… a meet and greet type deal.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: So, does that mean you don’t have the numbers on your branch?

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: That is correct, yes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Craig, you realize that we’re trying to decide whether if drastic steps need to be taken?

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: Look, I’m sorry, I didn’t know.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, the point is, is that doesn’t exactly bode well for your branch.

quotes.speaker: Craig
quotes.text: Oh man, you know what? Michael made that stupid movie, he doesn’t get into any trouble? Maybe I should have slept with you, too. [David looks at Jan, who glares at Michael.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, ok. Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: NO, NO I’m not, I’m not, I just… I just don’t know what to do anymore, Michael. I mean, we’re all gonna get fired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No you’re not.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah, Michael – the CFO thinks that we slept together. Do you understand, people get fired for much less? And I just [scratches head] can’t believe that you told everybody and we didn’t even sleep together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Technically, we fell asleep in the same bed. So…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, God. Michael. It was months ago. It was once, It’s over. Do you understand?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. I’m sorry. I will fix this. I’ll talk to him. I’ll talk to David.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Surely, you cannot be serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am serious. And don’t call me Shirley. Airplane.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Women are like wolves. If you want a wolf, you have to trap it. You have to snare it. And then you have to tame it. Keep it happy. Care for it. Feed it. Lovingly, the way an animal deserves to be loved. And my animal deserves a lot of loving.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey babe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You almost ready to go?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I guess, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What’s wrong?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nothing, it’s just I had to sit here all day, while Phyllis got like an entire garden delivered to her.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What, you’re mad at me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, I know that we said no big gifts, but I was kind of hoping you’d get me something for Valentine’s Day.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Well, Valentine’s Day isn’t over. Let’s get you home and you are gonna get the best sex of you life.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: You understand this is a very serious situation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No no no no no, yes I, OK, well, alright, here’s the deal. It’s my fault. This is, this is totally on me. Before you guys came in, I was talking to the guys. We were all chatting and I made a joke, a really dumb joke and Craig the idiot took it seriously. [Jan looks at Michael]

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: You made a joke?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did, it was stupid. And Craig, you saw him, he’s not the sharpest tool in the shed. Although he is a tool. [David grins]

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: Well I don’t need to explain to you that even a joke about sexual relations with your boss…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. It was borderline at best and… And Jan is a fantastic executive and has all the integrity in the world and um, I’m really sorry. It will never happen again.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, that’s fine. Let’s just forget it.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.text: Good. [Michael leaves office]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Heading out?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Alright, Beesly, Hey, Happy Valentine’s Day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye. [Jim leaves]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Goodnight Pam. [Leaves with oversized bear on back.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Night Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, Michael. Thank you again for that, really. It was very nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no big deal. Really. Sorry again.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, no, it’s OK. [Puts hand in way of elevator door to stop from closing.] So, uh, Happy valentine’s Day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, Happy Valentine’s Day. [Jan turns and then kisses Michael. Michael looks and sees camera, Jan turns and sees camera, too. Elevator door closes.]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oy vey… schmear. [Points at Fiddler on the Roof playing at Minskoff Theatre and does a dance.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody, hello, can I have your attention, please? Since it’s Valentine’s Day, there’s something that I wanted to say. I love the women of this office. Pam, I love you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael’s got a few tricks for Valentine’s Day. He found a place where you can get 12 plastic roses for $10 and he’s got a great line. “Me so thorny.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I love you, Angela. Yes, even you. I love you, Kelly. I love you, Meredith. This is all platonically, of course.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I love ladies, always have. And you know what I think is the most attractive part of a woman’s body? The brains. Because I don’t think a woman is beautiful unless she is smart. And also, the brains are where the ladies get their best nasty ideas for bedroom stuff.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You have any big Valentine’s Day plans, Kev?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Not really, my fiance is out of town.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where is she?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I’m not sure. Arizona? Sometimes she doesn’t tell me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s a lot of noodles. How much sodium do you think is in that cup? This place used to be full of hookers and porn shops and it’s not that way anymore. There’s an old building. That one hasn’t been torn down yet, but they will. They’ll get to it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Happy Valentine’s Day, Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Okay, you take it easy, ace.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Here you go, Creed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey, thanks, ace.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I’m not good with names.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is where it’s all happening. We got TGI Fridays. I’m in the picture! Sometimes I just jump into people’s pictures. Lot of people have their picture taken. It’s kind of a New Yorker thing. You jump in on a tourist’s picture and kind of ruin it. There’s an energy to New York that you just feel. Um, everybody… Don’t get hit. Everybody is kind of together and everybody hates each other, but loves each other at the same time. Screw off! People just yell at each other in New York, and it’s great.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’m gonna go call Bob.

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
quotes.text: So, what are you doing for Valentine’s Day?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m gonna spend it with my fiance.

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you guys doing?

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
quotes.text: Probably go grab dinner with my girlfriend. He’s gonna be pulling his pud watching Skinemax. [points to Vance Refrigeration Worker #2]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, okay. That’s enough.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, break this up.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.text: Yes, sure. Mr. Scott, you can head to the conference room. The other managers are already there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Great. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, here’s the thing about Jan. She talks such a big game about, “Oh there’s nothing between us and stop talking about it.” And “Border-line harassment when you call me at home.” But let me ask you this, is it just a coincidence that this meeting is taking place on Valentine’s Day? Answer, maybe, but maybe not. We shall see.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How do you spell “animalian”?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Animalian?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: None of your business. I’m writing something.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You’re writing something?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Forget it. I’ll look it up myself.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you know what? You do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I’m not gonna do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, yes, I’m in charge. You have to. Look it up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But I know how to spell it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So tell me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Only if you tell me what you’re writing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Forget it. I’ll do it. But you’re getting written up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So now you’re writing two things?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight lives on a beet farm and he practices karate at the forth grade level. And he apparently has a girlfriend, so… I guess there really is someone for everybody.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [phone ringing] Hi, this is Kevin. Stacy? Happy Valentine’s Day. Yeah. Oh, awesome. Okay. Yeah, I’ll be leaving here soon. Cool. I love you, too. Okay, ‘bye. Stacy’s back.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That’s great, man.

quotes.speaker: Devon
quotes.text: Hey Scott. Hey. Hey! Hey! Come here! Come here! I want to talk to you. Come here!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? It was nice to see Devon again. To sort of get closure on that whole thing.

episodes.title: Dwight’s Speech
episodes.description: Michael coaches pompous Dwight on the finer art of public speaking after being named as Salesman of the Year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s think this through. If we ask Corporate for that then…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They are either going to say yes… or no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could go either way. We don’t know what they are going to say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Think it through.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have to think it through. Because if they say no…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can we not?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! Yes, we have to! You know why? Because I don’t like to be cooped up in that office! In that box! All day long. [Michael starts playing with a football in the office] Heisman! Because I need to think. Okay, Jim? Oh, Kevin, oh! [laughs] Nice catch. Mmmm, mmm, mmm,mmm. Os-car! Intercepted.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Still want that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give it to me. Phyllis, give me the ball. Ok, give me the ball. Give me, you guys… Creed give me the ball! Right now give it to me.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Ryan!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fumble! Yaaah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hut! Hut! Hut! Hike!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You all right Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ooh. They’re having a sale on TiVo. Maybe I should get a TiVo. Oh. DVD Burner! Maybe I should get one of those. You are so lucky, Jim. You are so lucky you don’t have this problem. What was the 9th place prize again? A loaf of bread?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cugino’s pizza.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, great. Tasty, terrific pizza. Hmm. Question: Do their pizzas play DVDs?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight was the top salesman of the year at our company. He wins a little prize money and gets honored at some convention. It is literally the highest possible honor that a Northeastern Pennsylvania-Based Mid-size Paper Company Regional Salesman can attain, so…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What did I do to deserve this?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you sad that Dwight beat you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you going to cry, Jim? Do you need a tissue?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey, I heard you got a wedding dress. Do you have pictures?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! I… uh… yeah. Um… I’ll uh show them to you later.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I should get back. Talk to you guys later.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have a ton of stuff to do for the wedding. And I have to do it in the office. And that can be kind of awkward. Um… just because people can get all weird about wedding stuff. Then… I just… I don’t want to offend… Angela… or someone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s what she said!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha! I don’t get it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Grapes. Seductive. So you ready for the big speech this afternoon?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, it’s not really a big speech. You still coming right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Abso-fruit-ly. Fruit. Grapes. Nailed the joke. Matter of time. Um… And yes, it is a big speech. Biggest of your life.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Speaker at the Sales Convention. Been there, done that. Went there again, did it again. Two years in a row. Consecutive. I just… I miss the feeling of knowing that you did a good job because someone gives you proof of it. Sir, you’re awesome! Here’s a plaque. What, a whole year has gone by and you need more proof? Here’s a certificate. They stopped making plaques that year.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What if I give a really long, extended Thank You. For instance, “Thank you, Mr. Blank. Thank you very, very, very…”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That would look terrible. These are mostly salesmen and salesmen expect to be entertained and you are the main act.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When I was in the sixth grade, I was a finalist in our school Spelling Bee. It was me against Raj Patel. And I misspelled, in front of the entire school, the word ‘failure’.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s because you’re incapable of doing it because you don’t know how. Because you have no skills. Dwight, there’s no way I can possibly teach you what you need to know about public speaking by speech time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But I can teach you enough so that you don’t embarrass me or the company.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, deal! I’ll do whatever you say. No questions asked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, if you have a question, you should ask me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ll try and think of one. When…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t. Don’t try and think of a question to humor me. Just… try not to be such an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is that an insult or is that part of the public speaking advice?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Insult.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mom, I’m sorry. I know you and Dad are chipping in for the wedding but I do not want orange invitations. Yes! Well, if you really want my…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi, yeah, can I talk to one of your travel agents?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m going to take a trip. I’m going to get out of town for a while… and go someplace… not here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where do I want to go? Um… that is an excellent question. And one I should have probably thought about before I called you. Um…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I get here early every morning so I can set the thermostat. I like it a little cooler, around 66 degrees. I’m more productive. Maybe some people don’t like it as cold as I do, but I don’t care.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [stand up comic voice] But seriously, what’s the difference between a salesman and a saleswoman?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Saleswoman has a vagina.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s a joke, Dwight. It’s not a Sex Ed class.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But I’m right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, you’re right about the difference between a man and a woman, but not about the punch line to the joke, right? [stand up comic voice] The difference between a salesman and a saleswoman… is boobs!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey. Do you remember the speeches that you gave?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do. Both of them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Could I have a copy of one of them?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no! They would remember them. Look, it doesn’t matter what you say. It just matters that you’re saying something that people care about. Yeah? All right? Here we go. Watch this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Attention everybody! Attention please! I have some very great news from Corporate. We had a wonderful quarter and as a result all of you are getting bonuses for 1000 dollars!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [generalized clapping and cheering] Congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Unbelievable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You see that? You see how they responded to me? In that moment, I had them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is so great about the bonus!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no! It’s not true. I was just talking so just go out there and say anything. They’ll eat it up. They’re a great audience.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Go ahead. Get the wallpaper. Wallpaper the ceiling if you want. Call Terri and tell her she…

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It’s unbelievable!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me! May I have your attention please? There has been an accident on 84 West. Cars have skidded off the road into the safety railing. Several cars have flipped. There is broken glass everywhere. Several people are injured.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do we know anyone who was in the accident?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Brad Pitt. Also there will be no bonuses.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why would this affect our bonuses?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They are unrelated.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Is Brad okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He will never act again. Also, this branch is closing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What the hell is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Are we out of jobs?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: This is karma because of what he did to Jennifer Aniston.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He’s kidding. Dwight was kidding and I don’t know why because it wasn’t funny… and it was just horrible.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You said we were getting bonuses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Everybody in the conference room now. Let’s go. Let’s do it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Cancel wallpaper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: As your leader and your friend, I sort of demand that you can all speak in public as I can… and did… twice. [speaking to camera] You saw the plaque, right? [to office] All right. We’re all going to go around the room and we’re going to make toasts. And that way, we will overcome our fear of public speaking.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You mean Toastmasters?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam! I’m public speaking. Stop public interrupting me. Actually, this would be good practice for your wedding toast.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, the bride doesn’t really do… Have you ever been to a wedding?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I go?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Good. Jim taking the initiative.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So. Uh… I am going on a trip. But not really sure where I’m going yet. It’s kind of open-ended. So I was hoping maybe you guys would have some suggestions?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You should go to Hedonism.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It’s like Club Med, but everything is naked.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was thinking more like Europe. Or something like that. But, good second choice.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Been to Amsterdam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh ho hokay. You know what? That’s not a toast. You’re not standing up.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [mimes lifting a glass] To Amsterdam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When did you go there?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Umm… After my divorce. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really for like how long?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh, about a week. Er… .um… .maybe a month. I uh can’t…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Jimmy, listen to me. You do not want to go to Amsterdam. Trust me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where do I want to go?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I’d send you to Hong Kong.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Like to say ‘Hi’ to my friends in China. [speaks in Chinese]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Dwight. Show us what you have learned today.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good morning, Vietnam! [general groaning] Okay. You know what? This isn’t working. Because um I’m not nervous in front of them. They’re my subordinates.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. We’re not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, yes you are. I’m Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which means absolutely nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, can you explain?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it’s mostly made up. So…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight is not going to do a job. It’s sad. And they’re expecting excellence because I did do such a good job. Two years in a row. I killed. It was amazing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Confidence, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight. If you could travel anywhere in the world where would you go?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can travel anywhere except Cuba. And I will travel to New Zealand. And walk the ‘Lord of the Rings’ trail to Mordor. And then I will hike Mount Doom. So… no… just leave me alone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Just trying to get some advice on my trip.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh please! You’re not taking any trip.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know I majored in Public Speaking in College.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You did?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmmhmm. And the first thing they teach you is that you’ve got to be true to your self. And you are all about authority.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. I am.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The great speakers throughout history were not joke tellers. They were people of passion. So if you want to do well today, you got to do what they did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Which is?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You’ve got to wave your arms and you’ve got to pound your fists. Many times. It’s supposed to emphasize your point.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, I didn’t actually major in Public Speaking. But, I did download speeches from some of history’s famous dictators. Like this one [holds up paper]. Originally given by Benito Mussolini.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, look. I know you are giving this speech on your own but I wrote up a few talking points for you to take a look at. I hope you don’t mind.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ll glance at it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s time, Dwight. The grim reaper is here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The very best of luck to you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why’d you pick the V.A. for the reception?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy has a connection. It’s nicer than you think.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You’re inviting Jim?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of course. He’s one of my closest friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. You ready? Here we go! Wow. It’s a little bit bigger than I remember. Come on. We’re down here. Right.

quotes.speaker: Overhead
quotes.text: [song] You all ready for this?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [coughs] [sniffles] I am just feeling under the weather. And… I think that I will go home and rest.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I’ve never, ever seen you take a sick day.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, I’ve seen you take enough for the both of us.

quotes.speaker: Speaker
quotes.text: Next, I’d like to introduce the Dunder Mifflin Salesman of the Year, Dwight Schrute!

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [polite clapping]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, they called your name.

quotes.speaker: Speaker
quotes.text: Dwight, how we doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I can’t… I ca…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. You know what? Okay. No. No problem. You are lucky you have me here. I’m going to cover for you. [shouts] All right!

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [claps]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gooood morning, Vietnaaaam! I am not Dwight Schrute. Not at all. I am Michael Scott, his mentor and boss. And until Dwight comes up, if he ever does, I wanted to say a few words about excellence. What makes a work environment excellent? Well, there are many things, I believe, that do such a thing of that nature. And one would be humor. What is the difference between a salesman and a saleswoman?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I always set it at 69. [snickers]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe we’ll use a DJ. That’s the one thing Roy’s in charge of for this wedding but all he’s managed to do is set a date.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: But he did a great job. June 10th is perfect. I want a June wedding.  I’ve always wanted one. Ryan, do you know when you would want to get married?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Actually, I don’t see myself ever getting married.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ryan, you should be more sensitive. It’s obvious she likes you and comments like that, they just…

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I know what I said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m very sorry. I did not know you were wearing a hearing aid and I just thought you were speaking abnormally. …And now the black guy from the ‘Police Academy’ movies. A robot. [makes robot sounds] Michael Winslow, anyone?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Car starting. [makes car sounds]  All right, Dwight Schrute everyone.

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [clapping]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good luck. That is a tough crowd.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [bangs fists] Blood alone moves the wheels of history! Have you ever asked yourselves in an hour of meditation, which everyone finds during the day. [waves arm] how long we have been striving for greatness? [bangs fist] Not only the years we’ve been at war, the war of work, but from the moment as a child when we realized that the world could be conquered. It has been a lifetime’s struggle [waves arms]. A never-ending fight. I say to you [hits podium] and you’ll understand that it is a privilege to fight!

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [clapping]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: WE ARE WARRIORS!

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [clapping and cheering]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Salesman of Northeastern Pennsylvania, I ask you once more rise and be worthy of this historical hour!

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [clapping and cheering]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs maniacally] Yeah. Yes!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I’ve got a time share in Key West that might be available.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You really think you’re going to go?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. I’m definitely going.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Nice. Send me a postcard.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Jim has worked at the same place for five years. Jim eats the same ham and cheese sandwich everyday for lunch. I don’t know. If I were a betting man, I’d say he will have a fun weekend in Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No revolution is worth anything unless it can defend itself. [bangs fists]

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [claps]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Some people will tell you salesman is a bad word. They’ll conjure up images of used car dealers and door to door charlatans. This is our duty – to change their perception. I say salesmen… and women of the world unite! We must never acquiesce for it is together, TOGETHER, THAT WE PREVAIL!  We must never cede control of the motherland! For it is…

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [shouts] Together that we prevail! [cheering and clapping]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Australia? I have always wanted to go there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m going. I’m a little nervous to run into Dwight on his connecting flight to Mordor. But, other than that… um, yeah, I bought the ticket, non-refundable.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s awesome. Where are you staying?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know. I feel like I have plenty of time to figure out the details but…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When are you leaving?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m… leaving on June 8th.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. And I’m really sorry about that, I just…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh yeah. That’s too bad.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Do you want me to take these on my way out?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s ok. I got it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, thanks. [to Michael] There you are. What happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got thirsty. How’d it go?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was amazing. I wish you would have been there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You would not believe what happened here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Something happened?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! This woman came in, sat down, ordered a drink. The bartender asked for her ID which I thought was odd because I pegged her at like 35.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, it was weird. So, she was like ‘I don’t have my ID, please give me one.’ And he was like ‘I can’t do that. I can’t serve you.’

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Con artist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She might have been. So she says ‘Fine. I will go to my room. I will get my purse. I will come back. I’ll show you my ID.’ She hasn’t come back yet. She’s probably in her room drinking from the mini-bar! Right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight gave a great speech. That’s the word on the street anyway. And I entertained Dwight to no end with my bar stories. So, I captivated the guy who captivated a thousand guys. Can you believe that? A thousand guys?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My future is so bright, Jim. Jim, do you know how bright my future is? It’s so bright that… What? Do you know? Is there something I got to wear? Huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Goggles?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [imitating ’80s rock]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And what a lot of people don’t understand about sales is that it has so much to do with organization. I have a system in place for keeping track of who I speak to, when I speak to them and what we have discussed. Etcetera.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s it? You’re going to end with “etcetera”? Okay, what’s this big organizational system that…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, do you think I should describe our filing system?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That would be suicide. Never, never talk specifics. Not in a speech. But the fact that you have no idea what to say is, believe it or not, the least of our worries.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s your delivery…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Our biggest worry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t follow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My God, Dwight. The best way to learn is by watching. That’s why porn is a multi-trillion-dollar industry. Listen. Okay. Sit down, let me wow you. [clears throat] [shouting]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, God!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See, I have your attention now, don’t I? You’re scared, but now you’re ready to learn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, that didn’t go well.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it did not. And that is because at no time did you employ the use of humor. We’ll find you a joke that not even you can ruin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, listen up, please. Dwight has a joke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering to Angela] Stop it. [to the office] Two sailors walk into a bar…

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Please don’t tell a sailor joke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, why not?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Her nephew’s in Iraq.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Iraq is sand. Sailors are on water.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, but they are both in danger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, you know what? We need to… All right, everybody in the conference room now. Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who’s gonna start. How about Phyllis? You kick us off and then we’ll move around. Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What are we supposed to talk about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Anything your heart desires.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I would like to toast to the good fortune I’ve been having lately…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [shouting] Louder!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I, uh, I met a man and I’m totally in love, and that’s a chapter of my life that I thought had closed. Uh, I was terribly depressed for the longest time and I have to admit I had some very dark thoughts…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Good, good, good. That’s good. Now see, that’s not so hard, right? All right. Who’s next? Who are we going to… Ryan. Ryan’s next.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Why am I next? I thought we’d go in order?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t be shy, shy boy. Don’t be shy. Get up there.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well… A lot of you know that I’m in business school. And while I’m learning a lot here, a lot, hopefully soon I’ll land a challenging full-time or part-time position somewhere else.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Way to go, Ryan!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop! Stop! Stop! That’s, you know what? The toast is really not supposed to be about anything. It’s certainly not supposed to be about going anywhere or doing anything else, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan is a temp, and that means that he could go at any time. Am I worried about that? Try scared to death.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I got the stamps.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The ones that say “love” on them?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: The ones that say “39 cents.”

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. Doesn’t matter.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I didn’t think it did.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: As soon as they leave, well get Kelly and start.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly’s helping?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is that okay?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ghosts. Lots of ghosts in this old Radisson. There it is, Rosebud Room. Memories. Wow, this turnout is pathetic. I packed the house, you know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no, I don’t think this is it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Numismatic. Numismatic Collectors. Nope, wrong room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. They got sports medicine seminar, nope. Science fiction convention, nope.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, I read about that. The entire cast of Battlestar Galactica is gonna be here, including Starbuck. I’m so in love with her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re weird.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no. It’s totally normal, ’cause she’s not a Cylon or anything. She’s just a great human fighter pilot. If I see her, my heart will explode.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you a 12-year-old girl? I don’t know. There we go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, look at me. I’m huge in Wilkes-Barre. Performing nightly, Michael Scott. Not comedy fans here, which is fine because not having a sense of humor is just as fine as having one. Questions? Comment? Can’t see you, but I know that you’re not breathing. I know you’re breathing. Is this on? Hello? “Well, isn’t that… Well, isn’t that special?” “Jell-O pudding.” Bill Cosby. I think Bill Cosby said it best when he talked about his brother and all of the fun he… All the great things they did together as kids. And there was the one time when he put the snowball in the freezer, and it… And he waited for five months and then he took the snowball out and he threw it… He would have thrown it at the kid but then his mother had thrown out the snowball so he couldn’t throw it. So… Bill Cosby is smoking! And now some race car. [imitating race car engine] That brings me to my… Brings me to a point that you should always have a list of your clients. It’s important to because a client list is next to godliness… List. [baby crying] Could you shut him up, please? I mean, who brings a baby to a sales conference? Really rude.

episodes.title: Take Your Daughter to Work Day
episodes.description: A routine office day is changed when children come to Dunder Mifflin for "Take Your Daughter to Work Day." Michael is surprised when he strikes up a friendship with the five-year old daughter of his sworn enemy, Toby. Pam is desperate to befriend her colleagues' offspring and a misunderstanding puts Ryan under Stanley's thumb.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m looking forward to ‘Take Your Daughter to Work’ day. I am not great with kids, but I wanna get better. Because I’m getting married. So, I put out a bunch of extra candy out on my desk so the kids will come talk to me. …Like the witch in Hanzel and Gretel.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bribery. Nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I have more. [Holds up bags of candy]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam. Ms. Beasley if yer nastay! Janet Jackson. Hey! You having a wardrobe malfunction there? Or w—

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Michael. You can’t be nasty today. [whispering] ‘Cause of the… [points to ‘Welcome Daughters!’ sign]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … Oh, God is that today?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I reminded you last night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen, I like kids. But this is not a kid’s environment. This is like HBO, no limits. Who knows what I’m going to say? Crazy stuff. And it is R rated, it is not rated G. I am like Eddie Murphy in “Raw,” and they are trying to make me into Eddie Murphy in “Daddy Daycare.” both great movies, but, still.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I’ll be in my office.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don’t you think you should say something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They’re cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, I think that as the boss you should really—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine. Hi, children. I’m Michael Scott, and… I… am in charge of this place… ahh, what’ll make you… understand… I am… like Superman, and the people who work here are like citizens of Gotham City.

quotes.speaker: Jim and Dwight
quotes.text: [in unison] That’s Batman.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I’m Aquaman. Where does he live, guys?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The ocean.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [under his breath] I work with a bunch of nerds.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [looks at Sasha] Mmm… hello tiny one.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [to Sasha] Come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You are the future!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This… is my file cabinet. Uhm… oh. This… is the partition… between my desk… and Angela’s.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Abby’s my fiancee Stacy’s daughter, I think she’ll have a good time. I just hope she doesn’t look on my computer. …Actually, I’d better go check.
