quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael, you remember my daughter, Melissa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yes, hello, how are you? Good to see you. Wow, you’ve really grown up. You know what? Don’t mind me saying so, she is turning into a stone cold fox. Better keep the… frat boys away from her.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: I’m in eighth grade.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: She’s in middle school.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, middle school’s amazing. It is extraordinary. An extraordinary time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s not that children make me uncomfortable, it’s just that, why be a dad when you can be a fun uncle? I’ve never heard of anyone rebelling against their fun uncle.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [while Jake is throwing things at Michael] They want how many spiral pads?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Um, fif–well, fifty… I… over ordered because they had a back order.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I got permission to bring Jake into work, which is great because he got suspended this week and now I don’t have to pay for a sitter.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can you put that down there?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yep. [spreads tablecloth]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [to Sasha] Okay, tell them what you wanted to say.

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.text: Do you need any help?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. Thanks. We’d… have to explain everything, it’s probably just easier if we do it ourselves.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Alright, I wasn’t expecting that. Let’s uh… let’s go draw.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, she is so cute, I want to die. Don’t you just love kids, Angela?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I guess I wouldn’t mind a pair of small, well-behaved boys.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: God I cannot wait to get pregnant and have babies!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly and I both agreed that we would just have fun, and, I’m learning that fun for Kelly is… getting married and having babies. Immediately. With me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Just compare last year’s order to this year’s. Uh-huh. Yeah, I’m looking at it right now. [Sasha walks in the door] … Yes. We–yeah, they’re very–they’re different. [Sasha walks out] Yeah, we can stick with last year’s, you’re just going to have to supplement it, somehow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Abby! Do you want to help me shred some old documents? It’s actually pretty cool.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I only have one goal today. To make one kid like me. Just one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you reading?

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aww, best book?

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Yeah, but I’ve read it before.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pfft. So have I. Hey, question. If you had to spend a night in the Met or the Aquarium, which would it be?

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Definitely the Aquarium.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Definitely. Yes. Glad you said that. …You don’t want to help me with some of my sales, do you? ‘Cause, I’m kind of swamped.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Mmhmm!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yesss. And you’re Abby, right?

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m Jim. [Jim hi-fives Abby] Annnnd… let’s sell some paper.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let’s start with… your mom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes. Well… we can… [Sasha walks in, begins playing with Michael’s toy train] uhm… hey, uh, you know what? Can I call you back? I’ll call you right back. Yes, I promise. …Hello, can I help you? … You can pick that up, if you want. That’s— that’s alright. [Sasha moves the train to Michael’s desk] Want to bring it over… here, make some room. My name’s Michael. What’s your name?

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.text: Sasha.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.text: Ooh! [picks up train whistle]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you know what that is! That is a train whistle, like I’m the conductor. [blows into whistle] But I’m sort of the conductor of the office here, right? [blows into whistle] You want to try?

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.text: Sure. [Sasha blows into whistle continously]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All aboard for sales! Next stop, Cu…camonga! [Sasha and Michael laugh]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [shaking hands with Abby] Ow, ow, ow, ow, you broke my hand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There is no way that hurt.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? ‘Cause she’s pretty strong, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Little girl. Come over here. Shake my hand. Come on, I don’t have all day. [Abby shakes his hand] I don’t feel anything. Nothing. [to Jim] You’re so weak. [Jake walks over and messes with Dwight’s bobbleheads] Uh, excuse me, these are expensive collector’s items, okay?

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Do you have any computer games?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I don’t have computer games on my work computer. That would be innappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Yeah, Meredith doesn’t have any either. It’s so lame here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You call your mom Meredith? That’s very disrespectful.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Whatever, okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can refer to me as Mister Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: That’s your name? Mister Poop?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Schrute. Mister Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Sure, Mister Poop. [Jake walks away]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [quietly] … Schrute. [Jim and Abby snicker, Angela glares at Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.text: [to Phyllis] Are you Mother Goose?

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: I drink like, a hundred Ice Macchiatos a day, and practically nothing else.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: There’s a really cool coffee place, Jitters, at the Steamtown Mall. Ever been there?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: You’ve never been to Jitters? Ryan, you are so dorky. Gimme your number, so I can text you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uhm…

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: Come on! [Kelly glares through the door] You have an email address?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: …that I thought you should know …

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Mmhmm. What?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I think something a little fishy is going on. [points to Ryan and Melissa]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: A little fishy?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah. I mean, I’ve been noticing them all day, I was thinking that maybe … [Stanley gets up]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That little girl is a child! I don’t want to see you sniffing around her anymore this afternoon, do you understand?!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes, I–

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Boy have you lost your mind? ‘Cause I’ll help you find it! Whatcha lookin’ for, ain’t nobody gonna help you out there! Jesus could come through that door and he’s not gonna help you if you don’t stop sniffing after my child!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Stanley yelled at me today. That was one of the most frightening experiences of my life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [plays the recorder] That was Greensleeves. A traditional English Ballad about the beheaded Anne Boleyn. And now, a very special treat… a book my Grandmutter used to read me when I was a kid.  This is a very special story, it’s called Struwwelpeter, by Heinrich Hoffman from 1864. [reading from book] The great tall tailor always comes to little girls that suck their thumbs— are you listening, Sasha? Right? And ‘ere they dream when he’s about, he takes his great sharp scissors out, and then cuts their thumbs clean off!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight! Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There’s a photo…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What the hell are you reading to them?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: These are cautionary tales for kids, my Grandmata used to read these—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, you know what? No, no no no no. They, no. The kids don’t want to hear some wierdo book that your Nazi war criminal grandmother gave you.

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.text: What’s a Nazi?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s a Nazi?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [standing up] Nazi was a fascist movement…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …from the 1930’s…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t! Don’t! Don’t talk about Nazis in front of— you know what? They’re going to have nightmares, so why don’t you just shut it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was gonna teach the children how to make corn-husk dolls.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighing] Why don’t you just leave? Okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Bye, Mister Poop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. There goes Mister Poop. Now, who likes Dane Cook?

quotes.speaker: The Kids
quotes.text: [raising hands] I do, I do!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Children cannot lie. They are innocent, and they speak the truth, and out of the mouths of babes, Michael Scott is freaking cool. [cracks up]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You know, I never misbehaved in front of my father because he was a very strict disciplinarian. I can only hope my mate has some of those same qualities [makes eye contact with Dwight].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is where the magic happens! Right over here, let me show you this. See all these? [pets shelf of paper] You know what that is? That’s paper. This is where paper comes from. Any questions?

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: So… you cut the paper and dye it and stuff.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, we don’t actually cut the paper. That’s a good question. The paper is sent to us cut, and dyed, from a paper manufacturer, and then we sell it to a business for more than we paid for it.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: That’s not fair. [the rest of the kids agree]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is, well, w-w–you need someone in the middle to facilitate…

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: You’re just a middleman.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not just a middle… man…

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: Wait, why doesn’t the saw mill just sell paper directly to people?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are describing Office Depot, and they’re kind of running us out of business.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We have better service than they do!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …There’s Creed! Let’s take a look at what he’s doing, everybody! This is Creed, and he is in charge of… something. Right?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: That is correct.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Say hi to the kids.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hi kids.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yaaaaay.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Have you ever seen a foot with four toes? [begins untying shoe]

quotes.speaker: Kids
quotes.text: Ewwww!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing? N–stop it! Stop it! Just–no, no, no, no! No! Would you cut it out?! What is your problem?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Th-the hair covers it, mostly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No no no, we’re not gonna see— we’re not gonna see the four toed… Creed, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, there’s something interesting about me you might want to know. I … used to be … the star of a kids show.

quotes.speaker: Kids
quotes.text: No way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s true. I did.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: You serious?

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am totally serious. There was a show called ‘Fundle Bundle’ and I was the star.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: That doesn’t sound like a show.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s true! I can prove it! I can prove it, watch this. [gets up and runs out] Ryan, can you come here a second? [clears throat] I would like you to go to my mother’s house in Dickson city, and if she is in the pool, the back kitchen window should be unlocked, I want you to boost yourself up, I want you to go down to the basement. In the basement is a tape labeled ‘Fundle Bundle’. I want you to grab it, I want you to get my guitar.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Right. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to get the tambourine. Do you know how to play the tambourine?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, I’m already getting the pizzas from Bernetti’s, so…

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: You know, I can go with him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oka–

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No! I will… go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Thank you Ryan. Good attitude, hottest in the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Abby] Alright, nowwww… what kind… of pizza do you like?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t get why parents are always complaining about how tough it is to raise kids. You joke around with them, you give them pizza, you give them candy, you let them live their lives… They’re adults, for God’s sake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to give you a little blast from the past of Michael Gary Scott when he was a child star, and a show that you might remember called ‘Fundle Bundle.’ Okay? Without further ado, Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Miss Trudy
quotes.text: [from TV] …Bundle, are you ready to come on in? [TV children cheer] Let’s have some fun!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That… is Miss Trudy. Can’t tell from the costume, but she had an amazing body. Okay, you can… fast forward. And… I want you… to…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is that a real fun shooting windmill?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop! Stop! Stop! [Ryan resumes the tape] Yes! That is, uh, Edward R. Meow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s pretty funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Edward R. Meow
quotes.text: …Recess! Hey, what’s your name?

quotes.speaker: Chet
quotes.text: My name’s Chet.

quotes.speaker: Edward R. Meow
quotes.text: Well hi Chet.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Is that Chet Montgomery?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uhh, I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That is!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Checkin’ in with Chet. Doppler’s up.

quotes.speaker: Edward R. Meow
quotes.text: What do you want to be when you grow up?

quotes.speaker: Chet
quotes.text: I want to be on TV!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [employees chuckle] And he is on TV now!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can everyone please shut up, please! So you don’t miss it.

quotes.speaker: Edward R. Meow
quotes.text: Okay, next? So, whats your name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! That’s me. Shh. Shh.

quotes.speaker: Edward R. Meow
quotes.text: Well what’s your favorite subject at school?

quotes.speaker: Young Michael
quotes.text: Recess.

quotes.speaker: Edward R. Meow
quotes.text: Ree-cesss. So tell me, what do you want to be when you grow up?

quotes.speaker: Young Michael
quotes.text: I want to be married and have a hundred kids so I can have a hundred friends, and no one can say no to being my friend.

quotes.speaker: Edward R. Meow
quotes.text: [jaw drops, awkward pause] Uh, ah… oh, okay! Well uh, nice talking with you, Michael. Uh, back to you Miss Trudy!

quotes.speaker: Miss Trudy
quotes.text: Hi everyone, it’s one of my favorite times of the day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Coulda sworn there was…

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: Did you get married?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …uh, no.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Why not?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, just never happened.

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.text: So, do you have any kids?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, nope.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Do you have a girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do okay.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: Was Chet Montgomery cool back then?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Even I have a girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Alright, okay.

quotes.speaker: Sasha
quotes.text: So you didn’t get to be what you wanted to be.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …I guess not… you know, I have a load of work to do so I am going to grab a slice of this delish pizza… and I’m going to go do my work. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He’s not coming out. He won’t pick up the phone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can’t believe his mom dressed him like that, that’s the real tragedy.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [wrestling with Jake] Pam! Pam! I love this guy! [laughs] Come on!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, Melissa… I met your mom a couple times. She’s so nice.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: Who?  Terry?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: That woman is not my mother. That is my step-mother.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Mister Poop, I have to tell you something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, okay. But first, that’s not my name.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: You’re ugly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well at least I’m not a horrible little latchkey kid who got suspended from school. So…

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Meredith!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Toby knocks on door] Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I think these belong to you. [puts toys down on desk]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that’s okay, she can keep those.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Believe me, she has enough toys… she doesn’t need your watch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Is everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have to ask me that because you work for human resources.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh… it’s true…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, sure, playing the field is great, don’t get me wrong, but there’s more to life than notches just on my bedpost.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell me something honestly, do you… think… that it is too late for me to have kids?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, you need a wife first, or at least a girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What about…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Not Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …Jan. Kay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: If you really want to have kids, I— I guess you could somehow… foster parent, or something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …Or biologically.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Somehow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks, that’s, no, that… that really means a lot to me. Hey, does Sasha have a godfather, because I…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… kay.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Is it okay if I take one?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Is your job hard?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s not too bad. I get to shred things sometimes, do you want to see?

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Um… here it is. Don’t put your fingers in there. [shreds paper] Cool huh?

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: That’s so cool, yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I get to do this like, every week.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: That’s so awesome!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, it is true. I, Michael Scott, am signing up with an online dating service. Thousands of people have done it, and I am going to do it. I need a username. And… I have a great one [types]. Little kid lover. That way, people will know exactly where my priorities are at.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Do you want to come over for dinner tonight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ohh, man, I would love to! I can’t tonight, but can I come over some other time? [Abby nods]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What’re you doing? You never have plans.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks, Kev. Uhm… I’m actually going on a date.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Niiice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, uh, no, please? You can’t leave yet. There’s still one more thing we need to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] You… who are on the road… must have a code… that you can live by… [Dwight joins in] and so… become yourself… because the past… is just a goodbye… and teach… your children well…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why does he own a guitar if he doesn’t know how to play?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think he thought his ukulele skills would transfer. [Jim leaves]

quotes.speaker: Michael and Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] …did slowly go by… and feed… them on your dreams…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My theory is that… [Jim signals he’s leaving, waves bye to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Michael and Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] …The one they picked… the one you’ll know by… don’t you ever ask them why… if I told you would cry… you never look at them and sigh… and know they love you…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And they do, your parents, love you very much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One more time. [singing] You…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Schrutes consider children very valuable. In the olden days, the women would bear many children, so we would have enough laborers to work the fields. And if it was an especially cold winter, and there weren’t enough grains or vegetables, they would eat the weakest of the brood. [Laughs] They didn’t eat the children.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay. I think five plain and one veggie should be fine.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: How about pepperoni?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I like extra cheese.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Absolutely not.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I like extra cheese, too.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Fine. The first lesson we’ll teach children will be about obesity.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m pretty excited about today. I baby-sit Toby’s daughter Sasha sometimes. So, she’s the coolest kid. She has seen me play with dolls, though, so I don’t know how cool she thinks I am.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Put that away and learn.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: Learn what?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Learn why Daddy’s so cranky when he comes home from work.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I brought my daughter Melissa in. That girl is very spoiled. That child has no idea what I have to deal with so she can have her little cell phone and spend all my money at that Steamtown Mall.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: I’m gonna go read my book now.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [whispering] Angela. Is it okay if I’m the head accountant today?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m the head accountant.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, but can I say that I’m it, just for today?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I can’t set that kind of precedent. She’s a bright girl. She’d see right through that.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You must be pretty strong, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You think you can beat up Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Yeah. I don’t know, maybe.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I think you might be able to.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You think you could beat me up?

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah, I do.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Then you gotta have muscles, man. You got some muscles? Let’s see.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: I got some muscles. You wanna see the muscles? Bam! Look at that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, don’t touch him, please!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Man, you have got to be kidding me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Didn’t do background checks of the warehouse guys. [exclaims] Well, I’m sure it’ll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Can I have a quarter? I promise I’ll pay you back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Can I have a dollar? Then I can buy chips and a drink.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. There you go.

quotes.speaker: Jake
quotes.text: Will you marry my mom?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Melissa. Hey. I was working. I was in the middle of something.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: Just give me two seconds, I’ll be done.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I was in the middle of something.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.text: Dude, seriously, just give me two seconds, I’ll be done.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: …get you, I’m gonna get you! Come back here for more! [squealing]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Kids, kids, kids, slow down.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Oh, I’m gonna get you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What the… [pulls a pencil eraser out of his mug, after a drink]

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Did you draw that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Do you like to draw, Abby?

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Yeah, I wanna be an artist when I grow up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Me, too.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: You are grown up.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So, how’s your day been?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. It’s been a little more tiring than I thought.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, it doesn’t help that Stanley’s daughter’s such a slut.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Abby. I wanted to give you this for all your hard work today. Look. Michael signed it and everything. Official.

quotes.speaker: Abby
quotes.text: Thank you so much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I hate to break it to you, Abby. The certificate’s a fake. Okay? It’s not real. Where’s the certification number, Halpert?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Actually, I have the certification number right here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, really? Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. Okay. Fine. Well done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: “A7557962.” Totally nonsense numbers, but you do what you have to do.

episodes.title: Michael’s Birthday
episodes.description: In celebration of his birthday, Michael makes a mandatory invite of the staff during the workday to go ice skating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, Phil recruited me to sell these cards, and now I am recruiting you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Who is this guy again?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t worry about Phil. He drives a corvette. He is doing just fine. Okay. Calling cards are… the wave of the future. These things sell themselves.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Who uses calling cards anymore?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? That’s a nice attitude, Ryan, I’m just helping you invest in your future, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This sounds like a get rich quick scheme.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! Thank you! You will get rich quick. We all will!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Didn’t you lose a lot of money on that other investment, the one from the email?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, Toby? When the son of the deposed king of Nigeria emails you directly, asking for help, you help! His father ran the freaking country, okay? …Alright, so, raise your hand if you wanna get rich. [Jim and Dwight raise their hands] Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, um. How is this not a pyramid scheme?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, let me explain. Again. [draws on board] Phil has recruited me and another guy. Now, we are getting three people each. The more people that get involved, the more who are investing, the more money we’re all going to make. It’s not a pyramid scheme, it is a… it’s not even a scheme per se, it’s… [Jim draws a triangle around Michael’s diagram] … I have to go make a call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Happy birthday Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh ho ho! What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I said happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you! That’s really nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today is my B-day, and people around here just go crazy for it. I don’t know why. Oh! Fun fact. I share my birthday with Eva Longoria. So, I have a perfect ice-breaker if I ever meet Terry Hatcher.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. …Oh, happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, thank you sir.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Did you hear anything yet?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No. I’m still waiting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Dwight knocks on door] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. There he is, the birthday boy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh, god.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Birthday hug!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No no no, no, new suit, please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That suit is amazing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you very much. It is from Italy. [checks jacket] Actually— no, Bulgaria.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm. Maybe I should get one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good luck. One of a kind.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ebay. Hm. Question! May I be in charge of the party planning festivities?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not necessary, the party planning committee is all over it.  They’ve been working twenty-four seven all day yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excellent. On my part, I did manage to reserve the…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t! Nope! Please, don’t want to spoil it for anybody. Spoil the surprise.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let’s get the party started. [Begins ‘raising the roof’]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s get the party started.  Not the way I taught you! [Michael joins in]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: When should we bring out the cake, one or one thirty?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One’s good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: One thirty. [Pam yawns] I’m sorry, are we boring you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Party planning committee, listen up. Michael would like trick candles for his birthday cake, so make that a priority.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Where do we get those?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not my problem. Here is a list of things that Michael would like to be surprised by. [hands list to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael wants a strippergram?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, but he doesn’t want to know when, or whom.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. This is a closed door meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [answering phone] Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, I have Jan on the line.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, great, put her through.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hello, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m… returning your call, you said it was urgent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is urgent, I just wanted to call and wish you a happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, today’s not my birthday, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? ‘Cause, I thought we had the same birthday.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: …Happy birthday, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks. [grins]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Am I on camera?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope. Totally private. You can say whatever is in your heart. [Jan hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Ryan, sitting across from Michael] …You can take a five, if you want.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Somebody brought in donuts for my birthday!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Mmhmm, happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Man, I’m so sorry. When do you find out?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: They said this afternoon. They’re waiting on a second opinion.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Second opinion on what?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Um, I might have skin cancer.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, no! I was watching Grey’s Anatomy, and there was a lifeguard on it, and he had skin cancer too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kelly, you know what…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I never really thought about death until Princess Diana died. That was the saddest funeral ever. That and my sister’s.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Who brought in donuts?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Somebody got donuts for my birthday!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Happy birthday!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You didn’t know it was my birthday.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I… guess I forgot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I guess I forgot to give you a donut [closes box].

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Skin cancer is treatable.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It’s going to be okay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You don’t know it’s going to be okay. Don’t give him false hope. …It’s probably nothing, though.

quotes.speaker: Delivery Woman
quotes.text: Hi, delivery for Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go. Ohhhkay, this is great! [giggles] Thank you my friends, she is perfect! Ahhh, Dwight, may I have your chair please? And, um, some singles, if you will! Allllright. Nnnnn-dink! [puts single into delivery woman’s pocket, giggles] Okay, um, alright. This has arms. Is that gonna be a… is that alright?

quotes.speaker: Delivery Woman
quotes.text: Uh… s-sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] Okay. I’m so nervous.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can sign for it.

quotes.speaker: Delivery Woman
quotes.text: Oh. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was seven, my mother hired a pony and a cart to come to my house for all the kids… and… I got a really bad rash from the pony, and all the kids got to ride the pony and I had to go inside, and my mother was rubbing cream on me… for probably three hours, and I never came outside. And by the time I got out the pony was already in the truck. And around the corner. So that was my worst birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [eating donuts while Dwight plays the recorder] Stop it. Stop! What is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s ‘For the Longest Time,’ by William Joel. It’s you favorite song.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, it’s on the radio. My birthday blows. Nobody even signed my birthday poster. Probably my mother is the only one that cares enough to send me anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I probably care more than she does.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re making it worse. I bet Luke Perry’s friends don’t treat him like this [points to James Dean poster].

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When does he hear?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sometime today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohh… poor Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If I knew I had a week to live, I would… probably go to Europe. And South America. And the Grand Canyon. And… I would want to see the Pacific Ocean. …It would be a pretty busy week.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, that’s a list price of four dollars and fifty cents.  Unfortunately, this item is on [watch beeps] back… order… [hangs up] Michael! Michael! Michael Michael Michael! Come here, come here, come here!  Come here!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen up everyone! It is 11:23 exactly, the exact moment when you emerged from your mother’s vaginal canal, so… huh?! Right, have a seat. Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [grinning] Ohhh, God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There is a tradition that the Hebrews have of hoisting the birthday boy up on a chair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhh, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So come help me celebrate Michael’s birth moment. Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: …I’ll do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh, no, no, no! I can’t… Ryan, come on. Let’s do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Creed! Come on. Stanley!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …I feel like we should go get Kevin something. Do you think we can sneak out of here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe, but… we’re gonna need somebody to create a diversion, and…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On three, we’re going to hoist away! Ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Happy birth moment, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One. Two. Three! [Michael is raised until his head hits the ceiling]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa whoa! Alright. Alright. Watch it… please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oscar…

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It wasn’t me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, that is not an eight foot sub.

quotes.speaker: Delivery Boy
quotes.text: Uh, we don’t make an eight foot sub. This is eight one foot subs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: F. Alright, what’s the damage?

quotes.speaker: Delivery Boy
quotes.text: Uh, thirty-nine sixty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [pulls out wallet] Thirty nine… sixty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why tip someone for a job I’m capable of doing myself? I can deliver food. I can drive a taxi. I can, and do, cut my own hair. I did, however, tip my urologist, because… I am unable to pulverize my own kidney stones.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here they come.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get in here… everybody.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come and get it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Birthday party subs! My gift to you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, bologna, tomato and ketchup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The best.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: These are all the same?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Bologna? I don’t eat bologna.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then just have the tomato and ketchup. Still good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just the bread, it’s fresh baked.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-kay. Get whatever you want. [under breath] And choke on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was sixteen, I was supposed to go out on a date with a girl named Julie. But there was another Michael in the class that she apparently thought the date was with, so she went out with him, on my birthday. And, she got him a cake, at the restaurant. And it wasn’t even his birthday, but I heard about it the next day in school. So… That was the worst birthday I think I ever had.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So. We got Kev some stuff. Um… a party pack of M&M’s, his favorite candy. A DVD of American Pie 2, which is his favorite movie, and, he lent it to Creed, so, I can guarantee you he won’t get that back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sixty-nine cup of noodles.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which we realize sounds crass, but, it… is his favorite number.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And his favorite lunch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey temp, you know uh, we still got five feet of sandwich left [pulls ice cream cake out of freezer].

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [making peanut butter and jelly sandwich] Someone ate three feet of that thing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hell, yeah. Save room for ice cream cake.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [grabs cake] Oh. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. I got it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What are— it’s… the party planning committee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] This is the most important day of the year. I can’t risk anything.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What about that meeting… later… to discuss finances?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes… [whispering] but don’t expect any cookie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] But what if i’m hungry?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [whispering] No cookie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [puts fabric softener into cart] …What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You use fabric softener?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, you don’t?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: …Okay.

quotes.speaker: Office Staff
quotes.text: [singing] Happy birthday dear Michael, [Michael joins in, Kevin’s phone rings] Happy birthday… [everyone but Dwight stops] …tooo youuuu.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hello? Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin? Respect the birthday please.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, um, no not yet. I will. Bye. [hangs up] It was just Stacy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you done? …Good. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here we go. Make a wish.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uhhh… blow out the candle. Okay. Mmmm… [blows out the candles]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yaoo yay! [claps]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … I asked for trick candles.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam was supposed to get ’em.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, when she comes back we’ll do it again. [notices Meredith hugging Kevin] Hello, what about the birthday boy? Haven’t had a hug all day.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No one cares about your birthday. Kevin’s waiting to hear if he has skin cancer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … Aww, that… sucks, great. … Wow, that’s good timing. That’s… that’s, sorry, that’s terrible. Terrible news. That’s terrible… terrible news for both of us [takes cake into office and slams the door].

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [checking watch] We should probably head back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Okay. Oh. I dare you to make an announcement.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You dare me? How old are you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just… quit stalling.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [over loudspeaker, imitating Darth Vader] Luke, this is your father. Come set the table for dinner.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Such a dork.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [loudspeaker] Jim Halpert? Price check on fabric softener, the kind that gives you…

quotes.speaker: Store Employee
quotes.text: Ma’am? Please don’t touch that. That is not a toy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh I’m sorry. I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How old are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I hate you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [to Kevin] Honestly, is there any way you can get on your fiancee’s plan? Our health plan is s… just… it’s terrible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There you are. Good news. Did some research. It turns out that 98% of people with skin cancer fully recover.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Still scary.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, but it’s not brain cancer. And it shouldn’t stop us from having fun. You know what they say the best medicine is.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well the doctor said a combination of interferon and dicarbazine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And laughter… also.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don’t really think people are in the laughing mood.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are you here? I didn’t even invite you to my birthday party.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I work here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mocking voice] Nyeh, I work here. [to Kevin] Alright, well, you know what, since Toby doesn’t speak for everybody and I am your boss, I… think you should just go home. Take the rest of the afternoon off. Take a sick day.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: If I go home now, I’ll just drive myself crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you’re pretty much driving everyone else here crazy… crazy with worry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where have you been? And don’t say the bathroom, ’cause I kicked in all the stalls.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well that’s an invasion of privacy, so, I’m going to tell Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, don’t.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You… owe me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excuse me, everyone. Attention please. Kevin, we’re going to take you to a very special place, a place that will make you happy, and a place that is far, far away from the evil sun.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Is this trip related in any way to your… birthday?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How dare you sir. You are gross.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sees ‘Happy Birthday Michael Scott!’ poster at skating rink] That should not be there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ll get someone to take it down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it’s alright. It’s already up. Just leave it. Where’s Kevin? Come on! Let’s get our skate on!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Don’t be scared! You’re good! You’re good!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Think you can let go?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa. [Michael skates by]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: YEAH!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who is that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I’ve been pretty much skating my whole life. I thought about playing in the NHL, but, you’re on the road so much. You got no time to spend with your wife and kids. And I really want a wife and kids.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Pam, all this stuff with Kevin… um, it’s pretty scary. And I’m thinking that uh, next time you’re in the shower, you should check yourself out. You know, give yourself an exam. Those things are like ticking time bags. Alright? Think about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: …It’s something to think about.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I can’t relax about it, you know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin. You heard anything yet?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, not yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well. Live strong.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Carol? She sold me my condo! Hey! What, is this place on the market? Or…

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Uhh, no, I… don’t just sell real estate. Uh, my daughter has a skating lesson.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, these… all your kids?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: No just the front two.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey guys. Whats up? You wanna go for a ride? Is that okay?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool. Alright. Grab on. Here we go. Ready? Hang on tight. Alright. We are moving. We are reaaallly mooovin’ now!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Push. Good! That’s great. You got it. [Kevin’s phone rings] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hello? Yeah okay. Alright. Okay, I will, thanks. [hangs up] It was negative.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… God… [stomps] God! [throws hockey stick and yellow paper bracelet down] We’re gonna beat this, okay? We’re gonna… come here [hugs Kevin].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, apparently in the medicine community, negative means good. Which makes absolutely no sense. In the real world community, that would… be… chaos.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This is awesome. Thanks, you guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, who’s this from? Wowwwee, look at that! Jersey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Turn it around. Turn it around.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool. Ohh. Great. From Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Number one!!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you… Dwight. That’s great. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is from all of us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! You didn’t need to do that. …Nightswept. This is… really amazing. Thank you. I love it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael’s birthday was actually pretty cool. It was a good day. I don’t know… It was a good day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael’s birthday. It’s pretty fun to watch, actually. He gets very excited, and then he eats a lot of cake. And then he runs around the office. Then he has a sugar crash in the afternoon. And then he falls asleep. And that’s when we get our work done.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let’s get the party started.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s not how I taught you, right? [singing] My hump, my hump, my lovely lady lump Check it out [Dwight imitating drumbeat]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael’s birthday is hard for me because he gets very excited. But he’s also under a lot of pressure, which builds up until he’s ready to explode. As his right-hand man, it’s my job to release that pressure so that he can enjoy himself, if only for a moment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, here’s the thing about bosses and employees. A good boss will say, “Hey, it’s my birthday. Celebrate me.” A great boss will say, “Hey, it’s my birthday. Celebrate yourselves, because you are the ones who made me great, and I will acknowledge your contributions with donuts.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. You know, Ryan, you didn’t have to get me a present.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I won’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Great.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, good. I think I’m gonna go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I think you’re gonna stay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On my 20th birthday, my supposed best friend, Sam Ambrose, ditched me for his twin sister’s Sweet Sixteen party. And that was my worst birthday. Until today.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Can you please stop staring at me? [Dwight continues to stare and then walks away]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: To think that a man’s skin could turn on him. It’s brilliant, ’cause you’d never expect it. Most people think of their skin as an ally. [scoffs] Makes me rethink having skin at all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knock on door] Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey. I got the information.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, good. Okay. Don’t tell me, tell them.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [turns to camera] “The survival rate for localized melanoma is 98%.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God. That’s a piece of cake. That’s a piece of cake. Oh, 2%. Jeez, that’s good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [looking at camera] “There was 7,800 deaths from melanoma in 2005.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Out of, like, 18 billion Americans, so, no worry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: “For localized melanoma, the five-year survival rate is 98%. The survival rates for regional and…”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Those were probably misdiagnosed. I mean, anybody with a zit goes in and says, “I have cancer.”

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: “The skin is the largest organ of the body.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Untrue. The heart is bigger than the skin. If you stretched the heart out, it would cover more than the entire body.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m not afraid of dying. I know where I’m going. But if I were Kevin, I might be terrified. Gluttony.

episodes.title: Drug Testing
episodes.description: Dwight plays the role of Volunteer Sheriff after finding half a joint in the Dunder Mifflin parking lot leading to an investigation. Pam gives Jim a play challenge which he tries to complete.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kevin Malone, you’re next. Spit that out. [Kevin shoves the rest of the donut he’s eating into his mouth] Spit… Okay, come on, let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You look cute today, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks, girl.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, yesterday Dwight found half a joint in the parking lot. Which is unfortunate because as it turns out, Dwight finding drugs is more dangerous than most people using drugs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let’s go over some of the symptoms of marijuana use, shall we?  You tell me who this sounds like: slow moving, inattentive, dull, constantly snacking, shows a lack of motivation.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [nods] Hey…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I like the people I work with generally, with four exceptions.  But someone committed a crime and I did not become a Lackawanna County Volunteer Sheriff’s deputy to make friends. And by the way, I haven’t.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [mimicking Stanley] I enjoy the tangy zip of Miracle Whip.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] Jim does the best impressions. Sometimes he’ll look up at me from his desk and he’ll just be someone else. Like he’ll go um, [makes mournful face, giggles] that’s supposed to be Phyllis.  I can’t do it as good as he can.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And the guys are saying, chug, chug, chug, but I’m so small and all I’d eaten that day was one of those Auntie Anne pretzels from the food court so I said “Is it okay if I sip it?” and they said no, but Ryan seemed cool either way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stop! This is not Kelly Kapoor story hour.  Illegal drugs were consumed on company property, okay? Your ass is on the line, mister!  My ass is is on the line!  Now I’m going to ask you again.  What time did you go home last night?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Six.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I didn’t know that you were at a party on Saturday night.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I go to a lot of parties.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I’m gonna need to search your car.  Give me you keys.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I am not giving you my keys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t make me do this the hard way.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What’s the hard way?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I go down to the police station on my lunch break. I tell a police officer, I know several, what I suspect you may have in your car. He requests a hearing from a judge and obtains a search warrant, once he has said warrant, he will drive over here, and make you give him the keys to your car, and you will have to obey him.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, let’s do it that way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ry, is he bugging you? Dwight, dude, you gotta take a chill pill, man. It was one joint in the parking lot. You know, you’re totally harshing the office mellow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t stop this investigation. It is my job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa. You are a volunteer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I volunteered for this job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And that’s not the same.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is my duty…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [interrupting] Volunteer duty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …to investigate the crime scene. I have six more interviews to go and then I will reveal what I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [fake coughing] Narc!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [giggling]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you are attempting to compliment me then you have done a very good job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wasn’t attempting to compliment you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, you have…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uuf, well…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …because being a narc is one of the hardest jobs that you can have…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [shakes head] Okay…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …and I am very proud of being a narc.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don’t you just cool it, cool it Dwight, please, God! [to Jim] Dude, where’s my office? [Jim quietly laughs] I totally lost it, ’cause I was half-baked. Smokin’ doobies. Doobie brothers, I was smokin’ doobies with my brothers. Peace out, Seacrest!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, your office is behind you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks. M-m-munchies. Who wants some munchies?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don’t think Michael’s ever done drugs. I don’t know if anyone has ever offered him any.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oscar visited Mexico when he was five to attend his great-grandmother’s funeral. What does that mean to a United States law enforcement officer? He’s a potential drug mule.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have you ever taken any illegal drugs?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, I have not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you think it’s possible that maybe you could have had some drugs in your system without you knowing about it?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What are you implying?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have you ever… pooped… a balloon?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay. I’m done with this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He sure left in a hurry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t want to blow this. This is what all good law enforcement officers dream of. The chance to solve an actual crime.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you know what this is? [pushing a photo toward her]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes, it’s marijuana.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How do you know that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It’s labeled.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [grabs pictures back and looks at it] Dammit.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: That is Northern Lights Cannabis Indica.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, it’s marijuana.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m just saying that you can’t be sure that is wasn’t you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s ridiculous, of course it wasn’t me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Marijuana is a memory loss drug, so maybe you just don’t remember.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I would remember.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, how could you, if it just erased your memory?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s not how it works.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Now how do you know how it works?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Knock it off, okay, I’m interviewing you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No! You said that I’d be conducting the interview when I walked in here. Now exactly how much pot did you smoke?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [opens eyes wide in total surprise]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: So Pam told me that you do a great Stanley impression, I’d love to hear it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, um…[mimicking Stanley] Why do you keep CC’ing me on things that have nothing to do with me?  [Pam and Oscar laugh, Stanley walks in, and Oscar leaves quickly]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Is that supposed to be me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, hey Stanley. Uh, I was just doing an impression.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I do not think that is funny.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He does everyone in the office.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hmmmpt.

quotes.speaker: Pam and Jim
quotes.text: [in unison] I do not think that is funny.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jinx! Buy me a coke.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, no, no talking. Jim is not allowed to talk until after he buys me a coke.  Those are the rules of jinx, and they are unflinchingly rigid.  [Jim puts money in drink machine, selection is sold out]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sold out? That has never happened in the history of jinx.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [mouths] C’mon!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry, that’s not my problem.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [presses drink button, looks at camera, makes Jim-face]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know you’re innocent, but I can’t look like I’m treating you any differently.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I understand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where were you yesterday after work?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [smiles knowingly]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh-oh. Uh-oh. Who’s he calling?  Ratting somebody out.  Narc!  Narc!  Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That is so good, Michael

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Remember the narc bit? [laughs] Uh-oh, who’s in trouble?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Attention everyone.  Drug testers are coming in a couple of hours to test everyone’s urine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Waa… what? What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Company policy. If drugs are found on the premises there is automatic drug testing conducted within twenty-four hours.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Is that true, Toby?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, when you sign your job application you agree to comply with random drug testing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Two nights ago, I went to an Alicia Keys concert at the Montage Mountain Performing Arts Center. I scored these great aisle seats. Anyway, after the opening act this beautiful girl sits down next to me and I never get to meet girls with lip rings and she had one. I don’t know exactly how this happened but one of her friends started passing around some stuff and they said it was clove cigarettes, and I’m sure that it was clove cigarettes. Everybody in the aisle was doing it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, attention everyone the drug testing has been cancelled.  Instead, I will be going around to each of you and doing a visual inspection.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No you can’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can do that, it is my office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No you cannot. It has to be official, and it has to be urine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmmm. Ha. [under his breath] Alright. Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kevin, what prescription drugs are you taking, besides Rogaine?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I’m not taking Rogaine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angela, what about you?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don’t take any prescription drugs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re not on anything?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Gives Dwight a knowing look]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So the first time we went out to dinner, it was like, whatever, fine, but I was so nervous. So this time I wanted to be special, so I bought a new dress! [Jim hunches his shoulders and grins] One of those kinds that is kinda low cut at top to show something, but not everything. [Jim shakes his head no in agreement] I mean not everything, Jim. [Jim shakes his head in agreement] I promise, I’m not that kind of…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey guys, what’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: We’re having the best conversation.  [Jim, eyes wide, shakes his head, no]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, okay.  Well, Michael wants to see everyone in the conference room. [Jim shakes his head. Seems relieved to be getting away from Kelly] But you know what? We have a few minutes so you guys should definitely finish up your conversation. [Jim nods his head as if to say, “Gee, thanks, Pam.”]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So, I was looking so hot…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It has come to my attention that some people here think that the use of drugs is something to laugh about.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We don’t feel that way.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, not at all.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You were the one joking around calling Dwight a narc.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, uh, no. That was a test.  I was testing you, and you all failed. Miserably. When I said that Dwight was a narc, how many of you defended him?  How many of you said, “Hey, you know what, he’s right? What he’s doing is protecting this office from the evils of drugs.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am ridiculously anti-drug. So anti-drug that I am above suspicion in any way that involves suspicion, or testing of any kind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Drugs ruin lives people. Drugs destroy careers. Take Cheech and Chong everybody knows that Cheech and Chong are funny, but just imagine how funny they would be if they didn’t smoke pot.  I want everybody to take a look to their left. Now I want everybody to take a look to their right. One of those people will be dead from drug use at some point in their lives. This year more people will use cocaine than will read a book to their children.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Where did you get these facts?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are these facts scaring you, or are they not?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: They are not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you think that smoking drugs is cool? Do you think that doing alcohol is cool?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No, I don’t. I have a glass of red wine with dinner about once a week.  For the antioxidants.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, enough, enough, enough! I have written down a list of illegal drugs. Take a gander. How many of these are you familiar with?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hookah is not an illegal drug, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No it’s not. It’s a type of pipe. You can fill it with tobacco, often mixed with fruit, or other flavors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, you know what, Toby? Pam, can you take this down? [Pam throws her hands up to indicate she has no notepad] In addition to Toby’s urine being tested, I would like to test his blood and his hair.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You can’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can test anyone randomly, and I have chosen you randomly.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That’s not random.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, eeny, meenie, miney, moe, is random.  Okay, you know what? I’m going to need a volunteer to select one of these words and tell us of something tragic that happened in either their lives, or the lives of a loved one.  Yeah, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know that Jim has an amazing story about a relative of his who got caught up in the world of drugs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? [Jim shakes his head no]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim it’s okay. You can t… [Jim looks at Pam and shakes his head, Pam looks at him and gestures for Jim to go up and tell his story] This would be a good place to let it out, Jim. These are people you can trust. These are people who care about you. [Jim shakes his head no] It’s okay, just we will not judge you. We are here to not judge you. [Jim stands up] Oh, he’s doing it, okay. [Jim looks at Pam] It’s okay. [Jim pretends to try, looking teary eyed, shakes his head no, mouths “I can’t” and sits back down. Pam is amazed.] Oh. Okay, are you sure? [Jim shakes his head. Kevin pats his shoulder] That looked like it was going to be good. Alright. [Pam nods in admiration at Jim] Okay, well.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow! He really pulled out the big guns. Fake crying. Did not expect that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The point I’m trying to make with all of this people is that I hate drugs. I hate them, and based upon what I have seen you all don’t quite hate ’em as much as I do so you are going to have a drug test, and I am not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you will be tested.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I will not be.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You will be. That is the law according to the rules.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well Dwight just know that I’ve been very busy today and I got a lot of work to do and I wasn’t planning on going to the bathroom and I don’t even know if anything is going to come out, okay? So good. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hi, Linda. Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager. You might remember testing my urine a few years back when I was applying to be a volunteer sheriff’s deputy.

quotes.speaker: Linda
quotes.text: We test a lot of urine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mine was green.

quotes.speaker: Linda
quotes.text: Oh, right. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m all better.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I need you to do some work on the St. Andrews account. I need your urine. I need some filing done.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What kind of filing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just forget it.  Just the urine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That goes directly to the tester.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just. I need your urine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Like in a cup?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes in a cup, we’re not animals, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: For what purpose?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s none of your business.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then I refuse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Alright. Just, I went to an Alicia Keys concert, over the weekend, and I think I may have gotten high accidentally by a girl with a lip ring.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need clean urine for the lady.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But that’s illegal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t think of it that way. It’s like, urine goes all over the place. You know, there’s no controlling it. It just… goes

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not my urine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A cup could find its way under the urine. It might be an accident. It happens.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Were you forced to do drugs at this concert?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, just look. Look. Just… just fill up the cup.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Do you want to give Michael your urine?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I want him to have all the urine he needs.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You’re not going to get my permission on this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know that. Don’t you think I know that?

quotes.speaker: Linda
quotes.text: Yeah, we do testing all over the country.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Cool.  Hey, are you guys hiring?

quotes.speaker: Linda
quotes.text: You want to work at the urinalysis lab?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.  Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My father’s name was Dwight Schrute. My grandfather’s name was Dwight Schrute. His father’s name Dwide Schrude. Amish. I loved my father very much. Every morning he’d wake up at dawn and make us biscuits with gravy. When I was little my dad and I played a lot of games together. My dad cheated a lot but I never busted him on it. I would have, except I didn’t know about it. He didn’t tell me till years later. I was shocked when I found out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? [Jim shakes his head] Did you want to tell me something? You look like you want to tell me something. [Jim shakes his head no] You look like you have something really important to say and you just can’t for some reason. [Jim smiles] Come on, you can tell me. Jim, you can tell me anything. [Jim stops smiling and looks down. Pam wonders what that means]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I’d like a magazine.

quotes.speaker: Linda
quotes.text: We just need urine, sir.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I’d still like one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight. Well, I passed the test thanks to you and your untainted pee. Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s wrong? Where’s your costume?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s a uniform and I turned it in today when I tendered my resignation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?  Wha…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I took an oath when I was sworn in and I broke that oath today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [placing a coke can in front of Jim] Here. [Jim looks confused] Just buy it from me. I haven’t talked to you in hours and it’s been weird and I really want to know what the hell’s going on with Dwight. [Pam scoots the coke can towards Jim.  Jim pulls out his wallet and hands Pam a dollar.  He gives the coke back to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How much time do you have left on your break?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ten minutes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Since you did such a good job with the investigation, I decided to pull a few strings. Call in a few favors. and I’ve decided to make you official security supervisor of the branch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, sir.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s fantastic because I’ve always felt that the security here sucked .

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you wanna? Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Dwight K. Schrute, I hereby declare you an honorary voluntary corporal in charge of assisting all activities security.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Here’s your badge.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you, Michael. Very nice. Great. [To Hank]  Can I have a gun?

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: No, I don’t have a gun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I’ll have to bring in my bow staff.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: I don’t think so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [salutes] Thank you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Oh. Uh…[awkwardly salutes]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need to go over some details with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. [to Hank] Well, Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: First of all, Hank, how many orange traffic cones do you have?

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Two.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. What a terrible day to not be able to talk.  Dwight was literally carrying around his own urine and dressed like one of the Village People. Why does he do the things that he does for Michael?  I just don’t get it. What is he getting out of that relationship?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [growling] Nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do someone else.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, [gives Pam a look]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The eyebrow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m not only hoping to find the culprit who committed this heinous crime, I am praying to find this heinous culprit. And I will pray to Thor himself, if that’s what it takes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael’s behavior is erratic and unpredictable, but I don’t think he’s doing drugs. Maybe he should. Take the edge off. Uh, not at work, of course.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: People use marijuana to escape. Jim does not have a girlfriend. His sales are nothing to brag about. And he does not belong to any organized clubs. If that were my life, I’d do drugs.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: He asked if you’ve been acting withdrawn lately.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: And what did you say?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I said no.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Your turn, Stanley. [Stanley just takes a drink from his mug] Angela, you’re up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Last night? Let’s see.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go ahead. Don’t lie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I won’t. It’s just that last night is really hard for me to remember because I was just a teensy bit high. Should I have not said that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no. It’s okay. Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know that I shouldn’t have done it. But I was in the parking lot at the Quick and Easy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And I took a bong hit from my Bong Water with my pimp.
