quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Pam said you had something important to tell me. Is it bad? Am I getting fired? [Jim shakes head ‘no’] Why aren’t you telling me? It must be bad. They’re taking away my kid. I knew it. [Jim waves arms and shakes head ‘no’] They’re not taking away my kid. Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, sure, I can definitely help you with that. Okay? Please hold.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kelly Kapour. Say your prayers. Let’s go. Conference room, pronto. Come on, step it up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Drugs are everywhere in our society. They are omniscient. If you look at the amount of pot that was smoked in the United States last year, that would reach the moon.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly. I know. It’s amazing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, how could it reach the moon? Like, would you make it into a rope, or…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I have some hemp ropes at my house, they’re really strong…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut… Shut it. No. Just… Just focus on the facts. Cocaine. They use cocaine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, me? Just one of the gang. Sitting in the back, doodling, not playing attention. Bam! Pow! Surprise! Got you! [Note pad reads, “Creed -Shifty eyes / Ryan – Dilated pupils / Kelly – Hyperactive”] There’s a Volunteer Sheriff’s Deputy in your midst, and he is taking names.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One thing that you need to remember is that there’s no way of knowing who’s a user, who’s an abuser, because we don’t know. It could be anybody. Your instinct is to say it’s somebody-like Stanley or Oscar…

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no! Your instinct. That… Your gut reaction is to say that, but I don’t! That’s, that’s… Those are instincts that have been created by media and hype. And they are wrong. What I am saying is that you just do not know who drug users are. It may be the person you least suspect. It may be somebody hot, like Pam, or it could be somebody matronly, like Phyllis, but just not me.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It’s not me, either.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No? okay, fine.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on the phone] Michael, I’m gonna get going. I really don’t think I need to be in this meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, I really think that… [dial tone beeping]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Has she been on the phone the whole time?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Sorry you had to hear that. It was a lovers’ quarrel.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Make-up sex. Nice!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, let’s get personal for a second, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The scary thing is, it could have been any one of these people. They all had a motive. To get high.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, I made up some fliers for everybody to take on your way out, in case you’re ever tempted. So there you go. And, Dwight, you know, I’m very busy today. It wasn’t even planning on going to the bathroom, so I don’t even know if anything will come out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: just drink a lot of water.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You have to relax your muscles around the bladder.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t… Let’s just not talk about it, okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [reading from Michael’s flier] “Drugs:

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know, sometimes I wish we just didn’t have a conference room. [Kelly laughs] You know? He couldn’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: But then we wouldn’t have any meetings.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay. Bye, Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, my God. Oh, my God, oh, my God. Hello? Yes, I am so, so sorry. Yeah, actually, I don’t have that information just yet. Uh-huh. Listen, do you mind if I put you on a brief hold? Okay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I look forward to drug testing. I used to get a runner’s high, which is why now I swim.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Why would I be worried? I’m not a drug user. I would never abuse my body like that. I mean, they are plenty of other ways to have fun. My body is 100% drug-free.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [telephone ringing] Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam. Um, hold, please. [to Jim] There’s a Brenda on the phone for you. [to Brenda] Just one second, I’ll transfer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [telephone ringing] [shows note to camera “It’s OK. She’ll call back!”]

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: She’s got it up now.

quotes.speaker: Sheriff
quotes.text: He’ll be up. Okay, sure. I’ll get someone down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey. Hey. Jerry.

quotes.speaker: Sheriff
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sheriff Pierce? I’m turning in my badge.

quotes.speaker: Sheriff
quotes.text: Where sis you get that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I got it here.

quotes.speaker: Sheriff
quotes.text: No. No, you didn’t. we didn’t give you this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I mean at the gift shop. Also, I can’t wear this anymore.

quotes.speaker: Sheriff
quotes.text: You were never supposed to wear this in the first place, Dwight. Come on now, seriously, you got me concerned here a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, don’t worry. I never abused my power. I only tried to help the Sheriff’s Department in any way I could.

quotes.speaker: Sheriff
quotes.text: Right, well… Why don’t you give me a couple examples of ways that you’ve helped us out?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, God, there are so many. Roadside assistance, breaking up unruly parties, surveillance…

quotes.speaker: Sheriff
quotes.text: Surveillance?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Crowd control, directing traffic…

quotes.speaker: Sheriff
quotes.text: Mace! You… You’ve been carrying around weapons-grade Mace?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ve only had to use it once.

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
quotes.text: [tosses the butt of a joint in parking lot] We should get a pizza.

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #2
quotes.text: I hate pizza.

episodes.title: Conflict Resolution
episodes.description: When Michael takes over conflict resolution duties from HR, chaos ensues at Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So, uh… you found a band for your wedding yet?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: ‘Cause I’m in a band. We really rock.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean it’s inevitable. I definitely overhear some wedding preparation, but I’m fine with it. She hears me arranging my social life. And we both have to hear Dwight order deer urine over the Internet, so it evens out.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh I got the ‘Save The Date’.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, pretty stationery.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thanks!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I didn’t get mine yet.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There are a few people I decided not to invite, and that might make things kind of awkward but …  it’s my wedding. And I don’t want anyone there who has called me a hussy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, thanks, Fantastic Sam’s. Adult Cut Plus. Comes with a shampoo and blow dry. We’re doing I.D. photos today. Gotta represent.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Uh, on or off?

quotes.speaker: I.D. Photographer
quotes.text: Off.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay… [removes glasses]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh! What is on your face? Is that a disguise?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [leaving the room] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Clown paint.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I.D. badges are long overdue. Security in this office park is a joke. Last year, I came to work with my spud gun in a duffel bag. I sat at my desk all day, with a rifle that shoots potatoes at 60 pounds per square inch. Can you imagine if I was deranged?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s a nice tie.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is… who makes that?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, I don’t…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you mind if I wear that for the photo?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um…  let’s um, let’s keep our clothes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It’s like child abuse. I say, if Jesus saw that, he’d freak out! He’d freak out, Toby! I mean on some levels… it’s… and I’m supposed to work there. I’m supposed…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walking into the Conference room] What’s the dealio?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Just letting Oscar vent a little. We would use the break room, but the photographer’s back there today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s the problem?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It’s just a little dispute over a poster in their workspace.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Since Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So what, you’re having a little spat. I forget, are you guys dating?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, can I talk to you for a uh, second please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Here’s how I usually handle this: all I do is listen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: These things just have a way of working themselves out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It’s like if you write someone a letter, when you’re really angry… they say to keep it in a drawer for a couple days. Then you just never end up sending it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you know about conflict resolution? Your answer to everything is to get divorced. So…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay… what?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That was the right decision for me and my marriage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well… that’s not gonna fly here. Because in this office, it is till death do us part… assuming we don’t get downsized. [leans over to Pam] Uh, Pam, will you get Angela and meet us in the conference room please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holding up a binder] A mediator’s tool chest. Okay, well, before we get started, you should know that are 5 different styles of conflict.[in a comedic voice] My Shaolin temple style defeats your monkey style.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can we go? I have a lot of work to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Okay, this is important. The first style is lose/lose.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What’s the next one?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just hold on, please! Okay, if we do lose/lose, neither of you gets what you want. Do you understand? You… you would both lose. Now I need to ask you, do you want to pursue a lose/lose negotiation?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can we just skip to whatever number 5 is – win/win or whatever?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Win/Win is number four and number five is win/win/win. The important difference here is with win/win/win, we all win. Me too. I win for having successfully mediated a conflict at work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in front of poster] Okay, since this is the disputed poster. Now, one at a time, I want you to express your feelings using “I” emotion language and no judging or “you” statements.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I got this poster for Christmas, and I feel I want to see it everyday. It makes me feel like the babies are the true artists, and God has a really cute sense of humor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, seriously, that?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don’t like looking at it. It’s creepy, and in bad taste, and it’s just offensive to me. It makes me think of the horrible, frigid stage mothers who force the babies into it. It’s kitsch. It’s the opposite of art. It destroys art. It destroys souls. This is so much more offensive to me than hardcore porno. I’m talking about the…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay. Stop, stop, stop! Let’s see if we can just brainstorm and find some creative alternatives that are win/win.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Win!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Thank you, Pam. How about Angela makes the poster into a t-shirt, which Oscar wears. That way, he can never see it and whenever she looks at Oscar, she can see it. Win/win/win.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That’s… no…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay… well, brainstorm. Own the solution.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How about, I leave it up?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How ’bout, she takes it down?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about, Angela can keep it up on Tuesdays and Thursdays?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, that is called a compromise. And it is style 3. And it is not ideal. To sum up, win/win – make the poster into a t-shirt, win/lose – take the poster down, compromise – Tuesdays and Thursdays. And the answer is… make the poster into a t-shirt! Win/win.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Win.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: But, it…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [claps his hands twice] It is done!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Win

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: [snaps a photo of Creed, then Creed turns to the side for a profile shot] No, you’re all good.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Great. [gets up and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Angela.[hands her a Save The Date card] I didn’t have your zip code.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It was hand delivered. But, I did get a Save The Date after all. It’s not my taste.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You solved it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, good.  We can, uh, throw that one out. [shuffles through papers]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are those all the other complains?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Mmm-Hm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would like to see those please.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I… I can’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can’t do that, huh? Huh, ok. Now you and I have a conflict. I order you to give me that file.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That… [shakes head and places hand over the file]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [yanks the file away, despite Toby’s resistance] There! No more conflict. [looks at the camera] I had to use win/lose on that. It was not pretty. [looks back at Toby] All right… is that it?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [sighs and pulls out a box under his desk] It’s all Dwight’s.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Every Friday at 4, I have a standing appointment with Dwight for him to file a grievance against Jim. I tell him that I’m sending them to a special file in New York. That box is the special file in New York.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh… God. Alright. Why do I have to do everything?

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: Are you sure? [looks at Oscar, who is front of the camera, holding the baby poster in front of his chest]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, he’s sure. Just shoot.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: [shoots twice]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looking through papers in the complaint box] This is from Kevin. He says Stanley uses his Miracle Whip without asking. Meredith complains that everyone talks too loud in the morning and the lights are too bright. Creed… huh. Duh, duh. Creed is sick of looking at the redhead all day and wants a seat facing the receptionist.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You will notice that not one of these complaints is against me.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Actually, I have a separate folder for complaints against Michael. This [unlocks a drawer]is January through March of this year. [pulls out a fairly large folder]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How many of you have at one time gone to Toby to complain about another employee? [looks at all the employees, most of whom raise their hands] And… did you get what you wanted, or were you merely listened to, you forget about your problem, and you move on? [employees mumble “merely listen to and forgotten…” ] That is outrageous! I love this place… and it pains me to see all of the negativity festering… [sighs] Okay, today we are going to get everything out of these files and into the open, where it can be resolved. Alright, how about the Phyllis/Angela dispute?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You already did me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s what she said. [Jim mouths these words along with Michael] The thing is, Angela… you are in here an awful lot. You have complained about everybody in the office, except Dwight, which is odd because everyone else has had run ins with Dwight. Toby, by the way, what does “redacted” mean? There is a file full of complaints in here marked “redacted”… ?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, it just means whoever complained came to me later and withdrew it, so I took their name off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, ok. There were a bunch of complaints about Dwight that were put in the redacted file about six months ago.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa.. wha… wait. If someone has a problem with me, why would they withdraw it six months ago?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [notices Angela’s intense concern] Um… let’s move on. I volunteer. Did anyone have a problem with me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, Pamela. Come on down! Let’s do it! And [looks through the file]… okay. Just one complaint. Actually, it has been withdrawn. So that is no help to us. Next.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait, what did it say?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh… [reading]”Does she have to plan her wedding on office time? Couldn’t she do that at home?” [Pam looks Angela an angry look] Who else? Why don’t we just warm up first? Warm up emotionally, all right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have this kind of big secret about Angela. And I’ve been really nice to her… and I haven’t told anyone. And what the hell?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here is a Kelly complaint: “Ryan never returns my calls.” Ugh, join the club.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: My voicemail’s really spotty… sometimes…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I didn’t file a complaint. I was just talking.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: To your HR representative.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: To my friend, I thought. I want that withdrawn.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Fine, I’ll take your name off. [looks at Michael] So no one will know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [crumbles up the complaint paper] Makin’ progress. [Jim raises his hand] Yes?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight tried to kiss me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I didn’t tell anyone because I’m not really sure how I feel about it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is not true. Redact it. Redact it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I’m not actually making a formal complaint. I just really think we should talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, question. [looks at Toby] When a name is withdrawn, does that also apply to the permanent misbehavior file in New York?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley. [off camera]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [gets up and walks over to Angela, whispering to her] Hey. Thanks for ratting me out!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [still of camera] You got a lot of anger under there buddy. Come on start us out. Unleash it.

quotes.speaker: Anglea
quotes.text: I didn’t do it! [Michael and Stanley continue to talk off camera, but it’s inaudible]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I find that hard to believe… considering you have problems with every single person in this entire office except Bobblehead Joe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Someone complained that the men’s room is “whites only”. Stanley, you know that’s not true.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I didn’t say that.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Then why is there a picture of a white man on the door? [Michael, along with the camera, look at the standard stick man on the bathroom door.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Phyllis. You complained that Angela’s giving you dirty looks. And you tried to get off the party planning committee.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, I never said any such thing. Angela and I are close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And… also, Phyllis, Stanley says that you cry too much, and that bugs him.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Stanley and I are close, too.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We sit close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… ok.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [sits down for his ID picture] Just take it. [flashes goes off, while he is standing back up again]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can’t believe Angela. I went against my better judgment, and I gave her a Save The Date. And now it turns out she complained about me to Toby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it was redacted. Look, if she wants an invite, maybe she’s just trying to be friends.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don’t take her side.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sighs] Well, what does Roy think about everything?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t know. I try not to bother him about this kind of stuff.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You mean your thoughts and feelings?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah…

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I know you keep saying it’s your space, even though there’s no assigned parking, but I keep forgetting.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, that’s the problem.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I guess so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well… all settled, then.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [whispering to Angela] I don’t like you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, Ryan.  You told Toby that Creed has a distinct old man smell?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I know exactly what he’s talking about. I sprout mung beans on a damp paper towel in my desk drawer. Very nutritious. But they smell like death.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, Kevin. You are accused of making sexually suggestive remarks to Angela that made her feel uncomfortable. Solution:  Angela, you are to make sexually suggestive remarks to Kevin that will make him uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I accept your decision!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey… you know what, Dwight? Maybe we should get our photo I.D. taken together.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That doesn’t make any sense.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it saves time, you know. ‘Cause we could just meet in the parking lot every morning. Walk in together. Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: [to Dwight, who is sitting in front of the camera] Smile.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I never smile if I can help it. Showing one’s teeth is a submission signal in primates. When someone smiles at me, all I see is a chimpanzee begging for its life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This came out really well. [picks up Dwight’s I.D. from the laminating machine and hands it to Dwight] There you go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is humongous. I am not a security threat…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And my middle name is ‘Kurt’, not ‘Fart’.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What did I write?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have another complaint for Jim’s permanent file.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Talk to Michael. I gave him the box.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What box?!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: But I didn’t report your snoring-

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Wednesdays, tearful. Tuesdays… [Dwight walks in and rummages through his complaint box]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh. Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah… agh… dgh… Ahh! No, no! Four years of malfeasance unreported. This cannot stand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Calm down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No! You calm down! Who’s side is Toby on? Who’s side are you on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Him or me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Him or me? I cannot work with Jim anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Either he goes, or I go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You choose!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One of us is out of here by the end of today! [runs out]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… kay…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am not bluffing!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do the right thing here, Michael. Okay, I have served you loyally for years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I deserve this. You know I do!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [picks up Dwight’s I.D. and snickers] You know your I.D. says you’re a security threat?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You have till five.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, look, Jim. There’s a sales manager position open in Stamford. Want me to call Jan and tell her you’re interested? I could put in a good word for you, ’cause I’ll still be working here. Transfer! Transfer! Everybody! Transfer! Transfer! Transfer! Transfer!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay… you two, in the conference room with me. Nobody leaves until we work this out. Cage match!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cage matches? Yeah, they work. How could they not work? If they didn’t work, everybody would still be in the cage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, so Dwight, in your own words – [reads from complaint paper] “Someone replaced all my pens and pencils with crayons. I suspect Jim Halpert.” [flips to another paper] “Everyone has called me ‘Dwayne’ all day. I think Jim Halpert paid them to.”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] Yes! Five bucks each. And it was totally worth it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reading] “This morning, I found a bloody glove in my desk drawer and Jim Halpert tried to convince me I committed murder. I think he may be the real murderer.” [flips to another paper] “Jim Halpert said there was an abandoned infant in the woman’s room. When I went to save the child, I saw Meredith on the can.”  Gah. “This morning, I knocked myself in the head with the phone.”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That actually took a while. I had to put, uh, more and more nickels into his handset, till he got used to the weight, and then I just… took ’em all out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reading] “Every time I typed my name, it said ‘Diapers’.”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just a simple macro. You know, these actually don’t sound that funny one after another. But he does deserve it, though.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “By the end of the day, my desk was about two feet closer to the copier.”

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I just moved it an inch every time he went to the bathroom. And that’s how I spent my entire day that day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Japanese have this thing called shiatsu massage, where they dig into your body, very hard. And it is very painful. And apparently, some people throw up. But the next day they feel great. I’ve never had one. They sound awful.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe Stanford would be cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s a good market. Higher volume.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Maybe we should both go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have a girlfriend…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure you do, Dwight. Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, there’s like, 300 more of these. Let’s get to them later.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, you going to transfer Jim or not?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe, I haven’t decided yet. Let’s get to work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I want an answer by tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Oh… actually, tomorrow’s not good. How about later in the week?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Wait. How about a group picture while you’re here?

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: I can’t. I only get reimbursed for the I.D. photos.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well… that’s… what, a computer camera, right?

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: You mean digital?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’ll take like two seconds.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: 20 bucks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh… All right. Everybody, [looks around at the employees] come on. Group photo for the newsletter.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You gotta be kiddin’ me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, let’s go. Creed, Kevin, Oscar… andale! Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: One, two, three… smile. [camera flashes, but no one smiles] Try to smile.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We resolved a lot today, everybody. Think happy thoughts.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: Alright, I’m just gonna take it on three…  whether you smile or not. One, two, three. [camera flashes]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, let’s check that out. [looks at preview screen] Ew, okay, all right. One more. We’ll take one more.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: That’ll be another 20.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela, I want to talk to you about something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] You just press the button.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looks at to Jim] I am. [looks at Angela] It’s about the Save The Date.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, it wasn’t her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m the one who complained about you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I… I didn’t know that Toby was gonna write it down. [the camera flashes] I was just venting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] Okay, good. Check that out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, it was one day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] That’s terrible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I took it right back. It was like…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, dear.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] Let’s pay Mr. Price Gouger. [rejoins the group, on camera] Okay… we can do this. Come on, everybody. All right. Here we go. [flash goes off before he sits down]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was really hard getting a good picture of fifteen people. He would not give me a good discount. And eight tries added up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [flashback the photo being taken] One, two..[flash goes off] Didn’t say three, did I?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But, I’m sort of an expert at Photoshop, so it turned out fine in the end. When people work together, there is going to be conflict. You can’t outrun your problems.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on Pam’s answering machine] Hey, Pam… it’s Jim. Um, I have a doctor’s appointment in the city. So I probably won’t be in till the late afternoon. Just thought I’d let you know. Okay, bye. [camera shows Jim sitting on a waiting coach in another Dunder Mifflin office]

quotes.speaker: Female worker
quotes.text: Okay, Jan will see you now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And that is why the idea of a cage match is so universally appealing. But here’s the thing about cage matches: sometimes you have to open the cage. And that is something Toby will never understand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [elevator bell dings] What is this? What happened here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, this does not look good. Did anyone see what happened around my desk area this morning?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, I really think someone’s probably just playing a prank on you, so just go right through it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A prank, huh? This is official police line tape, okay? It’s not a prank.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Probably is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it, people! Someone must have seen something! [Jim’s cell phone beeping] Oh, you people are useless. Jesus.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [telephone ringing] Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam. Hold, please. Dwight, it’s the Sheriff. He said that it’s really important. It’s regarding your desk. I’ll transfer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, don’t! I can’t… [groans] [telephone ringing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just cut through it, man, it’s no big deal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is why I’m a Volunteer Sheriff’s Deputy and you’re not.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is not why. Wow, man, he really wants to get in touch with you. Maybe it’s a murder.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, there’s no blood.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe poison?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Possibly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [exclaiming in fear] No, Jim, no! [Jim knocks Dwight’s phone off its cradle] [yelling toward the phone] Sheriff, this is Volunteer Sheriff’s Deputy Dwight Schrute. Press the pound key! What’s your 20?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing much is happening today. We are having our photo IDs taken. Whoop-de-doo. Can’t always be like The Apprentice.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On Big Brother, something important happens every day. But real life is not like that.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: [Dwight slurping] Okay, here we go. One, two…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He sometimes wears glasses, write that down. Also, that may not be his real hair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I hate it when people don’t tell each other why they’re angry. My dad was like that. I would say, “What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad?” Over and over and over. And he would just look at me like I was an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m the one who petitioned the office board to have these ID badges taken.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: So there were no death threats?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me see your ID.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is this old story about two women who each think they are the mother of this baby. And they can’t decide, so they bring the baby to a wise man. Just like a manager in those days. And the wise man says, “I will adopt this baby and raise it as a Hindu.” See? They didn’t expect that. And that fixed it. Because I think he was the dad anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are dozens of old complaints in here. Cold cases, like the show. [imitating gonging] And Toby is a lazy detective who has decided that these armed robberies and rapes and murder/suicides are not important enough to solve. Well, you know what? I have a problem with that. And I’m going to open up these cases before Toby can kill or rape another person.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s not bad. Hey, do you do weddings?

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: Would you seriously want your wedding photos to look like that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not bad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I gave her a higher clearance than you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What does Level Red mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’d tell you, but then I’d have to kill you. [laughing maniacally]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wait. [puts eye drops in] [Photographer takes the shot and her eyes are  closed]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, wait. [put on a hat] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You must have misdialed. This is Phyllis. No, I’m not sure what his extension is. [glares at Stanley as he glares right back]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow! I never thought Dwight would go postal. It’s always the person you least expect and I always thought Dwight would go postal.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Come on, Dwight, I think it’s actually healthy to get it off your chest.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m done talking. I am a Schrute. We don’t back down.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You’re arrogant and pompous, and I don’t like you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “Cage Match”? I don’t know if it was in the packet from corporate, because I barely read any of it. So if you’re asking if I stole their idea, the answer is no.

quotes.speaker: Hank the Security Guard
quotes.text: Excuse me, sir! Dwight Schrute, is that your real name?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, sir.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Morning.

quotes.speaker: Hank the Security Guard
quotes.text: Good morning. Okay, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. [elevator door closes] No, come on… God!

episodes.title: Casino Night
episodes.description: The Dunder Mifflin crew holds a casino party at the warehouse and Michael has two dates.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight the Scranton Business Park is having Casino Night and we are converting our warehouse into a full-blown gambling hall. And I know it’s illegal in Pennsylvania, but it’s for charity. And I consider myself a great philanderer. It’s just… It’s nice to know at the end of the day, I can look in the mirror and say, “Michael, because of you, some little kid in the Congo has a belly full of rice this evening.” Makes you feel good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Excuse me. How long is the wait for a table for two?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I would never, ever serve you. Not in a million, billion years.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s a nice tux.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know. It belonged to my grandfather. He was buried in it, so family heirloom.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: So, what’s the deal? We gotta pay for our own drinks? That’s lame.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on, it’ll be fun, and besides, I’m a roulette expert.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Impossible. Roulette is not a game of skill, it is a game of chance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can always kind of win at roulette.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, really? Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How would you do that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mind control.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs] You can’t be serious. Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ever since I was a little kid, like, eight or nine, I could sort of control things with my mind.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t believe you. Continue.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was just little thing, you know, like I could make something shake or I could make a marble fall off the counter. You know, just little things.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] That’s ridiculous. You know what? Uh… Why don’t you move that coat rack? Excuse me, everyone! Attention in the office, please. Jim is about to prove his telekinetic powers and he needs absolute silence. Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I’ll try. [The coat rack wobbles] [Pam holds up an umbrella handle to the camera in another scene]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I try not to think of it as lagging behind. It’s more of a David-and-Goliath thing.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] Yeah, but… Well, the fact of the matter is that your branch is currently number four of the five branches that I oversee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Top 80 percent!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know that I’m very serious here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan, listen, I promise that I will kick it up a notch. Bam!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Emeril. Oh, actually, while I have you, not that I have you or have ever had you, but we’re having our Casino Night tonight and I think everyone would love to see their fearless leader here.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I thought that you were their fearless leader.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am, but you are the Eva Peron to my Cesar Chavez.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [laughs] I think you can handle it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, come on. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I think so, Michael…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, it’d be fun. I can hear it in your voice. You need a break.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Goodbye, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan and I understand each other. The romance thing is sort of on hold for the time being, but we’ve remained good friends. Good friends with privileges. Not now, some day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, everybody. Tonight’s event is to benefit the Boy Scouts of America.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Again? We do that every year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, they need our money. They don’t have cookies like the Girl Scouts.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It’d be nice to do something for people who are actually suffering.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Oscar, if you don’t like it, then you should concentrate on winning. Because the person at the end of the evening with the highest chip count will receive $500 to donate to the charity of their choice. And they will get a mini-fridge compliments of Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So get your charities in to Pam. I, for example, am playing for Comic Relief.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That doesn’t exist anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Comedy is very much alive, as are homeless people.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, they stopped making that show.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then, they need our money more than ever.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You have to pick an approved, non-profit organization.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: There’s a great soup kitchen in downtown Scranton. Delicious pea soup on Thursdays. I’ll probably give the money to them.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Something with animals. Or people.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Kobe Bryant has a foundation, and he is so hot. And he gave his wife the biggest diamond ring. I know he didn’t do it. …Maybe he did it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We are giving money that has been gambled. Why don’t we just deal drugs or prostitute ourselves,  and donate that money to charity?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, and another fun thing. We, at the end of the night, are going to give the check to an actual group of Boy Scouts. Right, Toby? We’re gonna…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Actually, I didn’t think it was appropriate to invite children since it’s… You know, there’s gambling and alcohol, and it’s in our dangerous warehouse and it’s a school night… And, you know, Hooters is catering. You know, is that enough? Should I keep going?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are you the way that you are? Honestly, every time I try to do something fun or exciting, you make it not… that way. I hate so much about the things that you choose to be. Okay, you know what? I will not donate my winnings to Comic Relief, since apparently it doesn’t exist. I am going to donate to Afghanistanis with AIDS.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you mean the aid to Afghanistan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I mean Afghanistanis with AIDS.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Afghani.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Afghani.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s a dog.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, that’s Afghan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s a shawl.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, canine AIDS?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Humans with AIDS.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Who has AIDS?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Guys, the Afghanistananies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, you know what? No. No. AIDS is not funny. Believe me, I have tried.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are certain topics that are off-limits to comedians, JFK, AIDS, the Holocaust. The Lincoln Assassination just recently became funny. “I need to see this play like I need a hole in the head.” [laughs] And I hope to someday live in a world where a person could tell a hilarious AIDS joke. It’s one of my dreams.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, nothing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: “Till Death Do Us Rock.”

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They’re wedding bands.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy was supposed to pick the band, but he’s concentrating more on the bachelor party now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, wait, where you going? I mean, even if you don’t hire a band, you still have to watch the bands. Pam, these are people who have never given up on their dreams. I have great respect for that. And, yes, they’re all probably very bad and that will make me feel better about not having dreams.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There’s a KISS cover band in here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let’s do it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m pretty happy these days. I’m getting married soon and I’m getting along with everybody at work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why did I talk to Jan about transferring? Well, you know… I have no future here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have already put down the deposit. Do you understand how a deposit works?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, I am not having fire-eaters in a paper warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s Casino Night like Las Vegas. There are fire-eaters all over the place.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Except my warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, actually, it’s my warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Actually, it’s owned by Beakman Properties, and Dunder Mifflin is four years into a seven-year lease.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are you here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When Darryl was coming, you said you wanted me here for protection.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not. I said, not that.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We just have a lot of stuff down there that could be stolen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s ironic.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That you are afraid.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Why? ‘Cause I’m from the hood?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dinkin’ flicka.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [sighs] Dinkin’ flicka.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I taught Mike some, uh, phrases to help with his interracial conversations. You know, stuff like, “Fleece it out.” “Going mach five.” “Dinkin’ flicka.” You know, things us Negroes say.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me some. [Michael and Darryl perform simultaneous hand gesture]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, I taught him a handshake, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim ejects a videotape from the VCR and puts in a new one] Wow. I don’t know how you’re gonna decide. They are all extremely good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think I should hire them all. Do like Lollapalooza.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Have three stages, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Your mom would love that. She would. Oh, this band is called Scrantonicity.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let’s take a look. Nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, wait. That’s Kevin. On the drums.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: On the drums! On the drums!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my God, that’s Kevin! Great song, Kev. Oh,  my God, he’s the drummer and the singer.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We really don’t do a lot of weddings. We actually don’t play in public very often. We are all really hoping that Pam’s wedding works out. This could be a turning point for the band.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. Oh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, you haven’t seen that since 1983. That is amazing. Okay, we have to sign him. I’m gonna call the label, we’re gonna…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No! No!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, Pam, you’re gonna lose him to another wedding.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, come back! No, no, no!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kev!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim is great. Being with him just takes away all the stress of planning my wedding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [phone rings] Yes

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [phone rings] Michael, Carol Stills for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Carol Stills.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I know a Carol Stills?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Your realtor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, put her through. Hey Carol, how goes the real estate biz? Is it real good?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s still me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes I don’t put Michael through until he’s already said something. I look at it as a practice run for him. He usually does better on the second attempt.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Carol, you’re on with Michael.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, Carol. How you doing?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: I’m great. I just needed one last signature for your mortgage insurance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey, no problemo. Incidentally, I love the place.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Great. It has a little bit of a weird smell. It’s okay. At Christmas, the tree helped.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Oh, good, I’m glad. Can I drop it over later?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Actually, I’m sort of hosting this charity thing in our warehouse, Casino Night.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, it’ll be good. You know what? Why don’t you come by? Bring the papers, I’ll sign them and then you can stay and have a drink.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: To the casino thing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. It’ll be fun. What do you…[phone rings] What do you…

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Could you hold on? Yes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, Jan’s on line two.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, put her through. [Deep voice] Jan Levinson, I presume?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s still me. Uh, Jan, here’s Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Jan. How you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know, I… I thought about it and you are right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I could use a little fun. So, I am going to drive up for your Casino Night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Incidentally, what is the charity?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: AIDS.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, then. I will see you tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Bye-bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bye Hello, Carol? Hi, sorry about that. I just…

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: No problemo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: To answer your question…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: I’d love to go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: I have to get a sitter, but that shouldn’t be a problem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Problem. Good.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: And I’ll bring the papers, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, All right. Sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: I’ll see you tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Two queens on Casino Night. I am going to drop a deuce on everybody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [People playing casino games as the actual Casino Night begins] Oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah! That’s great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Carol.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You look great.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Thanks. Thank you for inviting me. It looks so great in here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well… Kiss. [Michael kisses her on the cheek, pauses and then kisses her on the other cheek] That’s how we do it in the paper biz. It’s European and… Yes? Ah, Dwight [Kisses cheeks]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Code name Re/Max is here. No sign of Lan Jevinson.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m Michael’s wingman. I’ve got his back. Two dates. He’s got two dates tonight. My job is to keep Jan away from Carol and vice versa. Michael said, “We must deceive them, so as not to hurt them, and in that way, we honor them.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can I get you a drink? The food is from Hooters.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Drink would be good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh, I steal things all the time. It’s just something I do. I stopped caring a long time ago. You should see how many supplies I’ve taken from this place. Honestly, I love stealing things.

quotes.speaker: Billy’s Girlfriend
quotes.text: I’m gonna get a drink. Do you need anything?

quotes.speaker: Billy
quotes.text: No, I’m fine. Thank’s sweetheart.

quotes.speaker: Billy’s Girlfriend
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Billy, your nurse is hot.

quotes.speaker: Billy
quotes.text: That’s my girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your nurse became your girlfriend? Sweet.

quotes.speaker: Billy
quotes.text: She was never my nurse. I met her at Chili’s. She was my waitress.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Chili’s is great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welkommen, Bienvenue, and welcome to Monte Carlo! Dwight. I am no longer your boss. Lady Fortune is your boss.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [Under his breath] Will Lady Fortune give me a raise?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut it, shut it, shut it. Will Lady Fortune be your mistress? Only time will tell, my friends. Leave all your preconceived notions about casinos at the door. Old friends, new lovers, and the disabled!  Welcome all! Great, okay. Shuffle up and deal. Let’s get it started! Black-Eyed Crows.

quotes.speaker: Dealer
quotes.text: Okay, the game is No-Limit Texas Hold’em. Good luck, everybody. That’s at least four red chips to you, sir.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All-in. [Other players fold their hands]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bluffing is a key part of poker, which is too bad, because I’m not very good at bluffing. Did you believe me?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I’ll call.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are… That’s insane.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I have good cards.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Toby, I went all-in on the first hand, so doesn’t that tell you that I might have good cards, too? So don’t be stupid. Just take it back.

quotes.speaker: Dealer
quotes.text: No, I’m sorry. He can’t, sir. He’s gone all-in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, all right, whatever.

quotes.speaker: Dealer
quotes.text: Flip them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You really screwed that up. [Michael leaves]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don’t really play cards, but I’m not gonna lie to you. It felt really good to take money from Michael. Gonna chase that feeling.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I expect to do very well tonight. I have an acute ability to read people. Jim, for instance, has a huge tell. When he gets a good hand, he coughs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [coughs] I will raise. [Dwight sighs and folds his cards] Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s the weirdest thing. Every time I cough, he folds.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Wow, bad luck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, whatever. Hey, you know what? If luck weren’t involved, I would always be winning. [Sees Jan] Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, okay, I think we’re all adults here, and it has always been my understanding that we have an open relationship.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What are you… Just… Wait, what’re you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: After you said you weren’t coming, I invited Carol to come and I don’t think that I did anything wrong.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No. No, you didn’t. Hi, I’m Jan. I’m Michael’s boss.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Hi, hi.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Does anyone want a drink?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: No, I’m good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay. [Carol stares at Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. What…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jan’s here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Give me the dice.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Come on, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Billy
quotes.text: It’s all on you, baby. Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Good evening, Dwight. What is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Evening, Angela. This is craps. I need to roll an eight. If I do, everyone wins.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Then roll an eight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Good luck, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah! Yeah! [Kisses Angela, she slaps him and walks away smiling]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dwight, let’s keep it going. Let’s keep it going. Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Let it ride. Let it all ride.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Give me the dice!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: “Yeah, right,” what?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What was this? [Makes face]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Laughs] I have good cards.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mhmm, And I’m gonna take you all-in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. I think you’re bluffing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, I think she’s full of it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Straight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Three nines.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Pam. Jim Halpert, ladies and gentlemen.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you very much. It was fun.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Cosmopolitan, please.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Can I get a red wine? So, two hours? That’s a long drive.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, it’s part of the job, you know? Keep an eye on things. So… Why not? So, how long have you and Michael been…

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Oh, well, actually, I guess this would be our first date. I guess.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Casino Night in the warehouse. Good sport.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Well, I’m having a nice time.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, me too. Me too.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: One beer and one Seven and Seven with eight maraschino cherries, sugar on the rim, blended if you can.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, that’s still going on, huh? You and Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Dealer
quotes.text: The point is four. Shooter, roll it. Four!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, shooter!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Four! [Holds dice in front of Carol] Blow. Blow for luck! Yeah! Also, you. Not playing favorites. [Holds dice in front of Jan] All right, here we go!

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Dealer
quotes.text: Five.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So close. So close.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on. [Turns to Jan] So where you staying? Radisson?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Super 8?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, I…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Motel 6? Best Western?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I didn’t… I don’t know…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Holiday Inn? The Hyatt in Wilkes-Barre? You staying with Michael?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I won the 2002 $2,500 No-Limit Deuce-to-Seven-Draw Tournament at the World Series of Poker in Vegas. So, yeah… I’m pretty good at poker.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: All-in.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay, let’s do it.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Good Luck, honey.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, thank you, Bobby. But it doesn’t matter, it’s just fun to play.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Three queens.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nice, very nice.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I have an ace.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, that’s a flush.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, I have a flush!

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Look, I won! Look I have all the clovers! You wanna play again?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I suck.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: She took you down, huh?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I do not want to talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, I saw your tape. Your band, Scrantonicity? You guys rock.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah, you guys wanna play our wedding?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Awesome. Did Pam say it was okay?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Whatever. I’m in charge of the music.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dude, you will not be sorry.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Sweet. All right.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Smoke?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, thanks. You having fun?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Fabulous time. I drove two and a half hours to get here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, we all really…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Left work early, drove down here. And I am completely underdressed

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I think you look great.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Why did I hook up with Michael?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, why did you?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It was very late, Jim. Very… Very late and… Have you given any more thought to the transfer?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good. Have you told anyone?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, you should.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Excuse me. Big moment. The evening’s chip leader and winner of this beautiful mini-refrigerator courtesy of Vance Refrigeration, Creed Bratton, Dunder Mifflin!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Thanks. I never owned a refrigerator.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Sorry, babe. I am just beat.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s okay. I’ll see you at home.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Okay. Hey, don’t try to lose too much money, all right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: If you still want a honeymoon. Hey, Halpert. Keep an eye on her, all right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, will do.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: See you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye! Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, how’s it going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good, especially after I took all your money in poker.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Hey, can I talk to you about something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: About when you want to give me more of your money?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you wanna do that now? We can go inside. I’m feeling kind of good tonight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was just… I’m in love with you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m really sorry if that’s weird for you to hear, but I needed you to hear it. Probably not good timing, I know that. I just…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you doing? What do you expect me to say to that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just needed you to know. Once.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I um… I… I can’t.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You have no idea…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …what your friendship means to me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on. I don’t wanna do that. I wanna be more than that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can’t. I’m really sorry if you misinterpreted things. It’s probably my fault.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not your fault. I’m sorry I misinterpreted our friendship.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hey. I’m leaving.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, okay.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So, I just wanted to congratulate you on a fantastic evening. You did the company proud.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And thanks for inviting me. You were right, I needed it. So, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Thanks for coming.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: You, too.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And you guys have a good time together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Talk to you Monday.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good night. She’s a good boss.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: She seems really nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, she’s great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Love triangle. Drama. All worked out in the end, though. The hero got the girl. Who saw that coming? I did. And Jan was really happy for me. So actually the hero got two girls. He got the girl that he works with and he got the girl that he buys real estate from. So, I’ve got my New York girl and my local flavor. Life is good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [On phone] About 10 minutes ago. No, I didn’t know what to say.  Yes, I know.  Um, I don’t know, mom, he’s my best friend.  Yeah, he’s great.  Yeah, I think I am. [Jim enters] I have to go. I will. Listen, Jim… [They kiss]

quotes.speaker: Deleted Scene 1 Michael
quotes.text: Everybody, in the conference room now, please. Thank you. Time is money.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you need anything?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Should I get water or donuts?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, let’s go. Take a seat.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What’s going on, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want somebody to give me the name of one of our biggest competitors.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Office Depot!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Yes, that will work. All right. Now I need a plural noun. [All groaning]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Apparently Michael has come up with a Dunder Mifflin Mad Lib, and he’s making us play it with him. We are so happy. No. I’d like to choose a different adjective.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How about a location?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The planet Caprica.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where the hell is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s from Battlestar Galactica.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, all right.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I am going back to my desk…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. No, no, not until you give me an adjective.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Annoying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We already have that. So…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Frustrating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Toby, damn it, come on! We already have that. I need something fun. Something like fat or smelly. Or pukey. Pukey. Pukey’s good. Okay. Pukey. Now I need a noun.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Thank you, Phyllis. That wasn’t so hard. All right, here we go. “Office Depot is an annoying store. One day Creed went there to buy paper. And he ran into irritating Cylons.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, get them, Creed!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “One of them was named Michael Scott, and he was an…” Oh, damn it. Okay. Okay, okay, we’re… Okay, we’re starting over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My charity is the Farm Defense Fund. It’s one of the best organizations that fights infestation of the beet armyworm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My charity is the Lackawanna County Volunteer Sheriff’s Department, because Dwight’s a Volunteer Sheriff. So I thought this was a perfect opportunity to support/mock him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t believe that Jim moved that coat rack. But if he did, he has an obligation to use his gift wisely. With great power comes great responsibility. They could do a cross-section of his brain to find out more. But I don’t think it’s true, though.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, if anything goes missing, we will reimburse.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah. Can Dunder Mifflin afford that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dang! Paper making paper, I.e. money.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Paper money. [clears throat] Yeah. The company’s doing fine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, we’re not shipping as much as we did last year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Okay. You know what? Don’t even think. I command you to just go down and have fun tonight. All right? Don’t think about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Our numbers are down, yes, but we have a heck of a crew here in Scranton. Hardworking, motivated, dynamic. Every single last one of them. They follow my lead. I sort of set the tone. And it doesn’t hurt that my ex works for corporate. Jan loves this branch, and I think that’s really more than half the battle.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It is extremely stressful, planning a wedding by yourself. It’s like a job. I mean, it’s fun, but it kind of becomes like work. I’ve already planned it all out in my head. But it’s just in my head.

quotes.speaker: Meredith’s Vet
quotes.text: Hey. Meredith, right?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh, God. Oh, no. I have this problem all the time. I never remember people I’ve had sex with.

quotes.speaker: Meredith’s Vet
quotes.text: I’m your vet.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh, right.

quotes.speaker: Meredith’s Vet
quotes.text: And we had sex in the parking lot.

episodes.title: Gay Witch Hunt
episodes.description: Michael apologizes to Oscar, after he finds out he's gay, for calling him a homosexual slur--but his apology outs Oscar to the entire office. And Jim decides to take a promotion at the Stamford office.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, I’m not a temp anymore.  I got Jim’s uh, old job.  Which means at my 10 year high school reunion it will not say “Ryan Howard is a temp.” It will say “Ryan Howard is a junior sales associate at a mid-range paper supply firm.  …that’ll show ’em.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [after “the kiss”] You have no idea how long I’ve wanted to do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Me too.  …I think we’re just drunk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No I’m not drunk.  Are you drunk?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No… [Jim leans in for another kiss] Jim—

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you really gonna marry him?  [Pam nods] …Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sobbing] Jim is gone.  He’s gone.  I miss him so much.  Ooooh I cry myself to sleep, Jim!  [serious] False.  I do not miss him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No!  That is the fun of this place.  I call everybody “faggie”. Why would anybody find that offensive?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: OK I think Oscar would just like if you used “lame” or something like that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s what faggie means!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No not really…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Apparently you called Oscar “faggie” for liking the movie Shakespeare in Love more than an action movie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It wasn’t just an action movie, it was Die Hard!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: All right Michael, but Oscar’s really gay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I mean for real.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I know.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, I mean he’s attracted to other men.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, a little too far, crossed the line.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: OK, I am telling you, Oscar is an actual homosexual.  Yeah, he told me this morning.  And, obviously he hopes he can count on your discretion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would have never called him that if I knew.  You don’t… You don’t call retarded people “retards”.  It’s bad taste.  You call your friends “retards” when they’re acting retarded.  And I consider Oscar a friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen man, I am so sorry.  I had no idea.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, it’s fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  No it’s not.  I feel terrible about it.  I have been calling people “faggie” since I was in junior high, and I have never made this mistake.  If I don’t know how to behave, it is because I am just so far the opposite way, you know?  I’m just… I, I can’t even imagine… the… thing.  Maybe we could go out for a beer sometime.  And you could tell me… how… you do that to another dude.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That sounds like a great, wonderful idea, let’s do that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [in reference to Oscar being gay] It explains so much.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, I’m not gay.  And I don’t understand why anyone would think, that I’m gay… if… [sighs] Uh… yeah I’m gay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can’t say whether Dunder Mifflin paper is less flammable, sir, but I can assure that it is certainly not more flammable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why did I transfer to Stamford?  I think that’s pretty obvious.  I got promoted!  And you can’t beat that view… right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Big Tuna!  You’re single right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh-huh, yeah.  I am.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She’s pretty hot huh? [Jim nods]  She’s completely crazy.  Steer clear Big Tuna.  Head for open waters.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OooOK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OooOK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I ate a tuna sandwich, on my first day.  So, Andy started calling me Big Tuna.  …I don’t think any of them actually know my real name.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Big Tuna is a super ambitious guy, you know?  Cut your throat to get ahead kind of guy, but I mean I’m not threatened by him.  I went to Cornell, you ever heard of it? [laughs]  I graduated in four years.  I never studied once.  I was drunk the whole time, and I sang in the acappella group, “Here Comes Treble.”

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: So, end of day we are going to have a little diversity policy refresher, because of some more problems at the Scranton branch.  And I have a list of business startups I got from the chamber.  Yes, I am going to need someone to cold call them.
