quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I can do that.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Jim’s nice enough.  I dont… I don’t know how well he’s fitting in here. He’s always looking at the camera like this.  [makes classic “Jim”-camera face] What is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can you tell who’s gay and who’s not?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What about Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Absolutely not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, he is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, he’s not dressed in women’s clothes, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [deep sigh] There could be others…  I need to know.  I don’t want to offend anybody else.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You could assume everyone is, and not say anything offensive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I’m sure everyone would appreciate me treating them like they were gay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, what about Angela?   She’s hard and severe.  She could be a gay woman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I really don’t think so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know, I can imagine her with another woman, can’t you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [creepy smile]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do some research.  Find out if there’s a way to tell by just looking at them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim told me you could buy gay-dar online.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah probably.  He didn’t tell the truth a lot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Let’s call him and get the website.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What’s gay-dar?  Oh, oh, gay-dar, yes!  No, uh, I think they have it at Sharper Image.  Oh, you know what?  I could check for you.  No problem.  [loudly fake typing]  It’s sold out!  Yeah sorry about that, that’s a bummer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, they’re sold out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn.  [thinks]  I’ll try Brookstone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I miss that.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Chicken or fish?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [loud sigh] Chicken.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: So you havin’ a good day?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Excellent, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Good, glad.  OK.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I didn’t go through with the wedding.  I got cold feet, a few days before.  And I can’t really explain it.  I just had to get out of that relationship.  We still had to pay for all the food.  So we froze it.  But I’m, I’m doing well.  I have my own apartment.  I’m taking art classes.  And I have lunch for the next five weeks.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: After Pam dumped me, I um, I kinda stopped taking care of myself there, and uh, I hit bottom when uh, drunk driving arrest.  I’ve been working out and um, you know, I’m not gonna take her for granted.  I gotta win her back.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I got them a toaster.  They called off the wedding and gave the toaster back to me.  I tried to return the toaster to the store, and they said they no longer sold that kind of toaster.  So now my house has got two toasters.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That is so cool that you’re gay.  I totally underestimated you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes I’m super cool.  I am an accountant at a failing paper supply company, Scranton.  Much like, um, sir Ian McClellan.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sure, sometimes I watch Will and Grace… and I want to throw up.  It’s terribly loud.  I do like it sometimes when Harry Connick Jr. is on.  He’s so talented.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK.  Who put my calculator in Jello?  Good one.  But uh, seriously, guys who did this?  Seriously guys, who did this?  I need to know who put my calculator in Jello, or I’m gonna lose MY FRICKIN’ MIND!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know, it’s amazing to me that in this day and age, you could be so obtuse about sexual orientation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I watch the L Word.  I watch, Queer as F***, so…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: That’s not what it’s called.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: OK, Michael, are you aware that you ousted Oscar today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?  What does that even…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Coming out, is a significant moment for a gay person, and they should be allowed to select the timing and manner of announcing it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, gay pride, right? Gay pride parade?  It’s not like gay… shame festival.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: All right, now Oscar’s feeling discriminated against by his co-workers, primarily Angela, and um, that’s your fault.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think Angela might be gay.  Could Oscar and Angela be having a gay affair?  Maybe!  Is that what this is about?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: NO!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t kn–

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, it’s not possible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Anything’s possible.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know, imagine… you were gay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] Well, I’m not gay Jan, and you should know that better than anybody!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, your immaturity is extremely disappointing and may even lead to a lawsuit which is the absolute last thing this company needs right now.  Do you understand?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The company has made it my responsibility today to put an end to 100,000 years of being weirded out by gays.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Am I the first gay man you ever knew?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Trick question!  Cause you can’t always tell, so… how would I know.  Is that the right answer?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, Dwight’s looking at gay pornography on his computer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, Michael knows Pam.  He asked me to do this just for him.  He has his own reasons.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looking at gay porn] Nothing wrong with this stuff.  At all.  This is fine.  You know what.  Gay porn, straight porn, it’s all goooooood!  I don’t particularly get into this.  But uh, you know what.  I totally see the merit!  And actually… it is quite beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah damn pop-ups.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What are you doing?!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Watching some of your friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [yelling] All right, everybody in the conference room!  I don’t care if you are gay, or straight, or a lesbian, or overweight!  JUST GET IN HERE!  RIGHT NOW!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you know that gay used to mean happy?  When I was growing up it meant lame.  And now it means a man, who makes love… to other men.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’re all homos!  Homosapiens.  Gays aren’t necessarily who you think they are, people.  I mean anybody could be gay.  Business-men.  Like antique dealers, or hairdressers, or… accountants.  Oscar, why don’t you take this opportunity to officially come out, to everybody here.  However you want to do it.  Go ahead.  Stand up.  I’m doing this for you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes I’m gay.  And I didn’t plan on sharing that part of my life with you today, so, whatever.  Can I sit down now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who should be the judges and juries of our society?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Judges and juries!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, that’s a good point.  She has a good point.  Because gay marriage currently is not legal, under U.S. law.  I bet a lot of straight men wish that applied to them.  So they could go out there and have some torrid unabashed monkey sex as much as they could.  You know?  Sounds pretty good, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think all the other office gays should identify themselves, or I will do it for them.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No one else in this office is gay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What about Phyllis?  She makes absolutely no attempt to be feminine!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’m getting married to Bob Vance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s great.  Congratulations Phyllis.  That is great, and frankly kiiiiiiiind of amazing!  [laughs] See?  Everybody has a chance!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But still, Phyllis, in college?  Did you ever experiment with other women?  A lot of women do!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, you knew me in high school.  Course, we all thought you were gay in high school.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] Right!  [serious] And I take that as a compliment.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well with your ties and your matching socks and —

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I just like to look good OK, so —

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You sound pretty defensive Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I am just coming out myself.  I am coming out hetero!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I think the problem with this office is that you are sending mixed signals about my being here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No no no.  The only signal that I am sending is:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, if I was gay, I would be the most flamboyant gay you have ever seen.  I would be leading the parade covered in feathers, and just… I would be waving that rainbow flag.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don’t think I can work here any longer.  This has been the worst, most backwards day of my life.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You misunderstand– OK.  You know what, OK.  I uh, I’m gonna put my money where my mouth is.  You ready?  I am going to embrace Oscar.  You might want to watch this Angela, because you can’t catch anything.  Here we go.  We are going to make a statement.  You and I are going to make a statement together.  Oscar is my friend —

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I would rather not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …and I just don’t care who sees it, doesn’t bother me!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, NO!  I don’t want to touch you, ever consider that?  You’re ignorant, and insulting, and small!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, um… sorry.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael… I’m sorry.  That was a good idea.  Come on, come on. [Oscar and Michael hug]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sobbing] I’m sorry I called you faggie.  You’re not faggie.  You’re a a good guy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael appears to be gay too.  And yet he is my friend.  I guess I do have a gay friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [embracing Oscar]You know what, I’m going to raise the stakes.  I want you to watch this.  And I want you to burn this into your brains.  Because this is an image that I want you people to remember for a long time to come.  Whenever you come into the office I want you to think about this.  [awkwardly kissing Oscar]  I did it.  See.  I’m still here.  We’re all still here. [everyone claps]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Dwight gets up to kiss Oscar]  Oh come on!  Dwight!  Come on, man!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are not in the playground anymore.  There are new rules.  We have to be mature.  But we can’t lose the spirit of child like wonder.  What is love…  anyway?  Maybe it’s supposed to break all the rules.  Like me and Jan.  Or Oscar… and some guy.  Life is short.  When two people find each other, what should stand in their way?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am glad that today spurred social change.  That’s part of my job as regional manager.  But you know what?  Even if it didn’t, at least we put this matter to bed.  …that’s what she said.  Or he said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, there’s Gill.  Oscar’s roommate.  I wonder if he knows?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I was going to quit.  But Jan offered me a three month paid vacation and a company car.  All I had to do was sign something saying I won’t sue.  Gill and I are going to Europe.  Kids, sometimes it pays to be gay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [reading the note with the gay-dar]  “Hope this helps.  -Jim”  Nice!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Dwight is running the gay-dar over Oscar’s body]  What are you doing?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shhh.  Don’t be scared.  [gay-dar beeps over Oscar’s belt buckle, Dwight smiles] It works.  [gay-dar goes off next to Dwight’s belt buckle]  …oh no.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on speakerphone] Okay, what is your goal for after lunch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will do my job to the best of my abilities.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [under breath] Heaven help us. [aloud] Specifically.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will do my regional manager job to the best of my capability.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Specifically, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Specifically, Jan, I will make at least ten phone calls to clients.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I have to begin every day by letting Jan know what I intend to accomplish, and then I have to call her at the end of the day to tell her what I did accomplish. But it’s not mandatory. It’s something that I… wanted to do… and so it’s voluntary, really. Even though she… makes me. I think she just wants to hear my voice. Because we’re no longer lovers, and she’s just hurting. But things are going well with Carol. I’ve seen her seven times in the last few months, and I’m growing very fond of her kids. Tommy, who I call Tomas, and the little girl…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on speakerphone] Are you on the toilet, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [quietly] No.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I know sometimes you are and… that you wouldn’t tell me, so I’m just going to assume that you are, and call me back when you’re finished.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [Jan hangs up. Toby opens the office door.]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sigh]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, honey.  You holding up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m… painting my new apartment tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, good. By yourself?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aw. Well, hang in there, okay?  You know what? You should get one of this big body pillows. That way you wouldn’t miss you-know-who so much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Roy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do I think? I think everybody should stay out of everybody’s personal business!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes, I’m gay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [shocked expression]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Why are all the best-looking single men always gay?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Big Tuna. You ever Google Google? What do you think would happen?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let’s find out. [starts typing]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [makes frustrated noises]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh! Lots of results.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I didn’t mean you should do it. You were supposed to ponder it. It’s… You removed the fun. Thanks a lot, Big Tuna.

episodes.title: The Convention
episodes.description: Michael and Dwight go to a convention in Philadelphia and run into Jim, and Michael becomes jealous of Jim's relationship with his new boss. Meanwhile, Pam gets ready for her first date since her engagement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you see Oprah yesterday?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I didn’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I, uh… I am going to be a father.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What was Oprah about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Angelina Jolie was on. And she adopted a baby from Asia, and she said that it changed her life. And that really inspired me. So, I want you to look into seeing how much a little Chinese baby would cost.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s a really big decision.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe you should wait before you adopt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Or not adopt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just do it, okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy’s sister looked into it, and the application alone costs a thousand dollars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um… find out if there’s a cheaper, less expensive baby out there, okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, she also said the waiting list is like eight months.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Eight months?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t even know if I’ll want a baby in eight months.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You probably won’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, Pam? If in ten years, I haven’t had a baby, and you haven’t had a baby…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Twenty years.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thirty.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s a deal.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: All right. Three pairs of pants. Three pairs of socks. Three packs of condoms.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yesh.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, fun jeans.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right there. Ah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sign.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Per diem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guess where I am going. I will give you a hint. It is a booze-fueled sex romp, where anything goes. You are correct, sir! I am headed to Philadelphia for the Annual Northeastern Mid-Market Office Supply Convention. And Jim Halpert is going to be coming, which will be fun. Poor little guy. He’s been stuck working under Josh, the poor man’s Michael Scott, as he is known around my condo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t be mad, it is a business trip.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: But I don’t understand. It’s for managers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Monkey, I am an A. R. M., Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I know! It… I was just really hoping we could spend some time together. [A long silence.] Are you still there?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, Monkey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don’t “Monkey” me! You can’t wait to get out of here, A. R. M.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: In the Martin family, we like to say, “Looks like someone took the slow train from Philly.” That’s code for “check out the slut.” What is… why are there flies in here?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God! Are you so excited for tonight? I am so excited. You guys are going to click, I can feel it. So what are you wearing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You look so pretty.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, I have a date. He’s a cartoonist for the local paper, which is really neat, because I like to draw too. I’m kind of nervous. I haven’t been on a first date in nine years… probably shouldn’t broadcast that.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, remember, no matter how much you may want to, do not sleep with him on the first date. It gives him all the power.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sleep with who? Whom, whom… whom?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: My neighbor Alan. They’re going on a date tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow! Oh my God, I have a great idea. You know what you should do to be hilarious? Wear your wedding dress. It would be a great icebreaker.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And your veil.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, do it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’ll probably just wear this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? Okay. Well, word of advice:

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: There’s my girl. I noticed you handing out some shekels. How would one get on that train?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That was for per diem, for Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: That town smells like cheese steaks.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That town is full of history!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Andrea’s the office bitch. You’ll get used to her. [introducing himself] Creed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I have my neck pillow back? Michael! Can I have my neck pillow back?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Hey, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Josh, how ya doing?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good to see you. There he is! There’s the traitor! Traitor! Traitor! Come here, you. Come here! Yeah! The product… the progidal… my son returns.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was shocked when he told me he was transferring to Stamford. It’s like the firemen. You don’t leave your brothers behind, even if you find out that there is a better fire in Connecticut.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s really good to see you, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! Wow, I didn’t expect that. It’s good to see you too!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, hey, how’s it going up there? Have you made any sales yet?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, sold about forty thousand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shut up. That’s impossible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it’s not. I did. Yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, I did it too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, when I saw Dwight, I realized how stupid and petty all those pranks I pulled on him were. And then he spoke. I wonder how hard it would be to get a copy of his room key.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So did you hear?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Pam’s back on the market again.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Really? She’s dating?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: If I weren’t engaged, I would so hit that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So what kind of commissions you get up there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, Dwight. I’ve missed you so much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re so immature!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Listen, Michael, I heard you were a great salesman.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: And I just want to let you know that if our branch absorbs your branch, I’m going to look for a place for you at Stamford.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, hey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We all checked in?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Great, let’s dump our stuff and meet back here in half an hour.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan? Look, I think we need to set some ground rules.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The eight-hundred pound gorilla in the room. Carol. I’m still dating her, so nothing can happen between us at the convention.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Step away from me, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you for being so brave with all of this. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Alan’s cartoon is so funny, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And they’re, like, so smart. I don’t even know what they mean half the time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This party is going to be awesome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know! That is specifically why I chose a room close to the elevator. More foot traffic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Check it out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is crooked on that side.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is a lot of liquor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And a dart board.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that’s how we do it in Scranton. Or did you forget? There ain’t no party like a Scranton party, ’cause a Scranton party don’t stop.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: We should probably head on down and hook up with Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, well, we have time! One for the road, gentlemen?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: A shot of MIDORI, perhaps.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, no, sorry, it’s an inside joke. There’s this bartender at Stamford who, uh… you know what? You’d just have to be there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wish I was. I love inside jokes. I’d love to be a part of one someday.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Um, we should…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, see you guys down there. Change your mind, come back up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ll do a shot, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh, that would be gross. It’s not even lunch yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: SWAG! Stuff we all get. I basically decorated my condo for free with all of my SWAG.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check it out. Hi, I’m Michael Scott, Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager, Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Jerome Bettis
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m a huge fan.

quotes.speaker: Jerome Bettis
quotes.text: Thanks. I appreciate it, guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? I’m having a huge blowout tonight, Room 308. Hope you can come.

quotes.speaker: Jerome Bettis
quotes.text: All right, maybe. If I can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, cool! Okay, so… can I tell people you’re gonna be there?

quotes.speaker: Jerome Bettis
quotes.text: No, you cannot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So maybe. See ya.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why do they call him The Bus?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because he’s afraid to fly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Smile!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you remember me from last year? There’s a party in my room, 308, can’t miss it, right off the elevator. Tonight. Be there!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: All right, Jan just emailed me. She wants us to meet her up front.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep. Yeah, she’s up front.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don’t have email on your phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t have to, I just know. Yes, hello?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No one just called you.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, nice meeting you, Ted. Take care.

quotes.speaker: Ted
quotes.text: I’ll see you soon.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Yeah, stop by later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [into phone] See you in a bit. Bye-bye. [to Dwight] May I have a moment of your time please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need you to do something for me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. Anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to dig up some dirt on Josh. Find out if there are any skeletons in his attic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’ll talk to my buddy down at the station, stat.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey! What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It’s, uh… I was… might ask if you wanted…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [answering phone] Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam. He’s not in the office. Can I take a message? I will. You too. [hangs up] Sorry. What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Um, if, uh… um… I just completely forgot what I was going to say. It’s so weird.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Well, if you think of it, I’ll be here.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So I called my buddy down at the station today. Had them run a background check on Josh Porter. See if there’s any known aliases, et cetera.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He wasn’t volunteering today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Business has been pretty crazy around the office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Moved Ryan over to your desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, tell him I say hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will call him later with that message.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, how is… Toby?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby Flenderson is everything that is wrong with the paper industry. Is he why you left?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, no, it was… you know, a good opportunity for me, a promotion. I got a chance to…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Opportunity, promotion, blah, blah. You know, Jim, those are just words. Have you taken into account other factors, vis-a-vis bosses? Is Josh funnier than I am? Does he even have a girlfriend? Because I have two, basically.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, it’s really not a competition.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Jim got us a great lead with a new rep from National Envelope. We can grab lunch with them tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Great!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Jan, Jan? Don’t worry, I have got the tip.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa. Michael.

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.text: Wow, oh my God, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Was that your per diem?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that was a different hundred dollar bill.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What have you generated, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have generated a lot of interest in my party this evening.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What party?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The party I’m having tonight in 308. Obviously, you are invited.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, um… Jim and Josh are in meetings all day. And I am in and out of meetings. I can’t stay on top of you 24/7.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You should order the most expensive thing on the menu, so he knows you’re worth it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: If you do that, you’re going to have to put out.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. You’ll have to put out.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Is there a key for Jane Doe? Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Any messages for 308? All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey hey, fellers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Well, Jim and I have a meeting with Uni-ball in about forty-five minutes, so we should probably go now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, check this out. How about that? A little friendly competition. Stamford versus Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: I don’t think so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Jim. Looks like you picked a bad time to defect, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Fine! All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Excellent. Oh…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Keep the wing flaps.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut it. [answering phone] Hey, Pam, what’s up? Yep, yech… no. Tell him I will give him general specifics tomorrow, okay? Yes. [to others] Say hi to Pam!

quotes.speaker: Jim, Josh, and Dwight
quotes.text: Hi, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. That is Josh and Dwight and Jim. [to others] Pam says hi. [into phone] Have fun on your date! Very good, talk to you later. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You first.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on. Nice try, Josh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not. It hit the rim. Okay, and… okay. Double or nothing.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Or what?  We didn’t bet anything, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, let’s…

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Yeah, we should go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: We gotta go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Uh… we’ll do it later.

quotes.speaker: Evan
quotes.text: Say, while I have you here, could I talk to you about some new and exciting advances to our product line?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim and I have different definitions of friendship. I think it’s talking and being friends, and Jim thinks it’s moving to Connecticut and being best friends with Josh. Well, phooey on that. I, uh, I’m done. I am not going to be speaking with him anymore. Whatevs. Long-distance relationships never work.

quotes.speaker: Evan
quotes.text: That is so true. Ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, let me tell you what we’re looking for.

quotes.speaker: Evan
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry, my meeting ran late.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Jan, really. With a rep from HammerMill.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: They’re exclusive with Staples.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Used to be. Evan will call you in the morning to work out the details. We can now sell HammerMill products.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! Ha!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, Michael, I underestimated you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, maybe next time you will estimate me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight’s room key. And… Dwight’s room. What can I say? Old habits die hard.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: D?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God. Dwight got a hooker! Oh my God, I gotta call… well, I gotta call somebody, I don’t even know who to call. Dwight got a hooker!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So, Alan, Pam is obsessed with your cartoons. She reads them every day.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don’t want ketchup.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You love ketchup! He loves ketchup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So how do you come up with your cartoons?

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Well, I just, uh… I kinda think about stuff that I see, or dream them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You dream in cartoons? How fun!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, first guest! You are going to have some tequila, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: I thought there was a party in here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is the party.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: This is room 308?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Party central! So, what can I do you for? [Guy leaves] All right.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: See, this one is great, because it can work on a couple of different levels.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Huh.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: [French accent] Freedom fries for the table.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Freedom fries. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Yeah. I mean, people always say, like, “Don’t be edgy.” But I don’t know any other way. Yeah, you get it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, it was, uh, it was really nice meeting you, Alan.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Yeah. Next time bring some of your illustrations, I’ll let you pick my brain.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: More freedom fries.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s great.

quotes.speaker: Alan
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I went on a date. It wasn’t a love connection, um… I think when I like someone again, I’ll just kinda know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael. Am I the first to arrive?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People have been filtering in and out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I get a drink?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I get a drink?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure. You like Cosmos?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure, sounds good. So why are you here? Is Josh busy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I get it! No, no, I totally get it. He made a better paper airplane, Stamford is better in sales… I get it. We had some fun. We had some laughs. And that’s just…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, wait. I didn’t transfer because of you. You’re a good boss. You’re a great boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not better than Josh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, it’s not about… I transferred because of Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God. You don’t even know. She’s single now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I just… I heard something about that. It’s just, I kind of put it all on the line. Twice, actually. And she said no. Twice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m sorry, man. I’m sorry. Hey, you know what? I will talk to her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, that’s okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That’s all right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will. I’ll talk to her. You should at least talk to Roy. I mean, he knows exactly how you’re feeling.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Okay, maybe.

quotes.speaker: Evan
quotes.text: Are we early?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! No, you know, people have been filtering in and out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Evan, this is Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How are you?

quotes.speaker: Evan
quotes.text: Hey, uh… Arnie Reisman. Michael, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Ernie, how ya doing?

quotes.speaker: Evan
quotes.text: Do you guys work together?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, we used to. Now we’re friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Best friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Some people need dozens of friends to say, “Hey, look at me, I’m popular.” But not me. I’m very picky. I need three, maybe two. When you meet that someone special, you’ll just know. Because a real relationship, it… it can’t be forced. It should just come about effortlessly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now, would you do the pleasure of hitting the lights, sir? [lights go out, leaving Michael’s black light on] Ha, ha, ha.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha, ha, ha, ha.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa. What are those stains?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Blood, urine, or semen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God, I hope it’s urine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today I’m headed to Philadelphia for the annual Northeastern Office Supply Convention. [makes horns gesture and heavy metal scream] Wooo-yaaaaah! Oh, these things tend to be kind of crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Angela enters Michael’s office] Ah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sign.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Per-diem. [singing as he signs] Perrrr-diiiiieeeemmmm! [shows off $100 bill to Ryan] You know, Ryan, it’s all about the Benjamins.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [reading checklist] Fun jeans.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [points to door] Right there.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Fourth quarter projections for Jan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. What? Oh, yeah, have Pam give those to me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Will do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure you don’t want to come?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gonna be fun! Change your mind we can get you a cot.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [shakes his head]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A couple of years ago, I went to one in Hartford. “Connecticut.” And Todd Packer and I went to this bar and met a girl. And [laugh] Packer decides to make out with her. Turns out that her boyfriend is the bouncer at the bar. [laugh] I love this. The bouncer chases us out to Packer’s Vette, jump in the Vette, he peels out, and I [laugh] I don’t make it to the car. [turns serious] Um, and the other bouncers caught up with me and really did a number on me… It was in the paper… [brightens] But to answer your question, yeah, I’m really excited about this weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See that factory?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I almost worked there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup. Yeah, I applied for a job there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What would you have done? Been manager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was going to be a bottle capper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You? A bottle capper?! [laughs in disbelief]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know. Crazy world. Crazy, crazy world.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Yes, I’m aware of Jan and Michael’s… history. Um, I don’t really like to talk about it ’cause it’s unprofessional. Kind of gross.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Josh reminds me of a guy I went to high school with. Big football star, girls loved him. Whatever. Guess what he’s doing now. He’s a TV announcer for the Eagles. Up in the… [laughs] He doesn’t even get to play in the game, I mean.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, you ever been convicted of a felony?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: What? Uh, no. [to Jim] Uh, I want you to make sure you call Karen and get her to fax that vendor list over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Misdemeanor?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Um… When I was in the Coast Guard, a couple of us broke into the women’s barracks and we got arrested for trespassing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Coast Guard? So you know how to fight underwater?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: [stunned]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [Jim, Josh, and Jan walk in the hotel lobby] Josh, um… [Jim continues walking ahead] Why don’t you come up to my room for a couple of minutes and we can just go over the schedule for tomorrow together.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Can we do it over breakfast? It’ll be…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: A quick drink?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Thanks, but maybe another time.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [putting on a good face] Great! [walks off]

episodes.title: The Coup
episodes.description: Michael is in trouble once again as Jan busts him for declaring it's "Movie Monday" where everyone watches a movie and neglects work. Angela pushes Dwight to make a move on Michael's job while Pam and Jim find creative ways to waste time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [waiting on Pam to be done with the microwave] Ahhhhhhhhh. [whispering loudly] I’m hungry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Movie Monday!  The only cure I know for the Monday blues is… Varsity Blues!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s gooooo! Let’s go, let’s go, let’s go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [directing people to their assigned seats] Take a seat down there.  Second from the end.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, everybody here?  Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [walking in with a tray of six popcorn bags] Popcorn anyone?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes pleeeeease!  Thank yooouuu!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [with five popcorn bags left] Anyone else?  Nooo.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Movie Monday started with training videos, but we went through those pretty fast.  Then we watched a medical video.  Since then, it’s been half hour installments of various movies, with the exception of an episode of Entourage, which Michael made us watch six times.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Entourage!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin, would you like to do the scenes from last week?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t whine.  Get the window. [Dwight exhales]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Previously on Varsity Blues…

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ok.  Billy-Bob, got a head injury, but coach made him play.  So then Lance, he gets sacked, he’s out for the year…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [walking into an empty office because everyone is watching Varsity Blues] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not everyone approves of Movie Monday.  I won’t say who.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don’t approve.  I don’t.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hello? [Angela coughs and points to the conference room]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Jan walks in on Movie Monday] Hi Jan! Hope you brought the Milk Duds!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How would a movie increase productivity Michael?  How on earth would it do that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People work faster after…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Magically?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No… they have to… to make up for the time they lost watching the movie.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [walking past Dwight’s desk] Kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Michael is going to get us all fired.  You sat back and let him play that dumb movie, and now Jan is peeved off and we’re all going to lose our jobs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s not going to happen.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You know she has it out for him now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s not his fault!  He had to follow his heart!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ever since Michael dumped Jan for Carol, Jan’s been bitching out on him.  Reject a woman and she will never let it go.  One of the many defects of their kind.  Also weak arms.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight, you should be running this office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael would never let me…

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It’s not up to Michael, it’s Jan’s call. Talk to her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I could never do that!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Fine!  Sit back and do nothing and let us all get fired!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I know that patience and loyalty are good, and virtuous traits.  But sometimes I just think you need to grow a pair.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: At the Stamford branch, they all play this World War II video game called Call of Duty, and they’re all really into it.  I’m told it started as a team building exercise.  Unfortunately I really suck at it.  We didn’t play many video games in Scranton.  Instead we’d do stuff like, uh, Pam and I would sometimes hum the same high pitched note, and try to get Dwight to make an appointment with an ear doctor.  And uh, Pam called it… Pretendenitus.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone] Hey Kelly, my stuff just got here. [Kelly screams with excitement into the phone and Pam has to take it away from her ear]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kelly really likes to online shop.  Soooo, I felt like I wanted some new clothes.  I mean, I just, I wanted to, it just, I felt like it was time, to maybe um… just get new clothes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [pulling her new shirt out of a box] Ok.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [gasps] I love it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?  I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You haven’t even tried it on yet, try it on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not at work, I’ll try it on—

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Fashion show!  Fashion show!  Fashion show at lunch!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …noooo

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [clapping her hands in unison] Fashion show!  Fashion show!  Fashion show at lunch!  Fashion show!  Fashion show!  Fashion show at lunch!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why did you do that?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m just killing Germans, any way I can.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We’re on the German team.  Shoot the Brittish.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [turning around to Karen] Wait, are we playing teams?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [laughing] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [outside in the parking lot, pacing back and forth] WAH!  GAH!  [breathing heavily]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [answering the phone] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is this Jan?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is Dwight Schrute.  I am calling about an extremely sensitive matter.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You should talk to Michael, and he’ll talk to me, and that way we don’t have to speak to each other.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s about Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What about him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [exhales] I can’t talk here.  It’s too sensitive.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It’s not about a surprise party is it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, but we should discuss that another time.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Look, I am already an hour outside of Scranton, Dwight, I’m not coming back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pull over at exit 40.  There is a Liz Claiborne outlet.  I know you like that store.  Go inside and shop, until I can meet you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How do you know I like that store?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Many of your blouses are Claiborne’s.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How do you know that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Part of my job.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No it’s not.  It’s officially not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …noted.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walking into Michael’s office] I’m going… to the dentist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have to have an emergency crown put in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ouchy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.  It’s a new dentist.  He’s far.  I might be gone… three hours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Three hours, wow.  Have fun.  [Dwight walks away staring through the blinds at Michael]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you get anything good?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: New blouse?  Halter top?  Camisole?  Teddy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can save the branch.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you let me run it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [excitedly] “Ok” I can run it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What would you do differently?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mostly get rid of waste.  Which is half the people there.  And clean house.  [to waitress in diner]  Right here.  It’s all for me.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Dwight, you must feel strongly, to speak with me this way, behind Michael’s back, and turn on so many of your co-workers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The decision to turn on Michael was difficult.  [pouring way too much syrup on his food] But once I did it, I didn’t look back.  And mostly I feel that Michael would approve.  It’s really what’s best for the branch.  And I could care less about my co-workers.  So [cutting his food, giving Jan a “so there” look], here we are.  It’s all, on the table.  I want… the branch.  And I await your decision.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [shoveling waffles into his mouth] Oh, by the way.  There’s a new Ann Taylor outlet store near here.  I know you like their earrings.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [thinks for a second] Where is it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on speakerphone with Michael] Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I just had a very interesting conversation with one of your employees.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.  That’s nice.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, it wasn’t.  Dwight just told me that he thinks he can run the branch better than you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …what?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …you were at the dentist?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You can’t have people undermining you.  Get control of your branch immediately.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What was Dwight thinking?  That he could turn Jan against me?  She’s my ex-lover!  …ish.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [Pam walks out of the bathroom wearing her new red shirt] Woooooow.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It’s so sexy.  You look so hot.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It’s really something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [smiling] It’s too much.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m gonna return it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No, you have to keep it today, just see how you feel.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [walking into the break room] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You look nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Isn’t that like your third soda today?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah I think we can be a big help to your company.  [someone dims the lights, signifying that it’s game time]  Ok, see you next week.  Bye.  [to Karen] Again?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Scared?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [with her hands making the rocker sign] Call of Duty!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: [sounding upset] Andy, Jim, can I see you in the conference room for a minute?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Now?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Yes now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Put the game on hold everyone.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: This is not working, ok?  We are getting slaughtered out there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It’s the new guy. [looks at Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I’m sorry I don’t know… what we’re talking about…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: See what I mean?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: We just need a strategy, ok?  We’re going to set up a trap in the gun room.  All right Jim, are you using the MP-40 or the 44?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, sniper rifle?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: SNIPE–

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: WHAT?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: JIM!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you playing for the other team?!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: You don’t snipe in Carrington, ok?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Saboteur!

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Andy, it’s not—

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Saboteur!  I’m going to kill you for real.  This game— the game is over.  I’m really going to shoot you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want an M&M?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No thanks I’m stuffed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No seriously.  You should have an M&M, they’re really good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …ok. [takes and eats several M&M’s]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They’re good, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …so good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.  I thought you weren’t supposed to eat anything for a couple hours after you’ve had a crown put in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They have this new kind of quick drying bonding, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sounds like a good dentist.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s his name?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [long pause] Crentist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your dentist’s name is Crentist.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Huh.  Sounds a lot like dentist.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe that’s why he became a dentist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let me see your teeth.  Let me see ’em.  Let me see ’em.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [reluctantly opens his mouth and Michael peers inside]  Ahh.  Aaaah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You should… floss.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [exhales] Well then… I am glad you’re ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Business is like a jungle.  And I… am like a tiger.  And Dwight, is like a monkey, that stabs the tiger in the back with a stick.  Does the tiger fire the monkey?  Does the tiger transfer the monkey to another branch?  [smiling] Pun.  There is no way of knowing what goes on inside the tiger’s head.  We don’t have the technology.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in Michael’s office] Wow, this is tough.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhhh.  Arrrgggh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I just got off the phone with Jan.  And um… she demoted me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. You know what the craziest part of this is? She demoted me to your job!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gahh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And she said that you should be expecting a call later from corporate, and that um, I guess that means that you are going to be acting manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t believe this news.  That— wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.  I told her I didn’t know whether you’d wanna do it… because you’ve always been so loyal to me.  You’ve been my most trusted ally.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You said that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep, I did.  I did.  But I think… you should do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well… Gosh, if you think I should.  Then I will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [exhales] Perfect, well, we’re settled.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.  Well then, you are now acting manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton Branch, and I… am assistant regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Assistant to the regional manager.  Thank you Michael, for staying on.   I really appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey… I can’t imagine this place without you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [muttering] Can’t you?  That’s so nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well… I guess we should go tell the troops.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, when I’m ready, Mike. [Dwight exhales, Michael looks at the camera] Ok let’s do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hi, hello.  Everybody, I have some good news, and I have some bad news.  I… am being replaced, as your leader, by Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You’re kidding…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You might think that I am kidding, and I understand that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Congratulations Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you Angela.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: But… why Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because, Dwight… never lies.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How does that qualify him to run a branch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because that’s all it takes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, Dwight, would you like to say a few words to everybody… about loyalty?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you Michael.  I just want to say, to the few of you who will remain under my employ, that I intend to lead you into the black!  With ferocity!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, what will you do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I’ll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Do you have any savings?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, I don’t, but—

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, you might lose your condo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I… won’t.   I won’t.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have this little vacuum cleaner that’s broken.  If Dwight doesn’t work out, maybe that could be manager.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Maybe I’ll quit.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It’s really happening!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We can make a difference here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I, will, make a difference here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You alone?  Because I thought together we could—

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh please, don’t be naive.  But you can be in charge of the women.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [whispering] Look how cute he is!  He’s trying to shoot with a smoke grenade.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m sorry what are you whispering about?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I’m sorry nothing, just concentrate on turning around.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m trying—

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Just tap S then D.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [her players gun is pointed directly at Jim’s player’s head] Any… last words?  No?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? [Karen’s player shoots Jim’s player, “You killed Jim Halpert” appears on the screen, Karen giggles]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. Psychopath.  [Karen grins widely at Jim]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I’m just looking.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Please go back to your desk.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: In a minute.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I remember why I dress the way I do at work.  But I’m gonna keep the clothes.  I mean, it’ll be cool to just have some after work clothes that aren’t pajamas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I guess it’s time, that I turn over the keys, to the famous Sebring.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [smiling] No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s a corporate lease Dwight, you’ve earned it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not my style.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But you said you liked it.  You’ve always admired it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well that was before.  I’m thinking about getting something German, something with decent gas mileage.  Plus, that convertible, it’s a ridiculous choice for this climate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael finally breaks] Take it back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [confused] No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s my car.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What did you—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: THAT’S MY CAR.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, Dwight.  I know.  I know.  I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan called me about your little meeting!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, what you did.  I made the whole thing up, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think the Sebring’s cool.  It’s cool.  The Seabring’s cool.  It has a cassette and it has a CD.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh do you?  Do you like the Sebring— HOW DARE YOU?!  How dare you, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight gets on his knees and puts his face down on the ground] Don’t fire me.  Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me one good reason why I should fire you RIGHT HERE ON THE SPOT?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [terrified] I HAVE EXCELLENT SALES NUMBERS!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not.  Good.  Enough!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sobbing] I’ll do anything!  Anything!  I’ll do your laundry for a month!  For a year!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a laundry machine!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m sorry!  I’ll do anything, I swear. [squeaking, crying]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know if I can trust you anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can’t.  You can’t.  But I promise I’ll never betray you again.  What can I do, Michael.  What can I do?  [Michael exhales]  What can I do?  [Dwight has his face to the ground but his butt raised high in the air] What can I do?  What can I do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can get up.  Get up. [Dwight gets up with spit hanging from his lips] And you can hug it out, bitch.  [Dwight and Michael have a firm embrace]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hug it out, bitch.  That is what men say to each other, after a fight.  They hug it out, and doing so, the just… let it go.  And walk away.  And they’re done.  Not a good idea to say that to a woman however.  I have found.  It doesn’t translate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [leaving his desk for the day, pretends pull the pen out of a pretend grenade, and tosses it to Karen]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [throws some desk material in the air to signify debris from the grenade explosion, grins as Jim walks away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.  Yeah, we hugged it out.  But, it turns out, I was still a little angry.  So, I felt I needed to punish him, just a little bit more, [cut to Dwight standing on a box with “LIAR” written on a piece of paper hung around his neck, Dwight’s head hung in shame] and I’m making him do my laundry for a year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [Jan leaves Michael’s office; Dwight enters]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey. [shuts door] Is everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is not your business, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If the branch is in trouble, there are things you can do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you know about management, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know that we need to cut costs.  We could fire Meredith. That’s a big cost.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not firing anyone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Creed might be living here, we could charge him rent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … What?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Four nights a week, I sleep under my desk, and then three nights I stay at my place in Toronto. They don’t know about this job up there. It’s a welfare state. Beautiful countries, both of ’em.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Here we go. Everybody, you know what? It dawned on me we were all in there watching a movie together before we were so rudely interrupted, Let’s get back in there. [no takers] Come on. Movie Monday! Come on, Stanley let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [standing at the supply shelf] I’m on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m pretty sure Jan said that we’re not supposed to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, we had scheduled this time to watch a movie together, so I guess I will just go play some online Scrabble.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [looks to Angela]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [shakes her head disapprovingly]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Schrutes are a very loyal breed. But I also have Mannheim blood from my German grandmother. And the Mannheims knew when to cut and run. No sense going down with a losing regime. But the Schrute blood… It’s amazing that when these two bloods mix, the whole thing didn’t explode.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, she sleeps with him, but she is still in love with the head surgeon, um, the McDreamy guy, and she starts crying, but the dorky doctor, he’s in love with her… [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. … Uh, sure, I’ll get him for you. [to Michael] It’s Jan for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I may have a few weeks ago faked a call from Jan in order to get out of a synopsis of, I think it was, Navy: NCIS. Since then, Michael’s been suspicious.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nnnnice. Wow!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [playing Call of Duty] Oh? Someone’s left out in the open, taking a little siesta. Not smart. [shoots] Yes! Finally killed you… [Karen’s desk is empty]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hey, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How’s work going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [nervously] Pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [kills Jim’s character, giggles] Oh, you know what, I gotta see Josh right now, but remind me to tell you what Dwight said to me earlier, okay? You’ll get a big kick out of it. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [baffled expression]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Things are a little bit… different here in Stamford. [shrug] It’s not bad.

episodes.title: Grief Counseling
episodes.description: Michael takes on the role of office grief counselor when he learns that his old boss has died.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Ryan, can I get you a pencil from the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, no thanks, I’m good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, it’s okay, I’m going down.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um…  Yeah, absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, I’ll be right back. [goes down pretend stairs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs uproariously and applauds] Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hands Ryan pencil]  There you go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Awesome!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, can you get me a pen from down in the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t mind if I do.  See you in a minute.  [goes back down pretend stairs and grabs pen from Stanley’s desk]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. [continues to laugh] Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There you go, fresh from the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Michael, would you get me some coffee from the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s coffee in the kitchen, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But the warehouse coffee tastes SO much better.

quotes.speaker: Ryan and others
quotes.text: Yeah.  Yes, it’s better.  It’s great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [breathless] All right.  Okay. [goes back down pretend stairs, crawls on belly to the kitchen for the coffee]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am like Bette Midler in For the Boys.  Gotta keep the troops entertained.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [after Michael returns with coffee] With cream and sugar?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] All right.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on speakerphone] So, I wanted to let you know that we lost Ed Truck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oookay.  Let me see if I have his cell.  Is this the only reason you are calling, Jan?  Or does somebody miss me?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, Ed died over the weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Attention, everybody.  I just received a call from corporate with some news they felt that I should know first.  My old boss Ed Truck has died.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, Michael, that’s such terrible news!  You must feel so sad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I am.  It’s very sad.  Because he was my boss.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That’s a shame.  Ed was a good guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s right, you worked with him.  So did Creed.  Well, I’ll be in my office in case anybody wants to drop by.  Cheer me up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So did you hear the news?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The news that you just announced?  That Ed died?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is there anything I can do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, gosh, what can anybody do, really?  It’s… pssssh… .  He was almost 70.  Circle of life.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holds out arms to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.  Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Mmmmmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [extricating herself] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: What’s going on with Fairfield County schools?  Karen, did you generate that price list?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Um, shoot.  Uh, I will.  Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Okay, just get it done.  Jim, will you make sure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah, definitely.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [coughing out his words] Suck up!  Josh, did you hear what I said?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Thank you, everyone.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [at vending machine] Dammit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Uh, nothing.  They’re just out of Herr’s chips.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: But don’t worry about it.  My snack food doesn’t fall under the umbrella of your authority.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm, that’s where you’re wrong.  I’m your project supervisor today, and I have just decided that we’re not doing anything until you get the chips that you require.  So, I think we should go get some.  Now, please.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: It’s a real shame about Ed, huh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Must really have you thinkin’.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: About what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The older you get, the bigger the chance is you’re gonna die.  You knew that.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Ed was decapitated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: He was drunk as a skunk, he was flying down Route 6.  He slides under an 18 wheeler.  Pop.  It snaps right off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is the way to go.  Instant death.  Very smart.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You know a human can go on living for several hours after being decapitated.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re thinking of a chicken.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What did I say?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is just not the way a Dunder Mifflin manager should go, I’m sorry.  Alone, out of the blue, and not even have his own head to comfort him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] So, I’m not exactly sure how to say this…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ed was decapitated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You said you didn’t know how to say it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t… he was driving on the road and he went under a truck.  And that’s when his head was separated from the rest of him.  And I will let you know more as soon as I find out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If my head ever comes off, I would like you to put it on ice.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I do not wanna talk about this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When I die, I wanna be frozen. And if they have to freeze me in pieces, so be it.  I will wake up stronger than ever because I will have used that time to figure out exactly why I died and what moves I could have used to defend myself better now that I know what hold he had me in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t understand. We have a day honoring Martin Luther King, but he didn’t even work here.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on speakerphone] I understand how you feel, Michael.  I really do.  So, would it be helpful to give everyone the day off?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You really don’t get it, do you?  You don’t understand these people.  That is the last thing that they would want is a day off.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, what would you suggest?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [thoughtfully] A statue.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Of Ed?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [scoffs] I’m not sure that’s realistic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I think it would be very realistic, it would look just like him.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, that’s not—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We could have his eyes light up, we could have his arms move…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is not a statue, that is a robot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think that is a great way to honor Ed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And how big do you want this robot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Life-size.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm, no.  Better make it two-thirds.  Easier to stop if it turns on us.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What the hell are you two talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, we are talking about how to properly honor a man who gave his life as regional manager of this company, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know what, Michael?  I’ve really tried with you today…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm hm.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: …and I have to get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh do you?  You know who wished they could get back to work is Ed Truck.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So call me when you feel like having a real conversation.
