quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But Ed truck can’t because he is—

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Goodbye. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: DEAD.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look [holding up sketch] I gave him a six foot extension cord so he can’t chase us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s perfect.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, that is a “no” on the on the West Side Market.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Okay, great.  I think that’s enough.  Can I get back to work now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.  Never pegged you for a quitter.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I am NOT a quitter.  I will do this all day if you want.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, all day.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey.  What are we doing?   What’s the game?  I want in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, there’s no game.  We’re just trying to get these chips for Karen.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did you check the vending machine?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, the vending machines!  How did we miss that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have no idea.  We went right for the copier.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Mm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And then we checked the fax machine.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, nothing there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did you check your… butt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oohh… can you imagine how much blood there was?  If it happened right here, it would reach all the way to reception.  Probably get on Pam.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay that’s enough.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We do not wanna hear about this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you know what?  I didn’t wanna hear about it either, Stanley, but I did and now I can’t stop picturing it.  He leaves work, he’s on his way home… wham!  His cappa is detated from his head!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You have just spit on my face.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you know what?  There’s something wrong with you.  There is something wrong with everybody in here.  Because we have lost a member of our family and you don’t wanna talk about it, you don’t wanna think about it, you just wanna get back to work!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are five stages to grief, which are [glancing at computer screen] denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance.  And right now, out there, they’re all denying the fact that they’re sad.  And that’s   hard.  And it’s making them all angry.  And it is my job to try to get them all the way through to acceptance.  And if not acceptance, then just depression.  If I can get them depressed, then I’ll have done my job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to throw you this ball.  When you catch the ball, I want you to say the name of a person very important to you, somebody really special who died, and then I want you to say how they died, and you may cry if you like, that is encouraged.  Let me just start.  Let me show you how this works.   I catch the ball.  I lost Ed Truck.  And… it feels like somebody took my heart and dropped it into a bucket of boiling tears… and at the same time, somebody else is hitting my soul in the crotch with a frozen sledgehammer… and then a third guy walks in and starts punching me in the grief bone… and I’m crying, and nobody can hear me, because I am terribly, terribly… terribly alone.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Excuse me, I’m sorry to interrupt, uh, I need to see Pam.  There seems to be, like, something wrong with the radiator in her car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, fine.  Hurry back.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [as they leave] There’s nothing wrong with your car.  I just thought you might like a break from the “grief counseling” session.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.  I would like a break.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: How are you likin’ the new car?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah?  Sure is small.  Got airbags?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think so.  I don’t know, I was mainly focused on the cup holders.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [laughs]  Well, you’re not still driving so fast, are you?   Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone]  Hi, yeah.  This is Mike from the West Side Market.  Well, we get a shipment of Herr’s salt and vinegar chips, and we ordered that about three weeks ago and haven’t … . yeah.  You have ’em in the warehouse.  Great.  What is my store number… six.  Wait, no.  I’ll call you back. [quickly hangs up] Shut up [to Karen].

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [laughing] Six?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Pam returns to conference room] Okay, we can start.  Um…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You waited for me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Pam, you’re a member of this family.  So we will wait for our family members. Phyllis, you wanna give it a shot?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [grabbing ball] I got it.  When my mother was pregnant with me, they did an ultrasound and found she was having twins.  When they did another ultrasound a few weeks later, they discovered, that I had resorbed the other fetus.  Do I regret this?  No.  I believe his tissue has made me stronger.  I now have the strength of a grown man and a little baby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, why don’t you throw the ball to somebody else.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [throwing ball back] Nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [returning ball to Stanley] Oh, yes Stanley.  Come on.  Your turn, you have to go.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I will NOT. [throws ball back]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay… I’m going to toss the ball to Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Let’s see.  I had an aunt that I was really close to.  She was this amazing female boxer.  Um, anyway, she was injured in a fight, and she was paralyzed.  So, you can imagine how upset I was when I found out that she asked her manager to remove her breathing tube so she could die.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow.  If you wanna cry, that’s okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [catching ball]  Thanks.  Um, a few years ago, my family was on a safari in Africa and, um, my cousin, Mufasa was um, he was trampled to death by a pack of wildebeests and, um, we all… took it really hard.  All of us kind of in the audience of what happened.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want to talk about it anymore?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, it would probably take me like an hour and a half to tell that whole story.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Me, me, me, me, me me. [catches ball]  Yes.  Okay, um.  I was trying to throw this party once.  And everyone was over for the weekend.  And then my uncle Bernie died, and so me and my best friend, we had  to pretend like he was alive, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait a second.  That’s Weekend at Bernie’s. [upset] Do you think that this is a game?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, there is a ball.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, we’re starting over.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No, I’m done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are not leaving.  No!  We are not done.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We really have a lot of work to do right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Well, you know what?  The guy who had my job has died.  And nobody cares!  And he sat at my desk. [breaking down]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, look.  I know this is hard for you, but death’s just a part of life.  I mean, just this morning I saw a little bird fly into the glass doors downstairs and die.  And I had to keep going.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do you know?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That that bird was dead?  Did you check its breathing?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It was obvious…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Was its heart beating, Toby?  Did you check it?  No, of course you didn’t.  You’re not a veterinarian.  You don’t know ANYTHING! [runs out of conference room crying]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael! [following Michael downstairs] Michael.   Michael …

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [seeing bird] Oh, God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in disgust] Oh…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God!  Oh my God, come on …

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Poor little fella.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh shhhh–oot!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He is a goner.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, he’s not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, he’s not. [cradling bird next to face]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, get him away from your head!  He is covered in germs and bacteria!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you can’t get diseases from a bird!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: A dead bird should not be in the kitchen!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We don’t know if it’s dead.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ugh, no that thing is dead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You want me to flush him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Attention everybody.  This will only take a second of your time.  Today at 4 p.m. we will be meeting in the parking lot to have a funeral service for this bird.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I have a lot of work to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I’m sorry to inconvenience you, Meredith.  But that is what you do when things die.  You honor them.  Toby killed this bird.  And now we are going to honor it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: But…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no!  That’s enough!  You know what?  This bird is dead.  He died alone.  The least you can do is be there for him now. [to Dwight] Find a box for him.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I’m calling a supermarket in Montreal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [on phone] Bonjour.  Je cherche des tchips de la marque Herr’s.  Non?  Ah… merci quand meme.  Au revoir.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sounded good.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [crying]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s okay.  It’s okay. [pats Kelly on shoulder] Shh… yes, I know, I know. It’s been a tough day, but it’s good to let it show.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I mean, how many times to I have to confirm with Ryan [Michael walks away disgusted] for him to know that we have a date tonight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [trying to shove bird into a can] Argh… gah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are… What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?  No, this is about the right size.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, God, no it’s not!  What is the matter with you?  Is that the beak!?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m sorry, I grew up on a farm.  We slaughtered a pig whenever we wanted bacon.  My grandfather was reburied in an old oil drum. [pause] It would have fit if he had given me another minute.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need a box.  I need a box.  A small box… not too confining.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is it for the bird?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have it covered. [hands Dwight a decorated box]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If you wanna do something for the funeral…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, please.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe you could play a song on your recorder.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you have it with you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Always. [runs off]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did I wake up this morning thinking I’d be throwing together a bird funeral?  You never can tell what your day here is  gonna turn into.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [spotting Herr’s chips on her desk] Where’d you find them?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where’d I find what?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I called the manufacturer, who referred me to distributor, who referred me to the vending machine company, who told me that they sell them in the machines in the building next door.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Glad you could all make it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You told us we had to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, do you have the box?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Actually, I have it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You made this?  Wow. [impressed] That’s… that’s very nice.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: When I was five my mom told me that my fish went to the hospital in the toilet and it never came back so we had a funeral for it.  And I remember thinking “I’m a little too old for this.”  And I was five.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’d also like to say a few words if that’s okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do we know about this bird?  You might think, “Not much.  It’s just a bird.”  But we do know some things.  We know it was a local bird.  Maybe it’s that same bird that surprised Oscar that one morning with a special present from above.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, I remember that.  That was SO funny.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And we know how he died.  Flying into the glass doors.  But you know what?  I don’t think he was being stupid.  I think he just really, really wanted to come inside our building to spread his cheer and lift our spirits with a song.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He’s not a songbird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shhh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: An impression, then.  Lastly, we can’t help but notice that he was by himself when he died, but of course, we all know that doesn’t mean he was alone.  Because I’m sure that there were lots of other birds out there who cared for him very much.  He will not be forgotten.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [quickly] Amen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [begins playing recorder]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [singing] Just smile for me and let the day begin.  You are the sunshine that lights my heart within… on the wings of love …

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Society teaches us that  having feelings and crying is bad and wrong. Well, that’s baloney, because grief isn’t wrong. There is such a thing as good grief. Just ask Charlie Brown.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let’s get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Hey Jimmy. Want to see some pictures of my baby?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Umm… sure.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: [shows picture] Here he is.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [chuckles] He’s so cute.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: And here’s his first bath. Warning:

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on the phone] Ed Truck died over the weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow. He…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah. And I know… I know he was your boss, so I thought you should know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Does his family know?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yes, they know, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But I’m the first in the office?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I guess, yes. I think it would be appropriate for you to make an announcement to your team, in case they want to pay their respects.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, yes, sure, I will do that…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …’Cause I’m the first to to find out. Nobody else knows and it is my responsibility to tell them. Well, good. How are you holding up? Want me to come over? [Jan hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ed Truck died. And it blows. They say that with grief, time makes it worse, which is bad for me because I found out before anybody so I’ve had more time to be sad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Attention, everyone. As you know, Ed Truck is dead. If you have any contact information on Rolodex files or in Microsoft Outlook, remove it now. Also, if you have any photographs, Pam will make her shredder available during lunch. That is all.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Remembering the dead doesn’t help anybody. The way to best honor them is to figure out what killed them and prevent that thing from killing anyone ever again. In this case, some sort of steel exoskeleton to protect the neck, or else a device that allows the head to live separately from the body. I’m working on both.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would like you all to clear your schedules this afternoon, because I am telling corporate to send in a grief counselor. We need to find out what is blocking you. And that way, we’ll be able to honor Ed the way he deserves to be honored. May he rest in peace.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: …ces. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What was that, Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you said something, didn’t you?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: May he rest in pieces. [chuckles] You know, because there’s, like, two pieces of him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You think that’s funny.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, no need to call corporate. We are supposed to use Toby. He’s trained as a grief counselor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that can’t be right.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, I am trained in grief counseling, but, ahh, I don’t think that’s what they need right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then I guess that makes you about the worst grief counselor in the world, doesn’t it?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: So how’s your day going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I will be spending the entire afternoon in grief counseling for someone I’ve never met.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: That sucks. [laughs] You guys got it much harder up here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Closer to the epicenter, I guess.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [laughs] Cool, all right.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, as you know, Ed Truck passed away. So, I’m here to talk about it if anyone would like to.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Not really.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re ruining it, already. They should not be given the choice.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I did not know Ed Truck. So I will probably spend the day zoning out and planning my weekend. I think Ed would have wanted it that way.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Is anyone having any trouble eating?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Concentrating? Is anyone having trouble getting their work done today?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I’m having trouble getting my work done today.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, look, sometimes things crop up later. So, uhh, you should know I’m always available if anyone would like to talk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. Wow. No. No. You are the most heartless, soulless person I’ve ever met.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, I’m sorry…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No. Shh. Enough. It is going to take me hours to undo all the damage that your have done here. Dwight, Ryan, I want you to take the table out. We’re gonna go on a five minute break, and when you come back, we’re going to start with a clean slate, and, in the interim, I would like you to forget everything that Toby has said, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t think I’m overstating it when I say that Toby is a plague on this company. And he is worthless. You give people a chance to shine and they blow it, just like you knew they would. Grief counseling is not about, “Are you hungry? Would you like a sandwich?” These people are so far gone, you have to stick a food tube down their throats.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, part of the problem was that Toby talked at you. Now, I am going to talk with you. First off, I want you to be comfortable, because you really can’t grieve if you’re all tight and buttoned up. So, guys, loosen your ties, just take your jackets off if you want. Ladies, let your hair down. You know what? Even take your shoes off. I wanna get personal and I want you all to really open up. And I want you to know that anything and everything can be said.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay. I don’t think Kevin should take his shoes off.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: My feet do not smell. Angela knows that hyperhidrosis is a medically diagnosed condition.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I found an exercise in Toby’s binder that he managed to miss, that involves screening the part of you that says, “I don’t wanna do that. I don’t wanna talk about that. That is too private.” Here’s how it works. I’m going to throw you this ball.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, the ball-throwing exercise is in the binder. It’s in the section marked, “Fun Ways To Make Brainstorming Sessions Explode With Excitement and Creativity.”

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, my cousin Billy, they just had the twins.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow, I thought that was supposed to be, like, next month.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah, I know. I guess they couldn’t wait. I’ll bring in a picture if you…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I’d love to see them. Oh, and tell them I say, “Congratulations.”

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I should probably head back in.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But, umm, thanks for the break.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: No problem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in his office playing with a Dunder Mifflin Truck when it drops and the “head” of the Truck comes off]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael once told me that Home Alone is the saddest movie ever. When I asked him why, he said, “Because the whole family forgets the kid at home. There is nothing funny about that.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s… Hold it, hold it, hold it. Start, like, right in there. [Dwight digs hole in ground] Just dig.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ow! God!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, give it to me. You don’t know what you’re doing. All right. [Michael starts digging]

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Hey! Hey! What are you guys doing over there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing. Let’s just… all right. [talks to warehouse guys] Guys, do you have a box we could use?

episodes.title: Initiation
episodes.description: Dwight takes former temp Ryan to his beet farm to initiate Ryan to his new job at Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Brain teaser. I have two coins totaling 15 cents and one of them is not a nickel. What are they?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: A dime and a nickel.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I said one of them is not a nickel.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: But the other one is. I’ve heard that before.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok. A man and his son get into a car accident. They are rushed to the hospital. The doctor says, there is no way I can operate on this boy, …

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Because he’s my son. The doctor is the boy’s mother.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A man is found hanging from the ceiling…

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: He stepped on a block of ice, hung himself, and the ice melted.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A hunter.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It’s a polar bear because you’re at the North Pole.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Tell me what you did yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uhhh… nothing.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Nothing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, nothing. How was your day?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I don’t care how your day was Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. Well. Ok. I don’t care how your day was either, Jan. I was just asking you because you asked me. Why do you set me up like that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Tell me what you did yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I worked. And then I went home to my condo. And Carol came over. And then we had sex. Is that what you want to hear?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Never ever, ever sleep with your boss. I am so lucky that Jan and I only got to second base.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hi, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m great. So, Pam I would like you to keep a log of everything Michael does hour by hour so we can analyze it at corporate. Ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I don’t know if I’m…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thanks Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s weird. Jan use to treat Michael like he was a ten year old, but lately it’s like he’s five.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So you excited?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very excited?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes. I’m very excited.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Extremely excited? … Just very?  That’s cool.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I have spent a year here. I have to commit or get out. Dwight’s the top salesman in the company and he’s taking me on my first sales call today. And, um, I’m excited.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am very excited. Ryan hasn’t made a sale yet, but more importantly, he hasn’t made an ally yet. Is he going to be a slacker-loser-wise-ass like Jim was? Or is he going to join the Dwight Army of Champions?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: So what if they’re not talking much, then does it makes sense to kind of lead the conversation? You know, just ’till it gets to a point where they are asking questions? [car stops] So where’s the sales office?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When you are ready to see the sales office, the sales office will present itself to you. Your journey begins now.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [squeaky chair] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: My chair is squeaking.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is it?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: You took my chair.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I didn’t. I took back my chair that you took from me, but I didn’t take your chair.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: When you get up, I’m just going to take it back anyway, so…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So I guess I can’t get up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Koselli, the Kos. Cosby. Hey hey hey. I love Jello Pudding Pops. My son, Theo, loves Jello Pudding Pops too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you know where we are, temp?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I know where we’re not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I hold in my hand, a beet seed. Take it. [Ryan tries to take it, Dwight closes hand] AH! [Ryan tries again and takes seed] When… Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Big Tuna, can I talk to you for a second.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can you stand up? And talk to me over there?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: That’s it? That’s what you came up with?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I’m acting my heart out here.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, really. You asked for my help, so I helped.

quotes.speaker: Announcer
quotes.text: Attention Scranton Business Park, there will be complimentary pretzels in the lobby from now until 4 o’clock as a thank you to our loyal tenants.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Once a year they bring in a little cart and they give away free pretzels. It’s really not a big deal. To some people it is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Productivity is important but how can I be productive if I have this one little thing in my brain? That I cannot get out. And that one little thing is a soft pretzel. So I’m just going to have my soft pretzel, then I’ll get to work, and I’ll be super productive. Look out for me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looks at long pretzel line] Oh, shhh… Come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And just as you have planted your seed in the ground, I’m going to plant my seed in you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don’t think you know what you’re saying.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Smells pretty bad, doesn’t it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s called bull crap and a client can smell it from a mile away.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Gotcha.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh hey, I forgot something in my car.  I’ll be right back.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ok. [Dwight drives away] Of course.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I wake up every morning in a bed that’s too small, drive my daughter to a school that’s too expensive, and then I go to work to a job for which I get paid too little, but on Pretzel Day? Well, I like pretzel day.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Because they acted all tough and everything…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: But what they were rapping about was cupcakes and the Chronicles of Narnia. God. Who invented cupcakes, right? I want to…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Phyllis embraces Bob ahead in line] Hey, hey, hey! Phyllis, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’m just saying hi to Bob.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I think you’re cutting in line.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Well settle down, Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I’m not going to settle down.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get in the back please.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Boooooo. Booooo. Back of the line.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Boooooo. Thank you. [hi-five’s Stanley]. That’s right.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: What a pair of Mary’s.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This is Pretzel Day.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey Dwight, you’re a great salesman. Can you teach me? Sure, Ryan. I’ll make you the ole commodor.  I’ll abandon you in a beet field. Huh. That sounds great, Dwight, I’ll really appreciate that. Thank you so much for your mentorship.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Congratulations resourceful salesman. You have passed the second challenge. Welcome to Schrute Farm.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [rocks in squeaky chair]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sings] Love me, love me, say that you love me, fool me, fool me,

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: stop.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Go on and fool me. Love me, love me, say that you love me

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: This is not fair, this is going to be in my head all day. Please.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: fool me, fool me, go on and fool me. Love me,

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: This is not a proportionate response.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Love me, say that you love me. Fool me, fool me, go on and fool me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don’t care ’bout anything but you… what ever happened to those guys?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No cuts. Oh, Pam. Just the woman I’d like to see. You read my mind.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great! I thought you could use this time to authorize some checks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I thought that maybe you could wait in line for me while I go to the bathroom. You’re an angel.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, why don’t you just go up to your office, get some work done, and I’ll just bring you a pretzel.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because I like them a certain way, and if it gets screwed up, then whole thing is blown.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, I just think it’s really important that you be productive today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, productivity starts with patience and determination. I’ll be back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is time for your next test. You have planted the beet seed. You have walked the long lonely walk of loneliness.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Look man, I was in a frat in college. So I know what you’re doing. I get it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what your problem is? You know why you haven’t made any sales? Cause you think you know everything. You have to trust that maybe there are other people that can teach you things. Are you ready to learn? Are you ready for the final test?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Thank you! [takes pretzel]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi. Please tell me that you have a sweet pretzel left.

quotes.speaker: Pretzel guy
quotes.text: We do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Pretzel guy
quotes.text: And we have 18 different toppings. We have sweet glaze, cinnamon sugar, chocolate, white chocolate, fudge, M&M’s, caramel dip, mint chip, chocolate chip, marshmallow, nuts, toffee nuts, coconuts, peanut butter drizzle, Oreos, sprinkles, cotton candy bits, and powdered sugar.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is there anyway that you could do all, all of them?

quotes.speaker: Pretzel guy
quotes.text: The Works. You got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right! Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please be seated. [man runs behind Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Who was that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pay no attention to the spirits that haunt this hallowed ground.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Is that your Cousin Mose?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mose is my cousin and he lives here. He will always be my best friend. Unless things go well with Ryan today in which case, I won’t hang out with Mose so much anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is the greatest danger facing Dunder Mifflin?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Outsourcing and consolidation of competition.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wrong. Flash floods. What is the true cause of Robert Mifflin’s suicide?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Depression?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wrong. He hated himself. What is the DHARMA initiative?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I can’t believe that Ryan is not back yet. Where could they be?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sales take a long time.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, I’m so worried.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m sure Dwight will protect him.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don’t know. Dwight’s so weird.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: He’s not weird, he’s just individualistic.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No, he’s a freak.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You’re a freak!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Final question, young Ryan Howard. What is Michael Scott’s greatest fear?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, loneliness. Maybe women.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wrong. He’s not afraid of anything. Also, I would have accepted snakes. Fear is what it’s all about. You cannot sell while undergoing fear. You need to vanquish fear! One must wrestle fear to the ground. You will now wrestle my cousin Mose.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No. Ok. All right. All right. It’s over. This is over.  OK.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wrestle him to the ground.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, you’re a freak. I’m not doing this anymore. This is over. Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ryan. Don’t. Ryan! You don’t have to wrestle him. Just get in the coffin. Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Cousin Mose
quotes.text: Bye, Ryan. He seemed nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where are all the animals?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ryan, come on. I am sorry. I am sorry. Mose is sorry too. Look, he sent over a basket with eggs and some fat back bacon. And look, something he whittled.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You still mad? It’s just Jim and I didn’t get along, and I didn’t want it to be that way again. You know, I wanted us to be a team. An unstoppable team that competed against other teams.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Look, that, that’s not what I wanted, ok. I just wanted to go on a sales call.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Screwgun. The sales call!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Michael is listening to “Rock And Roll Part 2 by Gary Glitter” and everyone can hear it. Kevin singing in unison with the song] Hey! Hey!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mr. Kosseli. Hey hey hey, the Cos. What’s going on? Do we have a deal? Deal or no deal? Let’s make a deal. So what is the deal?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Establish time frames. Keep the phrase “real dollars” in their head. And always keep the power in the conversation. That’s why you’re losing them on the cold calls. Cause you say the word please too much.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Wait, can you go back?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael always said, K.I.S.S. Keep it simple, stupid. Great advice, hurts my feelings every time.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ok, I’m going to establish time frames.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m going to put everything in terms of “real dollars”.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m going to ask a lot of questions that all have sort of positive answers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Saying, that would be better, or we would like that. That sort of thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Exactly. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m going to try to be confident, but not cocky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Hey! Everyone, I am officially streamlining the efficiency of this corporation. Second…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, second, Toby. Second, I am insisting on increased accountability from every single one of you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Account…? Michael, what is going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I will be taking questions.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you have a lot of sugar today, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What’s on your suit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Carmel Dip. But, one question at a time please. Phyllis, Stanley. I want you to switch desks, I’m going to reorganize and restructure the physical layout of the office to maximize everything! I think we’re getting a lot done, don’t you? On paper at least. And we are, after all, a paper company. Are we not, are we not, are we not? Are you with me, are you with me? Thank you very much!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: They really didn’t like me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They did not. They didn’t have to say it to your face.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don’t get it. I don’t get what I did wrong.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not everything’s a lesson, Ryan. Sometimes you just fail. It’s those online paper jerks. The whole business is changing. You know what? They’re going to be screwed once this whole internet fad is over. What are you doing? [Ryan throws egg at building] Oh no no no no! Ryan! Yes! Ryan the temp! Come on! Courtesy of Dunder Mifflin. Come on! Drive.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You drive.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Oh, hi Jan. He’s, uh, on a sales call. No message? Bye, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight chokes as Ryan downs a beer in one drink] Temp! Temp! Temp! Temp! Ryan! Ryan! Ryan! Ryan! Yes! Just think, that temp agency could have sent you anywhere.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I think about that all the time.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Night, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, what time is it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: 20 past 5.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: AM or PM?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: PM.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: These came for you. Contracts? Brent Koselli?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Koselli. With the Jello.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is a huge sale.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Right. Good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Night, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Goodnight!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [phone rings] Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry, I forgot Kevin’s extension. It’s a fantasy football thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I was just going to go through the system cause I didn’t think you’d be there. Why, why are you still there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I had to work late. Jan’s making me keep a log of everything Michael does all day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. Do you think you could send me a copy of that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, totally. So…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, no, I um. Everything’s pretty much the same here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A little different. What time is it there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What time is it here? Um, we’re in the same time zone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How far away did you think we were?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t know. It felt far.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. I have a question for you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How many words per minute does the average person type?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I type 90.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Shut up. Mavis Beacon doesn’t even type 90.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s true.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, I said average.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: 70? How many do you type?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Forget it. I was just about to brag but forget it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on. Tell me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You have to tell me now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: 65. Ok, no need to laugh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, it’s, that’s respectable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Respectable?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So ok. I’m watching the movie, by myself…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because I just wanted a relaxing evening at home…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And, I’m freaking out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That movie is so scary!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But I’m holding on because I keep waiting for Sandra Bullock to show up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No way. How do you confuse 28 Days with 28 Days Later?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because I got it at Blockbuster and they don’t put the pictures on the box.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, you’re making this up!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Would I make that up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. Fancy New Beesley would make that up. New apartment, new stories.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, in my fancy new apartment. I have one bedroom, one bathroom, and a closet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And how many kitchens?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have one kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, you got totally taken for a ride Beesley.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s actually…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Most apartments these days have like three.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Three kitchens?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes!  How are you going to cook every meal of the day in one kitchen?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Ryan and Dwight enter] Hey, Ryan, are you ok?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um. Ok, bye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, I should, I should, I should probably go too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I was um…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, no no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You have to go?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, uh, well.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I should probably go too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Bye Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye Jim.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Three hundred and sixty four days, ’till the next Pretzel Day.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What I want, Michael, is an hour-by-hour log of how you spend your work time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that’s really not the way I roll, because sometimes I’m in the zone, and sometimes I’m in the zoning out.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Zoning out?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want me to go on Amazon and order you a slang dictionary? Cause I’ll do it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: If you can account for your time…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, big if.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: …then maybe corporate can justify your salary.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A woman spurned.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s like mommy and daddy are fighting. Except mommy outranks daddy and mommy is way scarier.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Take a good look at this boy…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I always do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …because you are never going to see him again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you lay a finger…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Today is Ryan’s first sales call and I am bringing this boy home a full-grown man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you look at that? [Hugs Ryan] [Dwight attempts hug] Damn it, Dwight! Come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight is taking Ryan on a sales call today. So if we find Ryan’s body in a heavily-wooded area tomorrow, I owe Jim $30. It’s an old bet, but a deal’s a deal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I once saw a movie called “Training Day”. It starred an African-American and Ethan Hawke. In it, the African-American trains Ethan Hawke with various tests and trials. Today, Ryan is Ethan Hawke, and I am the African-American.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get in the car.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don’t have a key.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t you realize the key is inside you? [pretends to pull key out of Ryan’s ear]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: He’s the top salesman at the company. He’s the top salesman at the company. He’s the top salesman at the company. Today’s gonna be great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, but seriously, your ears are the key. 90% of a good sales call is listening, only 10% is talking.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Huh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get in the car. [Ryan knocks the car door] Get… get in the car.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sales is not all in here. [wails arms] It’s also in here.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know, every time I think I hit rock bottom at my job, the floor opens up, like at a carnival ride. I’m gonna retrace my steps. College, four-year degree, student loans, business school, alone in a beet field. I… there’s a step missing. “Hey, mom.” “Hey, Ryan. How’s that five-year plan coming?” “Oh, it’s great. Today, I knelt down in cow manure and I got abandoned in a beet field.” “Oh, that’s cool.” “Yeah, that’s really cool. I’m learning a lot. I’m really glad I took this full-time job.”

quotes.speaker: Andy

episodes.title: Diwali
episodes.description: Michael encourages the entire Scranton branch to support Kelly and attend a local celebration of Diwali, the Hindu Festival of Lights. Meanwhile, Andy convinces Jim to turn a late night of work into a drinking game.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice dress, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It’s not a dress. It’s a kurta.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight, one of our most ethnic co-workers, Kelly, has invited us all to a Diwali celebration put on by her community. What is Diwali, you may ask? Well, to have Kelly explain it [girly voice] it’s ada blah blah blah, it’s so super fun and it’s going to be great. [normal voice] Lot of gods with unpronounceable names. Twenty minutes later you find out that is essentially a Hindu Halloween.

quotes.text: You look so handsome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really you do. I love the material.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I…

quotes.text: Hey. Hey. Stop that. That is offensive. Indians do not eat monkey brains. And if they do… sign me up… because I am sure that they are very tasty and nutritional.

quotes.text: Wha? Really? You should! It’s fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Diwali is a very important holiday for the Hindus. But, frankly, I’m a little appalled that none of you know very much about Indian culture. So, without further ado, Kelly you are on.

quotes.text: Um… Diwali is awesome… and there’s food… and there’s going to be dancing… and… Oh! I got the raddest outfit. It has, um…

quotes.text: Pam wishes. [generalized laughing] Kelly, I’ll take this one. Diwali is a Celebration of the Coronation of the God-King Rama. After his epic battle with Ravana, the Demon King of Lanka. It symbolizes the battle between good and evil…

quotes.text: All right, all right, all right, all right. This isn’t ‘Lord of the Rings’.

quotes.text: Sorry.

Here are some famous Indians. [slide show] Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar. He is a Nobel prize-winning physicist. Impressive. Apu from the Simpsons. Hilarious. Indian. M. Night Shyamalan. ‘The Village’, ‘Unbreakable’, ‘Sixth Sense’, ‘Sig… ‘

quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don’t know what Diwali is? Wow, Jan. I’m surprised. It’s the Hindu festival of lights. I just assumed you’d be familiar with it. It’s the most sacred and honored Hindu holiday in the world. It’s like Christmas, Easter, and Halloween—

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Mich—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: —rolled into one.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I bet you’re not even aware that our own Kelly Kapoor, who works in…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Um, customer service.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … customer service is a Hindu person.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yes, of course, I know Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I thought she was Muslim.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What? I’m not Muslim!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I think it sounds lovely. I think it sounds like a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You do?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yes, of course. It’s important to celebrate our company’s rich diversity. And, and in fact, Michael, if you had planned better, we might have been able to charter a bus to the event—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I dunno about that.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: —or, or, or been a sponsor for the party itself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: For Kelly, that seems a bit much.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hey, one person is an integral part of the fabric—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: She’s so wonderful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, you should see her naked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I had promised Carol a romantic evening on the town. Um, I wanted to take her on this spooky hay ride thing, but it was like seventy dollars a person, and she’s allergic to hay. So I said, “Pop a Claritin, and I will spot you the seventy bucks,” and she’s like “I don’t like to borrow money or take unnecessary medication.”  And I’m like, “Well you’re really not gonna like what I slipped in your drink last night.” And she’s like, “What the hell are you talking about?” And I’m like, “I’m kidding. I didn’t put a roof…” [cracks himself up] … We laughed so hard… It was hilarious… oh… [calms down] So yes, I’m very excited about the Diwali party.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: For Diwali 07, you must consider Scrantonicity. For a fraction of the cost of this DJ, you could have the rocking sound stylings of a Police cover band.

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Kapoor
quotes.text: No Police cover.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, okay, well, let me send you a demo, and… Better yet, I’ll give Kelly the demo, and she can give it to you. It’ll save us both on postage.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Kapoor
quotes.text: [nods]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: You’re the temp!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, yeah. [shakes her hand] Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Hi, I’m Carol.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hi, nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: The wavy brown hair and blue eyes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Michael talks about you… a lot.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Top of your class at business school, and you live on Shady Hill Road, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Wow, um… Sorry you had to…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Does Michael talk about me a lot?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: [pause] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He does? What does he say.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: He says… “I love him.” He loves you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: At Cornell, in my fraternity, my house name was “Hubble” because I was so good at finding a party. I was like a powerful space telescope, so… Freshman year, when my skin was still really bad, they called me El Guapo.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Big Tuna, tuna?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, I got eel.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [speechless]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [looking for Jim’s sushi] Eel… eel.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Didn’t see that coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And perhaps the most important person to Indian culture, Sir Ben Kingsley. Because of him, the British left India, and then he became an actor like Ronald Reagan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Your shirt is buttoned wrong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, any questions?

episodes.title: Branch Closing
episodes.description: When Jan tells Michael that the Scranton Branch will be shutting down, Michael strives to keep his staff's spirits up. Meanwhile, everyone privately begins to envision how their lives will change in the aftermath.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Who are you faxing so early in the morning?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, umm… kinda hard to explain.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t have a ton of contact with the Scranton branch, but, before I left, I took a box of Dwight’s stationery, so, from time to time, I send Dwight faxes. From himself. From the future. [reading fax] “Dwight, at 8 A.M. today, someone poisons the coffee. Do not drink the coffee. More instructions will follow. Cordially, Future Dwight.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No![knocks coffee out of Stanley’s hand.] You’ll thank me later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There she is – Jan Levinson. First…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …thing in the morning. Love to start my morning with a hearty bowl of Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Just call me Levinson in the morning, baby.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I am here to tell you that we are closing the Scranton branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t understand.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: The board voted last night to close your branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On whom’s authority?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: The board’s.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m very sorry. I don’t relish telling you this. You’ve been a big part of this company, and the board asked me to thank you for your years of service.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: A small number of people will be transferred to the Stamford branch, and the rest will be getting severance packages.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Am I a small number person or a severance package person?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, we haven’t made final decisions about personnel yet. But you’re a severance package person.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… [burrys head in hands] Oh, my god. Oh, my god! I don’t really get it ’cause we’re not doing that bad and our numbers are gonna come up.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, it’s not all about numbers, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It’s… it’s about talent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you gotta be… Josh?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Our CFO believes that Josh is going to play an important role in our company’s future.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh really, what role is that? King of the stupid universe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is an outrage, that’s all. It’s… hey’re making a huge, huge mistake. Let’s see Josh replace these people. Let’s see Josh find another Stanley. You think Stanleys grow on trees? Well they don’t. There is no Stanley tree. Do you think the world is crawling with Phyllises? Show me that farm. With Phyllises and Kevins sprouting up all over the place. Ripe for the plucking. Show me that farm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pictures. Memories. [Picks up a framed photo of Stanley’s daughter from Stanley’s desk] Look at that. They grow up so fast.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey stranger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t say that. That just sounds weird. Please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sorry. I just feel like we haven’t talked in awhile.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well… we have nothin to talk about, Dwight. Just do your work … while you still can.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When you become close with someone, you develop a kind of sixth sense. You can read their moods like a book. And right now, the title of Michael’s book is, “Something Weird is Going On.” Colon, “What Did Jan Say? The Michael Scott Story. By Michael Scott, with Dwight Schrute.”

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey, um… did you hear about your friends in Pennsylvania? Rumor has it that the Scranton Branch is… [clicks her tongue to her mouth motions chopping off a head]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? Wow… that’s bad.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um, sorry… the Scranton branch is closing? [Karen nods and Andy looks at Jim] In your face!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I work here now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmmm.. suck-ah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, great! Amazing. Best physical condition of my life.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What did Jan want?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing. Just checking in. I can’t tell you, so…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What can’t you tell me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing, Pam.[whispers to himself] What difference does it make?  We’ll be gone in a couple of weeks anyway.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You just said that we’re gonna be gone…?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I have any messages?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, what’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, ok…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [facing the whole office] Listen up, everybody… I have some news. We are screwed. Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton is being shut down.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, uh… we shouldn’t be talking about this until all the decisions have been made.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You knew about this all along, didn’t you?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Jan told me just a few minutes before she told you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Traitor. You are a traitor.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What about us, Michael? Do we still have jobs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know. Probably not. This is the worst.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It makes perfect sense that it would happen today because I just received this in the mail. [holds up cards] A thousand business cards with this address and phone number.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don’t want to blame anyone in particular. I think everyone’s to blame.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: If I get to stay and Ryan is laid off, I will kill myself. Like Romeo and Juliet, the Claire Danes one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [surrounded by clapping coworkers] Stamford, Connecticut! Stamford, Connecticut!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I worked in Scranton for a really long time. And uh, it’s going to be weird that it’s all disappearing. I mean, I always knew that the branch would shut down someday. I just figured it would be because Michael sold the building for some magic beans.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I couldn’t be happier. I’m gonna take the severance and retire. My wife and I are gonna travel. [chuckles] I really couldn’t be happier.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s a blessing in disguise. Actually, not even in disguise. Sometimes at home, I answer the phone, “Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam.” So, maybe that’ll stop now.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, some of us are fired and a few are going to Connecticut.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I don’t really want to work here without Pam. You know that Cinderella song, “You Don’t Know What You Got (Till It’s Gone)”? That pretty much says it better than how I know how to say it… in words.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Darryl. Noble Darryl. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Look, I heard about the office. Tough break.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know. Well, I’ll land on my feet. Don’t worry about me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I wasn’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, you’ll be okay too. You’re a warrior. You’re smart, capable. You’ll find something else and…

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Actually, Bob Vance bought out the warehouse. So he’s keeping on the whole crew. So, we good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is my house. The CFO is taking away my house and giving it to Josh. And Josh is giving the garage to Bob Vance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, listen up. Some of you may have heard some rumors about the branch closing. But, I am not going to take this lying down. I have a plan and I am going to save our jobs. So just hang in there. [Looks at  Dwight] Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, good… you’re bringing Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. This might get ugly. I need backup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What’s the plan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go to New York, confront the CFO, show him he’s making a mistake… save the branch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I drive?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No… way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shotgun!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. There’s no one else.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Still.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you very much. [hangs up cell phone] Okay, secretary says Wallace is away for the day and won’t be coming back into the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay. Um…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But, do not worry. I have his home address right [presses cell phone button] here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Christmas card list.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You sent him cards? You never met him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But when I do, we’ll have something to talk about.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, do you have a second?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Sure, what’s up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know it’s not definite or whatever, but uh, do you know who’s coming over here from Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: I honestly don’t. I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, so is it like sales or… accountants?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: You know what, Jim, I wouldn’t worry about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Jan, hey.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, good. You’re both here. Ready to talk logistics?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [to Kelly] I just feel like it could have been something special if we could have kept working together, but I’m gonna go someplace else and you’re gonna go someplace else. It just doesn’t make sense.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This kinda worked out perfectly for me. I got some good experience. Uh, Michael’s gonna write me a great recommendation. And as far as me and Kelly goes, I think it’s for the best.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, this is it. [runs up the stairs of CFO’s house, with Dwight] This is exactly what Michael Moore does, famous documentarian. He goes up to people with a camera and he’s like “Why did you do this? Why did you pollute? You are bad. You’re a bad person.” It’s very dramatic.  Although, I can’t say I was a big fan of  ‘Bowling for Columbine’, because I thought it was going to be a bowling movie, like ‘Kingpin’. And it wasn’t. It was something else.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So, Josh will be running what is now called Dunder-Mifflin ,Northeast, which is all the offices north of Stamford. And Jim, fi you want the job, you’ll be his number two.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Wow. Uh, sure. Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Excuse me, Jan, I’m sorry… I’m gonna have to stop you there. I, um, will not be taking the job.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Wha… excuse… why not?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: As of today, I have accepted a senior managment position at Staples.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Today?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: [nods]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You leveraged your new position with us into another offer?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Damn it, Josh. This whole restructuring thing was based around keeping you. I…

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: I’m sorry, all right? It’s done, it’s done.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I’m gonna make some calls.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Say what you will about Michael Scott, but he would never do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, do you know what you’re gonna say when he shows up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will improvise. I will speak from the heart.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. Bad idea. You need an attack plan. Here, I’ll be him, you be you. Let’s practice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as David Wallace] Dum, dum, dum, dum… coming home from work.

quotes.speaker: M ichael
quotes.text: Excuse me, Mr. Wallace? David Wallace?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes? What is the meaning of this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can you tell us why you are shutting down Scranton and putting 15 people out of work?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, the branch is no longer finicially viable. It’s simple dollars and cents.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, but these are employees, Sir. These are human beings.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen, Scott… we’re losing money, okay? It’s not a charity; it’s a business. And it’s a dying business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [no longer talking to Dwight as Wallace] Stop… stop it! Just, okay. He’s not going to say any of that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as himself] Whoa hey, why not?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because he’d be intimidated and I, just… let’s start again. Just be more scared of me, okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t touch me this time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as David Wallace] Dum, dum, dum, du, doy, du, do… coming home from work…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excuse me, Mr. Wallace?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [frightened] Uh!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So… we are still scrambling here. But uh, it looks like Scranton is going to absorb Stamford.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And I know that you just left there a couple of months ago, but we would like to offer you the number two position at that branch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it’s just I’m not sure if I um… well to be quite honest with you, Jan, I have a few unpleasant memories of Scranton. And um…

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. No, no. Just um… some personal stuff. And I’m not really ready to revist that, I don’t think.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ah. Well, please think about it. And call me. We will do whatever we can to get you to stay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey guys. Uh, I’m trying to organize a little group lunch for everybody since you know, we’re never gonna see each other again.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Where are we going?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I thought maybe DJ’s.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: How about Cugino’s?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don’t want to go all the way to Dunmore.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: How ’bout Cooper’s then?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No seafood.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But, I don’t want to go to DJ’s.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, now all of a sudden you get picky?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay, forget it. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hooters?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah. [takes a gulp of Gatorade and passes the bottle to Michael] Here, replinish your fluids.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [takes bottle and cleans off cap with his tie]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [in Scranton] Where’s Michael?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He’s not here. I don’t know where he is.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [looks around, noticing that no one is working] Wha… what’s going on here?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We know the branch is closing; Michael told us.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ah, god. Okay. You know what everybody? I’m sure there is a better way to do this but I’ve drive something like 400 miles today and I’m completely exhausted so I’m just gonna tell you. Your branch is not closing; Stamford is closing. Um, for the time being, it seems that all your jobs are safe.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes! [hugs Angela]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Stanley! [hugs Stanley]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is it because of Michael? Did he actually do something?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, reasons are not important. Would you just call him, please? Wherever he is… and tell him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure, uh, Jan… um, do you know, is anyone coming back to Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Back?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Coming to Scranton. Is anyone coming to Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, we don’t know. Probably. A few.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [referring to Michael’s ringing phone] who is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gonna get it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, not until I have some good news for them. Not until I have some good news.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I guess some new people might be coming from Stamford. Should be fun. New blood.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Is Jim coming back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s, um… I hadn’t thought about it, huh.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I just don’t want it to be weird, you know? I mean, I took his old job and his old desk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, that might be weird. Overall though, we still all have our jobs… so, good news, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, totally.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ahhhhh! [hugs Ryan] I’m so happy we don’t have to break up now, Ryan! [kisses him] This is the best day of my whole l ife!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: What you gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I really don’t know.  How you doing with all this?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: You know, I’m fine. I’ll be better when I know if I have a job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You’d actually move to Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, if they let me, I think I… I think I would.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: New York City is 45 minutes down the road from here. And you wanna  move to Scranton? I dunno. If I were you I’d move to New York?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, you know… I might do that. I, who knows? I… I might do that.

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: Hey Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [after screaming and throwing papers around in the kitchen] What’s up, Josh?

quotes.speaker: Josh
quotes.text: I just want to say thanks. Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thanks, man. You, too. Totally.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Anything?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nothing. [puts down binoculars]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What if this doesn’t work? What is the office actually goes under?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then it was an honor to have worked with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [pats Dwight and sighs] All right, favorite moments in Dunder-Mifflin history. Go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My first day when you hazed me by spraying me with a fire extinguisher.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was hilarious. The foam …

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh,… my first sale, my promotion to assistant regional manager, our basketball game, when you took me to the hospital, and told me that you cared about me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, right. Okay, that’s enough. That’s good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What were your favorite moments?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hmm, all of them. I loved them all. Every single one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What about when Jan said the branch was closing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, it doesn’t…

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey Pam, we’re going to Poor Richards. Creed’s buying shots.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No thanks, guys.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Have fun though.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey, I hear Jim’s coming back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really? Where did you hear that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I was…

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [interupting] Hey Ryan, you coming?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh yeah, we’ll meet you there.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Awesome. Let’s go, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [to Pam] I’ll tell you later.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Crazy day, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah, man! I’m uh… I’m really glad you’re still gonna be working here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, me too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe this is good. Finding another job is a pain. There’s another annoying boss, another desk, I’d have to learn everything all over again. So, there are reasons to stay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, um, I think I am gonna take that job. And Scranton… it’s not that bad. So, if they offer you a job there, I think you should take it.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Okay, yeah. Maybe I will.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, I’m happy he said that. I mean, I don’t think he’s into me or anything, but, I’m kind of into him. So…there you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are we still doing here? It’s over. Let’s go home. Get the car.
