quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [picks up his beeping cell phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, this was such a stupid idea! This was so stupid. I am such a stupid idiot. I let everybody down. Everybody hates me. I lost everybody’s jobs. Nobody likes me anymore!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone] Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: : Stranford is closed! Michael, we’re not closed. Stamford is closed. Stamford is closed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We did it? We did it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We did it!

quotes.speaker: Michael and Dwight
quotes.text: We did it! We did it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right here! Right here! [pounds his chest against Dwight’s]

quotes.speaker: Michael and Dwight
quotes.text: Ouu! Ou! Ouu! Ouu!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, baby!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In your face!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We did it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How did we do it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t … have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t understand.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well for a minute there, I saw myself selling my house, moving to Costa Rica, learning how to surf. But, Costa Rica will still be there. When I’m 65.

episodes.title: The Merger
episodes.description: Jan informs Michael that the Scanton branch of Dunder Mifflin will be merging with the Stamford Branch. Jim and Pam are reunited while the other employees of both branches must adjust to their new co-workers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The Stamford branch is closing and everybody’s just packing up their stuff. Andy Bernard made these tasteful hats.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to office worker] That’s the other thing you got to watch out…  [to Jim] Yo! Tuna! I wanna talk to you about this new boss, Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So what’s he like? Likes? Dislikes? Favorite sports? Favorite movies? Favorite men’s magazines?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? I think you just need to meet him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Playing your cards close to the vest. I get it. Good luck over there, Tuna. Cross me and I will destroy you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sounds good Andy.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: This is going to be an adventure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. This is going to be very interesting. All right, I’m out of here. See you later?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Right on. [to Andy] Hey is that Josh’s computer?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How’d the run go?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ah, pretty good. I finished.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s great!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Psh, why is that great?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because he accomplished something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What was your mile time?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: About seven.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] I could beat that on a skateboard.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, that has wheels.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, well my feet don’t. And I can still crush that time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really, Dwight? How fast are you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let’s just put it this way. Last weekend I outran a black pepper snake.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am fast. To give you a reference point. I’m somewhere between a snake and a mongoose. And a panther.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Man, what is taking Toby so long?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I’ll just time him later.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you’ll compare the times?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Are you ready?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, my groin…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Set

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …is really tight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t… [starts running]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Am I being mean to Dwight? I don’t know. I did just make him run around the building and I have no intention of timing him. This isn’t even a stopwatch. It’s a digital thermometer. He does make my life harder, sometimes. And on purpose. Like he tried to put meters on the bathroom stalls as a way of bringing in more money for the company. [yells to Dwight] Hey, three more laps to go. Gotta pick it up if you’re going to beat Toby.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aaaaah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I should probably get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here… Who’s here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nametag?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Karen Filippelli.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Karen Filip… [In Italian voice] Ka-ren Fili-pell-li.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Probably Italian. Possibly Filipino.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My branch is absorbing the Stamford branch. Or, as I like to put it, my family is doubling in size. That’s all I’m going to say about it because I have a gigantic performance ahead of me. And I have to get into my head and focus. [exhales]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who’s next?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s Andy Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Andy Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If I were you…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Saint Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …I would fire Anthony Gardner…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …before noon…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …to consolidate power.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not firing somebody on the first day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no! Not somebody. Gardner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Japanese camp guards of World War II always chose one man to kill whenever a batch of new prisoners arrived. I always wondered how they chose the man who was to die. I think I would have been good at choosing the person.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good morning!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Got the food? Good! Looky-looky-looky. What I want you to do… set it up in the conference room, please. Make it look nice. As if you are trying to impress a much older man who’s way out of your league.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes! I’m in a good mood today! I’m excited to meet all the new people and to see my old friend again, definitely. That’s always a thing that makes people happy… to have an old friend back.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! Ding-ding-ding-ding-ding. Our first arrival. Welcome to Scranton. This is Hannah Smoterich-Barr.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hannah Smoterich-Barr.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome to our humble abode. Follow me to your desk. Your ball and chain is right over here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know for a lot of these people this is the only family they have. So…  As far as I’m concerned, [holds up WORLD’S BEST BOSS mug] this says ‘World’s Best Dad’.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! There he is Tony… what’s your last name?

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Gardner.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gardner! I knew that. There you go. Gift bag… for you. [laughs] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, I didn’t get a gift bag.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, they’re just for guests. If there are any left over, you can buy one later.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: My bag’s mostly pencils.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wh..and coupons… to various hot spots around Scranton. [to Tony] All right! Let me show you to your area, sir. Come on, big guy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Can I have your pencils?

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m Pam.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Karen. I love your sweater.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thanks. My Mom made it for me.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Really? That’s so cool. I’ve always wanted to learn…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: …to knit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome, welcome, welcome! [in robot voice] Take me to your leader. Oh wait, I am your leader.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Uh wait, are you a robot or a Martian?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm… dah. I am actually your boss, Michael Scott. Welcome. Wow! You are very exotic looking. Was your dad a G.I. or uh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I’ll be the Number Two guy here in Scranton in six weeks. How? Name repetition, personality mirroring, and never breaking off a handshake. I’m always thinking one step ahead. Like a carpenter that makes stairs.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! You must be Andy Bernard. Aloha and welcome!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And you must be Michael Scott. Aloha and… hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A-ha-ha-ho. Very good! Welcome to our little kingdom. Ah, we have a bag of nifty gifties for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael, thank you for welcoming me to your little kingdom, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nifty!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They are nifty! They’re nifty gifties.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know who I really like? Is this guy Andy Bernard. He has got this very likable way about him.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: …which is why they need a passing game.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Jim] No way. Get him out of here. We don’t want any of this kind in here. Good to see you, man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Martin] How are you? Martin Nash, I presume? This is a little gift bag for you.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Oh! Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Free of charge. Follow me, I will show you where all the slaves work. [shakes head] Not… so, your desk is…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi, I’m Jim. I’m new here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my god! It’s really you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I was just doing a little joke there about how we’d never met…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know. I don’t care.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Awesome! Good to be back. The place looks really good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s really good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where do I stand with Pam? Um… no idea. I mean, we’re friends. Always have been friends. Um… .that is where we stand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, well, well. Look what the cat dragged in from Stamford.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fact – I am older. I am wiser. Do not mess with me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Sounds good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have a smudge on my forehead?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. Looks good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why are you looking at my forehead?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Meet my eye line, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stop acting like an idiot!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, buddy. Welcome back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey! How are you man? Good to see… you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m good! How are you? So…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Are you sitting here now?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um… unless you really, really want it back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, man, it’s really you’re call.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Cool, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispers] Let me get that for you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yuh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This one taken? No. Good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah. Jim is a nice guy. That’s why I got the desk.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, this came with the Stamford book. [Sets down box that says: Personnel Files Stamford CT Office Confidential] Can you take care of it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, yes I can.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: In general, they do not give me much responsibility. But they do let me shred the company documents. And that is really all I need.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael Scott. Thank you. I appreciate it, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello. I don’t believe we’ve been introduced. Dwight Schrute. Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Andy Bernard. Regional Director in Charge of Sales.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So you’ll be reporting to me, then.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Umm, on the contrary.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My title has ‘Manager’ in it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And I’m a director.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Which on a film set is the highest title there is. Do you know anything about film?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know everything about film. I’ve seen over 240 of them.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Toby!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How are you, man?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, really good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just wanted to say hi.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: How are you? Hey. Welcome back. [puts out fist to bump]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Is that like your new thing?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, I’m sorry, it’s…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. It’s cool.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, it’s nothing. We’ll just… [shakes hand]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. Good to be back.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So… okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: All right… sorry… sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No problem.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It was just…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [off camera] …what?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This thing is so awesome. It will shred anything. Ooh! It will shred a CD. It will shred… a credit card. It will shred… oh! [whispers] Shoot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking to himself] I present the orientation video.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We need to talk!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Which is higher? Assistant Regional Manager or Regional Director in Charge of Sales?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I told you the titles are irrelevant. They just relate to pay scale.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. So who gets paid more? Me or Andy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is not a matter of more or less. Your pay is just different. Okay? All right! Show time, part one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok. Who reports to who?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t care! Dwight! You all report to me! That’s all that matters! The rest of it just work out amongst yourselves, ok?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And then if I want…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Work it out amongst your selves!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please! I have a company to run. Well, you let me run the company?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Will you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kelly!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh! Oh my god! I have so much to tell you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes! Tom Cruise and Katie Holmes? They had a baby and they named it Suri. And then Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie? They had a baby, too, and they named it Shiloh. And both babies are amazing!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great. What’s new with you?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I just told you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Everybody settled in? Good. Why don’t we all proceed in to the conference room? Or, should I say, the banquet hall. For… drum roll, please [makes drum roll noises], the official Merger Day All-Family Welcome Breakfast. Come on in!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yoko shack.

quotes.speaker: Male voice
quotes.text: …thank you James. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, champagne.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope, no. Guests only.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Looks like salmon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope. Um… for the guests it is. For you, consider it cow-meat. Strictly taboo.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I eat beef.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then… consider it poisoned beef. No touchy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The beef is poisoned?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it’s not beef… just… sit down, please. [talks to group] Welcome. Help yourself.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Um… You might want these orientation materials.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wrong. Toby, this is an orientation not a borientation.[talks to group] Okay. Do not worry. All of your questions are about to be answered. Cell phones and pagers off, please.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, this looks promising.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You won’t be disappointed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s face it. Moving to a new job can be very stressful. So I have made an orientation video especially for you newcomers. But it’s not like any orientation video that any of you have ever seen. It’s funny. It’s got a little bit of a zing to it and I hope that it gives you a flavor of what we’re all about here at Dunder Mifflin. And what we’re all about here in Scranton. So let’s just all laugh together and watch “Lazy Scranton”.

quotes.speaker: Video
quotes.text: [Lazy Scranton Video]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sittin’ in my office with a plate of grilled bacon, call my man Dwight just to see what was shakin’.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yo Mike, our town is dope and pretty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So check out how we live

quotes.speaker: Michael & Dwight
quotes.text: in the Electric City!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They call it Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Electric City. Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Electric City. Call poison control if you’re bit by a spider.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But check that it’s covered by your health care provider!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It reminds me of the orientation video showed on my first day. ‘The Scranton Witch Project’.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in video] I am so scared… when people don’t label their personal food.

quotes.speaker: Video
quotes.text: [Lazy Scranton video continues]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You like coal mines and you wanna see ’em, Well, check it out, yo, the Anthracite Museum! Plenty of space in the parking lot,

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But the little cars go in the compact spot

quotes.speaker: Michael and Dwight
quotes.text: Spot, spot, spot, spot …

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on video in background] Spot. Scranton. What? The Electric City. Scranton.What? The Electric City. Scranton. What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, so far, I think it is killin’. I thought it would either be an ‘A’ or an ‘A+’ but I completely forgot that there’s an ‘A++’.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [recording phone message] This is Karen Filippelli. Please leave a message.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Terrible. Totally unconvincing.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [recording] This is Karen Filippelli. Please leave a message.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not bad, but you are Italian so… try it more Italian.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [recording] [in bad Italian accent] Dis is Kar-en Fill-uh-pel-li. Please leava me da message. A bon danza.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You feel good?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [recording phone message] Karen Filippelli.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, buddy. Anything new to report?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you mean to me? From you? Cause that’s how it works.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sure thing, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Am I trying to get under his skin? Yes. Because the angrier he gets, the more marginalized he becomes. Meanwhile, Andy Bernard is out there layin’ on the charm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Angela. Check this out. It’s my new screen saver.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you like it?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I do like it, actually.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you. You have such a pretty smile by the way.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What happened to grape soda?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah. I’m trying to move away from that. Getting into more of a bottled water phase.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. You’ve changed so much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I’m evolving, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So when do I get to hear everything? Are you still getting unpacked or… you want to grab a coffee or something after work?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh! Um… tonight, actually? No. I’m uh just still getting settled.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, no! You know. Whenever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh-kay. Sorry to interrupt. I…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. You’re not interrupting anything. Nope. I’m…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don’t…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. [to Pam] I should probably get back to work. Get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. I know, me too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The day’s going fine. It’s been a little chaotic but it’s fine. It’s great! A lot of distractions. But, it’s good.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: [using breast pump] Take a picture. It’ll last longer.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m sorry. It’s just, it’s a little distracting.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Ditto that, my brother.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Look what’s on his computer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is that? A squid’s eye or…

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: It’s my left breast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How did you…

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Right place at the right time.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Uh, what’s that smell?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What smell?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Must be an… air freshener plugged in somewhere. It smells like a funeral home.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, I’ll help you find it.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, you know. Never… .never mind.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I… I… I, uh, think I’m just allergic to your perfume.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: My perfume?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: It’s just my crazy nose. I’m… uh, used to different smells.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Bob Vance bought this perfume for me in Metropolitan Orlando. It’s made from real pine.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Who’s Bob Vance?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You have a lot to learn about this town, sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don’t know who these new people think they are. I’ve sat downwind of Phyllis’ stinky perfumes for years. Never said a word.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People hate people that are different from them. That’s natural. But you know what makes people forget their differences?  A great show. That is why I created the ‘Integration Celebration’. This is the moment when Scranton and Stamford come together as one. United in applause.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know what a lot of you must be thinking. ‘Wow! What a day! Feels more like a night at a party than a day at work.’ Well, in my opinion, business should feel like a night out. A night… at… the Roxbury. Okay. There’s supposed to be music and it’s… I got it, I got it! I got it. Dwight! Just.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you have batteries?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ssshh stupid! Um…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sings drum beat intro to ‘What is Love?’]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sings] What is love?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yes! Okay!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Baby, don’t hurt me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Andy & Michael
quotes.text: Don’t hurt me! Baby, don’t hurt me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Baby, don’t hurt me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Oh! Oh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa-oh-oh-oh

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Scuse me! Scuse me!

quotes.speaker: Andy & Michael
quotes.text: Whoa-oh-oh-oh! Whoa-oh-oh…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You me? You me? Me you? You! You! You me! Bow Bow Bow!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa-oh-oh-oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You me? You me? Me you me! You! You! You me you! You! Oh my nose so itchy, why’s my nose so itchy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, probably because of all the nose candy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs hysterically] Okay, I told you these guys had a sense of humor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very funny, Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Okay!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really funny, Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, all right, I’m on a roll.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are the new people on the table? To show them that we are not above them.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Shouldn’t we be equals?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not today. No. Tony! Please join your cohorts on the table if you would.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Uh… this is difficult, for me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I understand. We’re all friends.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: No. I mean I can’t physically. I can’t get on the table.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well. Just use the momentum of your lower half to hoist yourself up.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: [starts to climb table]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? I’ll help. I will…

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: No, please. No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t be shy! Dwight! Let’s do this!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do this. Come on. Ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on. We’re doing this thing! Let’s get up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On three. One… two… three.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bend at the knees. Okay, here we go. Here we go. I’m under this… I’m under this hock here. I don’t know what I’m grabbing here.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: All right. All right. Stop. Put me down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’ve almost got it. Push it! Push it!

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Let me go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m right in your crack!

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Put me down right…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Up and over.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Put me down!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Up and over.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Put me down right now!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’ve got it.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: I’VE HAD ENOUGH!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’ve got it, you’ve got it.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: PUT ME DOWN RIGHT NOW or else!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa Whoa Whoa! Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, hey. Easy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Easy.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: I’m sorry!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t…

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: It’s just not going to work for me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What…

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: I have to go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t understand.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: I was on the fence about this and… it’s just not a good fit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, we’ll squeeze you in.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: I can’t work here. I have to quit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can’t quit! On the first day. That’s [deep voice] heresy, my friend! [regular voice] Okay, let’s talk about this. What happened? I mean, what… Was it Toby? Did he say something? Cause he’s… what?

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: No. Toby was helpful. He was very kind. It’s just your management style.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My management style? So… didn’t you think ‘Lazy Scranton’ was funny?

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: No. Was it supposed to be funny?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, don’t bother quitting because you’re fired.

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are fired! I’m sorry, but we don’t have quitters on this team! Just clean out your desk!

quotes.speaker: Tony
quotes.text: But there’s nothing in my desk except coupons.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t try to apologize to me, man! It’s too late. Just get out! Take your bad vibes with you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That was my advice. Remember? I’m the one who suggested that you fire him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Probably the best advice you ever gave me, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And what advice has Andy given to you today that you have acted on? Would ‘none’ be an accurate estimate? None advice? [whispers] Fire Andy. Fire. Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight may have won the battle. But I will win… the next battle.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Tony was right. This environment is dysfunctional.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Maybe that’s because some people treat it like their own private Hooters strip club.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa, Angela! Hold on. Hooters is a restaurant. With over 400 locations worldwide.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Back to work. We don’t have to get along. We just have to work together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. We do have to get along. Can’t we all just get along? Or have we forgotten the words of the Reverend King.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The word merger comes from the word marriage. And that was what today was supposed to be. The loving union between people. Instead, it has become like when my Mom moved in with Jeff. And once again, it becomes my job to fix it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Hey, everybody! Something happened! Those guys from Vance Refrigeration, they let the air out of our tires.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! They punk’d us! They punk’d us good! Come on. Come on!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Does Bob Vance work for Vance Refrigeration?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Does he ever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Man, they got us so bad. We cannot let them get away with this. We have got to pull together as one and steal their refrigerators.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: YEAH!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don’t… I don’t think we can do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go home, Toby. Just…

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Hey! Why doesn’t your car have a flat tire?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why? I will tell you why. Because they saved the worst for me. They put a hate note under my windshield wiper. Check this out. It’s so hateful. [reads note] “You guys SUCK! You can never pull together as one and revenge us. That is why you SUCK!”

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: For crying out loud.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No, no, no. No.  You are falling for it. You’re playing right into their hands. This is just what they want you to do. Don’t, oh…

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: [to Stanley] What’s up with this guy?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Got an hour? I’ll try to explain.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: THIS IS EGREGIOUS! This is egregious!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Trust me. It only gets worse.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Is he always like this?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Sometimes he brings more costumes.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: When do people work?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, we find little times during the day.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: How are we going to get home?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Bob Vance has an air pump. He said he’d fill all our tires up.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Bob Vance of Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See that? Mission accomplished. Like a bunch of fourth graders. Sometimes, what brings the kids together is hating the lunch lady. Although that’ll change. Because, by the end of the fourth grade, the lunch lady was actually the person I hung out with the most. [answers phone] Jell-o!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, Jan!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Did you fire Tony Gardner when he was trying to quit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did. Major personnel crises averted. Compliment accepted.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do you realize, Michael, that we now have to pay him severance?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But do you realize that that was actually Dwight’s idea? Bad advice from my Number Two.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What? No. No. No, Jim is your Number Two.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: He’s the only one  who has worked with both groups. I sent you a memo about this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I know that. For, I do read the memos.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So after a great deal of thought and introspective-shun, I have decided to make Jim my new Number Two.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If he even wants it. It doesn’t come with a pay raise.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, it does, actually.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So who will be your new Number Three?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh… that I have not decided yet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael, I would just like to say you have handled this entire situation with great aplomb.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Andy. That’s… very kind. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I have to say your leadership…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut it…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: has brought…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut it! That’s… [whispers to camera] suck up!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [talking on cellphone] Hey! Where you at, Filippelli?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [off camera] I’m at the grocery store buying a corkscrew to give myself a lobotomy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] What’s wrong? You didn’t have a good first day?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh my god! Hey! You want to meet at Cooper’s in an hour? I need a drink.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Sure. Sounds good. I… . [sees Pam in rearview mirror] Hey! You know what? Can I give you a call right back?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought you had already… left.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh… no. I just uh had some other stuff I had to do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh… Good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, nothing. I just feel bad. I feel like things were a little weird today… or something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just think I should tell you that… I’ve sort of started seeing someone. And uh…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. That’s totally cool. You can do whatever you want.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: O..ok. Um..good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We’re friends. We’ll always be friends.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s good to have you back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Good to be back.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Where’d you get that salad?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Staples.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Saw your dorkmobile in the parking lot. What does it get, like four miles to the gallon?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, try double that. Classic TransAm, vintage American muscle. Please.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, my Xterra’s pretty sweet. Luxurious, yet rugged. Leave it to the Japanese.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Xterra’s not even a real word.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Actually, it is. It’s Latin for “earth.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, so you drive an X-Earth?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That makes sense. I’d rather drive a classic TransAm than an XEarth.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I bet you would. Oh, by the way, 1985 called. It wants its car back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well I hope 1985 has a time machine ’cause I drive an 87.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, speaking of time machines, I just got back from the future and I went to your funeral and, guess what, nobody came.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Speaking of funerals, why don’t you go ahead and go die.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, that was a really well constructed sentence. You should be an English professor at Cor-not University.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Idiot!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If I were an idiot, I’d be driving a TransAm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you were driving a TransAm, you would be the smartest idiot in the whole world.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [coughs word] Idiot!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughs sentence] You’re the idiot!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [coughs sentence] Nice comeback!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughs sentence] I was making fun of your comeback! That’s why it worked. [talks normally to camera] Totally got the best of that interchange.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And this is, don’t tell me, Martin… Ne… Ne…Nack.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nash.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Martin Nash. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Male, age 37…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mocha complexion. Supplier relations. Either caught a fish or was standing next to a man who caught a fish in Key West, Florida.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [holds up piece of paper] It wasn’t clear on the Google Image search.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, just…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Kev. How you doing?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, man. Good. Listen, my M&M’s are under the desk if you want any.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hidden from [whisper] them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Smart. Good. [to Angela] Hey, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You need a hair cut.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bye, Angela. All right, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: See you later, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: See you later.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Angela] It’s his first day back.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: His hair’s flipping out on the sides.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [smiles] I like it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, my Lord.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is weird with you facing the other way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I never even knew that part of the office existed. [Pam chuckles] Hey, who’s that guy? [Jim points to Stanley]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s Stanley Hudson.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He’s one of our salesmen.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Seems like a nice enough guy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh very.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What about, uh.. [points at Meredith]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm, that is… Janet Fenstermaker.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam nods head] You should say hi. Use her full name.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you for all of this. This is so helpful. You know what? One last question. Um, who is that fine older gentleman in the corner? [points to Creed]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, that is Creed Bratton. He has four toes and he fought in the Civil war.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: For the North.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For both sides. Whoever paid more.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Obviously.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, uh sorry. Seriously, can you guys… I’m trying to get some work done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry. Man. [Pam hesitates and then leaves]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey, nice thermos.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [notices Karen has same thermos as herself] Hey. That’s funny.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [holds out flask] Do you want a little?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Uh no, I’m fine, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Okay. If you change your mind, you just let me know, okay?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, I’m okay, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: That’s cool.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [approaching Kevin to shake hand] Hi, Andy Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Kevin Malone.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What’s that on your shirt? [points to Andy’s shirt]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That is a penguin. You like it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The Penguin.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Andy, or Andrew.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay, Penguin. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Smiles.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, what’s funny?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, have you met the Penguin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, nicknames, yay! Penguin power.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ha, that’s why I wore this shirt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, girls. What’s happening? Startinng to blend? Well, before long, you guys keep hanging out, you guys you are gonna share the same menstrual cycle.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: [sniffs. Pans to Creed eating his mungbeans.]

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: [pushing back desk item] Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: That was in your way?

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Um

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean my stuff’s coming over, but umm… is this…is this yours? [holds up travel mug]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [takes mug] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Have you lost weight?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well… I… Hey. You’ve never met me before.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know, but you just give off the vide of a guy who’s getting thinner.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, thanks. I appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You know who I really like? That guy, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can’t we all get along?  No, we can’t. But here’s the thing:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need somebody to pick a card. [Dwight raises hand] One of the new people, please? Tony? [Tony walks away]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [gets up] I’ll do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Good. Thank you. [Andy picks a card] Do not look at your card. Now, I’ve always said that to be a great salesman is to have the ability to connect with people right here [puts hand over heart]. So to be a great salesman is to be a king of hearts. Turn over your card.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [turns over card] King of hearts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [starts clapping] Very good Michael. Really good. [Michael shushes Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I think in order for us all to work together well we must come together as a family and then we can all be [starts to fan out the rest of his cards facing the group showing kings of hearts] a king of hearts.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [claps] That was fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [clapping] No, no, it’s better than fantastic. It’s super perfect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, don’t, don’t be a suck up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What I want all of you [points at Scranton branch] to do is approach one of the new people and tell them the one thing that you like most about them. Who wants to start? Who wants to give it a shot?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [raises hand] I want to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay Meredith, let’s give it a shot.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [to Martin] I love your complexion. It’s like devil’s food cake.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clapping] Beautiful. Very good, nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It just goes to show you, you play with fire and you are gonna singe your eyebrows. And they do not grow back the same way. [takes of glasses and points to right eyebrow]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It is inspiring to me to watch you navigate these murky waters.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bull… [bleep] [clears throat] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We heard it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We heard what you said. You didn’t cover it at all.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had a tickle in my throat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [points at camera] They’re gonna have… You can’t say that, all right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t say [clearinng throat noise]?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clearing throat noise] Idiot. Dwight’s an idiot! Did you catch that or did… did the cough cover it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sometimes it hurts Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [cleaing throat] You’re a jerk. Dwight’s a jerk!

episodes.title: The Convict
episodes.description: Michael learns that one of the new employees at Dunder Mifflin Scranton has a criminal record. Meanwhile, Jim helps Andy make a move on Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohhhh! She’s absolutely adorable!

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: He.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …Oh, sorry. He’s–he’s dressed all in pink.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: That’s his favorite color.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …Oh. That’s… fun for him.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhh, wow. Look at that. How cute.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Thank youuu.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh. May I?

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Uh, sure!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [climbs under desk] Hey, look at me, I’m a baby! I’m one of those babies from “Look Who’s Talking.” What am I thinking? [Laughs] Look at all those staplers! What’s a stapler!? I don’t even know, I’m a baby! Hey, Mom, I’m thirsty! I’m thirsty, Mama! I want some milk. And you know where milk comes from! Breasts.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: …Almost done?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just about… yup. Now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. I have started to see Karen. It’s very new, and… not really ready to talk about it openly yet, just because, I think, once the word gets out there, it might affect the way people behave around us or… I dunno. Just, not yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, Jan, it um… looks like a check, piece of paper of some sort. Receipt. I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Jan, this is Angela Martin from accounting.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [over phone] Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Look, we have a rebate from… the Federal Work Opportunity Program and no one knows what that means.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We get that money for hiring an ex-convict.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t hire an ex-convict. Unless they mean Toby. Convicted rapist. [Jan sighs] … I’m just kidding.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: When did the check come?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Last week.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, that’s when the branches merged, so Josh must have been taking advantage of this program. Smart move.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: One of the Stamford people is a criminal?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Jan, speaking of Stamford, Hannah brought in her baby.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Jan, which one of the new employees is a criminal?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, reformed convict, and, uh, I’m not sure. Though hang on, let me email our HR, stay on the line.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispering] Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hannah?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hmm. Martin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kuhhhh… you are such a racist.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, why am I a racist?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because you think he’s black.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: He is black… right? And…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it. Stop it right-stop it right now.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: …Okay it’s someone named Martin Nash.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why did the convict have to be a black guy? It is such a stereotype. I just wish that Josh had made a more progressive choice. Like a white guy… who went to prison for… polluting a black guy’s lake.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I wonder what he did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In our society, a black man can be arrested for almost anything. He was probably at a sporting event and… saw some people pushing each other, and he intervened.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why would anyone go to jail for that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sssssso, what we need to do… is to forget about this whole Martin in prison thing. People will draw unfair conclusions about Martin and or black people.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Angela?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sure. Let’s protect the convicts. At the expense of the general feeling of safety in the workplace. As a 90-pound female that sits in an ill-lit, rarely-visited corner of the office, naturally I agree with that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. All right. [everyone leaves]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [picks up phone] Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [over phone] I am so horny.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: …Okay I can’t… help you… with that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, I think you can, Big Tuna. Tell me about that Indian chick, Kelly. She seems pretty slutty. Good for a romp in the sack.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She is dating Ryan, I think.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, and I care why?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She’s… high-maintenance.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Next. How about… [motions toward Angela]. Blondes are more fun. C’mon, trust me on that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, trust me, that would be fun for no one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay fine. Um. Pam, the receptionist. Paaam. Should I go for it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: …Absolutely you should.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jackpot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just… try to be cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, are you cool, really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m cool, I’m cool, I’m so cool. Tell me what is going on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um… Martin, from Stamford, was, at one time, in prison. [Dwight starts to run] No. Dwight! Be cool! Be cool!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am greatly concerned about having a convict in the office. And I do not care if that convict is white, black, Asian, German, or some kind of halfsy. I do not like criminals.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All… righty, let’s get started. What is she into?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know Pam pretty well. I know the things that she likes, and, just as important, I know the things that she hates. So, one of the things that she likes is pranks. And, the things that she hates…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Frisbee-based competitions…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I started the main Frisbee golf club at Cornell. Where I went to college. I live to frolf.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Lead off with that. She loves hunting. She also loves those ads for Six Flags, with the old guy. [Andy hums Six Flag ad] Got it. Also… do you speak pig latin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Martin, how’s it going?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Good. Getting settled, you know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah. Good good. Good. Just a second. Everybody? May I have your attention please? I realize that a lot of you have already heard that Martin here has had some trouble with the law, but I just want to declare publicly that I… trust… him, completely, and that anybody who doesn’t is an ignorant, dumb… person. Okay? As a matter of fact, you show me a white man you trust and I will show you a black man that I trust even more. Pam. Tell me a white person you trust.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My dad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …Danny Glover. [Jim raises hand] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Jonas Salk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Justin Timberlake?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Please. Colin Powell.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey I got one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Jesus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Apollo Creed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Close your eyes. Picture a convict. What’s he wearing? Nothing special, baseball cap on backwards, baggy pants… he says something ordinary like… ‘yo, thats shizzle.’ Okay. Now slowly open your eyes again. Who are you picturing? A black man? Wrong. That was a white woman. Surprised? Well, shame on you.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: So… you all wanna know what I was in for?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. That’s not cool. You don’t have to tell them.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Um, I really don’t mind. It was a stupid mistake. I was working in finance and, I… got involved in some insider trading. So, I spent a little time in the clink.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] That is awesome.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I had Martin explain to me three times what he got arrested for, because… it sounds an awful lot like what I do here every day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What was prison like?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Not terrible. Boring. We do the same thing every day. But… at least we got outdoors time.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You got outdoors time?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Two hours, every day. Sometimes we’d play pickup football games…

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, why don’t we get outdoors time?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, some days I never go outside.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, we are running a business, so.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What was your cell like?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Not good. Uh… a little bit bigger than Michael’s office… but, you know, I really only slept there. You know, during the day, there-our time’s our own. They had uh, classes, I took some… watercolor classes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They have art classes?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Yeap. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: They have business classes there?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: They did, taught by some uh, Harvard business school guys–a lot of the guys also, that were in the class, the inmates, a lot of them have gone on to do extraordinary things in business.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kinda sounds like… prison’s… better than Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah. Well. That’s not true.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I would so rather be in prison.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Prison sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No you would not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This place is not prison. It’s… way better than prison.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [singsong voice] Baby. Hello baby. Here you want to play with this?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: You can’t give paperclips to a baby. He could swallow.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh, it’s okay. I’ve got tons of them. You like that? Goo-goo-goo-goo?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pam-a-lama-ding-dong. Listen, you’re cute. There is no gettin’ around it. So… I don’t know if you like country music, but I was thinking maybe one of these days we could drive out to a field, crank up some tunes, smoke a few Macanudos… maybe even toss a disk around.  Utway ooday ooyay inkthay, Ampay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow… I–

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Shh. Think about it. I’ll hit you back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow. That was… wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Listen up everybody! Um, you guys said that prison was better than this place, and I heard ya, loud and clear, so, I am instituting some changes to make this more like prison. We are going to start with an hour of outdoor time. So let’s go!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, it’s freezing out.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I can’t feel my toes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don’t we… pump some iron? Anyone wanna… pump up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is that, like… five pounds?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s uh… two and a half. I’m not going for bulk, I’m going for tone.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I’m going back inside.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, it’s… freaking cold out here. Anybody wants to stay out, you’ve got about… twenty-seven minutes of rec time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh heyyy. Martiiin. You have TV in the joint?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Yeah, in the rec room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah. A ten inch black and white?

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Actually, our TV was bigger than that one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: These people don’t realize how lucky they are. This office is the American Dream. And they would rather be in the hole.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Andy. I thought of one last tact you can take with Pam.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Quick question – do you play the guitar?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I play the banjo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hold on, let me think about that, yes, that’ll work. But can you sing in a sexy high falsetto voice?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] You know I can, my man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup. That’s perfect.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I’m gonna go get my banjo out of my car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: …I’m messing with Andy. I’m sending him to all the women in the office with… just… terrible information on how to get them to go out with him.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I love it. I want in. Who’s the target?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: …Oh, you know what? … It was… gonna be Pam, but…

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Perfect. What do I do? Just give me an assignment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, you know what though? I feel like I already sicked him on Pam… we’ll give her a break. Let’s think of someone else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right everybody, there has been a lot of name calling against our office today. Corporate maligning, slurring, much of it coming from one of you, who claims that prison is better… than… here. And none of can say “Boo” because none of us have ever been to prison. Well, there’s somebody I’d like you to meet. Somebody else who has been to prison, who can tell you what it is really like [puts on bandanna]. I’m prison Mike! You know why they call me prison Mike?!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Do you really expect us to believe you’re somebody else?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you really expect me to not push you up against the wall, beeyotch?! [employees protest] All right, hey, hey, hey, hey, that’s just the way we talk in the clink. Been a lot of fun talk about prison today, but I am here to scare you straight. I AM HERE TO SCARE YOU STRAIIIGHT!! In prison you are somebody’s bitch. Oh, and you. [points to Ryan] You, my friend, would be da belle of da ball. Don’t drop the soap! Don’t drop the soap!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael, please. [Michael makes kissing noises]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where… did you learn all of this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Internet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, not prison.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And prison. Eh, fifty-fifty, both. Look, prison stinks, is what I’m saying. It’s not like you can go home, and, recharge your batteries, and come back in the morning and, be with your friends, having fun in the office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What’d you do, Prison Mike?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I stole. … And I robbed. And I kidnapped… the… president’s son. And held him for ransom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is… quite the rap sheet, Prison Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I nevah got caught, neither.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you’re… in… prison, but, mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Prison Mike? What was the food like in prison?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gruel. Sandwiches. Gruel omelettes. Nothing but gruel. Plus, you can eat your own hair.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow. Prison sounds horrible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah. Well, thank you, Andy. Tanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Prison Mike. What’s the very very worst thing about prison?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don’t encourage him, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The worst thing about prison was the… was the Dementors. They… were flying all over the place, and they were scary. And they’d come down, and they’d suck the soul out of your body, and it hurt!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Demen-Dementors like in Harry Potter?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, not Harry Potter. … There are no movies in prison. This is my point! You guys got it soft, and cushy! This place is freaking awesome! The people are awesome! Your boss is nice! Everyone seems to get along! People are tolerant! People who… have jumped to conclusions can redeem themselves! Nobody is nobody’s bitch. I hope that this scared you. And from me, Prison Mike, to you, I just wanna thank you for listening to me. Letting me be a part of your life today. ‘Cause you got a good life! YOu got a good life. A good life. [turns around, takes bandanna off] So. What do you think? It doesn’t sound so great, does it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow. Thank you. Um, that must have been hard for you to relive that. Both of you.

quotes.speaker: Martin
quotes.text: Yeah, that… wasn’t really… at all my experience. There were certain elements of what you performed, I’ve seen on television. But it didn’t remind me of my time in prison.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Okay, fine. You guys think prison is so great? All right. Well, here you go. [locks employees in conference room]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, Michael. Come on. Let us out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! If you think is prison is so wonderful, then, enjoy prison! They are such babies. I am going to leave them in there until they can appreciate what it’s like to have freedom. And if this doesn’t bother them, then I am out of ideas.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [knocking on door] Hey! Let us out of here! Hey! I have–

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Shh!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [answering phone] This is Toby. Hey Pam. Where are you calling from?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael. Why’s everyone locked in the conference room?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They were very disrespectful to me, and to the office. And Martin has had a bad influence, to think that I gave him the benefit of the doubt.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, you’re going to have to let ’em out. Or… or I will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. You know what Toby? I am teaching them a lesson, so.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know they’re teasing you. I mean… obviously, this is… a much nicer place than an actual prison. We get paid to be here. We go home afterwards and have social lives. We have… we have parties here. They’re teasing you. To be funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [unlocks door] Okay nutcases, get out of there! Good work. Long day. Really long. Why don’t you guys head home. Early. Time off for good behavior! Heh. Good job. Enjoy your freedoms!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Martin went from being a new guy from Stamford… to a convict, to… my friend. Back to a convict. Then to… a kind of a nuisance, actually, to be completely honest. And finally, to… a quitter. And I will not miss him. And that is not because he is black.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] So we’ve been told, and some choose to believe it, I know they’re wrong, wait and see, ’cause one day we’ll find it, the ainbowray onnectionkay, the lovers, the dreamers, and meeee…

episodes.title: A Benihana Christmas
episodes.description: Trouble among the members of the party planning committee results with Pam and Karen hosting a rival Christmas party, but Michael isn't interested in celebrating after being dumped by Carol.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Merry Christmas! [holds up dead goose and puts it on Pam’s desk]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Merry Christ–[looks up] NO! Why… why did you bring that here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t worry, she’s dead. Oh wait. He’s dead.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, what uh…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I accidentally ran over it. It’s a Christmas miracle!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, get it out of here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Relax, OK. And because this is Christmas, I am going to roast this goose and prepare it with a wild rice dressing. Do we have any cayenne pepper in the kitchen?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Merry Christmas Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. What have we got here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What does it look like?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dead goose.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And circle gets the square.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Pam] So can you watch this? I’m gonna get my carving knife out of the trunk.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, Dwight, we talked about this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Toby, this is different. He’s already dead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Once I brought in a duck. To prepare for lunch. And people got upset. Apparently, they got attached to the duck and didn’t want to see it killed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He was already dead. And we Schrutes use every part of the goose. The meat has a delicious, smoky, rich flavor. Plus you can use the molten goose grease and save it in the refrigerator, thus saving you a trip to the store for a can of expensive goose grease.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. Win-Win.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Exactly. Thank you, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I like goose. If it’s already dead is it so crazy we eat it?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: That’s crazy. It’s crazy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Dwight, you cannot keep that here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, that is ridiculous. And totally against the spirit of Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Come on Dwight. We went over this, like for a half an hour.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s Christmas Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It’s a dead animal in an office. You can’t…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Toby…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sighs] Please? Please?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Clean it in your car.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I would like it off my desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh Pam. Take a chill pill.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Riding a bicycle down the hallway and singing] Deck the halls with boughs of holly. Fa la la la la la la la la. [Struggling to stay on] ‘Tis the … ack. [expletive] Hey! [to Pam] I would like a nice slice of Christmas Pam. Side of candied Pams. And perhaps, some Pam-chops, with mint…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can I help you, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m looking for the toy drive box.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s behind you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK…  Well, I need to put this bike in there. I hope it’ll fit, with all these little knickknacks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. What kind of bike is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Umm… I don’t know? Average kind?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The tires look pretty worn.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that is probably from the test drive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But the paint’s chipping. Is that your old bike, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yo, Michael, sweet ride Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thanks. [Michael and Andy do a fist bump and explosion.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes? [Pam holds up a bag] Oh Pam, that is so sweet. You didn’t have to do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [hands over bag] I didn’t, it’s from corporate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Did everybody get one of these?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Terrific. Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is going to be the best Christmas ever. My girlfriend Carol is coming to our party tonight, and I have a little surprise for her. [singing] I’ve got two tickets to paradise! Pack your bags, we’re leaving the day-after-tomorrow! Um,  taking her to Sandals, Jamaica, all-inclusive. All-inclusive. You know what that means? Right? Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Creed takes toy from toy drive box.] Oh, I think you’re supposed to put a toy in the box, Creed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: And a happy holiday to you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Carol walks through door looking upset] [waves] Carol.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Hi, is Michael around here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There she is. A Christmas Carol. Hello [kisses Carol] You’re about five hours early to the party. You’re such a blonde. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, everybody. I don’t know who you haven’t met yet, but I think this is one of them. This is my girlfriend – Carol. This is just the front of her. Show ’em, show ’em the other side.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: [whispers] What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Turn around, turn around. Come on. [making a body turning gesture]

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Get outta here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you get outta here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If I may say. She’s even prettier that you described her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [standing up] Oh, ouch. Michael, I don’t think there is anything wrong with the way you described her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: I really need a moment alone with you. [Carol heads towards Michael’s office.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not as much as I need a moment alone with you. [puts finger on her back and reaches for her butt] Berp.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: What is this? [Holds up a Christmas photo]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is my Christmas card. It’s a picture of you and me and your kids on a ski trip, having a blast. Ski-sons Greetings.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: No. See, we never went on a ski trip.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: I went on a ski trip.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Two years ago with my kids and my ex-husband.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, but what you didn’t realize at the time was that I was with you in a sense. I was in your heart…

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And next to your kids. What?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: This is so weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t understand?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It’s a bold move, to Photoshop yourself into a picture with your girlfriend and her kids on a ski trip with their real father. But then again, Michael’s a bold guy. [Towards unseen cameraman] Is bold the right word?

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: I think you’re a really sweet guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: But, um, I don’t know how to deal with, with this thing [waves Christmas card]. And, and the proposal. And I don’t think things are going to work out with us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no no no Ok, OK, You know what, you’re not thinking straight. You know what you need? You need to think this through in [making drum noise] Jamaica’s largest fresh water pool.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got us tickets to Sandals, Jamaica, We leave day after tomorrow. [Carol shakes head in disappointment]. You better find the skimpiest bikini there is.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Oh, no. Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And it’s all inclusive.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: Michael…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Carol. You walk out that door and it is over.

quotes.speaker: Carol
quotes.text: I know. [Closes door.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Psst. Jim. [Jim turns around. Pam nods head towards her for him to come over] Um, hey. I need to give you your Christmas gift now because, well, I’ll just tell you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For the past few months I’ve been sending Dwight letters from the CIA. [hands a folder to Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They’re considering him for a top secret mission. There’s his application. Oh, and this is where I made him list every secret he promised he’d never ever tell.
