quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Opens folder and reads from Dwight’s file] Last year, my boss, Michael Scott, took a day off because he said he had pneumonia, but really, he was leaving early to go to magic camp. Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So… here’s the gift. You get to decide what his top secret mission is. [Jim smiles] Sorry I didn’t wrap it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [closes folder] You know what? Uh, I really don’t think I should be doing this stuff anymore, you know?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, because of the promotion.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It just feels a little bit, like…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I get it, of course. OK. [holds out hand for folder. Jim gives Pam back the folder.]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I feel like there’s a chance for me to start over. And if I fall back into the same kind of things I used to do., then … what am I doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’d like everybody’s attention. Christmas is canceled.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You can’t cancel a holiday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Keep it up Stanley and you will lose New Year’s.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, take New Year’s away from Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, what’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Carol and I split up. Amicably. And I just don’t think it would be appropriate to celebrate under the circumstances.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Will they still air ‘Rudolph?’

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That’s not fair.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [over everybody else’s talking] Are we gonna cancel Hanukah as well?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine! [everybody stops talking] Have your party. Just no guests.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: But we invited guests.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you know what Phyllis? All of your guests would have probably canceled at the last minute anyway, leaving your life a stupid rotten mess.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, oh, oh, oh, it hurts.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It hurts my heart. It hurts my stomach. It hurts my arms.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK, well, why are you laying like that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [moves a little] Thanks. How did you push away the bad thoughts?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Like what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like maybe, the real reason they left was because there were things they wanted you to do in bed, that were, foreign, and scary?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well.. um I, I don’t…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And not that you didn’t want to try them. Some wine may have helped. Do you know what I’m referring to?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t need to know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael. Sorry to interrupt. Uh, It appears we’re one bathrobe short.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Take it from Toby.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Copy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, would you like to go to Sandals, Jamaica with me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s all… [Pam walks away.] OK.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey Dwight. Pretty nice robe- [Dwight grabs bag with robe in it and walks away.] Why?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Phyllis, I need you to pick up green streamers at lunch.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I thought you said green was whorish.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, orange is whorish.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Uh, so I had a couple of ideas to make the Stamford people feel more at home. Each year we have a Christmas raffle … [Phyllis and Pam nod their heads in agreement].

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It would never work here.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Ok … um, another idea was karaoke …

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: A Christmas drinking game …

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: God help you.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: These are all terrible ideas and none of them are on the theme of “A Nutcracker Christmas.” I think you should leave.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: You’re kidding.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You tried this out, and it’s clearly not for you. It’s time to go. Come on. [Angela gets up from seat] Please. [Karen gets up and leaves] Thank you. OK, thank you very much. [Angela closes door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing? [“Goodbye My Lover” by James Blunt plays]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [putting things into a box] We are getting rid of everything that reminds you of Carol.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, what’s the haps? [Dwight shuts door in his face.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Carol?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, look at this. [looks through papers] Your old condo closing papers. It’s riddled with Carol’s name. I wish I could throw this in the box. [Michael hits repeat to “Goodbye My Lover” on computer]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why don’t you just buy the whole song?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t have to buy it. I just want to taste it. I just… I just want a little taste of it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, look at this, she saved you two thousand dollars ’cause they failed to report a mold problem. [Continues to sift through papers] But wouldn’t that affect the final… How did she? Oh, oh, I see what she did. That is good. Wow. Carol is one smart cookie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Goodbye my lover. Goodbye my friend. [hits repeat again]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is an old adage, but they say when you find true love, you know within the first 24 hours. With Carol, I knew within the first 24 minutes of the second day I met her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I feel like I’ve been kinda cold to Karen and there’s no real reason for it. I mean it’s not like she’s ever done anything to me. So, I think I probably shouldn’t be cold to her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Karen. Sorry about that meeting today, that was really crazy.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, right? I’m so glad you said that. Because, I don’t know how those meetings usually go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, usually like that.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Does anyone ever stand up to Angela or..?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think one of her cats did once. She came in with scratches all over her face. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I really liked your karaoke idea.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh cool, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That could really be fun.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You guys do a raffle?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, we do a raffle…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey. [Toby puts hand on Kevin’s back, who is wearing the robe and feels it a little bit.]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This should’ve been up yesterday. [refers to party flyer]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It’ll be all right.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Pam puts up another flyer] What is that? [Reads flyer] The “Committee to Plan Parties invites you to a margarita-karaoke Christmas?” There’s no such thing as the “Committee to Plan Parties.”

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There is now. We just started it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, you just can’t start a committee. You have to have funding.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: What’s your funding?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Two hundred dollars.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What’s ours again?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Umm, two hundred and one dollars.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh right.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [pointing] Hey, a margarita-karaoke Christmas party, that sounds like fun.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, that is not a party. There’s only one party and it’s hosted by the Party PLANNING Committee and it starts at three o’clock.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Then why are there two flyers?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, I understand that this is confusing for everyone, let me explain. There’s a party that starts at three.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: And then there’s a way more fun party that starts at two forty-five.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right, and if you’re interested in the way more fun party, all the info can be found here on our more brightly colored flyer. [Angela rips down brightly colored flyer and walks away. Karen rips down Angela’s flyer.]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I didn’t see where it was.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup, looks like the Scranton people and the Stamford people are finally coming together. And that’s what you want, right?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I think that’s a really good option…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam and Karen. I am ordering you to cease and desist all party planning. Immediately.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: As ranking number three in this office, I am order –

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Umm… I’m number three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re number four.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, but I’m number three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah, no. [to Pam and Karen] You must turn over to me all Christmas decorations and party paraphernalia immediately that will be returned to you on January fourth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, I think I can help here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, good

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: As ranking number two, I am starting a committee to determine the validity of the two committees and I am the sole member. The committee will act on this now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, this is stupid.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Could you please keep it down? [interrupted Dwight] I’m in session. I’ve determined that this committee is valid. [Pam and Karen cheer.]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No no, no, wait, wait, wait [raises hand] Permission to join the Validity Committee.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Permission denied.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey. I can’t concentrate when I know you’re in pain, man. Let me take you to lunch. [Michael sighs.] C’mon, my treat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Nothing here to distract myself with anyway.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That’s my boy. I know the perfect place, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hooters?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. Benihana. Much classier. But don’t worry, the babes are totally hot, too. [do a fist bump and explosion]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, I need my entourage [both exit Michael’s office] Jim. Dwight. Ryan. C’mon, we’re going to Asian Hooters.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ah man, I can’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why not?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m not feeling so well. I’ve got a ton of work to do here. MSG allergy, peanut allergy, I just ate there last night. [Michael feels Ryan’s forehead]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, feel better.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: C’mon Jim, let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. [to Ryan] Wow, thanks for taking all the excuses, dude.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Doctor appointment, car trouble, plantar warts, granddad fought in World War II. Use your head, man. I keep mine in here. [Holds up blackberry.] Look alive, Halpert. Welcome back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bros before hos. Why? Because your bros are always there for you. They have got your back after your ho rips your heart out for no good reason. And you were nothing but great to your ho and you told her she was the only ho for you. And that she was better than all the other hos in the world. And then … and then suddenly she’s not yo’ ho no mo’.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So she looks really hot, so I said, “You look hotter than usual today.” [to waitress] Thank you. Michael [gesturing to sit down.] Head of the table.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get out Jim. [Dwight tries to sit between Andy and Jim] Actually, um… [to two other people at the table] Sir, I’m going to need take this chair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, just, just leave them alone please. They’re on a date. They look very happy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So she looks at me right, and she goes, “I’m sorry, don’t I even know you?” After a year, a year of buying lattes from her, do you believe that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can’t… I can’t here what you’re saying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Carol used to drink lattes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [off screen at other end of table] What’re you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She would get this little foam mustache…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [still off screen] Carol had a mustache?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I used to say “Hey, got latte?” And she’d say, that’s not funny.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [off screen] What are you guys talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She totally got me. She understood that we didn’t have to laugh to enjoy —

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael! Repeat what you said louder!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is my job to be there for Michael. How can I be there for Michael if I’m here for Michael? [food is thrown at Dwight’s face]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m already starting to forget what color eyes she had. I can’t, OK, I’m gonna call her. I am gonna call and find out…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who are you calling?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m just gonna call her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Put that away. Put that away. S.O.S. We… I… May day. Haha. Man down over here, [to waitress] we need your help.

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: What can I get for ‘ya?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I think we’ll start with a round of noga-sakes. [waitress gives confused look]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: One part eggnog, three parts sake. Some places won’t make it for you though, because eggnog is seasonal.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You should, you should put out salt for the rims [referring to margaritas]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I was just getting a snack.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can have your snack in here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Pam, don’t tell her what to do! Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think I’ll go to Angela’s party, because that’s the party I know.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I miss the days when there was only one party I didn’t want to go to.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: So I only use three?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If you’re using more than three pieces of tape to wrap a present, you’re doing it wrong.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: OK. And where to do you get all those cool bows?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I just get those at any party supply place.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: OK. Are you sure I can’t use like, the cartoons from the newspaper?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh yeah, your mom would love that.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [Karen walks in] Hey. All right, I’ll see you guys later. [leaves room]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: He’s cute. You should date him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah… Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Looks like you’ve got a little Nakiri knife action going there.

quotes.speaker: Chef
quotes.text: No, it’s Usuba.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, I bet you wish you had a Nakiri, though.

quotes.speaker: Chef
quotes.text: Actually, the Usuba’s the better knife when you’re working with this quantity.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nah, I don’t know… Still think Nakiri’s better.

quotes.speaker: Woman at bar
quotes.text: I think he’d know. [Dwight and her stare at each other]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing he’s doing is cheering me up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wait for the onion. Trust me. Hey Cindy, he just had his heart broken, you wouldn’t do that to him, would you?

quotes.speaker: Cindy
quotes.text: I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, sure you would. Look at you, I bet you break up with a guy every hour. [Cindy laughs and walks away]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You made her laugh. Yes! She totally digs us. [referring to what chef is doing] Watch, watch, watch, watch. [Onions smoke up] Heh, heh? What did I tell ‘ya?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re right. That’s good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hello everyone. We would just like to announce that our party is starting now in the break room. So… you can come by… .

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have a very important announcement to make… about… your paychecks. Umm… Your paychecks will be arriving as scheduled on Friday. And they will be in the correct amount that they are normally in… Please stand by for a very important announcement… refer..[starts to leave office] for further regarding your paycheck! [runs outside]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [on cell phone to Dwight] I need to know if I can start the party?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael! Hey! Over here, Michael! [waves down Michael with a napkin and whistles to get attention]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This drink… [in audible conversation with Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know. No one can hear me. You know what? Start the party.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Did Michael give you permission to do this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [with conviction] Start the party.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Angela slams phone shut and runs back to office.] Also, I would like to inform you that, um, as a special treat, my party will be starting early. In fact, it will be starting right now [opens door to conference room.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Our party is also starting now [opens door to break room.]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [Stanley gets up and walks towards the break room.] All right Stanley. Woo.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good choice. [Kelly drags Ryan to the break room.]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Welcome Hannah. You will not be disappointed.

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: Why would I be disappointed?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I said you wouldn’t be disappointed. [Meredith heads towards break room.]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Meredith, if you don’t come to my party, you will be very, very sorry.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Is that a threat?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, it’s an invitation.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We have vodka!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Lots of it! [Meredith leaves to break room party.]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I hear Angela’s party will have double-fudge brownies. It will also have Angela. Double fudge… Angela… double fudge… Angela [puts out hands to weigh his options] Hmmm…

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Brownies. Cupcakes. [Kevin walks toward conference room]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Don’t push it.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Are we taking this too far? You know what, I don’t think we’re taking this far enough. [Pam and Karen look at each other] What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I got goose bumps.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don’t back down. My sister and I used to be best friends, and we haven’t talked in 16 years. Over some disagreement, I don’t even remember. So… yeah. I’m pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahh, damn this chicken is good. My compliments to the chef. [points to chef] Which is you! Right? Hahahaha. Awesome! I need some meat. I want some steak. [leans over to neighboring man’s plate] I see steak.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excuse me [tries to take away meat with chopsticks] Ah, un guard. [Fights with chopsticks and laughs] Family style.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it’s not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Cindy, Cindy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t think… I love it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I want you to close your eyes and imagine your dream house. [Cindy laughs] C’mon, do it for Michael. He’s had a really long day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] I don’t know what he’s doing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim! Jim! What… What’s happening?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, [points to Cindy] she’s asleep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh… Narcolepsy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Probably.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Now open your eyes and describe it to me.

quotes.speaker: Cindy
quotes.text: I… don’t know, it has four bed rooms and a loft…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh my gosh, now she’s up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And she’s trying to correctly butcher a goose, but she’s having trouble coming up with it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, OK. Cindy! Yo, Cindy! Cindy! Hold its neck back and insert the knife below the jaw. Bring it all the way around, there’s going to be a good amount of blood. [Cindy looks confused. Woman next to Dwight is disgusted] Don’t let it bother you. Have a bucket there, for the blood… and the innards… and the feathers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no, this is different. The CIA thing, that was a prank on Dwight. This is more like a umm… OK, it’s pretty much the same thing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What d’ya think? [to Stanley about his drink]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Fruity and delicious.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: See, I told you. You want one Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No thanks. They’re too sweet.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey, so what’s the status.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Looks like they forgot the power cord.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, you’re kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, you guys, guys, um… I’m sorry, but there’s a problem with the karaoke machine. [everyone sighs]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well that blows.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hang on little ladies. You don’t need this thing, I’ll go grab my synthesizer. [Everyone cheers]

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: Darryl! Darryl! Darryl! [Darryl exits break room and passes Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey. Hey, look, when you get done with your… [looks inside conference room] meeting, you should, uh, come to the break room. We’re having a party.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, ok.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right. Se you later…

quotes.speaker: Hannah
quotes.text: [tries to break nut on a Nutcracker doll] These nuts are really hard to crack.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Try harder then. [Hannah smashes Nutcracker on top of nut. Sees Kevin take another brownie] Uh uh. No one has seconds until everyone’s had some.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You’ve got to be kidding!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You’ve got to be kidding. {Kevin takes bite of brownie]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Cold, huh?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Huh? [puts on jacket]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Maybe that’ll help. Is it cold in there?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [referring to waitresses] They have been checking us out, all night! I am not kidding!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what we should do?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We should invite them to the Christmas party.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Now, you are thinking. Yes. And you know what? Because you have had such a rough day, you get Cindy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you are such mench my friend. [They stand up and do fist bump and explosion]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, where is everybody? I would like them to meet my new girlfriend. [Guys walk in with two different waitresses from Benihana’s]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I’m sure they’ll want to meet her, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The least I could do was give some poor sick kid a bike.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: That rocks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nah, you rock. Tell you what, if you want it, it’s yours.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: Thanks! I, I wanna give you something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. [She whispers in his ear. Michael starts to laugh] That’s what she said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello? I would like everybody to meet my new girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My new girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Where’s Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: Is he the hot one or the giant baby?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispers] The giant baby. Wow, I am so sorry, I had no idea this party would be so lame.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [under her breath] There’s another party in the break room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, party in the break room! Let’s go, let’s go! Thank God! Let’s go to the break room.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey, excuse me! Waitress lady! Hey, where do you think you’re going with that? [refers to toy she just took from table]

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: I thought I could have it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You can’t have it [takes back toy] I don’t walk into your house and steal your Hello Kitty backpack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shhh… Shut it! C’mon! Party.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey! It’s Angela! [Angela slams door shut, but not before Kevin sneaks out] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We’re going to …

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [singing] I want you to know. That I’m happy for you. I wish nothing but…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just think there are two, two specific kinds of people in the world. People who own houses and people who own condos. [turns to reach for pretzel while Second Cindy turns other direction] And… my question to you [points and pulls away other waitress] is do you agree?

quotes.speaker: Other waitress
quotes.text: Do I agree about what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you agree about what? [laughs] Wow. You’re  lucky you’re so darn cute.

quotes.speaker: Other waitress
quotes.text: What’re you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’re you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [singing] And I’m here to remind you of the mess you left when you went away. It’s not fair, to deny me of the cross I bear that you give to me. You, you, you, you, you, you, you oughta know ta know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right [high fives Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Did you have fun at Benihana’s?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. It was awful. I couldn’t hear anything. [cheers from other party]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’ve had the worse day here [turns up Nutcracker music on the stereo. [Sighs. Dwight reaches for and holds Angela’s hand]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [Karen and Pam enter] Dwight, you won the raffle! [holds out gift]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No… way! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Open it! Open it ! Open it! [Dwight rips open present. Angela is upset and Pam notices]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Do you like it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Walkie-talkies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can I talk to you a second?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Well the Committee to Plan Parties has served its purpose. We’re gonna disband. In the name of Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [holds up rice krispie shaped like a star] In the name of Nutcracker Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Angela, we’ve been hearing really great thing about uh… your brownies and we were hoping you’d consider merging into two parties.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m not sure. Does your karaoke machine have Christmas songs?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, but we don’t have a power cord.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, I may have seen it somewhere. [Goes to plant and picks up power cord] Is it this one?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm. Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We’ll go tell everyone.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy and Michael
quotes.text: [singing] And if you want love, we’ll make it. Swim in a big sea of blankets. Take all your big plans and break ’em. This is bound to take awhile. Your body is a wonderland. [Michael notices Cindy ride up to him on the bike and looks confused] Your body is a wonderland.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Your hands.

quotes.speaker: Both
quotes.text: Your body is a wonderland.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I’ll use my hands on it.

quotes.speaker: Both
quotes.text: Something ’bout the way your hair falls in your face…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [singing] Whatever we deny or embrace. For worse or for better. We belong, we belong, we belong together… Ryan…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When you know, you just know.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check her out. My little gal over there. Babe-alectable.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Which one is she? [Michael stares at both waitresses]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s… it’s one of those two. [points at both]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You don’t know?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dude, you should know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah… well, it’s been hard, they’re wearing the exact same uniform. And I’ve been drinking. And you know how all waitresses look alike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I honestly don’t see what the big deal is. Stevie Wonder is married. Are you going to tell me that Stevie Wonder doesn’t love his wife just because he’s not sure what she looks like?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Where’s my girl? Is she in the fridge? Where is she hiding? I don’t know where she is. ‘Cause I’m drunk, I can’t even find her.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: You know where I am.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Haha, I do! I just haven’t hugged you in awhile [marks Cindy’s arm with a black marker]

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, good. That felt good. Let’s go. Party.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [singing] Spinnin’ n reelin with love. Give it the time, I might come back down. But it feels so good. My feet don’t touch the ground. Wha..wha..wild. Wha..wha..wild. Well everybody knows, I’m crazy about ‘ya…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [into walkie-talkie] Monkey, this is Possum. Do you copy?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [into another walkie-talkie] Copy, Possum. What’s your twenty?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: No way. [both hold up Bridget Jones’ Diary movie DVD]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What a horrible, horrible movie that was.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: And now we get to remember it forever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Thank you. [Both hug]

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, you. How are ya?

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: Hey. This party blows, so we’re gonna leave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. Hey, you should stay because we are having fun and…

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: Cool…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where do you wanna go?

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: I… We’re just gonna take off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I… you know what? I, OK, listen. I like you. I really like you. So much in fact, that I would like you to accompany me on a trip to Sandals, Jamaica.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: No… I have school. [leaves with other waitress and bicycle]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You want help? OK… Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] Lady, from the moment I saw you standing all alone. You gave all the love that I needed…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That waitress was the one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. She wasn’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How can you be sure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, for starters, I’ve known you as a couple since the beginning of the relationship, which was approximately [looks a watch] three hours ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t make fun… You’re making fun of me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I guess, I didn’t know her very well. I marked her arm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I, I put a mark on her arm. [Both are laughing] So I could tell them apart. I don’t… I know, I know. I can’t believe I gave her my bike!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, why do I feel like crap?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You just had a rebound.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I had rebound? Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Which, don’t get me wrong, can be a really fun distraction, but, when it’s over, you’re left thinking about the girl you really like, the one that broke your heart.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I totally rebounded. Someone else shoots and I take the ball and I score. Well, I guess I didn’t score and I’m not sure who’s actually shooting, but, whatever. Doesn’t matter. It’s all good. Or as my ex might say. Domo arigato, Mr. Scott-o.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [singing, with Dwight holding up microphone] Little baby, parum pum pum pum. I am a poor boy too, parum pum pum pum. I have no gift to bring, parum pum pum pum. That’s fit to give our King, parum pum pum pum..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes, I just wanted to see if, uh you would like to come to Jamaica with me. There’s this resort called Sandals. Really? OK. All right. I promise you won’t be disappointed. Umm, It’s all-inclusive…

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [singing] … Shall I play for you, parum pum pum pum [Oscar and Gil walk through door]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Too soon. [both turn back around and walk out]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [singing] I played my drum for Him, parum pum pum pum. I played my best for Him, parum pum pum pum, Rum pum pum pum, rum pum pum pum.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing along] pum pum pum pum pum pum pum

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bye Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Night.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Pam] Oh, you know what? Sorry, forgot to tell you. I intercepted a transmission earlier and it seems that the CIA is gonna need Dwight down at their headquarters in Langley for training and an ice cream social with the other agents.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We should get him a bus ticket. [types on computer] To make his trip easier.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no, that would be great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It costs seventy five dollars.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm… Well, maybe the CIA can send a helicopter?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohh… [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Cell phone beeps] What the? [Reading text message] “You have been compromised. Abort mission. Destroy phone.” Destroy phone? [Dwight throws phone off of the roof and walks away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: William Randolph Shakespeare once wrote in one of his plays, and I’m paraphrasing here, “Love doth be poison.” Brilliant. And a lot of people don’t give Shakespeare enough credit. They think it was somebody else. A-holes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: When Michael suggested canceling Christmas, I was outraged, not on my behalf, but on behalf of baby Jesus. I mean, would he cancel Christmas because he got dumped or he was two weeks behind on his party planning, on top of the fact that his cats were ill? I think not. I think baby Jesus would suck it up and plan his party.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: We didn’t have a party planning committee in Stamford. Somebody would just volunteer to run out to Carvel and pick up an ice cream cake. So the fact that they have a committee here, fascinating.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is ridiculous. I… I’ve spent so much time, like I always do. And for that little trollop to come in here and throw her own party… Are you even listening to me?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Angela, what do you want me to do?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I want you to tell her to stop, Toby. Am I being clear?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [sighing] Look, it’s a free country. If she wants to throw a party…

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What are you…?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: …using her own money…

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: And what…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: …then she should be allowed to.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No she shouldn’t.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: The more the merrier.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Angela slaps Toby on the face.] Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oww.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I’m sorry. It wasn’t my intention to hurt you, but I want to wake you up to the injustice that’s going on right in front of your face.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That really hurt. I’m writing you up. [Angela makes an angry face] Hey, you are not allowed to touch other employees. Am I being clear?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Michael was so right about you. You are pathetic.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don’t care which party I go to. Once you’ve danced naked at a hash bonfire with the spirits of the dead, all parties seem pretty much the same.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think I’ll go to Angela’s party, because that’s the party I know.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Where would you like the Rice Krispy Treat stars?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: They’re Sugarplum fairy wands.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sugarplum fairy wands.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It’s like you weren’t even at the meeting.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I’m going to the party in the break room, because they have more chairs in there. If I have to stand around a long time, I get real unpleasant to be around.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Phyllis puts down phone] Hmm hmm. [Phyllis gets up and goes to Angela’s party]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. You know what, I better hold off. I wanna make sure I don’t dial Carol before I get drunk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, really, you’re just calling her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. You know what? I am. I’m gonna call her. That’s a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [from across the table] Where’s Michael going? Michael? Is he sick? Is he choking?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on [phone] No, I don’t think I’m asking too much. I think it’s only fair that you tell me exactly what I did wrong. Okay. Uh huh. Well that… yeah. Uh huh. All right. Well, could you tell me something that I did right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [knocks on office wall] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hello, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Merry Christmas. [hands over a gift]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, thank you. Do you always get presents for your ex-girlfriends?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, we’re never technically… um is there.. Is there a problem?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, I didn’t get you anything, because you have treated me inconsiderately, and I’m not gonna stand for that anymore.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um That’s… That’s fair. I’m sorry. Merry Christmas. [Ryan starts walking away.]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [runnning after him] Wait, Ryan, you’re not mean. You’re adorable. I’m so sorry. I got you a present, too. But then when I got to work, I didn’t see anything on my desk from you, so I threw it away. And then Asuncion took the trash out, that’s why I think it’s in the dumpster. I’m so sorry. I’m the worst. [Kelly hugs Ryan]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: There’s no fizz in this punch. Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I’ll just go get a ginger ale.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, I’ve got it, Phyllis. Stay. Have fun. Eat your wand.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [talking to Kelly in dumpster] Hey, Kelly, you know what? Throw my gift away, too.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [from inside dumpster] No, you paid money for that CD.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I’m serious. It’ll show that we don’t care about material things.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don’t understand.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly, I’m so cold!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [starts to cry] You don’t have to scream at me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Are you having fun in this relationship?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don’t know Kelly, sometimes I look at us and I think…

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [crying] Don’t dump me while I’m in the dumpster. Just go back inside if you’re so cold. I’ll just stay in the dumpster. [Ryan smirks]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [both inside dumpster] Did you look over here?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Who’s eating all these apples?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And what are these? Are… Why are there egg yolks in here? Aren’t you supposed to eat the yolks?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael was on an egg-yolk diet. He’s so weird.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Do you think I should diet?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, you’re perfect. [Kelly gasps] What? Did you find it?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No, I’m scared.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: All of a sudden?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Uh huh. Hold me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, honey, here’s Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Second Cindy
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He is also in an interracial relationship, so, you know, if you have any problems, you can always call him.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, you’re gonna face far greater problems than I can possibly help you with.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sounds good. Okay, let’s go.

episodes.title: Back From Vacation
episodes.description: Michael isn't supposed to let anyone know that he and Jan went on vacation together in Jamaica, but he accidentally circulates a compromising photo of them to the office via e-mail.

episodes.title: Traveling Salesmen
episodes.description: Dwight does a favor for Angela to keep her from getting in trouble. Andy finds out and uses it against him to get in tighter with Michael. Now Dwight must fess up, which will reveal his relationship with Angela, or risk getting fired.

episodes.title: The Return
episodes.description: Andy does the impossible--he makes everyone in the office miss Dwight, who is forced to take a job at Staples. Meanwhile, Oscar comes back to the office and Michael predictably throws a stereotypical Mexican party to celebrate.

episodes.title: Ben Franklin
episodes.description: Michael asks Jim to get a male stripper for Phyllis's office bachelorette party, but he gets a Ben Franklin impersonator instead. Meanwhile, the men's bachelor party goes as planned until Michael becomes uncomfortable with the stripper.

episodes.title: Phyllis’ Wedding
episodes.description: Michael exaggerates the importance of his small role in Phyllis's wedding and makes an ass out of himself, and Pam notices that Phyllis stole all of her wedding ideas from her original wedding plans.

episodes.title: Business School
episodes.description: Michael is a guest speaker for Ryan's business class, but they have a falling-out after Michael finds out that Ryan spoke negatively about Dunder-Mifflin. And back at the office, Dwight tries to kill a bat that he found in the ceiling.

episodes.title: Cocktails
episodes.description: While Michael and Jan go to their first Dunder Mifflin outing as an official couple, the office workers left behind go out for happy hour. During happy hour, Roy finds out that Jim and Pam kissed at Casino Night.

episodes.title: The Negotiation
episodes.description: Dwight saves Jim from an attack by Roy, but Dwight won't allow Jim to thank him for it. Meanwhile, Darryl asks Michael for a pay raise, and Michael discovers that he is woefully underpaid--so Michael goes to headquarters to ask for one himself.

episodes.title: Safety Training
episodes.description: Andy returns to the office after weeks of anger management training, determined to make a fresh start with all the Dunder-Mifflin employees. Meanwhile, it's safety training day in the office, and Michael and Dwight are on a mission to illuminate the dangers of the workplace.

episodes.title: Product Recall
episodes.description: Michael tries to be proactive during a watermark crisis, but only makes the situation worse. Meanwhile, Angela has trouble being apologetic with customers, and Andy discovers a secret about his new girlfriend.

episodes.title: Women’s Appreciation
episodes.description: Phyllis gets flashed in the parking lot, and Dwight goes all out to secure the premises. Michael ostensibly takes the women in the office to the mall to comfort them, but he's really doing it to get advice about breaking up with Jan.

episodes.title: Beach Games
episodes.description: Michael uses "beach day" at Dunder-Mifflin to find out which employee would be his most capable replacement, just in case he receives the promotion to the New York office that he's applied for.

episodes.title: The Job
episodes.description: Michael appoints Dwight as regional manager, anticipating that he will receive the job at corporate. Jim and Karen also interview for the same position. And Michael gets back together with Jan after she gets a boob job.

episodes.title: Fun Run
episodes.description: Michael accidentally runs over Meridith in the parking lot, and his guilt causes him to organize a 5-K run for her. Dwight and Angela have a falling-out after he kills her cat, and Jim and Pam's relationship is discovered.

episodes.title: Dunder Mifflin Infinity
episodes.description: Michael feels threatened when Ryan returns to the Scranton office to share his ideas about the future of Dunder Mifflin. Jim and Pam's relationship is shared with the entire office, while Angela and Dwight's relationship is on the rocks.

episodes.title: Launch Party
episodes.description: The Dunder Mifflin Infinity website is launching and Michael is excited about going to the big launch party in New York while Angela plans a satellite party for the Scranton branch. Meanwhile, Dwight competes against the website to see who can sell the most paper in one day.

episodes.title: Money
episodes.description: As Jan renovates the condo, Michael confronts his growing debt every way he can, which includes pressuring his employees for a loan. Pam and Jim spend a night out on Dwight's family beet farm, now a bed and breakfast.

episodes.title: Local Ad
episodes.description: Michael tries to make a local Dunder Mifflin commercial that is better than the one the professional ad agency made for them. Meanwhile, Andy tries to confide in Dwight about his new relationship with Angela.

episodes.title: Branch Wars
episodes.description: Michael and Dwight try to play a prank on Karen, who is now manager of the Utica branch, after she tries to steal Stanley from the Scranton office. Meanwhile, Pam, Toby, and Oscar start their own exclusive office book club.

episodes.title: Survivor Man
episodes.description: After Michael isn't invited to a camping trip with Ryan, he sets out to prove that he can brave it out in the wilderness by himself. Jim, who is in charge of the office while Michael is gone, tries to change the birthday party policy.

episodes.title: The Deposition
episodes.description: Michael is put in an awkward position when Jan sues Dunder Mifflin for wrongful termination and he is deposed as a witness. Meanwhile, Kelly begins smack-talking Pam after Darryl beats Jim at Ping-Pong.

episodes.title: Dinner Party
episodes.description: Michael invites Jim and Pam and Andy and Angela to a couples-only dinner party, which makes Dwight very jealous. However, the only thing he's missing is a ringside seat to witness Michael and Jan's extremely dysfunctional home life.

episodes.title: Chair Model
episodes.description: Kevin and Andy team up to reclaim the stolen Dunder Mifflin parking spaces, which forces them into a showdown with the other four bosses of the office park. Meanwhile, Michael becomes fascinated by a woman modeling chairs in a catalog.

episodes.title: Night Out
episodes.description: Michael and Dwight go to New York to party with Ryan, who is having lots of personal and professional problems. The rest of the office employees work late, and wind up getting locked in the business park.

episodes.title: Did I Stutter?
episodes.description: Michael tries to figure out how to respond to Stanley's insubordination during a meeting, and Dwight buys Andy's vehicle and immediately flips it for more money.

episodes.title: Job Fair
episodes.description: Dunder-Mifflin participates in a high school job fair, but few students are interested. Jim, Andy, and Kevin play a round of golf with a prospective client. Back at the office, everyone but Dwight and Angela leave for the day.

episodes.title: Goodbye Toby
episodes.description: Michael throws an extravagant going-away party for Toby, and falls in love with the woman who is replacing him. Jim plans to propose to Pam at the party, but gets out-staged. Back at corporate, Ryan is arrested for fraud.

episodes.title: Weight Loss
episodes.description: Michael tries to motivate the Scranton branch to lose weight as part of an interoffice competition. Jim is lost after Pam leaves for art school in New York, and Angela continues to see Dwight even though she is now engaged to Andy.

episodes.title: Business Ethics
episodes.description: A confession at an H.R. business ethics seminar leads to a dispute between Michael and Holly over whether Meredith should be fired. Dwight tries to prove to Jim how long he can go without taking a personal break.

episodes.title: Baby Shower
episodes.description: After planning an office baby shower for Jan, Michael is upset when he finds out that she had the baby without him--even though he's already been told that he's not the baby's father.

episodes.title: Crime Aid
episodes.description: Michael and Holly have sex for the first time, and Michael holds a fund-raiser for the office after it is burglarized. Dwight confides in Phyllis after Andy and Angela set a wedding date, and Jim runs into Pam's ex-fiancé, Roy.

episodes.title: Employee Transfer
episodes.description: Holly is transferred back to New Hampshire after corporate discovers that she and Michael are dating. Dwight tries to apply to Cornell to get under Andy's skin. Jim's brothers and Pam decide to play a trick on Jim when they meet for lunch.

episodes.title: Customer Survey
episodes.description: Dwight and Jim believe that something is suspicious about their low customer performance ratings. After consulting with Angela, Andy finds the perfect site for their wedding--Dwight's beet farm.

episodes.title: Business Trip
episodes.description: David Wallace sends Michael on a business trip to Winnipeg to help him forget about Holly's transfer to Nashua, and Pam tells Jim that she failed a class and has to stay in New York City.

episodes.title: Frame Toby
episodes.description: When Michael discovers that corporate has brought back Toby to replace Holly, he tries to frame him with drugs and to get him fired. Meanwhile, Pam has issues with the disgusting microwave. Finally, Jim surprises Pam by buying his parents' house.

episodes.title: The Surplus
episodes.description: Michael has to spend the office surplus by they end of the day, but he can't decide between a copier or new chairs. Dwight plays a dirty trick on Angela as they prepare for Andy and Angela's wedding on the beet farm.

episodes.title: Moroccan Christmas
episodes.description: Phyllis blackmails Angela into doing the work for the Christmas party, which Michael turns into an intervention after Meredith gets drunk and sets her hair on fire. Meanwhile, Dwight corners the market on a popular Christmas gift.

episodes.title: The Duel
episodes.description: Moments before he leaves for New York for a meeting with David Wallace, Michael tells Andy that Angela and Dwight are seeing each other. Andy and Dwight then decide to have it out in the parking lot.

episodes.title: Prince Family Paper
episodes.description: Michael's conscience gets the best of him after he and Dwight go undercover to scout a family-run competitor. Back at the office, everyone else spends the day debating whether Hilary Swank is hot.

episodes.title: Stress Relief
episodes.description: Dwight's too-realistic fire alarm gives Stanley a heart attack. When he returns, Michael learns that he is the cause of Stanley's stress. To remedy the situation, he forces the office to throw a roast for him.

episodes.title: Lecture Circuit 1
episodes.description: While on lecture tour to other Dunder Mifflin branches, Michael and Pam discover that Jim's ex-girlfriend Karen is pregnant. At the office, Andy falls for a prospective client, and Jim and Dwight try to set up Kelly's birthday party.

episodes.title: Lecture Circuit 2
episodes.description: Michael and Pam go to Nashua and discover that Holly has a new boyfriend. At the office, Jim and Dwight try to come up with a theme for Kelly's birthday party, and Angela gets a new cat.

episodes.title: Blood Drive
episodes.description: Michael holds a lonely hearts party on Valentine's Day at the office, hoping that he will run into a woman he met earlier that day at a blood drive. Meanwhile, Jim and Pam have an awkward lunch with Phillis and Bob Vance.

episodes.title: Golden Ticket
episodes.description: Michael asks Dwight to be the scapegoat for one of his business ideas that backfired badly on him. But when that idea has an unexpected positive upside, Dwight still takes credit and Michael becomes furious.

episodes.title: New Boss
episodes.description: Michael gets upset when he gets a new boss to act as a buffer between him and David Wallace, and he gets even more upset when he disbands the Party Planning Committee and cancels Michael's fifteenth anniversary party.

episodes.title: Two Weeks
episodes.description: As Michael prepares to leave Dunder Mifflin, he announces that he will form his own paper company. Will anybody join him?

episodes.title: Dream Team
episodes.description: Michael and Pam begin their first day as the Michael Scott Paper Company putting together the rest of the staff and trying to raise money.

episodes.title: Michael Scott Paper Company
episodes.description: Tension and disillusionment begin to emerge as Michael, Pam, and Ryan move the Michael Scott Paper Company into a cramped "workspace" at the business park.

episodes.title: Heavy Competition
episodes.description: Dwight chooses loyalty to Dunder Mifflin over loyalty to Michael, which leads to a bitter battle between Michael and Dwight over Dwight's accounts. Back at Dunder Mifflin, Jim pretends to confide in Andy.

episodes.title: Broke
episodes.description: The Michael Scott Paper Company is gaining clients by offering lower prices than Dunder Mifflin, but is going broke in the process. However, Dunder Mifflin is losing clients to Michael, and is desperate to buy him out.

episodes.title: Casual Friday
episodes.description: Michael returns to Dunder Mifflin and brings Ryan and Pam in as salespeople, but the existing salespeople demand that Michael return the clients they stole back to them. Meanwhile, some employees take the idea of Casual Friday too far.

episodes.title: Cafe Disco
episodes.description: Michael tries to create a place to escape from work in the storage room that used to house the Michael Scott Paper Company, while Jim and Pam consider taking off and getting married that day.

episodes.title: Company Picnic
episodes.description: Michael runs into Holly at the company picnic, and the two of them accidentally reveal that the Buffalo branch is closing during a comedy skit before corporate has made the announcement.

episodes.title: Gossip
episodes.description: Michael regrets revealing that Stanley is having an affair, so he spreads a bunch of lies about everyone else to cover his tracks--except that one of the lies that he spread actually turns out to be true.

episodes.title: The Meeting
episodes.description: Michael sabotages--then promotes--Jim's efforts at getting a promotion, while Dwight and Toby try to prove that Darryl has submitted a fraudulent medical claim.

episodes.title: The Promotion
episodes.description: Jim discovers just how hard being the boss can be when David Wallace forces Michael and him to determine which employees will be getting a raise.

episodes.title: Niagara
episodes.description:
The Office travels to Niagara Falls to celebrate Jim and Pam's wedding under strict orders not to mention Pam's pregnancy. Michael, Dwight, and Andy all want to hook up with guests at the wedding and Michael and Dwight meet twins.
Pam is forced to deal with an embarrassing injury for Andy the night before her wedding, while Kevin deals with the loss of his dress shoes on the morning of the ceremony.

episodes.title: Mafia
episodes.description: Michael meets with an insurance salesman that visits the office and is later convinced by Dwight and Andy that he is part of the mafia.

episodes.title: The Lover
episodes.description: Jim and Pam return from their honeymoon and learn, to their horror, that Michael is dating Pam's mom. Meanwhile, Dwight gives Jim a "gift"--which actually has a listening device attached to it.

episodes.title: Koi Pond
episodes.description: Michael is upset when he becomes the butt of all the office jokes after he falls in a koi pond. Andy and Pam go out together on some cold calls, and everybody mistakes them as a married couple.

episodes.title: Double Date
episodes.description: Michael sparks more anger from Pam when he breaks up with her mom on her birthday after he finds out she's 58, and Dwight unsuccessfully tries to get everyone in the office to owe him a favor.

episodes.title: Murder
episodes.description: The entire office is preoccupied about rumors of Dunder Mifflin's bankruptcy. Michael tries to create a distraction by engaging everyone in murder-mystery game, but Jim wonders if that is a good idea.

episodes.title: Shareholder Meeting
episodes.description: Michael speaks out of line at the Dunder Mifflin shareholders meeting and creates a big problem for management, while Jim discovers that nobody in the office thinks he's the "real" boss.

episodes.title: Scott’s Tots
episodes.description: Ten years ago, Michael promised a group of third graders he would pay for their college tuition if they graduated. Now comes time to pay, and he can't do it. At the office, Dwight's employee of the month idea gets Jim in big trouble.

episodes.title: Secret Santa
episodes.description: Michael gets upset when Jim promises Phyllis that she can be the office Santa, but the office Christmas party may be overshadowed by some bad news from David Wallace.

episodes.title: The Banker
episodes.description: A banker representing a potential buyer comes to the Scranton branch to interview the H.R. department before the sale goes through.

episodes.title: Sabre
episodes.description: Michael hates the changes that Dunder Mifflin's new owner is implementing, so he turns to David Wallace for advice. Jim and Pam find the perfect day care center, but Jim's mistake threatens to ruin the interview.

episodes.title: Manager and Salesman
episodes.description: Sabre's CEO wants the Scranton branch to have one manager, and Michael voluntarily steps down and lets Jim become the boss when he finds out that salespeople make more money. However, he soon comes to regret the decision.

episodes.title: The Delivery
episodes.description:
Pam goes into labor and Jim is ready to take her to the hospital, but she refuses to go. Meanwhile, inspired by Pam and Jim's baby, Dwight and Angela try to reach a "business agreement" to have a baby of their own.
After the baby is born, Pam has trouble getting the baby to breastfeed. At the office, Michael takes credit for hooking Jim and Pam up, and tries to do the same thing for Kevin and Erin, making Andy jealous.

episodes.title: St. Patrick’s Day
episodes.description: It's St. Patrick's Day, and the CEO forces the office to work late because she won't leave. In addition, Michael unsuccessfully tries to suck up to his new boss, and Andy and Erin's first date is delayed because Erin is sick.

episodes.title: New Leads
episodes.description: When the sales staff begins trying to boss around everyone in the office, Michael tries to teach them a lesson by withholding a valuable set of sales leads.

episodes.title: Happy Hour
episodes.description: Oscar gets everybody in the office to go to Happy Hour so that he can hit on a coworker in shipping. Pam tries to set up Michael with a friend at the bar, but Michael's alter ego, "Date Mike," threatens to spoil the entire evening.

episodes.title: Secretary’s Day
episodes.description: Michael creates problems for Andy on Secretary's Day when he tells Erin that Andy was engaged to Angela, and Kevin is upset after Oscar makes a video comparing Kevin to Cookie Monster.

episodes.title: Body Language
episodes.description: Michael is hopeful that a potential client is interested in him, but everyone in the office except Pam thinks he's wasting his time. Meanwhile, Dwight recruits Kelly to apply for the Sabre minority management training program.

episodes.title: The Cover-Up
episodes.description: Michael becomes convinced that Donna is having an affair and puts Dwight on the case, but Pam soon discovers that the suspicions may be true. Meanwhile, Darryl gets revenge on Andy for an earlier incident.

episodes.title: The Chump
episodes.description: Michael continues to see Donna even after learning she's married and meeting her husband, Dwight and Angela take their baby contract to an arbitrator, and Jim and Pam struggle to stay awake at the office.

episodes.title: Whistleblower
episodes.description: Jo comes to the Scranton branch to find the whistle-blower. However, three different people have confessed to Michael, Michael is protecting them, and the person most people think is the culprit is keeping his mouth shut.

episodes.title: Nepotism
episodes.description: Everybody demands that Michael fire the new office assistant, but he won't because he's his nephew. Meanwhile, Pam tries to play a prank on Dwight, who has bought the office building, to make up for ruining Jim's prank.

episodes.title: Counseling
episodes.description: Michael is forced to go through counseling with Toby, Dwight seeks revenge on a local mall that refused his business, and Pam tries to fake her way to a promotion.

episodes.title: Andy’s Play
episodes.description: Andy invites the entire office to watch him in the community theater production of "Sweeney Todd," but Erin decides to babysit for Jim and Pam instead, and Michael is upset because he auditioned for the lead and didn't get it.

episodes.title: Sex Ed
episodes.description: A herpes scare causes Michael to get back in touch with his ex-girlfriends, where he decides to reevaluate those relationships. Meanwhile, Andy tries to teach safe sex to his officemates, but he has a clear ulterior motive.

episodes.title: The Sting
episodes.description: Michael organizes a sting operation to find out the secrets of a rival paper company's salesman who is stealing Dunder Mifflin's clients, and Andy gets Darryl's help to form a band.

episodes.title: Costume Contest
episodes.description: It's Halloween at Dunder Mifflin, and Michael is upset that Darryl went over his head with an idea, and Jim and Pam are obsessed with finding out why Danny didn't call Pam back when they were dating four years ago.

episodes.title: Christening
episodes.description: During Jim and Pam's daughter's christening, Michael becomes upset over the lack of family-like unity between himself and his employees. So he responds by impulsively joining a teenage church mission to Mexico.

episodes.title: Viewing Party
episodes.description: Michael sabotages Erin's "Glee" viewing party because of his contempt for Gabe, Jim and Pam discover that Dwight can keep their daughter from crying, and Andy has a bad reaction to a mixture of wine and a Japanese stimulant.

episodes.title: WUPHF.com
episodes.description: Some co-workers who invested in Ryan's Internet venture want him to sell, but Michael refuses to go along. Meanwhile, Jim loses his motivation to work when he reaches his commission cap, and Dwight creates a hay festival in the parking lot.

episodes.title: China
episodes.description: Pam stands up to Dwight when he makes cutbacks to save money in the building, but will Dwight have the last laugh? Meanwhile, the office is surprised and energized when Michael outsmarts Oscar in a debate about China.

episodes.title: Classy Christmas
episodes.description: Michael throws an elaborate Christmas party to celebrate Holly's temporary return to the Scranton branch, but is disappointed when he learns that she still has a boyfriend.

episodes.title: Ultimatum
episodes.description: Michael gets upset when Holly returns from the holidays without an engagement ring, but still together with her boyfriend. Meanwhile, Pam tries to help her co-workers keep with their New Year's resolutions.

episodes.title: The Seminar
episodes.description: Andy tries to host a small business seminar at the office. Michael agrees to help by posing as a Greek entrepreneur, and tries to get Holly to play along.

episodes.title: The Search
episodes.description: When Jim gets an emergency phone call from Helene, he is forced to leave Michael in the bathroom of a gas station. Meanwhile, Holly, Erin, and Dwight set out on a journey to find Michael. Back at the office, Pam's artwork starts a captioning contest that seems to offend Gabe.

episodes.title: PDA
episodes.description: It's Valentine's Day, and the office is fed up with Michael and Holly's PDA, Andy helps Erin solve Gabe's riddles to find her gift, and Jim and Pam get drunk and try to find a place in the office to have sex.

episodes.title: Threat Level Midnight
episodes.description: Michael finally finishes his movie "Threat Level Midnight" and screens it for his employees at Dunder Mifflin, but Holly is less than enthusiastic for his finished product.

episodes.title: Todd Packer
episodes.description: Everyone is up in arms after Michael convinces Holly to give Todd Packer an office job, and Andy gets upset after Pam gets a new computer for reception but not for him.

episodes.title: Garage Sale
episodes.description: Michael plans to propose to Holly the day of the Dunder Mifflin garage sale, but Holly may have to take an extended leave of absence to Colorado because her father is sick.

episodes.title: Training Day
episodes.description: Michael makes fast friends with the man coming in to replace him at Dunder Mifflin, but later begins to have second thoughts after seeing him in action.

episodes.title: Michael’s Last Dundies
episodes.description: Michael hosts his final "Dundies" as the boss at the Scranton branch, but tension is in the air, and Deangelo Vickers, the new boss, is having trouble with his co-hosting duties.

episodes.title: Goodbye Michael
episodes.description: As the office gets ready for Michael's final day at Dunder Mifflin, Michael doesn't tell anyone that he's leaving a day early. Meanwhile, Deangelo accompanies a nervous Andy on a visit to one of Michael's old clients.

episodes.title: The Inner Circle
episodes.description: Tensions rise and feelings are hurt when Deangelo creates an "inner circle" at the office--which is only composed of men.

episodes.title: Dwight K. Schrute, (Acting) Manager
episodes.description: When Jim rejects Jo's offer, Dwight becomes acting manager at the Scranton branch, but an accident could cause his tenure to be short-lived.

episodes.title: Search Committee
episodes.description: The Scranton branch puts together a search committee to find the next boss, but the pool of interviewees proves to be less than impressive, and Dwight demands an interview in spite of his gun accident.

episodes.title: The List
episodes.description: New Dunder Mifflin CEO Robert California leaves a piece of paper with a line down the middle that has names of the Scranton staff on either side of it, leading everyone to try and figure out what it means.

episodes.title: The Incentive
episodes.description: Under pressure from Robert to increase branch sales, Andy offers an incentive program to the sales staff, which backfires on him when he offers a very personal grand prize.

episodes.title: Lotto
episodes.description: After the entire warehouse staff wins the lottery and quits their job, Darryl becomes depressed and demands to be fired. Meanwhile, the office staff is forced to load the truck for their orders themselves.

episodes.title: Garden Party
episodes.description: Andy claims to be throwing a garden party at Dwight's farm to impress Robert California, but he's really doing it to win the approval of his parents, who appear to favor his younger brother.

episodes.title: Spooked
episodes.description: Erin is worried that she is about to get fired after she organizes a disastrous office Halloween party for Robert and his son. Meanwhile, Robert probes the minds of the employees to come up with the perfect spooky story.

episodes.title: Doomsday
episodes.description: Dwight installs a "Doomsday Device" on the office computers that could get everyone fired if they make too many mistakes, while Gabe tries to hit on one of Darryl's warehouse employees.

episodes.title: Pam’s Replacement
episodes.description: A pregnant and insecure Pam tries to prove that Jim is attracted to her temp replacement, and Robert and his musician friends take over a jam session with Andy, Kevin, and Darryl.

episodes.title: Gettysburg
episodes.description: Andy decides to motivate and inspire everyone by taking them on a field trip to Gettysburg. Some people in the office stay behind and Robert California asks them to come up with Dunder Mifflin/Sabre's next big idea.

episodes.title: Mrs. California
episodes.description: Robert brings his wife to the office so that she can find a job, but he gives Andy conflicting messages about whether to hire her. Meanwhile, Dwight opens a gym in the building and tries to persuade Darryl to join.

episodes.title: Christmas Wishes
episodes.description: Andy tries to make this year's Christmas the best ever by granting each person's holiday wishes. Meanwhile, Robert California tries to drown his sorrows at the office party.

episodes.title: Trivia
episodes.description: Andy hopes to make up for a sales deficiency by entering and winning a bar trivia competition, while Dwight flies to corporate headquarters in Florida to demand a management interview with Robert.

episodes.title: Pool Party
episodes.description: Robert throws a party for the Dunder Mifflin staff at his house before he sells it because of his divorce. At the party, Erin and Dwight agree to flirt with each other to make Andy jealous, and Jim tries in vain to duck out early.

episodes.title: Jury Duty
episodes.description: Jim gets caught in a lie about his week of "jury duty," and new questions emerge when Angela gives birth to a "premature" baby.

episodes.title: Special Project
episodes.description: Andy puts Dwight in charge of a special project in Tallahassee, but Dwight doesn't like the team Andy's assembled for him. Meanwhile, Darryl tries to figure out the meaning of Val's Valentine's gift.

episodes.title: Tallahasse
episodes.description: Dwight refuses to let appendicitis get in the way of leading his new team in Tallahassee, while Andy decides to step in for Erin as secretary in the office.

episodes.title: After Hours
episodes.description: In Tallahassee, Dwight and Todd Packer try to romance Nellie to get the VP position, while Jim wonders if a colleague is trying to hit on him. Back in Scranton, Val's boyfriend shows up with a message for Darryl.

episodes.title: Test the Store
episodes.description: Dwight and his team get ready for the grand opening of the Sabre Store, while Andy makes Toby teach self-defense to the Scranton branch employees after he is beat up in the parking lot by a girl.

episodes.title: Last Day In Florida
episodes.description: Jim tries to warn Dwight that he's going to be fired after Robert rejects the Sabre Store idea, but he refuses to listen. Meanwhile, Darryl and Toby try to sell cookies to Kevin, and Erin tells Andy she's not coming back from Florida.

episodes.title: Get The Girl
episodes.description: Andy goes to Tallahassee to tell Erin that he loves her and needs her to return to Scranton. Meanwhile, Nellie shows up in Scranton and tries to claim Andy's manager position by offering everyone raises.

episodes.title: Welcome Party
episodes.description: Andy tries to break up with his girlfriend after going to Florida to declare his love for Erin, and the office employees are forced against their will to throw a party for the hated Nellie.

episodes.title: Angry Andy
episodes.description: Andy and Erin return to Dunder Mifflin, only to discover that Nellie has taken his job and office and refuses to give them up. Meanwhile, Ryan becomes jealous after Pam tries to play matchmaker for Kelly.

episodes.title: Fundraiser
episodes.description: Andy confronts Robert for the first time after losing the manager position and quitting his job at a fund raiser sponsored by Angela's husband.

episodes.title: Turf War
episodes.description: Dwight and Jim fight with the Syracuse over a client after Robert shuts down the Binghamton branch, and Andy sees an opportunity for revenge. Meanwhile Robert tries to figure out the contents of a drunken voicemail to Nellie.

episodes.title: Free Family Portrait Studio
episodes.description: With former CEO David Wallace's help, Andy launches a plan to get revenge on the Scranton branch. Meanwhile, Dwight launches his own plan to find out if he's the father of Angela's baby.

episodes.title: New Guys
episodes.description: Dwight and Jim are intimidated by the office's newest additions, who are considered younger versions of themselves. Meanwhile, Andy tries to make Nellie's life miserable, and Angela tries to get rid of one of her cats.

episodes.title: Roy’s Wedding
episodes.description: After Roy's wedding, Jim and Pam wonder if they still have any secrets they're hiding from each other. Meanwhile, Clark tricks Erin into a "news audition," and Dwight challenges Nellie's new charity initiative.

episodes.title: Andy’s Ancestry
episodes.description: Nellie plays a trick on Andy after researching his ancestry, Dwight teaches Erin a new language, and Pam tries to teach Nellie how to drive.

episodes.title: Work Bus
episodes.description: When Jim convinces Dwight that the building is unsafe, Dwight rents a bus and sets up the office inside. Nellie asks for Andy's help in adopting a baby. Meanwhile, Jim tries to make Pam happy with some pie.

episodes.title: Here Comes Treble
episodes.description: On Halloween, the Cornell a Capella group pays a visit to Andy, Dwight discovers that Nellie takes anxiety pills, and Pam disapproves of Jim's business decision.

episodes.title: The Boat
episodes.description: Andy has one last chance to captain the family boat before he sells it, Jim, Pam, and Nellie prank Dwight with a radio interview, and Kevin finds out about Oscar's affair with Angela's husband.

episodes.title: The Whale
episodes.description: The office trains Dwight to sell to a female client without being offensive, only to discover that the client is Jan Levinson. Angela and Oscar both think the senator is cheating on them, and Jim has trouble on an important conference call.

episodes.title: The Target
episodes.description: Angela orders a hit on Oscar for cheating with her husband, the office makes a tower with their customer complaint cards, Jim wines and dines Stanley and Phyllis in exchange for a favor, and Pam begins her mural.

episodes.title: Dwight Christmas
episodes.description: Dwight puts together a Pennsylvania Dutch-themed office Christmas party, but he ends it abruptly because Jim has to leave for his other job. Meanwhile, Erin seeks comfort from a co-worker after a disappointing text from Andy.

episodes.title: Lice
episodes.description: Pam causes a lice outbreak but lets Meredith take the blame, Jim has a business meeting with Dr. J, and some coworkers try to get Darryl and Val back together.

episodes.title: Suit Warehouse
episodes.description: Dwight and Clark pose as father and son to get an account, Darryl goes for an interview with Jim's new business, and everybody in the office goes crazy over a new espresso machine.

episodes.title: Customer Loyalty
episodes.description: Dwight tries to keep Daryl from leaving Dunder Mifflin, Jim misses his daughter's recital because of an important business meeting, and Nellie is worried that Erin will dump Andy for Pete.

episodes.title: Junior Salesman
episodes.description: Dwight gets to hire a new salesman to replace Jim when he is at his other job. But will he promote Clark or go with one of his unqualified friends instead?

episodes.title: Vandalism
episodes.description: Pam tries to find out who vandalized her mural, Darryl finds out that Jim is a slob, and Oscar and Kevin go to Angela and The Senator's child's first birthday party.

episodes.title: Couples Discount
episodes.description: Andy returns after three months to an angry office and an even angrier girlfriend, and Jim's Valentines Day with Pam does not go as planned.

episodes.title: Moving On
episodes.description: Andy finds out that Erin dumped him for Pete, Dwight gets Angela's help taking care of his aunt, and Pam interviews with a real estate firm whose boss is a carbon-copy of Michael Scott.

episodes.title: The Farm
episodes.description: Show follows Dwight Schrute a beet farmer running a bed and breakfast inn.

episodes.title: Promos
episodes.description: The release of the documentary promos creates tension for the Dunder Mifflin employees, Dwight considers a business venture with his girlfriend's family, and Jim and Darryl have an awkward business meeting with baseball player Ryan Howard.

episodes.title: Stairmageddon
episodes.description: Dwight shoots Stanley with a bull tranquilizer after he refuses to go on a sales call, Jim and Pam head to marriage counseling, The Senator comes out of the closet, and Andy tries to find a talent agent.

episodes.title: Paper Airplane
episodes.description: The employees hold a paper airplane competition, Andy gets an acting role in a workplace safety video, and Jim and Pam's marriage tensions continue to build.

episodes.title: Livin’ The Dream
episodes.description: Dwight becomes regional manager after Andy quits his job, Jim dedicates more time to his Dunder Mifflin job to save his marriage, and Angela has problems with her new living arrangements after her breakup with The Senator.

episodes.title: A.A.R.M
episodes.description: Dwight prepares for a marriage proposal and hires an assistant for his assistant, Andy auditions for a singing program, Darryl tries to leave his job without a fuss, and Pam has second thoughts about Jim staying in Scranton.

episodes.title: Finale
episodes.description: One year later, Dunder Mifflin employees past and present reunite for a panel discussion about the documentary and to attend Dwight and Angela's wedding.
